Please let us know should you plan to revisit Khao Lak and we hope to welcome you back to our resort again.  Thank you and Best regards,  Hataichanok R. Social Media Executive JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa.

title: Nice quiet stay
review: Get a room that is on the ground floor that has pool access. Its worth it. You will swim a lot more than otherwise planned. Such fun. The hotel is well maintained, Food, staff, attitude and accommodation are terrific. Just select the best time of the year to optimise your visit. The gym has daily classes and even has squash and tennis courts available. Japanese buffet and Thai Buffet are not to be missed.  This is where the Tsunami took place and interesting to see the Museum and hear the tragic stories that took place. Also the timeline of the event.

title: Holiday
review: Dear Fitpete,  Sunny greeting from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa !  Thank you for taking time to write a review of your experience at JW Marriott Khao Lak. It is wonderful to read that you enjoyed our infinity pool which is surely the highlight of our resort. We are delighted to know that our services and facilities, all added to the enjoyment of your stay.   Thank you once again for the lovely comments and we hope to see you back to enjoy another relaxing and memorable time.  Thank you and Best regards,  HataichanoK R. Social Media Executive. JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa.

title: Most restful holiday ever!
review: My husband and I came here for 2 nights while we traveled around Thailand. It was definitely the quietest area we stayed, and the hotel was stunning! The room was beyond comfortable, the breakfast buffet had something for everyone, but the restaurants left something to be desired. We had a terrible meal experience, and the staff was not very accommodating. The food director did contact us after our meal, and discounted the food we were unable to eat, however it did leave us not really wanting to come back.

title: Superb property, beautiful 👌
review: We stayed here 3 nights Luxury stay in JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort and Spa. It's beautiful property. Highlights about this property beach front resort include 4 restaurants- Japanese, Thai, Italian international/ continental. 4 bars/lounges, and a full-service spa. House keeping staff is very good my rating no 5. Restaurants staff is very helpful my rating is 5. Front desk staff is very helpful my rating is no 5. Overall it's awesome place 👍 I can say they are having biggest swimming pool

title: Pool Paradise
review: Dear Monojtravelxp,  Warm greeting from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa !  Thank you so much for taking your time to write these kind and motivating words for us. Your kind comments and wonderful review about your recent stay will be an inspiration to our team. We are a resort that offers a lot more choice, activities, entertainment and restaurants. Our staff work hard to make your holiday perfect!   Our team is looking forward to welcoming you again!  Thank you and Best regards,  Hataichanok R. Social Media Executive. JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa.

title: Amazing hotel and great service
review: I simply loved this property. The fact that its fairly spread out and has a water body almost everywhere you go, all the pools are interconnected I guess. The hotel has the most friendliest staff and the property is maintained very well. I saw workers cleaning the pool, the common areas of the hotel almost all day long. its the perfect place to relax. While there we also tried the various restaurants and found the meals good. The breakfast buffet is definitely one of the best spreads.  The staff is very helpful for everything and they take great care of you. They also have rooms that open into the pool so you can just step out of your balcony directly into the pool. I liked the fact that they gave us inter connected rooms even when we'd forgotten to ask at the the time of…

title: Good but not 5 star!
review: Dear Priyanka,  Sunny greeting from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa !  We are thrilled to know that you had a wonderful time with us and I really appreciate that you took the time to write about our services and amenities in TripAdvisor. Our resort is surely a true paradise, the ambience of the resort becomes a serene getaway. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast restaurant,  the service of our staffs and the infinity pool which is the main highlight of our resort, it sure is a treat to be ungraded to a pool access room where you can directly access the pool at the comfort of your own room.   We will have the pleasure of welcoming you back in the near future.  Thanks and Best regards,  Hataichanok R. Social Media Executive. JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa.

title: Wonderful 8 night stay
review: Where do I start.. WOW!! We visited JW Marriott Khao Lak for a wedding. We were told by friends it was amazing and they clearly had the same experience we had. Staff are incredibly warm and polite, going out of their way at every opportunity the General Manager also makes sure he chats to guests and extends a warm welcome. The weather was torrential for one of the functions but staff took it in their stride, ensuring umbrella's were at hand, cleaning up water puddles, collecting all the outdoor decorations to relocate inside and just doing all they could to take the stress away from the bride and groom and family. The hotel itself is immaculate.. surrounded by water, great food and bars, excellent gym, table tennis table and the list goes on. The buffet breakfast was AMAAAAZING.…

title: Heavenly
review: Absolutely lovely, from check in to check out.  We stayed for 3nights, on the all inclusive package. Beautiful views, a gorgeous room, endless swimming pools and beach sunsets that will always be remembered. Breakfast accommodated all tastes, lunch  options were delicious, and the choice of dinners was well thought out.  And let's not forget the swim up bars ! JW Marriott has once again exceeded  our expectations 😀 We'll definitely return , with our children.  Thank you for an amazing stay!  We would rate this resort 15/10 .

title: Focused on package tours
review: Dear Cindy S,  Warm greeting from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa ! Thank you very much for taking your time to share your experience, this is truly valuable for us.  We are delighted to know that you had an amazing time during your 3 day stay at JW Marriott Khao Lak. We are extremely happy to know that we were able to live up to your expectations and that you enjoyed the comfort of view, room, pool, beach and food. We enjoy giving warm, attentive and friendly service and are delighted to know that this has made your stay with us more memorable.  We hope to welcome you back in the future. Please do let us know if there is anything we could do to make your next stay even better.  Thank you and best regards,  Hataichanok R. Social Media Executive. JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa. +66 76 584 888

title: Peaceful place
review: When we were there (early June), the main marketing focus of the hotel seemed to be on destination weddings (India) and package tours (Germany, UK, possibly Australia). Our booking had been made directly via Marriott.com. As a result, we felt that we were the 'odd ones out' in a system highly geared towards tour groups and package deals ("...how come you don't have any meal vouchers?").  From the view of an individual traveller, this is my feedback to the hotel management -  Positive:  1) All staff were very friendly and engaging; clearly this can be attributed to consistent training and the results are impressive.  2) The entire place was kept meticulously clean at all times. While cleanliness seems to come natural to Thais, the standard here was above and beyond.  3) Given the…

title: Paradise that caters for couples as well as family
review: Dear  Laowai67,   Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa on this forum. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our friendly and efficient service, our  overall facilities and High Speed  Wifi Coverage.  As you have pointed out in this period we do have a number of all-inclusive deals available, however we have similar offer available for our valued Marriott Rewards Members,  bookable on the hotel website under extended  stays offers called “return to Paradise”.    In order to maintain our hotel and product facilities, we have at times renovations as part of our upgrade plans. Please allow me to apologize regarding the inconvenience you have mentioned, I will certainly share your feedback with our team for further improvement.   Laowai67 , I would like to thank you for taking the time to write such a detailed review for our improvement,  and we very much hope to welcome you back in the near future at the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa.   Sincerely,  Luca Forges Davanzati Resident Manager JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa  Tel: +66 76 584 888

title: One of the best stay
review: This hotel is best for relaxation if you living in busy town want to move away for relax this is great place. The hotel have one of the best beach i have ever been large with many sun beds. Some rooms are connected with swimming pool you can easy jump to pool from ur room.

title: Beautiful Resort
review: Stayed for 3 nights as part of a company leisure trip.  Arrived rather late after 1.5hrs drive from airport and a dinner stopover in a local restaurant. Check in took a while as we had 7 pax and we had booked 4 rooms. Was served some refreshing welcome drink and wet towels while waiting. Lobby was rather grand and overlooks the huge swimming pool. Was almost lulled to sleep as the piped in music was a soothing Thai traditional music. Apparently, the music is being played 24/7, unheard in room but quite obvious if balcony door is opened.Not a bad thing though, as the music is rather therapeutic.  Was assigned a pool access room in wing 1. Room is beautiful and size is adequate, with a king sized bed. Mattress was very comfortable but the down pillows are too soft, which you may…

title: Honeymoon Bliss
review: Where do I start..? This hotel is out of this world, my husband and I stayed here a year ago on our honeymoon.  The hotel and grounds are absolutely stunning!  Our room was beautiful.  It was cleaned daily and received little complimentary chocolates too!  We arrived to a cake for our honeymoon (And another for my birthday).  Check in was a little slow but when you're able to look around the grounds, it's really no biggie.   The breakfast buffet is amazing, so much to choose from so there is something for everyone.  We didn't eat in the hotel restaurants at night as we preferred the beach restaurants and they are much cheaper too.  We would each have a starter, main and maybe two drinks each and the bill would come to approx 150-200 Thai Bart (which works out at about £12-£15, I…

title: wonderful family vacation location
review: Dear Smcg84,  Warm greeting from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa !  Thank you for your great TripAdvisor review. We are all very glad you had a wonderful experience here in our resort. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay, and that you found our staff to be friendly and efficient, breakfast, activities, and breakfast quality.  We very much hope to welcome you back and please let us know when you plan on returning to Khao Lak.  Thanks and Best regards,  Hataichanok R. Social Media Executive. JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa.

title: Just as picturesque as the photo's...
review: couldn't have asked for better family vacation spot! we had spent 3 nights in Bangkok before coming to meet friends in Khao Lak.  They were staying at the Radisson where we originally thought of staying but that hotel was full so we chose the JW Marriott.  Don't get confused when reading reviews -- there are numerous JW marriott's in this general region.  This one is about an hour or more drive from the hotel in Phuket.  For sure, go with this one -- get away from the city.  You'll love it.  I would actually recommend to go ahead and take the hotel's shuttle service.  it is slightly more expensive than a taxi but not that much, but is way safer and more comfortable and also you can actually fit your luggage! we had small suitcases and a baby stroller and that wouldn't…

title: Wonderfully secluded chill spot!
review: Dear Lasarilla,  Sunny greeting from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa !  Thank you for sharing your experiences with others here on TripAdvisor. Your review of beautiful beach and amazing infinity pool is much appreciated, there are surely the highlight of our resort. We are delighted to know that our services and facilities, all added to the enjoyment of your stay, and we much happy to read your comment regarding our spa massage that has been voted as one of the top 60 Spa on Booking.com, and our spa therapist work hard to ensure that our guest leave with the utmost feeling of relaxation.  Thank you once again for the lovely comments and we hope to see you back to enjoy another relaxing and memorable time.  Thank you and Best regards,  HataichanoK R. Social Media Executive. JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa.

title: Paradise
review: We have been to Thailand several times but never stayed in just one place we have usually toured.  We chose this hotel as you can now fly direct to Phuket and boy we were not disappointed, the place is amazing.  We were welcomed at the airport and had a private transfer to the hotel, the transfer was enjoyable as we saw aspects of life and the country we had not seen before.  At the resort we were made welcome by the staff and after registration we were guided to our room 4107.  The rooms are spacious and well appointed down to the orchids in the bathroom.   The hotel is based round a waterway with access either direct from the waterside rooms or many other places. The whole complex is lush and kept so clean by an army of cleaners and gardeners.   The beach has a bar which…

title: A really amazing place!
review: Dear SusieQ008,  Sunny greeting from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa !  Thank you very much for taking your time to share your experience. This is truly valuable for us. We are thrilled to know that you have had a memorable experience of our beautiful beach, excellent and attentive service of our staff, good quality breakfast and our variety restaurants.   We look forward to seeing you again soon for another momorable holiday at JW Marriott Khao Lak and please do not hesitate to visit our website for your future bookings.  Thank you and best regards,  Hataichanok R. Social Media Executive. JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa.

title: Perfect Hotel with Perfect Staff
review: What can I say other that this place is wonderful! We spent some days in February this year and everything was perfect. We decide to have the room with direct access to the pool, and it was a very good idea. It's a big pool going around all the rooms and it's very clean and quite. The beach has been divided in two parts. In one parts kids are not allowed, and I think it's a very good idea for both people with kids or not. Food was amazing. We enjoyed Thai food and Italian food as well - I have to say congratulations to the Italian chef Enzo. He is great!  The staff was really friendly, welcoming and really very good trained.  The spa of this hotel it's another wonderful place. When you enter there it seems you are in another place. It's huge and massage was of course perfect as…

title: Beautiful Resort
review: Dear Davide C,  Warm greeting from JW Marriott Khao Lak Reort & Spa ! Thank you for taking your valuable time to share your experiences here on TripAdvisor.  We are delighted to hear that you've enjoyed your stay with us. Our resort is located within the serene surroundings perfect for a private getaway. Additionally, we do offer a number of indoor and outdoor activities suitable for both kids and adults, so there's never a dull moment in our resort. Our team works hard everyday to ensure that each and every guest's experience is an exceptional one.  Please let us know should you plan to revisit Khao Lak and we hope to welcome you back to our resort again.  Thank you and best regards,  Hataichanok R. Social Media Executive  JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa +66 584 888

title: Fantastic stay at the Marriott
review: A lovely hotel, extremely luxurious with all the little details taken care of. Beech/pool towels are provided, loads of bathroom toiletries, free water, there is even a hotel beach bag in the wardrobe to save you getting sand on yours! Breakfasts are included in most stays, but we didn't have any further meals included in the price. Make use of the many restaurants nearby the hotel, easiest accessed by walking down to the beach and turning right or left. Two nice restaurants located to the left, we didn't go to the one on the right.  At least once, you must try Blue Mist. This is a local restaurant that provides free transfers to and from the hotel. Just ask anyone in reception to call them for you, they do this regularly and have the details.  There are a number of ATM's on…

title: Amazing beachfront hotel
review: The swimming is by far the biggest I've ever seen in Thailand, 16,000 sqm is simply humongous! We were upgraded to a direct pool access which was very nice. The room size was more than enough and well decorated. Extremely clean. There are a Japanese, Thai and Italian restaurant, therefore everybody can enjoy.

title: Awesome resort!
review: Dear Stephane,  Warm greeting from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa ! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination resort.  We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your time with our infinity pool that is the highlight of our resort and being able to access the pool straight from the comfort of your own room is surely a treat. We hope that you will return to us again in the future.   Please do let us know if there is anything we could do to make your stay even better.   Thank you and best regards,  Hataichanok R. Social Media Executive. JW Marriott Khaolak Resort & Spa. ++66 76 584 888

title: Amazing, even with monsoon rain
review: Stayed on a luxury escapes voucher and had the most brilliant time. What a hotel! The grounds. The staff. The food. The spa. Everything was just perfect.  As a luxury escapes novice, I was skeptical, and waiting for the catch. No catch, just low season offerings, when they'd much rather bums in beds than empty rooms. Of course, with low season comes some hotel maintenance works, and less 'action', but that's the point!   Not sure whether perhaps the time of year, and voucher season, but almost every guest was Aussie (including us of course). Just something to note, given that some people prefer to venture overseas to escape their countrymen and women :)   ROOMS  I got a little carried away researching the rooms before we arrived; but you really need not bother. All rooms have…

title: Good, but too large
review: Gorgeous grounds, beautiful rooms and fabulous service. Food in the various restaurants was ok but breakfast buffet was excellent. The spa is the most beautiful spa I've ever seen. The wonderful, peaceful atmosphere was unfortunately ruined by a mother and daughter skyping loudly; the resort should ban use of cell phones in the spa.

title: BEAUTIFUL.
review: We went as a family and booked 2 nice and well equipped pool villas, so far so good.  The entire compound is simply too large and creates no cosy holiday atmosphere.  Everything is well and professionally managed, the food at the restaurants / the buffets is really excellent and of high quality. Still, the amount of people flowing into the restaurants for breakfast and dinners creates waiting lanes - a no go for a high class resort.  Next time we will look for something more cosy.

title: Relaxing by the beautiful beach
review: We stayed here in early May. The property is huge and very beautiful. Our room walks straight out to the pool. The large pool meanders its way around the whole property.  The only draw back is that with a room that walks straight to the pool you also see people swimming in your pool area. It is kind of like having people in your back yard. There are a lot of mosquitoes around.  I got bitten at least 6 times a day.  The buffet offers a wide variety of local and international food. The waiting staff are friendly and always willing to help. I had a problem with house keeping not cleaning my room daily on time until I requested it to be cleaned everyday. There is a Thai massage called Silk Massage near those restaurants outside of the hotel. Our family went there several times for…

title: Jw Marriott khao lak,,,,,,,,, fantastic
review: We stayed at the JW Marriott Khao Lak for 8 nights in may 2017.  It's an awesome location and a fantastic hotel.  It has the biggest pool one can imagine and a beautiful beach front.  Better yet is the quality of restaurants and food.  It has 5 great restaurants. 3 of them are proper gourmet fine dine restaurants. One Japanese, one Thai and one Italian.  The food at these places is excellent and passionately made.  There is a great beach front restaurant which is also a bar and does fabulous sea side lunches.  The food quality and service are amazing.  The best part is the people at this property. The main chef at Italian restaurant and the executive chef Mr. Jai took personal interest and care for the guests. All the other staff is extremely courteous and accommodating.  It was…

title: beautiul hotel
review: The hotel was just as good as we imagined....and right on the beach... the rooms were spacious and light and there was so much selection food to please the kids also... the amenities were great, we enjoy playing tennis and had good courts and also gym... the pools and cleanliness of the hotel was exceptional......

title: Possible the best Marriott resort I have ever stayed at
review: I actually stayed here two years ago (June 2015) - so hopefully it is still as wonderful today as it was then.  I was logging on here to write a review on another JW Marriott resort I recently stayed at and it occurred to me that I never wrote a review for this one! This place is absolutely breathtaking. The size is perfect - not too big, not too small. The pools are fantastic, and the landscaping is too.  I don't remember the beach being that great - but that was due to location, not the resort's fault (I prefer clear azure and calm waters with white sand). The rooms are amazing, especially if you can get one of the two story bungalows with the massive decks. Once again - the POOL is amazing...it is huge and wraps around the whole resort. The swim up bar is great too. I don't…

title: Wonderful Hotel.
review: We booked this hotel for our 25th Wedding Anniversary, our first visit to Thailand. Hotel is very impressive, and staff very welcoming and hard working. Everywhere kept clean and tidy. We had a pool entry room situated in block 1. Good size room and in a quiet block. Large terrace where you can access the pool and swim down to the main pool and beach. Beach is gorgeous! Plenty of sunbeds,never had a problem getting one. Bar staff continually walking round with glasses of iced water which was much appreciated in the heat. We ate at the hotel,and on the whole the food was good, UK prices though.  I'm gluten intolerant and this wasn't a problem the Chef would come and discuss menu choices with me before ordering. Our only slightly disappointing meal was in the "Olive". We enjoyed…

title: Lovely second stay
review: We only stayed for two nights this time, at the end of our 11 night stay in khao lak and after a one night stay in the jungle.  We had two connecting deluxe pool access rooms, 5005 and 5006 at the back of the resort with the glass safety panel which were just wonderful.  The pool is fantastic, we would swim down to the beach and have a massage. There are still some lovely beach restaurants to the left and right of the hotel, despite being told on check in that they had gone!  On our first night we ventured left and ate at coconuts, with a table right on the beach, our feet in the sand we had a perfect night.  Cocktails and gorgeous food, who could want more.  We also ate at Phens to the right, for lunch the next day.  It was very nice but it is set back from the beach. …

title: 11/10 Just Perfect
review: Loved staying at the Marriott, the staff are caring and dedicated people and love what they do. Breakfast was sensational . Huge swimming pool. Great restaurants​ especially the "Olive". A holiday to remember.

title: Bliss! Best family holiday with 8 & 5 year old
review: We stayed in both Marriott hotels in Phuket. This one is amazing, but very different from mai Khao. This 5 star hotel is manicured, a lot of asphalted Tiny black polished pebbled footpaths everywhere with endless km's of canals. They all ultimately lead to the beachfront. This has the largest pool complex in all of Phuket and is a lot of fun just meandering in pool floaties. We brought goggles, flippers, floaty boats and skimmers to add another level to just swimming about. The swim up bars are a lot of fun, the lunch time Italian wood fired pizzas were out of this world! The atmosphere at the breakfast Pavillion was a bit of a let down for us even though the quality of food was unparalleled. It was just too big and impersonal. The Italian restaurant is ok, the Thai restaurant…

title: 2nd time back and it wont be the last!
review: From the moment we were met at the airport till the (sad) moment we left to go home, we had a great time. As before, the staff, the hotel and facilities did not disappoint. We had worried that after our first very positive experience, a return visit wouldn't live up to our memory of staying at the hotel, if anything it was better. Knowing the what amenities and services were on offer, and how to take advantage of these and finding out in time what was was available really helped. We hadn't used the Spa on our first visit but as our 'Return to Paradise' package now included Spa vouchers we now did, and what a treat (we would say it was possibly the highlight of holiday). Excellent treatments in a beautiful environment.  Also, I have to say I have never stayed somewhere where…

title: 3 points (because the pool was amazing)
review: Good news first: the pool is the largest we have ever experienced. Very nice. Same with the garden of the hotel. The gym is well equipped. What else on the good side...? Sorry that was all. Now the bad news: (in a nutshell: we believe the management is not up to speed) - here the details: empty cups around the pool the whole day - no one cares to remove. Same with room service plates in front of doors. Most staff doesn't look happy. They offer a shuttle bus to bang niang and Khao Lak (only 5 or 6 times a day and for a one way trip they charge THB 100 per person. Gentlemen this should be for free or then more frequent!!!).  Compared to other hotels you don't feel a difference whether you stay there as an elite program member or a backpacker - same. The Thai restaurant is not…

title: Best family holiday
review: My husband, myself and two children aged 8 & 9 years have just returned from an amazing holiday at this resort.   We were first welcomed on our arrival with a welcome drink, refreshing towel and friendly service. The person who checked us in then escorted us to our room. Our room was impressive. It was clean, modern and luxurious. We were in a two bathroom, two level room with a spacious balcony.   The kids club was great and catered for kids of all ages. It had organised activities, friendly staff and my boys loved the play station and computers.   The food was exceptional and the staff work hard to ensure guests are happy. I have travelled a lot for both work and pleasure and the breakfast buffet is fabulous.  Eggs cooked anyway, coffee made to order, fresh squeezed juice,…

title: Long-haul Transit to Luxury
review: After a nearly 24-hour transit, and having very little advance expectations, the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort turned out to be a spectacular surprise.   Starting with the warm, Thai wai welcome to our surprise upgrade (to a loft-style suite steps from the ocean). From the lush beachfront setting, to the tranquil, meandering swimming lagoon. What a gem!  Since joining TripAdvisor in 2015, and in having reviewed over 25 hotels/lodgings/accommodations worldwide, my husband and I are in agreement that this JW Marriott ranks as our best resort experience (thus far). No hyperbole here.   Random "standouts" at this JWM includes the well maintained beachfront and perfectly situated loungers. I also loved the generously oversized bath and beach towels. High quality and super absorbent.…

title: Awesome Hotel
review: This hotel is 5 star class, amazing resort, very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were spacious and modern. The swimming pools are incredible. My partner and I stayed here with another couple and we all rated this hotel very highly. Well worth the trip to Khao Lak. The restaurants are very good, top class but the Italian stood out over all of them with the chef Enzo just an amazing guy and a better cook! he came out to meet us and cooked us a request that was not even on the menu, just the best chef ever!!. This guy is so passionate about his work and is a real peoples person. The Japanese and thai restaurants were also fantastic and the breakfasts amazing. Right on a beautiful beach, so much cleaner than the likes of Patong. The massages were also top class.We will…

title: Amazing!
review: Amazing hotel. Perfect location, beautiful building, clean, easy to get around, friendly and professional staff. Great breakfast buffet, lots to do. Something for everyone. A lot of activities to keep all ages busy. Simply amazing!

title: Stunning Rooms and amazing beach
review: We stayed in a pool access room in April 2017. The room was very large and beautifully furnished and very clean. If I were to come here again I would probably try and get a room where the terrace is covered overhead as it did rain a couple of times and all of our belongings got wet! The hotel itself was lovely and we were very impressed. The gym facilities were very good too but they could up the air conditioning in there! My only negative point about the hotel was the price of their Gala evenings. On our first night we paid for the Beef BBQ on the beach but it rained so we were inside the main buffet area and felt that the selection was not quite as advertised. £100 for 2 adults and 1 child is quite steep for a bit of beef and salad! We quite liked the Coconut restaurant just…

title: Beautiful resort with beautiful staff.
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at this property. The rooms are clean and  spacious though show a little wear and tear, especially in the bathroom. It is well worth paying extra to have a pool access room. The never ending pool winds its way through the resort. bordered by lovely tropical gardens. The food was good, without being outstanding and we tried all the restaurants. The Thai buffet night however was brilliant. The crowning glory is the staff. They are friendly, professional and always willing to the extra mile.The beach is lovely too without the raucous sound of long boats everywhere. We'll be back for sure.

title: Sixth time at resort and will definitely be back again!
review: We have stayed at the resort many times, and keep.coming back for a reason. The staff is very welcoming, friendly and attentive. This is the type of resort where you can truely check out and relax. We spent hours in the pool just flaoting around. With so many different areas to explore you'll never got bored. We had the extended family join us on the trip, and it was the best family vacation we've had. The kids loved playing in the kids club and ping pong, grand parents enjoyed playing with the grandkids in the pool, and all the parents loved spending time together at the restaurants.  Sunset from the pool bar is truely amazing!

title: We had a Luxury Escapes package for 8 nights for the family, 2 adults and 2 kids
review: Everything you could need is in the resort.  The kids club is well equipped, and the restaurants on site are all high class.  The food is excellent, as is the service and the friendliness of all the staff.  Normally when we travel we like to get out and about, but that's a bit harder with kids, so the resort was a great option.  We did hire a scooter for a day just outside the resort for 250 Baht (+50 Baht for petrol), and we managed to get 3 of us on the scooter, with our little one in between us.  We went to the Ban Biang market, which by comaprison to other places I've visited, is very touristy and over priced, but it's all there is in town.  The Sun Riang waterfall was a nice trip, about 8 kms from the resort and I managed a couple of trips there to get the family all to…

title: Pool access room
review: Great resort in a very laid back area with all that you need to enjoy thailand. The executive Chef went happily out of his way to satisfy our dietary requirements. The Employees genuinely felt eager to please.

title: Paradise
review: We have stayed in many resorts in Thailand. JW Marriott was the best, this was our second visit and it was even better then the first. The grounds are amazing and the pools unbelievable. It is situated on a nice clean stretch of beach. Breakfast at the buffet was varied and of good quality with endless latte's delivered with a smile. Lunch was good as well and dinner at Olive Restaurant excellent especially the Tiramisu.  However what sets this resort apart are the staff. Everyone without exception had a friendly greeting and a smile. Nothing was to much trouble for them and they went out of their way to please. There are to many to mention them all but we would specially like to thank Boy, Sorn, Dong, Layla and Anissa for their extra care and attention. Also Jack and Dong for…

title: Always good
review: This is our 3rd time here and would recommend to anyone  5 restaurants good size rooms beautiful pool and gardens and very friendly staff excellent cocktails and good wine list 2 happy hour sessions and an wonderful spa

title: Honeymoon
review: Have to admit, throughly liked this hotel complex. My mate's son Oaklee starred in The Impossible movie about the awful Tsunami n 2004 and it's a place that has certainly built itself upon that tragic disaster. The hotel has miles of pools and are incredible (highlight) and if you have children it's the perfect place to go. We wished we weren't just bed and breakfast as it was our honeymoon and we didn't feel that loved and dinners etc can top up. The staff are friendly and down to earth. Be prepared for service charge on everything and if like us you just have bed and breakfast you may want a short taxi into town for great cheaper food. The beach at the hotel is stunnnig and rooms are lovely, including wi Fi and access to drinks. Limited to no entertainment in May though. We…

title: Love This Resort & Staff
review: We stayed for a week in a Family Pool Access Room with our two children aged 4 and 10. The family room was perfect in size for a family of 2 adults, 2 children with the feature of direct access into the pool a great hit with our children. Besides the absolute beauty of this property and stunning beach on either side the one factor that impressed us the most was the staff. In every department they could not do enough to help us whatever we needed. It is a complament to managment the way they run this resort and invest in the training of staff to always deliver a five star service to us the clients. All the restaurants were top class with Olive being our favourite, my wife visited the Spa on several occasions and always returned super happy with the service and treatments.…

title: Not 5 Star. A good 4 star
review: Any review must be written on the basis on how much you paid versus your expectations. We paid £120 a night so I wasn't expecting 5* as sold on the website.  The resort generally was okay. Not much character and all the staff appeared to be going through the motions. Room was fine, cleaned regularly with a decent shower, which always helps. Not much privacy though when sitting out on your balcony as almost all are overlooked.  Breakfast was carnage!!! There wasn't many tables to sit outside and sometimes not enough tables at all so you had to queue even to get a table inside. Big hotel with big buffet, very average quality of food.  The Germans were out in force reserving their sunbeds at dawn and then pitching up at 11am. I thought this was a thing of the past in the 1990s in…

title: Big hotel
review: Dear JonGlo1,  Thank you for sharing your thoughts thru the review. I regret to learned that we have shortfall of your expectations, there are some missed opportunity which we could do better e.g. breakfast restaurant when it's come to the peak time and the beach sunbeds control etc. Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience and not having deliver the best relaxing peaceful stay experience due to circumstances. I have shared your comment to the respective team and moving forwards with improvement based on your feedback accordingly.  Thanks again for letting us know. We are looking forwards to have a chance to serve you again when your travel bring you back to Khao Lak!  Have a great day!  Best regards, Mee Room Division Manager

title: Luxury on all fronts
review: Beautiful gardens. Fantastic pool...the biggest you've ever seen. Plus a kids pool. The rooms are lovely.  Our spa treatments were included and we all enjoyed massages, pedicures and facials.  Hot and humid so spend the afternoon in the pool or down the beach and talk to everyone that goes by. Lovely staff.  Good food.

title: Paradise
review: This hotel is one of the best in the world we have stayed at.   This was our 3rd visit and we intend to stay again as the hotel itself is immaculately maintained and the staff do everything in their power to make you happy, even if it means going out of their way or doing something outside of the ordinary.  We had a couple of minor issues during our stay but the hotel dealt with them efficiently and promptly.  Since our last visit in April 2016 it was evident that a considerable amount of money has been invested in the hotel with many areas having been painted and foot paths and other areas replaced. But the best part of the hotel has to be the gardens, which are so beautiful and so well maintained.  Thanks to all the staff at the Khao Lak Marriott for making out stay wonderful…

title: Extraordinary
review: My wife and I went here to celebrate my 50th birthday and it was everything we ever could have hoped it would be and so much more:  The staff - lovely, friendly - excellent English spoken by everyone we interacted with. Always seeking to make your stay that much better.   The food - some of the best food we've ever tasted. We live in Thailand and so chose not to visit the Thai restaurant, instead opting for the Italian and a couple of buffet nights. The food was consistently fabulous.   More on the food - we attended a seafood, on-the-beach BBQ. All sorts of fresh fish, tiger prawns, and two different kinds of lobster ready to be chosen and cooked up by the kitchen staff on the beach. It was beyond mouthwatering. Since it was my birthday night, we got a front row seat to the…

title: Super Relaxing
review: Staying here with two small children and friends with kids.  So relaxing and amazing hotel for families but also 12yr+ only areas, lots of different areas to swim, relax and eat. Food is amazing from breakfast, lunch & dinner. Cleanliness has been awesome all round. Staff so willing to help with anything that they can. Spa treatment and area is amazing.  Beach right at your door step, safe for kids to play on sand and swim in the water. Definatley recommend for everyone to come and stay here.

title: Paradise
review: Set in a beautiful location on the edge of a pristine beach that goes on forever, this resort would be hard pressed to disappoint. It is north of Phuket so out of the hustle and bustle. The facilities are exceptional and encourage total rest and relaxation. The resort is divided into family oriented and couple only sections so caters well to both groups. The multiple restaurants offer great food and good service. The rooms are of high quality and serviced daily. The only nuisance we have found is the television turning itself on in the middle of the night. If you are in need of a total switch off and unwind then this is the place to do it.

title: Great resort
review: We spent 10 days in a pool access room as part of a luxury escape package. Overall the experience exceeded my expectations. The room was spacious and well appointed. Wonderful showers and good servicing. The pool areas are extensive and amazing - mostly you felt as if you had them to yourself. There is also an adult only pool area. The food selection and quality was first class. Great cocktails at reasonable prices made from fresh fruit rather than concentrates. One minor hiccup was that our dinner bookings got mixed up on 3 occasions but this was handled well. Our original room was below a roof repair job and became noisy but as soon as our complaint was registered we were moved to another room. Overall the service was excellent. There is not much to see and do in the Khao Lak…

title: Great resort - not so great location
review: Dear Ken,  Warm greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination resort.  We are delighted to hear that you've enjoyed your stay with us. Our resort is both family and adult friendly, and our team works hard everyday to ensure that we provide a wide variety of high-quality food and services. At JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, we strive to make each and every guest's experience an exceptional one.   We value your comments and have since shared your feedback on areas for improvement with concerned associates for further action.   We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to Khao Lak. Please let us know if there's anything else we can do to make your next stay even better.  Thank you and best regards,  JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa

title: Good but could be better
review: Stayed here recently as a large family group spanning 3 generations so needed a resort that catered for everyone. This place ticked most boxes for everyone re: food, service and accommodation. The kids loved the kids club and spent a lot of time there by choice.  The adults enjoyed the Spa and private adults only pool area.  Everyone found something they  liked at the restaurants so nothing really to find fault with.  We had the added bonus of a luxury escapes deal which included a lot of extras, and to be honest it was probably these inclusions that made our stay better than average.  My only issue was the 90  minute distance from the airport and somewhat isolation from the local village/town (not that there is a lot to see or do in Khao Lak).  Charging guests 200 baht return…

title: Nothing But The Best!
review: Dear The_wifes_concierge,   Warm greetings form JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your preferred choice of destination resort.  We are thrilled to hear that you and your family had a great experience staying at our resort. Khao Lak is located further away from the bustling Phuket and is an ideal alternative for those looking for serene experience of a true private gate-away. The location also offers a number of activities at many unspoiled natural attractions nearby which include Waterfalls Bike Tours, snorkeling and diving at many of the world-famous islands such as Similan Islands, and the exciting bamboo rafting at our National Parks.   Upon your next visit, please let us know how we can enhance your stay to make it even more exceptional.   Thank you very much and best regards,  JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa

title: Relaxing holiday
review: We stayed for 4 nights in 2 rooms (5 adults) in April- arrival was underwhelming but the view from the reception is stunning, looking out over the pool to the sea beyond. We had a one bed duplex and a standard room and they were both fine - I would not say they were luxurious. Wi-fi was good throughout the hotel and grounds. It was the Thai New Year so the hotel was very busy for a few days, especially in the breakfast room. The food quality and selection however were good. The beach is very nice and quiet due to the hotel's isolated location. There were lots of sun loungers, but most had towels on them before 10am. We had the special NY buffet which wasn't very nice but the entertainment was ok. Our main issue was with the staff - nobody smiled and they just didn't seem…

title: Excellent
review: We stayed here fir 11 nights after spending 3 nights in Bangkok. We were made to feel very welcome on arrival and offered cold drinks and refreshing cold towels. Check in was very professional and each ad every member of staff very more than friendly. A very special mention to Tin who showed us to our room and was very helpful to us throughout our stay. Rooms were fantastic, one of the largest most comfortable bed we have ever slept in. Bathroom was also lovely, big walk in shower,extra large bath,two sinks and plenty of toiletries.  Pool was amazing, largest infinity pool we have ever seen with the winding swim around pool right round the resort.  Bars do a happy hour which is good value and lovely to end your day of sunbathing sitting by the beach bar with a cold cocktail and…

title: Wow!
review: Dear smoothoperator54,  Warm greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort and Spa! Thank you for choosing us as you choice of destination resort.   We could not be happier to hear that you have received a warm, memorable welcome from our staff Tin. Thank you for your kind comments regarding our rooms, we strive to provide all the necessities to be your home away from home with a touch of luxurious service. We appreciate you taking your time to share your experience with others here on TripAdvisor.  It would be a pleasure to welcome you back in the near future. Please do not hesitate to let us know if there is anything else we could do to make your next stay even better   Kind Regards

title: Magic
review: We stayed for 2 weeks from April 1st. We had a terrible first week - weather wise. So much rain and no sun! With a 17 and 15 year old it wasn't great. We arrived early morning around 8am. We had to wait till 12 for our rooms. This wasn't a really good start to the holiday after such a long journey - 5 hour drive to Gatwick, 12 hour flight and then onto the resort. The reception staff were lovely though, so polite, especially 'Apple' We had 2 swim up rooms along the river (pool) absolutely gorgeous. The bed was so comfy, the bathroom was stunning. 'Jane' came every afternoon to check if we needed anything- water, coffee, shampoo etc. She was so lovely. The gardens and grounds are kept beautifully, the staff were the politest we have ever met. The restaurants unfortunately are so…

title: Amazing hotel!
review: Dear dav678,  Greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort and Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination resort.   Thank you for sharing your experience with others here on TripAdvisor. In regards to your comment regarding your check in time, our standard check in time is 15.00 and early check-ins are subject to availability upon the date of your arrival. We understand that many guest have traveled long hours and want to check in early, and we have tired our best to accommodate everyone by arranging early check in refreshments and welled prepared lounge , thank you for your patience. We are sadden that the rain has spoiled you first week with us be happy to hear that you enjoyed the rest of your stay with us. Thank you for your kind comments regarding our staffs, as we Thais, are know for our friendly hospitality and genuine smiles.   It seems that an all inclusive package is something you might be interested in, for your next return to us, we encourage you to check our direct website for all inclusive deals. We hope to welcome you back again soon. Please do let us know if there is anything else we could do to make your next stay even better.  Kind Regards,

title: Quite  Simply the Best Hotel
review: Absolutely fantastic resort!!!!!  We are still here and we are knocked by the athmospere and the kindness from all the staff, just a perfect place to relax and enjoy life at it's very best!!!!!  The beach is so nice and the pool is even better, just bring your best mood and be one with this 5 star (and this is 5 star++) resort.  The Spa is a gem!!!!!  Best of all is the food, breakfast and all the  meals inside and outside the resort just make You wish You could stay forever and ever...  Love from us ❤❤

title: Great for all ages!
review: We had a bumpy start to our vacation because I wasn't feeling well, but Kuhn Money helped us switch rooms and get comfortable. Thank you, Kuhn Money :) This place is all you could hope for--a real tropical beach paradise. The town is not close, so if you want to explore farther out, just rent scooters. The beach goes on forever, and it's just the Marriott out there, but they have tons of activities at the hotel and are family friendly with quiet adults only areas. Tons of food, special buffets, tennis, yoga, diving, a recreation area with ping pong and pool--they have it all.

title: Mostly Wow !
review: Dear Jon-N-Lily,  Greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort and Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination resort. We could not be happier to hear that Ms. Money was able to turn your stay around. Our resort is truly a serene getaway hence we are further away from all the clustered hotels and resorts in Phuket. Many also travel afar to visit  many of our world renown islands: Similans, Surin, Phi Phi, Phang Nga Bay..etc We hope that your memorable time here will entice you to return to us in the future.   Kind Regards,

title: 2nd visit and we will be back 💕🌈
review: First the good bits, this hotel is a fabulous place to stay. The building itself is beautiful the rooms are excellent, gardens and pools amazing. We had a bed and breakfast deal and I would say without doubt that the breakfast offerings are the best we have ever had in a holiday hotel, their staff were always very helpful and friendly. We expected to dine quite a lot at one of the many restaurants in the hotel but the cost since the fall in the pound was too high, we didn't want to spend £50+ per person so all six of our party ate out every night there are plenty of local restaurants close by, Pams and Pinkeys being our favourites. I wouldn't recommend the two just outside the main entrance the Italian was expensive and rubbish. For me the main issue was the beach, yes it looks…

title: Relax, relax, and relax
review: Dear Stephen M,   Warm greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination.  We appreciate you kind review about our facilities, pool, staffs, and our breakfast selections. Our chefs work hard to ensure that we are able to help start your day with a beautiful wide selection of high quality food. In regards to your comments about the pricings of our restaurants, we use high quality produces and our pricings are in-line with other five star hotels and resorts in surrounding areas. However, we are more then happy to recommend outside restaurants for those who want to have other dining options. We highly recommend our guest to visit Bang Neign Market for local food and souvenirs; market operational days are Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays.   We hope to welcome you back in the future. Please do let us know if there is anything we could do to make your next stay even better.  Kind Regards,

title: Fantastic resort
review: This is am amazing resort that until last year I never knew such places existed  Had a pool access room and kids were 7&5- this year (8&6)  Plenty of space with a king bed, day bed and extra roll away for kids to have own space   Open the sliding doors and jump In the pool 🏊🏼  Our idea of heaven   Kids club is great - be sure to book activities 1 day in advance to ensure the kids can participate   3 restaurants on site and it's hard to choose the best one!  Although we did tend to favor the Japanese Sakura teppanyaki bar 😇🙏🏼  The chefs were very entertaining  Prices advertised don't include the 10%+7% taxes so keep that in mind when ordering beverages and food   Beach is magic and body boards are provided complimentary and SUP boards only 200t baht an hour   There are…

title: Beautiful resort but check in was stressful
review: This resort is absolutely stunning and is situated on a beautiful stretch of beach.   We had a wonderful holiday and ,even though we were staying at a time when the resort was at full capacity ,it never felt overcrowded.   Our children loved the huge interconnecting swimming pools and enjoyed swimming along the canals and under the bridges.  On the beach you can borrow body boards and kayaks for free.   Although the hotel states that is doesn't allow reserving of sun beds on the front beach row we did notice that every morning there would be a row of reserved beds with no one on them and we didn't see the staff taking any action to stop this happening.   Our preferred place to sit was at the infinity pool as it was where our children wanted to spend most of their time. It allows…

title: Excelllent grounds and pool
review: The head of "grounds keeping" and the team do an outstanding job at this hotel - everywhere you walk it's very well maintained and it must be a huge job....it's just a great place to walk around on your way to somewhere else and the pool is also in excellent clean condition and access is immediately outside your rooms backdoor if you are on the ground floor. The spa and spa staff were also excellent and together the "grounds and spa" were the highlights of the stay.  We were disappointed with what appeared to be a systematic flaw in the beverage system .... on one night we had to order 5 bottles of wine on the wine list and all were out of stock (it took a very long time to finally get one that was in stock and it wasn't a one off issue) on another night all 3 sakis were out of…

title: Amazing
review: Dear Angus W,  Sunny greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your preferred choice of destination resort.  We could not be happier to here you positive feed back regarding our resort grounds. Our staffs work hard to ensure that our pool is well maintained, and our landscaped beautifully sculpted. Our infinity pool is the main highlight of our resort, so booking a pool access room would surely be a treat. We understand that our long stay guest may want to have different dining options. Therefore, we provide different theme night buffets by the beach side each night: Japanese Buffett, Catch From the Ocean, Kebab night, Beef Lover, Thai Night etc...   We hope to welcome you back in the future. Please do let us know if there is anything else we could do to make your next stay even better.   Kind Regards,

title: fantastic service
review: There is a reason this hotel has over 1500 5-star ratings on trip advisor - it is brilliant.  We traveled with 5 adults and 2 kids.  Location: Khao Lak is approximately 1.5 hours from Phuket airport. There appears to be considerable development going on in the area and with plenty of restaurants, bars and few markets for for tourists.   Food: the hotel has 4 restaurants and a deli.1 Restaurant is for an incredible buffet breakfast and the other 3 are Thai, Japanese and Mediterranean.   Drinks - there are bars at the pool and there is also a bar near reception  Pool - the pool is incredible. It literally meanders through the entire hotel culminating near the beach side. Being Thailand the water is warn like bath.  Rooms - well appointed with Mini bar, coffee facilities,…

title: 4 person adult family holiday
review: Dear Pad00,  Warm greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort and Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination resort.   We appreciate your review of your recent stay with us. As you have mention, we have three main restaurants on our property, and a DELI for those looking to grab a quick bite or coffee. In addition, we also have theme nights buffet along side with live performances each night by our beach front: Thai Night, Japanese Buffet, Catch From the Ocean, Beef Lover, Kebab etc.. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed using our recreation facilities, we provide many classes such as yoga, aerobics, Thai boxing, bike tours etc.... In regards to your comments about snorkeling, we recommend you go to Similan or Surin Island, hence those are the best spot for snorkeling.   We hope the you will consider us again in the future. Please do let us know if there is anything else we could do to make your next stay even more special.   Kind Regards,

title: Nicest beach ever !
review: Loved my holiday in Thailand, very beautiful beaches with great food. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, loved the swim up bars and the size of the pool area. The food at the hotel was very good but pricey for Thailand and the drinks are also expensive 200 Bart for a bottle of water in the restaurant and 105 for a lemonade was to much! Rooms were clean and comfortable and offered the best breakfast I'd had in a hotel !

title: Family wedding in khao lac JW Marriot
review: Dear Paula F,  Warm greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa! Thank you for taking you time to share your experiences with others here on TripAdvisor. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our pool, and the service of our staffs. In regards to your comment about the price of our beverage, our beverage pricing is inline with other five star hotels and resort in surrounding areas. We appreciate your kind comments about our breakfast, our chefs work hard to ensure that we they are able to provide our guest with a wide selection of high quality food.   Kind Regards,

title: I'm Going Back!
review: Wonderful venue, fairy tale wedding, awesome decor n yummy cuisine n cocktails, perfect weather. We were pampered wined n dined n had a wonderful experience. The rooms were comfortable, service was good . All in all a lovely time to remember

title: My favourite Thailand resort!
review: Dear Pitunaina,  Thank you for the great review. Whilst you rated us at 3 out of 5 therefore I was wondering if that was accidentally putting the wrong rate? Is that possible for you to reconsider re-rate us once again? That's would be very kind of you.  We looking forwards to serve you again whenever your travel bring you back to Khao Lak!  Have a great day!  Best regards, Mee Room Division Manager

title: Heaven on earth!
review: This is one of the most beautiful resorts I have stayed in over many years of travel.  The setting is nothing but spectacular.  The long stretch of private beach is unrivaled in Thailand.  We spent a week at the Andara in Phuket before coming to Khao Lak for 3 nights.  Although the Andara was wonderful, I wish we had stayed longer in Khao Lak.  The resort has happy hours in each lounge area.  Our last night we watched the most beautiful sunset I have ever seen from the beach lounge (I am 61, I love to travel, and have seen many).  If I am lucky enough to get back to Thailand in the next few years, I plan to stay at this resort for at least a week.  The room itself was nice but nothing spectacular (We had a deluxe double that opened on to the pool).  We ate one meal at the…

title: Family Holiday from 25th February 17 to 1st March 17
review: We chose to stay at JW Marriott Khao Lak during our family holiday. It was 4 night 5 days stay as we also went to Singapore after that. It is about 90 minutes drive from Phuket which is the nearest airport. The resort also provides transport for a additional fee. We opted for a local Khao Lak  cab for the transfer which worked out about half price than the resort. Took us a while to locate the cab rep. The service was good and reasonable at THB 1500 for a mini van.It is called Boss Taxi. Got details on tripadvisor.  On arrival we were provided with welcome drink by the ever polite staff. Found the room and the property very good. Two rooms were poolside and that was well worth it. Apart from that there was a infinity pool and clean beach. Poolside and beachside had drinks bar.…

title: 100% Recovery
review: Dear Kaushik B,  Sunny greetings from JW Marriot Khao Lak Resort and Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination resort.  Thank you for your review of your stay with us. We are glad to hear that you took advantage of our pool access room, it sure is a treat to be able to directly access the pool at the comfort of your own room; Our pool is nevertheless, the main highlight of our resort. It is our priority to ensure that we are able to provide superb service, and that includes paying special attention to our guest dietary preferences. Our chefs work hard to ensure that we are able to provide a vast variety of food and beverage preferences.  It would be a pleasure to welcome you back again in the near future.   Kind Regards,

title: Sensational
review: We stayed at the JW for one week and we enjoyed every second.  The breakfast is great - so many choices and very good quality. If you lucky you can sit outside.  The beach is very nice and offers you very long walks.   The pool is great, we had been upgraded so we had a room with a direct entry to the pool which we really enjoyed.   I had Muay Thai Boxing Class and enjoyed the work out very much.   There is a running course but I prefered my 5k route down to the main road and then a 800M on the road and back through the village.   This hotel is the best ressort I have seen so far.

title: Everything you could want, and more!
review: Dear Marco-Ken M,  Greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination resort. Thank you for your kind comments of our breakfast, our chefs work hard to ensure that they work hard to provide a large variety of food selection. Our infinity pool is the main highlight of our resort, it sure is a treat to be ungraded to a pool access room where you can directly access the pool at the comfort of your own room. We hope that you will return to us again in the future. Please do let us know if there is anything we could do to make your stay even better.   Kind Regards,

title: A Wonderful Site for a Peaceful Vacation
review: This was our second family holiday at the JW Marriott & now looking to book the 3rd. This hotel is truly sensational. From the layout, restaurant quality, cleanliness,  super friendly staff and wait for it,  the breakfast buffet! Special thanks to the breakfast team Laila, Pear & Peaw for making us feel so welcome every morning.

title: Paradise
review: I really don't know where to start with this place.  I am missing this hotel & it's lovely staff very much and I've only been home just over a week! Everything about the hotel is beautiful. The lobby, grounds, pool, beach. I stayed in a Premium Lagoon View room which had a lovely sunny balcony and view. The bed was huge & very comfortable, shower powerful, toiletries plenty, I'm trying to think of a negative but can't.   A few reviewers have mentioned it being out of town as one of the down sides. For me this is exactly why I booked. You get the best of both worlds... deserted quiet beaches, fab little independent restaurants on the sand either side of the hotel so you can eat to the sound of the waves or you can sample the lovely hotel food - the themed beach front nights…

title: Gorgeous hotel on a gorgeous beach
review: Can't speak highly enough of this hotel.   Our holiday was amazing. The beach here is gorgeous and the pool is gigantic.   The buffet was delicious and one of the best I have ever seen. So much fresh food.   Rooms are really nice.  Lots on offer. Many local restaurants on the beach, kids club, tour desk, bikes, beach yoga, spa.  A beautiful hotel in a great place - family friendly environment unlike Phuket.

title: Absolutely amazing
review: Dear Joanne B,  Warm greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort and Spa. Thank you for taking your time to share your experiences with others here on TripAdvisor. We strive to be your home away from home, and we could not be happier to hear that you had a great time with us. It would be a pleasure to welcome you back agin in the future.  Kind Regards,

title: The Best👍🏼👍🏼😉
review: The Marriott at Khao Lak is truly the most beautiful place with its stunning 2 kl pool that meanders around the whole resort and is accessed directly from the groundfloor rooms.  The grounds are delightful and the white sandy beach is superb.  All restaurants are of a high quality with a wide variety of choice.  The Spa is just gorgeous and the therapists very knowledgeable. Wonderful, wonderful place. Resort staff were very helpful and went out of their way to assist with everything.  Drive from Phuket airport is 1 1/2 but well worth it.

title: Koah Lak
review: Dear  Susan B,  Greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort and Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination resort.   We are glad you enjoyed our infinity pool, our infinity pool is the pride and joy of our resort; it is after all, the longest infinity pool in South East Asia. Our staffs work hard to ensure that our pool is clean and our landscape beautifully sculptured. We strive to provide you the best service and a wide rage of food selections.   We hope the you will visit us again in the future. Please let us know if there is anything we could do to make your next stay even better.   Kind Regards,

title: Excellent beach resort with Kaho Laks best breakfast
review: The hotel is located on a quiet part of a long beach, there are some simple Thai restaurants on the beach with good food. The hotel has a huge pool and our room had direct pool access from our terrace. The beach is clean. The breakfast buffet is outstanding and especially when you manage to get a table outdoors. Really friendly staff.

title: Lovely, quiet location
review: Dear MagnusNystedt,  Warm greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa! It is a pleasure to be your preferred choice of destination resort. Thank you for your review of our beach,pool, staffs, and breakfast selection. We hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Kind Regards,

title: Relaxing pamper holiday!!!
review: Hotel: The hotel is beautiful and well maintained.  The staff are friendly and professional, and breakfasts are to die for.  There is water everywhere so you will never be too hot for too long.  If you have kids, get them inflatables to float around the hotel waterways.  Location: I stayed in Khaolak town the week earlier which was very convenient, but the Marriott's beach/surrounds are prettier and more relaxing and the sunsets are stunning. The beach isn't eroded like some of those further south in Khao Lak.  It's a bit expensive to get in and out of town by taxi, but if you are there to relax then it's perfect.  There are also 12+ areas dotted around the resort.  There are beach restaurants to the right and left of the hotel which are very reasonable.  The restaurant to the…

title: Wonderful
review: Dear hotdog6,  Sunny greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak resort and spa! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination resort.   You review here on TripAdvisor is much appreciated, and we are happy to hear that you enjoy the serene location of our resort. We understand that many adults and vacationing couples look to spend a quiet vacation here at our resort, therefore, we provide designated areas for children and families. For those looking for fun activities, our recreation center provide daily activities such as boxing, yoga, bike tours, aerobics, and many more.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back again in the near future. Please let us know if we could do anything to make your next stay even better.  Kind Regards,

title: Beautiful hotel with the nicest personal
review: We had 8 lovely days/nights at this beautiful resort. It was a great package, which included 6 spa treatments and all meals. We upgraded to a room that spilled out into the many waterways. It was large and spacious and the room was well kept. On my husbands Birthday, we came back from dinner to find gorgeous animals made of towels on our bed, and a delicious chocolate cake with a candle and happy birthday wishes! What a nice touch. The entire staff were extremely friendly and always helpful. We had nice conversation with Harry (food and beverage) and Ann (beverage server). The breakfast room staff were always friendly and welcoming. The choices of food were many and varied. There was a nice couple that sang at the bar and at the Italian restaurant. Their music was excellent. We…

title: Golden wedding celebratory holiday.
review: Have just returned from here after a 2 week stay. It isa beautiful hotel. Rooms are spotlessly clean and the beds are so ooo comfy. The Thai people are so friendly and always smiling. The only downside for us was that it is very quiet at night around the hotel. We went into Khao Lak most evenings. Going in by concessionary bus from hotel was 200 baht each way and 300 baht by local taxi. Lots of nice restaurants and bars in Khao Lak. We particularly liked the Monkey bar where they had a live band. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Exceptional
review: Dear Win G,  Warm greetings form Khao Lak! Thank you for choosing us as your preferred choice of destination resort and taking your time to share your experiences with others here on TripAdvisor.  We appreciate your comment regarding the friendliness of our staffs, as we Thais, are known for our superb hospitality, and genuine smile. It is true that our resort is located in quite a remote setting, however, that is part of the charm of JW Marriott Khao Lak, unlike the many clustered hotels and resorts in Phuket, our resort offers a serene experience of a true private gate away. If you are feeling adventurous upon your next visit with us, I would recommend you to do our Waterfalls Bike Tours, visit the many islands around us, and try our the exciting bamboo rafting at our nearby National Parks.   It would be a pleasure to welcome you back in the near future.   Kind Regards,

title: Incompetency
review: We booked a Luxury Escapes 8 day holiday. The welcome and information given at reception by Ben was friendly and informative.  The room was spacious, clean and had excellent air conditioning, thanks to our house keeper Pli for your efficient service and our beautiful Anniversary towel decoration.  We upgraded to a swim out room and were so pleased that we did, it was like having your own private pool. The canals that linked up to the large pools were pristine.  The beach was beautiful and the water warm! , just be careful of the strong undercurrent. The Waterfront buffet breakfast was the most extensive we have seen anywhere, and was also open for a la carte lunch. Thanks to all staff, especially Laile, Ja, and Kee. Dinner choices were a themed buffet on the beach or the…

title: Another great stay the J W Marriott
review: Dear Pam L,  Warm greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination resort to celebrate such a memorable event.  We could not be happier to hear that you took advantage of our pool access rooms. Since our infinity pool is the highlight of our resort, to be able to directly access the pool straight from the comfort of your own room is sure a treat! We appreciate your kind comment regarding our staffs and chefs, we have shared your feedbacks to our team, and they could not be more thrilled. We Thais are know for our hospitality and genuine smiles, thank you for letting us provide you with that experiences.   We hope to welcome you back in the future. Please do let us know if we can do anything to make your next stay even better.  Kind Regards,

title: a beautiful place with great staff
review: Was given a getaway trip from my mother as a gift.  She is a marriott rewards member and wanted the stay paid on her credit card although she wouldn't be there because she wanted the member points.   We contacted marriott and the hotel 3 months in advance and asked whether this was possible.   Were given a form to fill out and sign and fax to the hotel.  We faxed it, and then called the hotel to make sure they received it.  They said yes and it was accepted and no problem.  The lady at checkin had no idea what I was talking about and was taking over me and brushing it off and told me I could use a different card.  I had to repeat many times that i understand a special form is needed and we had faxed it and called to confirm.  I finally showed her the form in my email.  Then she…

title: Wonderful ever and ever!!!!
review: This is the first time that I have been to JW marriott khao lak with my friends. We booked 1 room, but when we were there, we shown up for 3 people. Our room type that we booked was deluxe room, but we paid for extra person then the staff who checked us in told us that the room will be ready at 12.30 hrs. We were waiting the room at deli cafe, cake and juice was nice. Once we got the room, it was amazing we got upgrade to premier room.   We were spent a lot of time at infinity pool bar, all staffs so nice, friendly, and take a good care for us.  I will go there again.  Thanks

title: Luxurious, peaceful and beautiful
review: Dear Paloy P,  Greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa! Thank you for choosing us as your choice of destination resort. Thank you for your review of your recent stay with us. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our food selection at the DELI, we make our food and bakery fresh everyday. We hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Kind Regards

title: Amazing stay
review: To be completely honest, as I arrived at the resort, it immediately exceeded my expectations. The staff really made my experience memorable as they were so friendly, welcoming and helpful. The rooms were very spacious and luxurious - I had the best nights sleep in that amazing bed! I loved how quiet the beach was - at sunset I walked along to the end and back and rarely saw more than a few people. The only downfall about the resort is the food. I found it quite disappointing - after breakfast, lunch and a three course dinner every day for 8 days, you get quite sick of it! The Thai, Japanese and Italian were just super average and seemed quite westernised, though the buffet breakfast was wonderful! We took a day trip to the Similan Islands just to do something different one day…

title: Mr McGinn
review: This hotel is on the large side but it does not feel that way when staying there. My experience of check-in was excellent and our room was as booked a pool view room. We were offered an upgrade to a pool access at a cost however we preferred the room we had booked. The hotel and beach is fabulous and the attention to the grounds and pool is obvious. We had a 9 night stay during our holiday to Thailand and it was very relaxed with the staff throughout exceptional. We were on half board which we found to be great. The restaurants were very good and the themed buffets were also excellent. It was explained to us that there was a set menu for half board however you could chose a la carte to a value of 1300 bht each and pay the difference if required. The breakfast is nothing less…

title: Quite location
review: We recently stayed for 12 nights in the hotel, our second visit as we had enjoyed it so much the first time. Again, we were not disappointed.  Although it is quite a large hotel with just over 200 rooms, the overriding impression is one of calm, well-ordered serenity. This is due to the spacious, beautifully manicured grounds, the largest waterway system/pool in South East Asia, a wide beach frontage onto a gently,shelving beach and the noticeable absence of noisy, motorised water sports. Admittedly, the main pool area did become busy at times, but there was always plenty of good lounging space to be found in the gardens bordering the beach.  Service was excellent: efficient, but always delivered with friendliness and a big smile. Nuch and Poo, our waitresses for breakfast at…

title: Great holiday but some room for improvement
review: A great place for a family holiday set on a wonderful beach with an impressive swimming pool that goes around the whole property. Would like to see the owner invest more to refurbish the rooms which are a bit dated. The breakfast and room service was solid but nothing there with a wow factor. Japanese restaurant was excellent for dinner with staff trying to make it fun for young kids. Would like the pool to be a tiny bit cooler so it is more refreshing as it feels like a bath.

title: Amazing resort and staff
review: The resort and beach  is amazing, however the staff is what makes this resoert  excellent. Everything was perfect from the moment we arrived until we left. We were greeted when we arrived and check in went smoothly, when we left after 5 nights mener of the  staff waved us goodbye as we were leaving by car.   Positives: #amazing resort  #amazing beach #wounderful staff, highly motivated and friendly, at breakfast they would come over to fuzz with our baby and housekeeping would make new towel animals for our baby # great breakfast, huge selection of food with high quality. Egg station, fresh juice station, great bakery foods, even a really good rye bread. #this is a large resort, the staff makes sure to make a personal connetion with every  guests  Not really any negatives: #…

title: Amazing place
review: Last month we had our second vacation in the JW Khao Lak and it will NOT be our last.  This place is nothing but amazing!! The people at JW Khao Lak really make this a very special experience.  We met so many wonderful and smiling people full of good energy. It fills you up with energy and still relaxes you, like the perfect vacation should.  The layout with the endless pool, beach activities, indoor activities and not to forget the spa makes it so easy to enjoy every minute.  The beautiful rooms all with easy access to the pool is brilliantly done.  For us the culinary experience is very important! Again the JW Khao Lak is going above and beyond!! 4 amazing restaurants, a breakfast with a unbelievable selection, live cooking and a quality and attention to detail that will amaze…

title: Whooo oooh makes you want to dance (in the Sun)
review: What an amazing place, people and staff.  I would recommend the Marriott in Khao Lak to any one and everyone.  Beautiful beach and pool. The rooms are great, beds lovely and soft linen but the bed is hard enough to take my 90 kilos.  The beach lovely and perfect for long walks in the sunshine/amazing sunsets.  We've also used the gym which is ok. Usual hotel standard but with lots of classes in Thai boxing and yoga. My wife says they're great!  Breakfast is awesome! We haven't got the evening meals and lunch in our package but we have tried them. Very good!  There are a few restaurants along the beach to the left which have been very good. Excellent place!!! I love it !!!

title: Good But Could Do Better
