Some of the party were in the swimming pool all night making noise !  We felt that the other guests and their needs were secondary to the needs of this group of people.   On arriving we thought about upgrading to a swim up room we didn't do it and we were very very happy we didn't - THE POOL IS TOO WARM it isn't a refreshing experience ! Because it's very hot here this would have been the reason…

title: Paradise with a dash of heaven
review: Dear cathydyakiewicz,  Greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa! We are honored to be your resort of choice, thank you for taking your valuable time to share your experience here on tripadvisor.  As you are our valued gust, we want to apologize for any inconveniences from the noise that you may have experienced during your stay here with us. Thank you for your kind comments regarding each of our restaurant outlets, and your comments regarding our dessert will be shared with our F&B team. We are also happy to hear that you have experience great service here with us.   We hope that we have another chance to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely,

title: Relaxed beach holiday
review: This place was truly remarkable. The beach front access was deep and amazing. The service left you wanting for nothing and feeling as though they anticipated your every need. We will be back! Thank you for a lovely stay!

title: JW Marriott - Khao Lak - Paradise - Look no further
review: Dear sunyswimpurch,   Greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa, thank you for choosing us as your destination resort. Your kind comments regarding the service of our associates will be shared with our team. We look forward to welcoming you back to our paradise resort.   Sincerely,

title: You won't be disappointed here
review: Just checked out from this resort after enjoying, for the most part, an 8 day stay (yes, another Luxury Escapes package)!  The most stressful thing about this place is the transfer to and from the airport...oh and noisy guests who are celebrating at the resort their wedding anniversary over three days-including taking over various swim up bars, swimming throughout the night, and having music blaring so loudly that we were treated to complimentary coffees and ice creams in the deli, as management sought to get things a bit more under control. It was the only negative really, but once I'd put my concerns to the manager we were sent flowers and had a 2000baht concession on our bill to accommodate for our loss of amenity during this time!   Apart from that, we had the most relaxing…

title: Stunningly beautiful and relaxing
review: Travelling with another family made our group up to 9 - 4 adults and 5 children.  This was no problem for the hotel though: we were picked up Sunday evening from the airport by the hotel mini-bus transfer after a full day travelling.  We were provided with bottled water and experienced an exciting 1 1/2 hour trip along the highway to Khao Lak.  The children were unaware at the parents racing hearts as we weaved throughout traffic and motorbikes: the road was smooth and the minibus airconditioned and that was all the kids cared about.  I felt it was exciting to experience authentic Thai road travel, but we were grateful to arrive safely at the resort!  The check-in process was easy: the staff in reception know English quite well and we were greeted with a cold drink and chilled…

title: Khao Lak - JW Marriott
review: Dear Holly B,  Warm Greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed you stay with us. Thank you for taking your valuable time sharing your experiences here with others on our Tripadavisor page.   Thank you for your kind comments about our associates, we will surely pass on your kind words.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our infinity pool, our pool has been the pride and joy of our resort and it is surely one of our selling points. Your review of your dining experiences is much appreciated, we are glad that you were able to try authentic Thai food, while having a glimpse of our culture and traditions.    We hope that you had a memorable experience with us. Please allow us to once again be your resort of choice the next time you visit Thailand.   Sincerely,

title: Happy holidays don't want to leave
review: What a great place to totally chill out, relax & unwind! Despite the extreme heat & humidity ( unusual at this time ) we enjoyed all activities, restaurants, massages, cooking class & relaxed ambience that this resort offers. Staff were friendly & so very obliging & helpful. Would definitely recommend this JW as a holiday destination.

title: Good relaxing vacations
review: We are staying here on a Luxury Escapes deal for 9 night, we have pool access room which I would highly recommend. Resort is fantastic, right on the beautiful beach, 3 swimming pools (kids, adults and the main pool).  Spa is fantastic, restaurants are great, Olive was our favourite, you need to book for dinner every night. Breakfast has a good selection but lunch gets a bit boring after a few days.   Resort is a 15 minute taxi ride from the centre of Khao Lak, but outside the hotel on either side there are some great little beach bars for a cheap  beer and watch the sunset or massage and hair braiding.  All in all we've had a great time, leave tomorrow which we are sad about, suitable for families with all age kids, young and old alike.

title: Nice hotels
review: Dear gjtanner,  Greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa, Thank you for taking your time to share your memorable experience of your recent stay with us.  Thank you for your recommendation of our Luxury Escape, it has indeed, been a very popular package that many guest book here with us. We have taken your comments regarding our lunch selections and hope to add more variety to our lunch selections.   We hope that you will continue to choose us as your destination resort, and hope to welcome you back in the near future.   Sincerely,

title: Third Visit and Just as Good
review: My wife and I stayed for two weeks this past January and it was just as good if not better than our previous visits.  We plan to return again in Jan. 2017.  It is a large facility, but you do not get a feeling of being crowded.  The pool is so large that is rare for you to be  within 20 feet of anyone else.  The length of the beach  and the placement of beach chairs is such that you can have a conversation with your partner without fear of it being overheard, nor do you often hear other people talking.    In fact we had relatively few interactions with other guests.  And those arose only when people heard our American accents and inquired with variations of "what the devil is this Trump up to?"  Unlike many we prefer the second floor to the pool access rooms because it allows…

title: Fantastic Family Holiday Destination
review: Dear Davidgpf,  Greetings from sunny JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa! We are thrilled to here that you had a memorable experience with your stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience with others here on tripadvisor.  Thank you for your kind words regarding our pool and facilities, our associates work hard to maintain a safe, clean, and well maintenance pool and beach area for our guests.   We are honored to be your resort of choice, and we look forward to welcoming you back to our beautiful resort in the near future.  Sincerely,

title: Had blast in Khao Lak
review: We stayed at JW Marriott Khao Lak as a family of four, with kids aged 5 & 8, for 8 nights on a Luxury Escapes package deal. This review is probably a bit lengthy for some, so I will break it up into sections for those interested in particular areas only…  Check In:  Due to our flight arrival time and Phuket Airport immigration delays we did not leave the airport until about 8:30pm (11:30pm Australian time). As promised a JW Marriott rep was waiting for us and we were soon on the shuttle bus to the hotel. Reception called en-route to see if there was anything they could do for us, which was a nice touch. Due to our late arrival the reception lobby was deserted so the check-in process was quite quick. We were still met however with nice smiles, welcome drinks and cool towels. We…

title: Family holiday
review: Dear  Sean S,   Warm Greetings from our JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa team to you! We are honored to be your choice of destination resort.  Thank you for taking your valuable time to write this lengthy review and share your positive feed backs and tips with others.   We have shared your kind words about our staffs at each and every one of outlets. As we Thais, are known for our simile and hospitality, we cannot be more proud to hear that you have experience great service from us. You review of our restaurants are much appreciated, and we are happy that you were able to come during Songkarn festival to experience the traditional way of celebrating our New Year.   Thank you for your kind words regarding our pool and facilities, our associates pay attention to detail and work hard to keep our pool well maintained, and our landscape marvelous. We hope that your recent experience here at our resort will drive you to come back to us. Our associates look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.   Sincerely,

title: Truely a Luxury Escape.
review: We spent 8 Great days at the Marriot with a group of family and friends to celebrate my birthday. The food,rooms and especially the staff made it a lovely experience. To Nicholas at the front desk and Poo, the head of the dining room staff, a special thanks for going out of your way to make us all so welcome. To the management congrats for encouraging your staff to be focussed on customer service. I recommend this place unreservedly.

title: 5 star & family friendly
review: My wife & I stayed on an eight night all inclusive package. Cannot fault this resort, I think the quality of the food is a strong point. On a package you have a restricted menu but there is plenty of variety. I particularly liked the outdoor Thai dinner near the beach which was fabulous. Do a Thai cooking course if you get the chance. Staff are friendly & efficient  & grounds are impeccable. Great beach. Plenty of guests, many families with small children but at no time did it feel crowded. Location a little isolated, so do at least one day trip.

title: 1st ever visit to Thailand
review: Well what can I say, what a fantastic experience. We have just returned from our 1st ever visit to this wonderful Country & what a hotel to stay in. The staff were always very polite & if there were any problems they were generally sorted very quickly. One or two things we did observe which may help you in making decisions. We booked by choice HB, this we wouldn't do again partly because it is so cheap to eat out & we were disappointed that this restricted you in the restaurants within the complex to set menus for your evening meal, which over 14 nights would be too repetitive for us hence we chose to eat out on numerous occasions. We did treat ourselves to al a carte in The Olive on our last night which was very nice although for us personally too bigger helpings. Don't forget…

title: The ultimate beach holiday!
review: Really, everything has been said in previous reviews. You really have to start with the employees at this beautiful hotel. It would be impossible to award an employee of the week or month as every single member of staff is worthy of winning. It really would be unfair to single out individuals so I shouldn't really mention Laila who greeted us each morning at breakfast - she is so friendly and just lovely. So many reviews mention breakfast - rightly so - the choice of food, the location and service - all first class. The hotel itself is beautiful - definitely 5star. The pool is amazing but I just loved splashing about in the sea for hours a day. The beach is amazing - spotlessly clean and just goes on for miles. Sun beds are plentiful, no real need to get there early unless you…

title: Very good-some buts.
review: First the good, and there's plenty of it. Stayed here for 8 nights, from 11-19th April, on an all inclusive package for food, and 8 spa treatments. The rooms are great, nice balcony overlooking the pool, more a waterway, staff are typically Thai, warm and helpful. Spa treatments were excellent and the girls who took them very skilled. The beach has lovely white sand, and the whole resort is very well maintained by an army of staff, leaves swept up everyday-really!  Food for us was the Achilles heel. The breakfast is a huge buffet which focuses on quantity and variety rather than quality. There are 3 restaurants, Thai, Japanese and Mediterranean. On the deal we were on there was a limited choice in each of these. The standard of food was ok, not gourmet in any sense, with the…

title: Best hotel in thailand
review: We visited the JW Marriott in August 15 as two couples and one child. We booked directly through the hotel and arranged a transfer for 3000 THB from the airport to the hotel which is approximately 90 mins north of the airport.  When we arrived it was a quick check in after 20 hrs of transit and we were immediately impressed with the facilities and the service. There are many restaurants to choose from as well. The pool that just runs around the entire resort is just awesome.  We were travelling with our 5 yo daughter who loved the kids club. It was well run had many activities, some were at an extra cost and the room was cool and secure. The staff there were also friendly and grest with the kids.   There is a little group of shops just out the front of the hotel that includes…

title: Absolutely excellent
review: We took a Luxury Escapes package while friends with us did not. They paid 55% more than us fir an inferior room and 1 less meal/day. If you buy a LE package, first call the hotel and check available dates and any SURCHARGE periods. THEN buy the package and immediately call the hotel back to lock in your dates. Complex but worth it.  We had a lagoon side room. Absolutely fantastic. The staff were just so good: professional, helpful and friendly. Not much English though. The food was very good and the spa treatments included in the package were worth about $750 between 2 people.  I could not fault the hotel. Khao Lak village was grim. Incredible rubbish at prices higher than anywhere else in Asia.   The supermarket at the Marriott entrance gate sells tonic water at about 1/8 the…

title: Perfect hotel, lousy souvenir shop
review: Everything was perfect until we bought a Buddah Mask from a boutique within the hotel premises. Price 20'000 Bath (ca US$ 500)  We asked for it to be shipped to our address in Switzerland and paid for this an additional  6'000 Baths (ca US$ 180). Back home we received an additional invoice in the amount of ca US$ 750 from a local carrier whose fîrst words were to threaten us : if you don't pay we don't deliver. In the end we paid because the mask was a souvenir to mark our 40th wedding anniversary. The BOUTIQUE DID NOTHING TO HELP US.

title: A great all inclusive hotel
review: My husband and I stayed here on a family holiday. The hotel is about 1.5 hours drive from Phuket Airport with not much within walking distance.   We booked as a part of a luxury escapes package which includes all meals. The pool was fantastic and the food was lovely. All the staff were very friendly. The hotel is designed to keep the customers on site but I highly recommend venturing into Khao Lak and exploring a little. It was a very relaxing stay.

title: Must rate as one on Thailand best
review: My wife and myself have been travelling in Thailand for twenty years, visiting on more than 20 occasions.  Have just completed a 10 night stay in Jwm kl. we stayed in the direct pool access rooms where you can jump directly into the pool which stretches some 3km.  The resort is in every way sensational.  Lots of restaurant choices, great food, excellent service, staff are absolutely wonderful.  The rooms are comfortable, very clean and well appointed. Whilst the location is in one of the quieter areas this we felt was a good thing as it allowed us to spend the time in paradise.  Direct beachfront is beautiful, clean, no haggles and stretches for kms. I cannot wait to return.

title: The most beautiful and luxurious stay ever!!!
review: Dear Chris C,  Greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa, we are honored to be your choice of destination resort. Thank you for sharing your experiences with our resort here on Tripadvisor.   We are happy to hear that you had a great time with your stay at our direct pool access room. Our associates work hard to keep our beautiful infinity pool well maintenance for our guests. Thank you for your kind words regarding our restaurant outlets, staffs’ services, and resort atmosphere.   We hope that your stay with us was memorable and that you will come back to us in the near future. We look forward to welcoming you back to our paradise resort. Thank you   Sincerely,

title: Luxury Escape Voucher
review: Even though we checked in late at about midnight, it was pleasant and quite quick. We are a family of four and the staff member upgraded us (at a cost) as he thought our original room would be a bit small. Obviously the pool in great. We had a swim up room which was very private and we swam up to the Happy Hour most days we were there to the Infinity Pool Bar. Voucher included all meals, along with 4 x 45 minute massage at the Day Spa (Quan) - very impressive. Also a cooking class that we didn't use. Breakfast had a great selection; Lunch we only used at the Infinity Pool Bar which you could choose from sandwiches, salads, burgers etc. There was other options for lunch, but we were out and about, so didn't use them. Dinner time had a selection of 4 different restaurants -…

title: Lovely resort
review: Clean, kind and comfortable. The facilities are well kept and clean. The only reason I have gave a 4 out of 5 is because there is a smell of mold in my room that will not dissipate. I should probably call the front desk and ask for a new room, but I'm on vacation and don't feel like it!   Based on the location, I'd assume this resort was devastated by the tsunami in 2004 but you'd never know by looking at it today in 2016. I'm traveling with a family friend in a wheelchair and getting around with her is pretty simple despite the lack of elevators because of small ramps throughout the property. The facility is well kept and the pools are lovely. You could travel by water almost anywhere if you'd like.   The food is very good but the restaurants on the property are very expensive.…

title: Enjoyed the pool mostly
review: Check in took awhile though it was a nice experience as they sit you down in the lobby and take your information back to the office to do the paperwork.  In other words you don't stand at the front desk to check in as you would at most hotels.  It is a huge resort so plan on walking a lot while you are there and in February it was hot.    Our room was located in section 4 and on the 3rd floor, so no pool access, just a deluxe pool view room with a balcony..  If I had upgraded I would have preferred an eastern exposure in Section 2, poolside. Section 3 faces west and seemed really hot.  Also, the rooms with the glass panels on the ground floor seem sterile and not private.  I would choose a room with some of the lovely vegetation, plumerias, etc surrounding it.  Our room could…

title: Best Asian resort i've stayed at.
review: We booked a package with a family pool access room, all meals and a massage daily, through the hotel's website.  The rooms were amazing, huge and loved the pool access. We were in wing 2 and had plants out the front of the patio so very private..  A family of 2 adults and 2 children (8&10).  The meals were all amazing. Ate mostly at Thai and Italian places.  Buffet lunch was great and they were very accommodating of special requests.  Staff from checkin, to cleaners to waiting and bar staff were all fantastic and very friendly.  Pools are great and so clean.  Beach and ocean are the best I've experienced since I started living in Asia.  No motorised water sports, so no sectioned water areas.  You can hire body boards, canoes  paddle boards by the hour for free.  We are planning…

title: A Treat at Khao Lak
review: This hotel was booked as a treat by my partner and sister - BIG thanks.  The JW Marriot is one of those flash hotels that has a swanky lobby, welcoming friendly staff, more than several restaurants, day spa, 3 pools and way more.   We had spent time in Surin, Old Phuket Town, Kata, Karon, seen the Big Buddha previously & done other touristy things so the location was not an issue. For those travellers who like to travel & shop & eat out locally I would say you're a little restricted. We were happy to have 3 days of lieing by the pool, massages & eating the breakfast buffet {the most fantastic hours of 6.30 to 12).  You can get a 5 minute shuttle to Turtle Village for very limited shopping - there is a supermarket here if you want to buy Singa & chips for your room!

title: Luxury hotel but lacks soul
review: I'm getting the hang of these reviews. This might be a long one to explain myself and the  3/5. Could have been 5/5.  If u like review I think there is a button to say if it's useful. Let me know. Might benefit other travellers, managers and reps.  Put your feet up ! Last day of holiday to reflect before home.  Third time in Thailand. Not divas or high maintenance Have stayed in rooftop shacks to luxury hotels. Ordinary folk. 2-3 worldwide  holidays a year.  I'll write things that are important and other things people think are important. Travelled with Thomsons. Never find the upgrade worth the money. Spend it on a trip away instead.  Flight ok but immigration took over two hours in the heat. Take a drink with you.  Private transfer doesn't seem worth it. All small buses rather…

title: good for mass tourism, needs renovation, rip-off restaurants
review: Dear PaullGartshore ,  First of all, we would like to thank you very much for staying with us as your preferred choice of stay during your visit to Khao Lak and taking the time to share your detailed experience.  The main attraction in Khao Lak is natural beauty and surroundings in tranquil setting which contrasts with other areas much more busy.   Perhaps you have not been acquainted properly with the unique attractions in the area.  We do have entertainment available on daily Basis in our outlets such as Thai Dance for out Thai Night and Jazz& reggae and pop Musicians on the Beach lounge or in our outlets.    Please be reassured that your comments have not been unnoticed and have been shared with our team in an effort to improve our service.  Your feedback is extremely valuable to us, we thank you again for choosing JW Marriott Khao Lak, we sincerely hope that you will allow us an opportunity to regain your trust on you next trip to Khao Lak.  Sincerely,  Luca Forges Davanzati Resident Manager JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa  Tel: +66 76 584 888

title: JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort
review: pro: - nice garden and pool - huge property - family friendly - beach access -> go to the restaurants there, they're better and 10% of the price  con: - overpriced, this is not a 5 star property anymore and is in strong need of renovation. we had the executive suite for ca. 500 usd/night and bathroom looked like in a 3 star hotel with rosty sink etc. aircon was blowing some dust into the room which resulted in a small layer of dust over the furniture and triggering my dust allergies. - balcony of executive suite gets less sun than duplex beause windows are not that high - balcony are cheap and underwhelming (ours hasn't been cleaned for weeks) - breakfast with >100 people and unmotivated service feels far away from 5 star. we went to buy our own brekfast in the shop nearby that…

title: Nice hotel with grand deluxe pool
review: Dear vir2l ,  First of all, we would like to thank you very much for staying with us as your preferred choice of stay during your visit to Khao Lak and taking the time to share your experience.  As the Cleanliness in our hotel is a key priority, I am very sorry that your suite fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with the housekeeping team in an effort to improve our service.  We have well noted your air conditioned comments and will be performing urgent maintenance accordingly.  Our pricing is in line with similar properties in this area and we feel that we offer good value given our location and extensive facilities. However, in this case it appears we failed to meet your expectations, and for that I would like to apologize.   Your feedback is extremely valuable to us, we thank you again for choosing JW Marriott Khao Lak, we sincerely hope that you will allow us an opportunity to regain your trust on you next trip to Khao Lak.  Sincerely,  Luca Forges Davanzati Resident Manager JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa  Tel: +66 76 584 888

title: Great vacation spot for everyone.
review: I took my wife and my two children to JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort this April 2016, and had the best experience possible.  From beginning to end the staff of the facility  were all so friendly, polite and helpful.  The resort has the best infinity pool and access to the beach that I have come across.  I had a great experience at all the restaurants located in the resort, the food was tasty as well.  I had the opportunity of tasting Japanese, Thai, and Italian/ Mediterranean cuisines at the resort.  Also to my amazement the resort offers special theme nights where you can enjoying dining outside next to the beach.  I got to experience the Bollywood night dining by the beach and the atmosphere and experience is one to remember.  As for my children they loved every minute of our…

title: perfect hotel perfect location
review: Stayed at this hotel 31 st march for 7 nights. We have three boys twins of 11 and a 14 yro. Lovely family room very spacious with pool access. Staff couldnt be more attentive if they tried and are always helpful friendly and polite.Good selection at breakfast, and lots of space both inside and out. We didn't eat at hotel as the restaurants and drinks were expensive (although there are offers on cocktails and a happy hour) instead we ate every night at one of the many restaurants along the beach. The food was delicious and we paid around £20-£30 for all five of us including beer and wine. The pool at the hotel is amazing and there are water ways snaking all around hotel to swim round aswell as the main pool and a childrens pool. The beach was clean and the sea was warm and clear.…

title: Wonderful stay in Khao Lak
review: This is a beautiful hotel in a beautiful location. Hotel was amazing and the food was fantastic. There was a beach BBQ on Monday with kebab skewers and amazing sauces and salads... We thought it was one of the best meals we'd had in Thailand. The only thing I felt was missing and I would have loved, was a cold water plunge pool. I would be grateful if this was installed in time for my next visit. Because I will be back!

title: Lots of children so not really a couples resort anymore
review: This hotel has been selling packages in which kids stay & eat free. Predictably this means there are now a lot more children at this resort. Unfortunately everywhere is really noisy and it is hard to relax. It wasn't always like this. The restaurants used to be really peaceful and romantic. Now they're super busy and loud. Same for the pool and pool bars (!). We woke to children running up and down the corridors yelling in the morning and slept to the sound of children running on the wooden floors in the room below.  On the positive side, the resort is still beautiful and the staff are all excellent. If you are coming with kids and you enjoy a holiday where there are lots and lots of children this resort might suit you. For us, we'll be heading to an adults-only resort for some…

title: Stunning Resort in quiet area of Khao Lak
review: Spent 14 nights at probably one of the best hotels I have had the pleasure in staying in. The accommodation, grounds, pools and beach are stunning. The staff are the most friendliest and accommodating employees I have seen in a hotel resort and really compliment the hotel resort.  Rooms - Large and the most comfortable bed you would expect from a quality hotel. Large Bath (Jacuzzi style but no jets), walk in Shower with large overhead shower, double sink and fully complimentary bathroom products. Flat-screen TV in the room, safe, loads of storage and the room is finished with sofa and a further recliner style lounger. Mini Bar stocked (and enough room to keep cold your own purchases). On the patio - sun deck loungers and table and the best bit (if you are lucky to get a ground…

title: Great holiday - highly recommend
review: Dear pcater, Greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa, we are thrilled that you have chosen us as your destination resort.  We whole heartily appreciate you spending your time to write this informative review.   It seems that our accommodations and the friendliness of our staffs have been the highlights of your recent stay with us, we could not be happier.  Thank you for your praises about our breakfast venues, the Deil, Takrai Restaurant, and Quan Spa. We are disappointed that our beach buffets did not meet your expectation, rest assure that we will share your comments with our food and beverage team about adding more variety of food to our menu. In regards to the prices of our drinks, we are in line with other resorts in the area, and given our location and the amenities we offers, we feel that we offer a good value.   We hope to be welcoming you back to our beautiful resort in the near future.   Sincerely,  Hanna Karuna Biboribankul  Social Media Executive

title: paradise and amazing sunsets
review: Stayed 12 nights on a bed & breakfast basis in one of the lower floor swim up rooms(not near the children's pool).  Firstly the staff are amazing from reception team to the Gardner's and waiting staff always smiling and nothing was too much trouble. An example of which was one night we wanted ice to take back to our room for a few quiet drinks on the terrace. The beach bar had running of my CE so they asked us to go to our room. Less than ten minutes later a whole jug and 2 chilled glasses arrived. Lying on the sunbeds each day the beach staff would bring chilled water every half an hour or so and would offer to clean your sun glasses Breakfast was superb. Just about everything you could ever want including sushi. The ladies who manage the egg stations were polite and wished us…

title: Beautiful Resort with a Stunning Pool
review: We loved this resort, stayed in a duplex suite which was great with the 2 kids downstairs and us in a galleried upstairs.  The facilities were really good, especially the swimming pool which is an endless lazy river.  The food in the hotel was also really good, but by the time the +++ for taxes and service and, and, and, it became very expensive.  We were there for B&B and it was actually perfect as there were lots of local Thai eateries along the beach which were cheap and so good. If I had any gripes it would be that the kids club was a little disappointing, a 'treasure hunt' turned out to be the staff hiding ping pong balls in the club area and many of the activities seemed to be quite girlish (necklace making, fan painting etc.) which wasn't brilliant for my 7 year old boy. …

title: Best we've experienced in Thailand
review: Dear ClaireGrande,  Warm greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak and Spa, thank you for choosing us as your destination resort.  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing to us about your experience at our resort.  Thank you for your kind words regarding our infinity pool, we are thrilled that it was one of the highlights of your stay with us. In regards to the Hotel’s food and beverage prices, our prices are in line with similar properties in this area, and we feel that we offer a good value given our location and facilities.   Your suggestions regarding the activities in the Kid’s Club has been noted, and will be brought to our related staffs. We look forward to welcoming you and your friends back at our lovely resort. Have a great day.

title: Fantastic warmth
review: As a few of the other reviewers here have said - we also travelled via the Luxury Escapes package. For starters we were really really impressed with this truly 5 star resort. Beautiful room with big balcony with sun beds looking over the pool (no rooms are without a pool view) and everything you'd expect in a 5 star resort. The staff were excellent and the facilities were beautiful. The resort is point blank on the beach with resort facilities right to the sand including sun beds and bar. The restaurants were diverse and all excellent. As far as the package is concerned (if even relevant here on trip advisor) we were very surprised at the breadth of lovely meal options including both al a carte and buffet options each night. Sure you had to book each morning where you wanted to…

title: Heaven on earth!!!!!!
review: We travelled in april 2016 my wife and I. It was our 2nd luxury escapes deal .pick up from the airport followed by an easy 80 mibs journey to khao lak marrIot.we were made very welcome with happy faces everywhere and a warm greeting.reception staff were nice and helpful and we got tje  room I had requested in wing 3 following other reviews I gad read. A well appoibted room wirh great bed ,tv bath and shower,hairdryer and ironing board.our ground floor room had a balcony that you stepped off into the warmest bath like 3km od stunning pool. It was heaven .wing 3 is close to kids pool and swim up bar(2 of these on site)not too noisy at all. Note that plenty of rooms with pool access do have pool fencing for  safety. Ours did not . The package included breakfasts lunch and…

title: Favourite resort on our Thai tour
review: Khao Lak is beautiful. Was our favourite stop out of Bangkok, Krabi and Kata Noi beach.  Could not fault this hotel. Set on a fabulous beach stretching a few km with clear waters.  Hotel is large and although full never felt overcrowded. We had two interconnecting rooms with pool access, these can only be found at the back of the resort but is only a 2 min walk to beach.  Ask to be sat in the quiet area at breakfast if children over 8 as much quieter as can become a noisy affair with all the children here.  Olive restaurant was lovely and we ate at the places both left and right of hotel which were all great and very cheap.  The bamboo huts offering massages to the left of the hotel beat any spa as set right on the beautiful beach.  Did elephant trekking through the hotel which…

title: Two words....... Amazingly sublime
review: I am writing this review whilst sitting alone by the pool at the JW marriot. My brother booked this trip via luxury escapes last year and we have travelled as a party of 9 adults and 2 one year olds. We have booked for 10 nights and I am currently on day 7. Here is my experience so far ..... On arrival pick up was easy ..... Courtesy coach was exclusively for our party and once you get through the chaos of Phuket airport it was easy to find. 90 minutes transfer to hotel was swift and lots to look at on route. On arrival at the hotel and cold towel and welcome drink were provided. Our party were all close together in rooms. I was room 4175, a fair way from reception but near to beach and restaurants ( I haven't needed to go to reception so glad I'm near the beach )  My brother…

title: Impressive service mind
review: The hotel locates at the nice beach like aprivate beach. All staff are well trained with service-mind, keep a warm welcome and big smile. Room delivery food is quick. But the taste is so so. Overall facities are very good Room is clean Don't buy any tour at the hotel it is too expensive

title: Excellent resort in Khao Lak a little bit isolated
review: Khao Lak beaches are amazing: they stretch for kiilometers and kilometers. Marriot Khao Lak is basically in the middle of one of those extense beaches, which means you get all the peace and quiet you can go after in your holidays. The hotel offers all kind of entertainments: free yoga, muai thai, bicycle tours, pilates,... apart from spa, billiard, ping pong, a huuuge swimmingpool, and activities in the sea. the good point is that if you do not feel like staying inside the hotel all the time, you can enjoy a good selection of bars and restaurants and massage stands right on the beach at both sides of the hotel. If you wish to go to the shops at Khao Lak, it is not in walking distance, but taxis are quite cheap (300 baths per way). Breakfast buffet is superb, and sitting areas…

title: Fantastic Resort
review: What a great hotel and great service and very friendly staff, this is no doubt a 5 Star Resort. We got a room upgrade on arrival to a spa room, we did not want it as we had booked a pool access room, the upgrade was of course because there were no available pool rooms, so we stayed in the spa room for one night, but it was fine, so the treated us to a free dinner, though we had to pay for the drinks, but still a nice gesture. The breakfast was fantastic, everything you could dream of, was there. 4 restaurants and a deli om the Resort, so you dont have to leave, but still a bit pricy, but you only have to go down to the Beach and go left or right and there are lots of restaurants and very cheap, 2 people cam easely have dinner for 5-800 baht. The pool is fantastic and you cam…

title: Fantastic location friendly and efficient staff
review: Just back from two weeks in this fantastic resort which we thoroughly enjoyed.  We do not normally go to such a large resort hotel but the Marriott caters for families and couples well.    We wanted a quiet room and we were given a top floor room in wing one and it was perfect. I would say wing one and two would be the quietest  while three four and five would be best if you have children or if you like to meet up with new friends.  The beach is outstanding , miles of pristine sand to walk along with restaurants and  massage cabanas right next to the hotel.   The breakfast was fantastic lots and lots of choice ,great range of fresh fruit, fresh fruit smoothies continually topped up ,omelettes made to your personal taste something for everyone.   The stars of the hotel are the…

title: Absolutely Exceptional
review: Dear StuartAnn,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your positive experiences.   We are truly happy to hear that we have met your expectations with our service, facilities, and amenities. We are happy that you were able to have a memorable experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate your comments regarding our beach, spa, hotel's outlets and breakfast. We hope to be able to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn  Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Great hotel with very good staff and the best swimming pools
review: I took my wife and two kids (3 & 6) to the JW Mariott for 10 days over Easter 2016. We had one of the best holidays ever (and we travel every holiday).  Service : Never had better service in a hotel, ever. Even where my booking for a romantic dinner on the beach for my 40th birthday was forgotten (the only "blip"), they insisted we do it anyway (with 15 minutes time to set up) and then the whole dinner and wine etc was on the house. That was equivalent to about USD200, so they really stepped up and took responsibility. It also seemed like they were trying to make up for it for the rest of the holiday.   By the end of the holiday we had met the head chefs, food and beverage chief and felt like part of the family.  Special thanks to Jay (Head Chef I think), Sa ( also a head Chef),…

title: Fabulous Khao Lak
review: The hotel was great very good facilities especially the gym and the yoga room was very professional. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful you can see they had a great training as they do a great job. The room was modern and the wifi worked perfectly. The GM was very friendly and came to say hello what we thought it was a great touch. Would come gain as it is value for money

title: Tranquil Location and a great Property
review: Dear MHWombat,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your positive experiences.   We are truly happy to hear that we have met your expectations with our service, facilities, and amenities. We are happy that you were able to have a memorable experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate your comments regarding our fitness centre, service staffs and room. We hope to be able to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn  Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Treated like royalty .
review: Thai people would have t be amongst the friendlyest people I have met. But staying at this hotel we were made to feel like family.Obviously the training is acceptional, but also we felt their friendship was given honestly. We still have some staff members as our Facebook friends.  If you are planning to lost weight, it won't happen here, as its fully inclusive ,and the meals from breakfast lunch and dinner are surperb. They have 3 different restuaurants and you can take your pick every night from Japanese , Italian or Thai,and all were excellent . We were lucky enough to have s pool room,which meant every morning we would get up and walk outside and the pool was on our doorstep. We spent 7 nights there, and were sad when we left, as we'd made some lovely friends amongst the…

title: Simply divine. Even better than anticipated and we are notoriously hard to please!
review: We stayed at the resort for 10 nights between 10/3-20/3 with our 4.5 year old and 14 month old boys in a family lagoon access room.  Overall we loved our stay and the hotel and grounds are wonderful and the staff offered a service second to none. I always strive to write a balanced detailed review, so here goes:  Service - we love Thailand as it really does live up to its name as the 'land of smiles'. The staff goes out of its way to help you, 24/7 and don't walk past without greeting you ‘a good day'. If we had a query or needed further information, they responded straight away. I did find the pre - departure communication a little slow, following up to queries a couple of times to get a response by email.  Room (1014-wing 1) - the room was huge and plenty big enough. We booked…

title: Room for improvement
review: The reason I am giving this property a 3 rating is down to a few factors - firstly the setting of the resort is beautiful , tranquil & nicely laid out. In my opinion block 1 or 2 are the best, location wise & overlook the adult pool & fountain area. We had a 2nd storey  duplex room with a delightful overhanging balcony & yes as per other comments the rooms & furnishings do need updating , but the beds are extremely comfortable & are cleaned well on a daily basis.  I do understand that many guests are on different packages , which may or may not include breakfast but having to wait every morning to fill in a card with your details is a bit antiquated when surely giving a room number should suffice. This brings me on to my biggest gripe about this property , the holiday camp style…

title: Pure relaxation with excellent service
review: Dear Oscarspet,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa Thank you for taking your valuable time writing us with your feedback and for your nice words about our associates and overall experience.  At our Waterfront Restaurant, We do have separate air conditioned and open air areas for breakfast available for Adults and over 6 Yrs old children whilst the main hall is for families. Please accept our apologies for the lapse in communication; perhaps our associates did not direct you properly.  We have recently added extra 50 Sun loungers beside the water sport area which will enable our guest for more space and comfort. New chairs have also been added in the pool alcoves and in the gardens.  I am very sorry that your stay fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with the resort team in an effort to improve our service.   We sincerely apologize for not having delivered towards your expectations and we all hope to have the opportunity of welcoming you back to our beautiful resort in the near future.  Respectfully,  Luca Forges Davanzati Resident Manager JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa  Tel: +66 76 584 888

title: Our stay was like Paradise !!!
review: Shortly we will visit this resort for our third time which speaks for itself. Yes you can find more modern resorts now in Khao Lak but we like the traditional feel of JW Marriott and the fact you really wouldn't have to leave the resort if you chose not to. The rooms are a good size, clean and well appointed. Very comfortable large beds and pillows mean you are well rested every day to enjoy the many activities on offer. Our pool access room has a very private deck where you can slip in and out of the pool, or there are many other spots around this very large canal style pool you can set up for the day. The breakfast buffets are some of the best we have experienced. We have lunch at the pool bar cafe, the staff there are just beautiful and quickly got to know we like our lattes…

title: Amazing
review: Stayed in a pool access room in december 2015. Travelled with a friend who stayed in a standard room (deluxe lagoon pool view).  The rooms are very spacious and clean. A bit of wear and tear, but that's expected in this climate. The beach area is absolutely fantastic with lots of sunbeds, a gorgeous beach with plenty of excellent, cheap restaurants surrounding it. This is particularly nice considering the expensive prices of food and drinks at the resort. While lying on the sunbeds staff kept your glass full of ice cold water The main pool is great with a nice pool bar, but the pool that stretches for kilometres along the resort is the real treat. Stepping out from the terrace right into the pool is amazing. Neither the pools or beach felt overcrowded and according to staff the…

title: One of the best in the world.
review: Dear Johan W,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your positive experiences.   We are truly happy to hear that we have met your expectations with our service, facilities, and amenities. We are happy that you were able to have a memorable experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate your comments regarding our room, pool, service staffs and breakfast. We hope to be able to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn  Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Stunning Setting, but oh, the food
review: Our holiday started with the hotel transfer picking us up from Phuket Airport, it took around 60 minutes to get to the hotel. Check in was done by a lovely lady, can´t remember her name. She told us everything we needed to know and then followed us to our room. We had booked a pool access room and we loved it. Having the opportunity to walk 4 steps from your terrace and then in to the pool, it was amazing.  The room was very nice, a rock hard bed as expected in Thailand, a very nice bathroom with both tub and a separate shower. Housekeeping always did a great job keeping the room clean, and every day we had a new "towel animal" on the bed when we came back from the beach. The room shows signs of wear and tear but that´s normal in this kind of climate.  There a lots of places to…

title: Fantastic place
review: Dear peter7173,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your positive experiences.   We are truly happy to hear that we have met your expectations with our service, facilities, and amenities. We are happy that you were able to have a memorable experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate your comments regarding our room, pool and service staffs and we will improvement on your comments of in-room lighting. We hope to be able to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn  Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Good in parts
review: We had 10 nights on a Luxury Escape package (all found) and it was a somewhat mixed bag.  On the plus side, the pool is truly magnificent.  The beach is great, the grounds lovely, the room was fine,  a little tired, but nothing to worry about.  The sax player/ live entertainer, Gerard was brilliant and really added to the atmosphere.  The Spa was incredible.  Since our package was all found, we went to all the restaurants at the resort.  Breakfast was varied and really quite good - no complaints there.  The Italian restaurant, Olive, was really good and we ended up eating there every night.  Why you might ask? - because the other resort restaurants were truly awful!!  The first night we tried the Thai restaurant and our green curry was tasteless.  The chef asked how we liked his…

title: Worth a Visit
review: Yes the Marriott is a very nice place to stay. We only had 3 nights here the Swimming Pool is amazing good for your daily excercise.  We did gave a Pool Room Access Room a Real Treat. Breakfast was included and such a good variety of food.  After having Breakfast no.need for lunch. Evening nice Restaurants to the right of the Hotel on the Beach. We look forward to visiting again.

title: Great beach resort
review: Dear gypsygirl52,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your positive experiences.   We are truly happy to hear that we have met your expectations with our service, facilities, and amenities. We are happy that you were able to have a memorable experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate your comments regarding our pool and breakfast. We hope to be able to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn  Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: An amazing way to relax
review: Stayed at the J W  Marriott from 5th to the 19th March 2016.  What can I say...... beautiful beach side resort. On arrival we were given cold drinks and flannels and headed off to breakfast while awaiting our room.  Room was ready by 11am in block 1, room 1011 beautiful room with pool access and v v clean.  Plus sides of this hotel staff staff staff, they are amazing and nothing is too much trouble, resort is clean and peaceful. Downside hotel restaurants are a bit pricey so we opted to eat at the many venues available on the beach where the food and setting was fantastic, great to enjoy a proper Thai meal whilst watching the sun go down. Rooms were spotless and one day noticing that no water had been left we called reception and four bottles were delivered within minutes! Great…

title: "Dreams do come True"
review: Dear Tillytonks2009,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your positive experiences.   We are truly happy to hear that we have met your expectations with our service, facilities, and amenities. We are happy that you were able to have a memorable experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate your comments regarding our Pool Access Room and F&B outlets. We hope to be able to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn  Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Awesome Resort and Staff - Simply Paradise
review: We just got back from 6  glorious days at the JW Marriott.  Facilities and staff are incredible.  Rooms are a bit tired but to be honest you don't spend much time there.  Definitely recommend if you need to get away.

title: Great beach resort!
review: Great beach resort!   We (couple + 2 children)  stayed here our first 3 nights in Thailand  (including one day to the Similan Islands) and one more night among our return from khao sok national park.  fantastic family room with direct pass to the huge swings pool, amazing bath tab,  huge  breakfast options and above all - fantastic service - from the ball boy to the reception and till the last cleaning staff - just great! The location of the hotel is on a nice tropical  large beach  shore with white sand, and 50 meters from the hotel beach you can find a lot of typical Thai  cheap "beach restaurants"  and massage options, so you don't  really need to use the (very expensive) restaurants and spa of the hotel.  All in all - great experience.

title: Amazing Amazing Amazing
review: Dear gilyael1,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your positive experiences.   We are truly happy to hear that we have met your expectations with our service, facilities, and amenities. We are happy that you were able to have a memorable experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate your comments regarding our pool and breakfast. We hope to be able to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn  Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Simply amazing
review: This is simply the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Stayed here for 6 nights with the family. It was simply the best vacation ever for the kids. we got ourselves upgraded to a villa with the pool right at your backyard. The pool of the whole cannot be described in words. Its just wow ! it snakes it way through our rooms and comes out to the most breathtaking infinity pool with a bar in it. The hotels private white sands beach is paradise. The service is marvelous. The rooms and the toilets out this world. The buffet breakfast is so huge that you would need a segway to go around. I tried the spa and the massage was heavenly.We never stepped out of the hotel for days it was just swimming eating the beach and sleeping. The most relaxed rejuvenating vacation that i have ever had. I…

title: Amazing hotel
review: Dear bobmuks,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your positive experiences.   We are truly happy to hear that we have met your expectations with our service, facilities, and amenities. We are happy that you were able to have a memorable experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate your comments regarding our pool, beach and breakfast. We hope to be able to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn  Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Wedding Anniversary Celebration
review: They say a picture is the equivalent to 1000 words, and in this case I hope you would agree? I shall go ahead with 1000 words anyway, because this place and the people deserve it ... Khao Lak is a stunning part of Thailand, and what made is super special is staying at the J.W.Marriott. The staff there are ever so friendly, everyone from concierge who helped with my tailored suits, to the Bar staff with whom we got to know during our 2 week stay (surprisingly!). There was one particular person, Jimlim, who spoke English like no other Thai person I have ever met before. She is the social ambassador (never heard of this title but sounds pretty cool!) and can be seen in one of these pictures with a French couple whom became good friends. We were at an event one evening and couldn't…

title: This is truly a 5 star hotel, in every sense
review: Approx 5 km north of Khao Lak city centre and 2 km from the mainroad towards the beach is JW Marriott Resort & Spa.  A fantastic resort with Asias longest pool, there are waterways/channels that runs all over the premises. We have been told it´s between 2-3 km in total length.  Everything from the room, service staff, restaurants, beach area are truly 5 stars.  This hotel might have the best breakfast buffé we have ever came across, and we have stayed at some really upscale places during our travels.  The beach area is large and very clean, and there are sunbeds for everybody. No need to get up at 4 a clock in the morning to put out your towels! The staff passes you every 20 minutes and gives you ice water to make sure you drink properly. That´s smart service in my book.  They…

title: Best Resort EVER, Amazing, Best 8 nights, GF food Options
review: Wow what an amazing place, truely 5 star luxury resort.  We booked 8 nights through luxury escapes deal only 5 weeks before stay as recommend by friends but without deal couldnt afford it.  Deal was excellent value with all meals, 8 massages and a 1 way transfer. We used them for return transfer for 2100 BHT.  We also got slightly later checkout and use of checkout lounge.  We upgraded to a 2 story duplex on arrival (extra AUD 1100 for 8 nights on top of pool access room we had) to get own space upstairs and kids had beds downstairs, heaps of space, lovely balcony and pool access was just one set stairs down.  Room was clean and bed so comfy.  Biggest bath i have seen and a great shower.  We had 2 bathrooms in our suite.  We had a room close to breakfast and beach which was…

title: Great Place
review: One of the most relaxing mini vacations we have had.  Facilities are fabulous.  We had room with lagoon access.  There is a lagoon several Km's long that meanders around the complex plus several pools.  On site shops and restaurants.  We ate at several of the restaurants and found them good.  There are restaurants up and down the beach that are in easy walking distance and much cheaper.  This is a great place.

title: Beware of handing your credit card in at front desk
review: Dear Bill H,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your positive experiences.   We are truly happy to hear that we have met your expectations with our service, facilities, and amenities. We are happy that you were able to have a memorable experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate your comments regarding our pool and hotel's outlets. We hope to be able to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn  Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Great tip from 'miss Marriott' Jimlim
review: We have recently returned from 6 nights at this hotel and the resort was beautiful and extremely well maintained. The breakfast was amazing and the pool was exceptional. So basicaly we cannot fault our time at this resort. Since returning home there have been 2 fraud transactions made on our credit card. We only used this credit card twice while we were away ... at this hotel and at the Movenpick on Karon Beach. Each of these hotels had the same procedure where they take your credit card and take it out your sight to another room out the back for pre-authorisation. This can be the only way someone has been able to access the card details so in future we will never let the card out of our sight so these hotels need to get another system.

title: Believe the hype!
review: We got back yesterday from a ten night stay at JWM, and after checking out at an extended 2PM (much appreciated).    No doubt you will see a lot of five star ratings for this establishment, and in my opinion you should believe the hype.  It is one of the best places that I have ever stayed, and the friendliness of the staff cannot be exaggerated.  If some of the tips I have for you appear as criticisms, they are not intended to be as we ourselves took a lot of cues from other guests in their comments here.  -	First up, if you get in late, don’t feel bad in telling your greeter/s that you can be given the rundown the next day.  We arrived at 7PM (10PM on our body clocks) and just wanted a drink, a feed and bed.  The overview is quite long, and the showing of the maps, explanation…

title: A wonderful stay
review: We stayed here for 1 week during our 1 month Thailand trip and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. We had a premium lagoon view room on the top floor of building 2 (2205) and were very satisfied with it. It was clean, comfortable and actually quite peaceful with a lovely view over the lagoon.  We arrived fairly late but check-in was fast and courteous. We had a small snack at the Thai restaurant on our first evening and kept returning. Our best thanks to Ann and Oil for great recommendations and wonderful service. Oil even arranged a farewell dinner for us and we have very fond memories of the staff here. The breakfast buffet is fantastic. We sat outside on the terrace each morning and after a few days were greeted like old friends. I think the separate dining area for people without…

title: Enjoyable - beautiful room- expensive drinks
review: Dear montemaranne,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your positive experiences.   We are truly happy to hear that we have met your expectations with our service, food, and amenities. It seems like the great service and friendliness or our staffs are the highlights of your stay here, and we cannot be more pleased to hear about it. As we Thais, are known for our hospitality and smiles, we are happy that you were able to have a memorable experience with us.  Thank you for you encouraging words to our staffs, we will certainly share the positive feedbacks with them. In addition, we also appreciate your comments regarding our pool and landscapes. We hope to be able to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn  Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Could be better
review: We stayed here for 8 days in March 2016 following a land tour of India.  We thought our all inclusive package covered all meals , but now find lunch is restricted to one course.  Breakfast buffet is outstanding, but the Waterfront restaurant is a large noisy cafeteria style gallery room.  Service is outstanding.  Have eaten at Olive (Italian) restaurant and ver pleased.  Likewise Sakura ((Japanese) restaurant.  Find the price of mediocre wines exorbitant.  Beautiful pools and beach access is terrific.  We will travel the 10-15 km by resort shuttle into local township. Excursions are expensive and again in talking to other guests they give mixed results.  For us this was a chance to get some R& R in a warm tropical climate with terrific pool and beach.   It has done this very…

title: Amazing hotel!
review: Dear Ken050,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your experience with you stay with us in March.   Thank you for your kind comments regarding our pool and facilities. We are thrilled to hear that you had a positive dining experience with us at Olive and Sakura. With your next visit, we encourage you to try our other resort’s services and activities if you have not already done so. Our Spa services have been the highlights of many of our guest stay here at the resort, we offer varieties of massage packages, body treatments, and beauty services. In addition, we have schedules for classes such as umbrella painting, Thai cooking lessons, and animal towel folding. All our activities can be booked in advance with our reception center.   We appreciate you choosing us as your choice of resort, and hope to service you again in the future.    Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Beautiful hotel made more beautiful by the staff
review: Me and my wife went here for our honeymoon and it was absolutely beautiful, the staff really made the whole experience. We got massages included in our package and it was the most amazing bit, every part of it was out of this world amazing. The food was full of selection, loved the thai restaurant and was pleasantly surprised by the italian restaurant. The pool bar food was epic and helped us have some snacks for later when all the restaurants are closed. The bus system was good for access to town, an acceptable price as well. The cocktails were amazing but out of happy hour were expensive but there are loads of places down the beach, not a far walk that will also go above and beyond for their customers.  Tour plans are cheaper when bought in the town but definitely don't be shy…

title: Very Lovely Property with Good Service
review: Dear Get C,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your positive experiences.   We are truly happy to hear that we have met your expectations with our service, facilities, and amenities. We are happy that you were able to have a memorable experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate your comments regarding our pool and hotel's outlets. We hope to be able to service you again in the near future.   Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn  Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: family vacations
review: As expected of the Marriott, the brand delivered very good service and provided a  positive and relatively good experience. The big plus point for choosing this resort in Khao Lak would be the humongous and touted as the longest swimming pool by the resort in Asia Pacific (Spans the entire resort with 2 very different kind of water landscape).   I thoroughly enjoyed a memorable and pleasant swimming experience exploring the pool with varying depths and lengths unique to this resort. I must say that there are very limited resorts that have pools of this scale. This resort sure brought back fond memories of the pool i experienced at Sheraton Hua Hin.   The check-in and check-out process were fast and efficient. The room facilities were excellent (Spacious room with comfortable…

title: 2 weeks of paradise
review: wE selected the place as it was isolated enough from touristic places and far enough from the main road ; estate is magnificent  , a building in shape of letter E with swimmingpool and waterways meandering along the building lenghth of 3 km where you can swim everywhere ; gardens beautifully manicured with an army of gardeners, several varieties of flowers and trees ; rooms are quite nice , classically furnished, ,  light not strong enough ; king size bed but too hard , we have experienced soft welcmoe mattress in other places and would have preferred that ; bathroom separated from the room by a window which could have been pleasant , but toilets are in the bathroom so we had to close the shades ! bathroom well equipped with all amenities ; we had a pool access room so it feels…

title: Beautiful, relaxing great staff
review: One of the best hotels we have stayed in. We were in Khao Lak 2 years ago at The Sands which was wonderful but the Marriott surpassed it. First off, upgrade to a swim up room. If you don't, once you arrive you will regret it. The whole resort is connected by a series of canals and pools; get yourself a lilo and relax! Secondly, I would recommend just having bed and breakfast. It's more than enough to fill you up for the day and come the evening, there are several good beach side restaurants adjacent to the hotel. Our favourite was The Andaman purely because of the wonderful staff there but you get great, cheap, fresh food at any of them. The resort itself is immaculate, the staff genuinely friendly ("sadika") and helpful and the rooms perfect. We stayed in 3029 which is away…

title: Fantastic hotel and lovely staff
review: High quality hotel, fabulous well equipped, spotless, spacious rooms. Good wifi coverage all over complex. Class hotel equals expensive but quality food & drinks. Breakfast was good, so much choice and variety. Olive restaurant was excellent, beach / pool bars excellent for cocktails & food. The Thai restaurant is good but you'll get more choice and better value at the beachfront restaurants (turn right out of the hotel). Staff were excellent - always friendly and helpful. Would return.

title: Relaxing 2 days
review: Marriot in Khao Lak was one of the best hotels I have ever visited with the biggest breakfast buffet ever seen . Really lovely food amazing scenery top class services and definitely a place I would visit again to stay for a week . Congratulations Marriot personnel and thank you for your great efforts in creating a wonderful experience for me

title: Truly amazing
review: We were here last year, and enjoyed it so much came back again this year, and it is better than we remembered. The staff are amazing, always friendly and smiling, the rooms are large and comfortable, spotlessly clean with big comfy beds efficient air con and spacious bathrooms The beach is one of the best beaches we have seen in 20 years of holidays in Asia, sandy, clear sea and views that just go on The sunsets at the beach bar are a great way to start the evening The restaurants on the beach are very close, and sitting under the trees listening to the sea is heavenly The only bad thing this year is the hotel setting up their outside dining almost on top of the guests on the sun loungers, but we still plan back next year

title: Very good... But!
review: Dear SueD,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa, We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time writing us about your experience at our resort.   It is our pleasure to welcome back returning guests, thank you for your continued loyalty and kind words. We are pleased that we are able to continue to meet you expectations when it comes to our staffs, facilities, and amenities.   Thank you for your kind comments about your positive experiences with our rooms. We have also taken note about your comments regarding the outside dining set ups and will discuss it with our F&B team.  We are honor to be your hotel of choice at in Khao Lak and hope to service you again next year!  Sincerely, Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Loved this Property!
review: Have just returned after a two week stay at this hotel.. We found that overall it was a very pleasant stay with a couple of downsides..  Our room was always cleaned very late in the afternoon and not particularly we'll, the balcony was never touched at all during our stay, sheets were only changed once during our holiday evident by a stain which my wife noticed.  on checking my bill after the first week we found that we had been charged for long distance phone calls we had not made, on complaint the charges were removed without an explanation.  As a couple we found that the hotel was a children's paradise.. Driving everyone mad especially at meal times, great for families but not for the likes of us.

title: Quality Chill out Time!
review: A superb hotel, right on the beach, near enough to Khao Lak but not to close to be bothered by 'looky men/women'.  A good choice of dining options both on resort and on the beach (off resort) the pool is something else!! Approx 1km loop round the hotel.  Would highly recommend.. Top quality service.

title: A piece of a paradise
review: When waking up in the morning for a song of cicadas followed by birdsongs at same time when sun rises. Lazily open your eyes and stretch yourself in a very comfortable large bed, take a shower in a lovely big bathroom where shower is even better than one at home, enjoy luxurious toiletries. Get dressed and go for a breakfast that serves whatever you could want for. Everyone you meet greets you with the big warm smile and politeness. This feels good I can tell you.  We stayed two weeks in this wonderful and beautiful hotel. Our two rooms were in block three in a third floor facing the kid’s pool. That didn’t bother us at all; pool area was quiet already very early in the evening.  Rooms a big and beautiful decorated, a lot of storage place, a little worn but then what. Bathrobes…

title: Amazing staff and beautiful hotel
review: We stayed in a swim up room it was shaded from the sun which was an advantage as we could stay on our balcony all day. The sun is very strong so more than 20 mins and your likely to be burnt. The swimming pool is the largest I've ever seen and we would spend between 2-4 hrs going through the whole pool. It was clean and tidy like the rest of the hotel. The staff were absolutely brilliant. Aom and May did our rooms everyday they left chocolate on the bed made different towel animals and folded the bed and our robes differently each day. The pool staff worked constantly to remove any leaves that dropped in to it.The staff were always busy cleaning constant maintenance e.g painting the steps and the walls etc. The buffet breakfast had an enormous selection and tasted fab. We had a…

title: Beautiful
review: Upon arrival, such a warm greeting from the personnel and in fact every time we returned from an excursion, the same thing.   The personnel are understanding, calm, smiling, friendly  and very efficient, in particular Louis (her name is pronounced Louise).   They all seem to really care.   The hotel grounds and interiors are spectacular.   Everytime you turn a corner, the zen, classy and stylish decorations are calling out to be photographed.     The beach is a dream.  Only thing is when uncouth holiday makers tie their towels over a few deckchairs in front and then only come back hours later !   Thankfully the surveillance team take away their towels and leave them a note saying that their belongings can be found at the towel center.  Rightly so!   Complimentary drinkable water…

title: Amazing lagoon
review: First impression was friendly welcome by 2 beautiful receptionists who clearIy explained about the resort. The second was room upgrading to a higher category. Resort's lagoon is the most interesting facility that brought us here and not disappointing at all. Chef at Sakura (a Japanese restaurant) made us enjoyed. Breakfast buffet line is also brilliant.

title: Wonderful service at a beautiful resort
review: We really enjoyed our 10 day holiday in this resort. One of the best parts were the immaculate service from all the staff - made you feel special from the moment we arrived. The gardens were beautifully kept, and the pool system was fantastic with so many different interlinked areas.  The breakfast comprised a huge selection of foods from all over the world, which was served either inside, or outside (which we preferred as it was child free and much quieter than inside). We did eat in a couple of the restaurants on the resort: the food was good and service excellent, but we ended up eating at one of the 7/8 places that have sprung up along the beach nearby. The food in all of these was good and much cheaper, and the people there so friendly. The Czar bar served excellent…

title: Great service - need small adjustments
review: Can't complaint about the service, the staff is really friendly and polite and gives you everything that you are looking for. The one thing that's missing is that little extra - better air condition in the gym/relax, wider selection of vegetarian food and a small renovation of the hotel with feels already a bit warn out. We had a swim up room wish I highly recommended. A lot of mosquitos in the area so bring lotion or something if you can. Otherwise - perfect!

title: Overrated
review: Very friendly staff but often lacking management direction, in particular the breakfast buffet where guests were supposed to log in at one main point on arrival but there some 5 separate entrances : confusion prevailed . Italian restaurant overpriced , only 3rd. choice of wine available. Reception staff not very friendly, did not ask whether stay had been enjoyable. Resort operates on the American ++ system , which adds 17% to all prices.  This resort has the potential to be really good but based on our visit I do not believe its 5 star status. I would not go again

title: Feel like I died and went to heaven!!!!
review: Dear  Guadalix ,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa !  Thank you for taking your valuable time writing us with your feedback. We are happy to read your positive words about experiencing our hospitality and Friendly associates.  As our buffet Breakfast satisfaction in our hotel is a key priority, I am very sorry that our buffet fell short of your expectations. We have setup signage and associates at every entry point leading to the buffet to guide guests and we are currently on process to have more wine available for your selection.   Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with our team in an effort to improve our service.    We look forward to regain your trust and have the opportunity to welcome you back in our beautiful resort.  Sincerely,  Luca Forges Davanzati Resident Manager JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa  Tel: +66 76 584 888

title: Beautiful Hotel, Amazing Rooms with direct access to huge pool
review: THE most amazing resort I have ever been to. It is peaceful (only hear the birds and waterfalls) each room is private, there are no rooms overlooking other rooms, all separated by gardens/trees/walkways etc. we have a pool access room which is wonderful, however I have a minor walking handicap and had to ask for a room with a ladder into the pool. Which are available. The restaurants here are first rate. The staff are always happy and obliging and helpful. The spa is divine!! The beach is set up with very comfortable lounge chairs and there is a dedicated bar there. I would recommend this place with NO hesitation to anyone seeking peace and tranquility. It is NOT a party resort! The children have separate swimming areas and separate dining areas too!! As I said..... Paradise on…

title: Stay nowhere else
review: Wonderful hotel & staff. The most amazing breakfast area with amazing selection of food. Everything you could wish for(except prosciutto). Staff excellent from moment if checkin. Luxurious bed, lovely room with access to water. Restaurant selection that we had on our package was very good & plentiful. Massages were the best we've had. So relaxing. In all, the only complaint is steps into pool from room a little dangerous with no rail, but THANKYOU Marriott for beautiful visit.

title: One of the best resorts in Khao Lak ...
review: We are a married couple in our early 50's, this is out 12th visit to Thailand and our 2nd stay at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak.   Positives:  Pool - We have not come across a pool as large and clean as this one in all our travels throughout the world. Cleanliness - housekeeping is fantastic, I really could not find anything to fault ...and yes, I am quite fussy :)  Food - both the quality and the variety of food is very impressive and is of a true 5 star standard.  Service - in most part, fabulous. After a small glitch (due to an administrative error, our airport pick-up didn't turn up until we called the resort).    Negatives:  Pricing of food and drinks should be reviewed. We stayed during very high occupancy and we were on a 'food included' package, so we were not affected by…

title: Idyllic beach resort holiday
review: My partner and I stayed here for 8 nights after purchasing a voucher from a luxury travel website. Everything promised on the voucher was delivered and we really couldn't believe the amazing value we received.
