We chose the pool access room which is highly recommended - every afternoon we would step off our back porch and swim around the extensive pool that surrounds the resort.  The room was built in a thai style and the resort seemed well maintained to me. There was wi-fi in the room however so slow it wasn't worth connecting to. The staff were all very friendly and the extra mile with delivering icy cold water and cold towels whilst on the beach loungers was such a nice touch!  There are multiple restaurants to choose from so you don't get bored. The breakfast buffet is…

title: perfect resort in the world
review: This upscale beachfront resort is the dream resort for any of beach n pool loving backpackers. Southeast Asia's longest swimming pool which is 1.8 kms distance and 16000 sq m lagoon shaped pool with pool access rooms make the resort an ideal venue for a romantic vacation.  The resort also has warm kids pool and free kids club facility which is additional bonus for family. We took 2 hours to swim around the swimming pool. My wife and son have never enjoyed swimming so much than in there. We would go back any time for a luxury break. Staffs including guests in this resort are very friendly, warm and ever smiling. This is the best 5 star resort ever and I can give 7 stars for the architecture, cleanliness, hospitality and swimming pool. Complimentary breakfast is wide selection of…

title: Amazing infinity pool,
review: Lovely hotel, I don't know why its taken me two months to write a review. We spent 5 nights here in early February and had a wonderful time.  Free wifi throughout the hotel is a big plus, I wish more hotels did this. I am also loving that newer hotels have HDMI hook ups so you can connect your laptop to the TV.   Pool Access room was delightful; however the extra space in this category of rooms is kind of vacant and not useful if there are only two of you. Walking out of your room and straight into the pool is neat but not necessarily needed for the extra cost.   Breakfast was very good although they tend not to refill the hot dishes after 10 AM; however, there's still plenty to eat. The smoothy bar is a nice touch.   Overall the staff are exemplary. Friendly, helpful, and…

title: First class resort
review: A great resort which must rank in top 5 in Thailand. The location is a long way from the airport in Phuket but the locality is stunning .Right on a great beach with easy walking at low tide and safe swimming. We stayed during Chinese new year and expected things to be very busy and chaotic but the resort staff coped easily and provided great service and support at all times. Room was very good with direct access to the enormous swimming 'arena' - ideal for an early morning dip. We used the Olive restaurant every night. Service from Jack and his wonderful team was outstanding at all times and the food quality was very good. We would loved to have tried the gourmet wine tasting menu but the price of 5599 bahts per person is ridiculously high and is poor value - so we di not try it…

title: Very good experienve
review: Our stay at JW Marriott was overall extremely good. We travelled as a group of 8 people and we found the rooms and the cleaning of the rooms very good.   The location is perfect for kids and the sea was calm and very good for kids. The pool is amasing.  we recommend it for families and for complete relaxation.

title: Perfect!
review: Might feel a bit prizy, but it's worth every penny. One of the best 5-star resorts ever.   Breakfast is wide selection of quality products.   Everything that we asked for was organized quickly as possible.

title: No other hotel feels perfect after Marriot
review: We have stayed twice at JW Marriot at Khao Lak and would go back any time.  I just love the pool at Marriot. I have never enjoyed swimming so much than in there. You can do a hotel sightseeing by swimming, all pools are connected :) I also liked the gym very much. Towels and water are available at the gym, separate room for your own exercise/yoga (another quiet exercise room near the beach) and also instructed classes available. Tennis courts for free and bikes can be rented. Can recommend a guided bike tour to waterfalls. It was fun!  Breakfast is good with many choices. We ate few times dinner at the hotel and the dinner restaurants were also good. There are some small local restaurants near the hotel where you can eat cheaper or go to Khao Lak center.  There is nothing else…

title: You don't get what you pay for and I will never stay at Marriott again!
review: We paid for a suite but were put in a pool view room (almost the lowest class).  We were told (by the rude front desk staff)  this is a suite (the suite was over 900 sqft the pool view room was not even close).    I took photos of the pool view room we were in.  Not to Marriott standards that I expected.  Safe was broken, you could see the circuit board inside.  Bed was not a king as advertised but two double beds pushed together so there is a gap in the middle.  The bed was much too big so only one night stand.  No electrical sockets near the bed at all.  So you had to charge everything on the opposite side of the room.  Very dirty looking shower.  Some white stain on the outdoor couch cushion, I convinced myself it was ice cream but I am pretty sure it was not.  Refrigerator…

title: I didn't like this hotel; I LOVE IT!!!
review: Second time visiting for us and the hotel and staff were as polite, friendly and helpful as the first time.   An hour and a half from Phuket Airport, this hotel appears from nowhere at the end of a twisty drive.   We were met with a welcome drink and then taken to our rooms which were both on the ground floor allowing us to gently slip into the meandering pool.  The rooms were beautifully presented with crisp white bed linen and stunning bathrooms with useable shampoo, conditioner, etc.  The hotel grounds and the pool are beautiful and kept to the highest standard.  We chose to dine at the Beef Lovers BBQ on the beach one night, Sakara (Japanese) and the hotel laid on full Chinese New Year celebrations which were great fun with dancers and singers and of course the lion dance. …

title: Great place to relax
review: Dear Beverleyhf,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our pool, room, service staff and hotel's restaurants.  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Impressive! Outstanding service, calm beauty, everything a resort should be...even during crazy busy CNY!!
review: We stayed at this hotel for six nights in the middle of a world backpacking trip. It was our luxury stop and definitely lived up to expectations. We 'splashed' out on the pool access room - a worthwhile investment, meaning we could step off our balcony straight into the biggest pool in south east Asia and swim directly to one of two swim-up bars.   The Thai restaurant on site is fantastic.  We really enjoyed our stay and would fully recommend this hotel.

title: JW Marriott
review: Dear Georgie W,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our pool, room, and hotel's restaurants.  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Hotel with great Pool
review: The ambiance of the JW was calm, relax, and very beautiful.  We stayed here for 6 days during Chinese New Year.  We have experienced other places in Asia to be chaotic at this time of year, but amazingly, this Marriott did a fantastic job of pampering so many guests, and it never felt crowded or chaotic.  There were always enough beach loungers available, drinks made quickly, cheerful and pleasant service by every employee we encountered, and rapid responses to every request.  I was astounded one night when we ordered room service, and they said it would be 40 minutes, but it arrived in 20 minutes!  The rec area had ping pong, pool tables, shuffle board and video game stations, where our son was entertained and met new friends when he had been enough in the sun with us.  The Spa…

title: Great resort. Very quiet
review: This is a great hotel on a relatively isolated stretch of stunning beach in Khao Lak. If you like massive resorts with everything working like clockwork this is it. Highlights - The swim up rooms and the almost 4km of swimming pools - Plus near perfect swimming, walking or running on the endless soft sandy beach - The breakfast here is world class.   Top tips - take a step next-door to eat and pump some money into the local economy, there are 8/9 local restaurants that have popped up, partly to serve hotel guests - Blue Mist is really good, eating on resort 24/7 can be expensive.   We booked a hotel meal on the beach on the final night however whilst the setting was incredible, the food experience wasn't worth the money, wouldn't do this again.   Btw - this hotel is almost 60…

title: Amazing holiday in the "land of smiles"!
review: Dear MarkyLondonN1,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our pool, beach and breakfast.  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manage

title: Second stay
review: We have just returned from a two week stay, bed and breakfast, at this resort. We arrived around 0930 and were lucky, to get into our rooms by 1130am. We had paid for a deluxe pool access room, and were lucky enough to come out of our decking into the lagoon pool. The room was, and had, everything that it was stated in the description. It was beautiful, with a lovely big bed which was firm, but very comfortable to sleep in. It's at this point that I ask anyone reading the reviews before coming away. Please bear in mind that some people want to complain about anything they can, after being at places like this. In my opinion it easily deserves it's 5 star status. The rooms, are perhaps a little worn in, but so comfortable and lovely furnishings. There is No musty smell in the room…

title: Brilliant Holiday
review: This was our second stay at the hotel. We decided to come back after the first stay had been great. Again, we booked a shuttle service with Khao Lak Land Discovery to pick us up at the airport in Phuket and take us to the hotel. The drive takes about one and a half hours. This time our flight got delayed due to heavy rainfall, but the driver was still waiting for us outside the terminal. The check in was very friendly and we were able to relax right away as we were greeted with a hot towel and a refreshing tea. We arrived pretty late so there weren't many people around. Our room was located on the second floor. We chose pool view instead of a room with direct access to the pool because we thought it was much nicer to not have people swimming by your room all day. The balcony…

title: Our second visit - even better than the last!
review: Not long returned from a two week stay at this superb hotel.  This was our first trip ever to Thailand and after a day in the hotel my wife said she would return at the drop of a hat - I agreed!  We booked a swim up pool room and were lucky enough to have the nearest room to the beach area.  I think the room had been recently renovated, certainly we were very impressed wit its appointment, it was superbly finished with a firm but very comfortable bed and excellent bathroom with a first rate high-pressure shower, though you have to shift the angle of the head to avoid water getting into the room proper.  Out room was spotlessly maintained by out lovely room cleaner and friend Ta.  Ta seemed to be typical of the Thai people and all of the excellent staff  in this hotel, so helpful…

title: Great holiday
review: Stayed for one week. Hotel is located right on the beach and is a collection of buildings each containing approx 8 apartments. The swimming pool is enormous and very clean although we preferred the sea (for the waves !). Our apartment was very good  - clean and well equipped. Buffet breakfast was varied and consistently of a high standard. The on site restaurants we tried were very good and just a bit more expensive than the beachfront restaurants found just beside the hotel. We particularly liked Phen and Blue Mist.

title: serene and lovely
review: Dear Kevin M,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our pool, beach, breakfast and Restaurant.  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Best hotel on the greatest beach shame about the food
review: We spent a week in a room attached to the  piscine. It was calm, restful, so nice with a beautiful beach. The resort is well laid out, you feel as if it is empty. There is almost no one on the long strentch of beach, and wonderful local restaurants just on the right hand side of the beach.

title: Beautiful and relaxing
review: Dear Jenny C,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our room and beach.  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: The BEST resort EVER!
review: 5 star hotel lives up to its reputation. A nice well thought out hotel on a stunning beach in a quiet laid back area suitable for families and couples. Good mix of guests from different countries with no one country dominating. Room large well furnished with all amenities expected of a 5 star hotel. Numerous efficient friendly staff in all areas only to will to help and assist. Only disappointment was the food, over priced ( but thats to be expected from a 5 star marriot) trouble was it was not very good and the buffets apart from the thai buffet had very limited choice and everything from starter to dessert was considered an extra. Buffet breakfast was the opposite vast array of all types of food, good value. Fill up for breakfast and dine out for other meals. Quality of food…

title: Paradise found
review: My wife and I are just starting the second week of our stay here. The hotel is stunning and we are staying in a pool access room which is fabulous. My wife slipped and badly damaged her ligaments in her ankle last Wednesday. The hotel sent a nurse to our room and arranged for us to be driven to a hospital about 30 minutes away for an xray. We were seen within 10 minutes and on our way back to the hotel within an hour all for the princely sum of 530 baht (£10). The xraywas £4,doctor £4 and bandage and painkillers £2!! The hotel staff without exception have been excellent particularly our first aider Kwan who visits every day,our cleaner Tuen and the front desk staff and management who have provided a wheelchair and crutches free of charge. The weather is beautiful and the…

title: Fantastic stay, beautiful pool
review: Dear Graeme B,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our Pool Access Room, Beach and Staff Service.  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manage

title: Excellent resort, few minor issues
review: Have just returned from a fantastic 5 day stay at the JW Marriott Khao Lak. The resort was stunning and the 3kms of pool was astounding and in pristine condition. The beach was one of the most beautiful we have ever seen.  We stayed in a duplex suite and felt totally spoilt by the outdoor balcony overlooking the pool, comfortable/ giant bed and housekeeping leaving adorable towel sculptures and daily weather reports.  The F&B options were excellent, with varied and good-value themed evenings outside each night - we went to the steak night, Thai night and wine tasting event. The breakfast buffet was also huge and high quality. Only complaint was that the majority of F&B staff at themed events and the pool bar seemed to have a fairly limited understanding of English and the food…

title: Very Very Happy!
review: Dear VictoriaLaidler,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our Pool, Beach and Staff Service.  We have well noted your comments about the understanding of English of our staff service and also limited of food choices menu. Please accept our sincerest apologies and we will certainly follow up with our team evaluating these points for further improvements  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Luxorious hotel
review: I'm writing this review while lying on a sun lounger on the beautiful beach at the JW Marriott. There is no doubt that this is a fabulous resort in a stunning location. The quality of the accommodation, food, service and general ambiance is among the best I've experienced. The swimming pool has to be the best feature, fresh water that goes all around the resort, lovely to cool off in or just while away an hour or so floating in and out of all the 'rivers'! There are a couple of things they could improve, I'm really just being a bit 'picky' here but it would make a difference: - the food and drink is very expensive when compared to the local bars and restaurants, it's obvious a lot of people eat out or bring in takeaways - the grounds by the beach need more regular maintenance ie…

title: Sprawling and comfortable...but disappointing food
review: Stayed in a pool-access room on the ground floor. Very comfortable and well appointed, if a bit dated.  The spa was great - had a super massage.  The grounds are sprawling with something for everyone.  Unfortunately, the food was a HUGE letdown which is terrible considering you're stuck in the middle of nowhere and will wind up eating at the resort for the most part. The Japanese restaurant was less than basic, and the beach-side restaurant served uninspired, run of the mill, and poorly executed food - sad when Thailand is a country with such a delicious and rich culinary tradition. The breakfast buffet, thankfully, saved the day.

title: Absolutely Fantastic !!!
review: Dear  Rahul A ,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa !  Thank you for taking your valuable time writing us with your feedback, this is sincerely appreciated. We are happy to read your positive words about experiencing our hospitality, rooms  and four fabulous tropical Spa.   I am very sorry that our bood and beverage offerings  fell short of your expectations. Perhaps we have not properly informed that besides our Japanese, Thai and Mediterranean restaurants you may request other items to our executive chef  such as Indian and Vegetarian options.  We also Organize special events on the beach such as our Beef Lovers night, Catch of the Day or Thai themed night.   Please be rest assured that your comments have been shared with the food and beverage team in an effort to improve our service.   We look forward to regain your trust and have the opportunity to welcome you back in our beautiful resort.  Sincerely,  Luca Forges Davanzati Resident Manager JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa  Tel: +66 76 584 888

title: Perfect place for a laidback holiday
review: First time visitors to Khao Lak & absolutely LOVED the JW Marriott !! A really beautiful, luxurious hotel in a great position on a beautiful beach.  The most incredible "river" pool ! Extremely courteous, obliging & friendly staff.  Stylish, delicious restaurants.  Fantastic breakfast buffet.  Absolutely amazing Day Spa - best massage I ever had in the most stunning surrounds.  Family Access Pool room was perfect & well worth upgrading too travelling with 2 children.  We thoroughly enjoyed our holiday there, would highly recommend it & will definitely return.  Booking through Luxury Escapes by far the best value.

title: Wonderful place, paradise on earth.
review: Dear thesmithgirls,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our Pool, Restaurants, Spa and Staff Service.  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manage

title: JW @ Khao Lak
review: We stayed there for 4 days around new year of 2016 and it was quite a memorable  experience.   In general Khao Lak , the area where the hotel is location is way quieter  than main Phuket town or even Rawai beach areas. The hotel is almost a mile inside the mail road right on the beach. Anybody who has stayed would mention the pool which is around 2 KM and said to be the biggest in Thailand. So if you are travelling with kids or a water person you have enough to keep busy. Other than the pool, the restaurants i.e. Italian, Thai, Deli are very good and reasonably priced. We attended the new year party also there and the spread  and band was amazing. The service is what you would expect from JW and keeps you happy throughout. The outdoor activities and family/kid activities are…

title: Perfect experience from check-in to check-out
review: From the moment we arrived in the lobby, we felt at home at JW Marriott Khao Lak. The staff is simply amazing. From the girl handing you your beach towel to the reception manager you are met with a smile and a genuine desire to make you feel at home and welcome.  The hotel is perfect for travelling with children, yet also so big and well planned that couples can find lots of quite places to be romantic.  After a two week stay we can hardly recommend this place enough, and our little girl Frida will miss all her new friends in Khao Lak (the staff).

title: A really fabulous resort but....
review: Dear Dennis M,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our hotel facilities and service staffs.   We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Very Unique Hotel Pool Design and Nice Beach
review: We visited the resort via Luxury Escapes vouchers which included all meals, spa treatments, cooking class, & airport pickup. The venue is first rate. The incredible canal-like pool is a joy - warm, clean, and lots of places to explore. Simply splendid. The rooms were first rate - well appointed, lots of drawer space, big bathroom, a menu of pillows, & always beautifully cleaned by Tuen. Lots of beach chairs and umbrellas but the age-old problem of selfish people reserving chairs for hours without using them. The staff were so pleasant and polite & helpful. Great squash court, gym, pool tables, games room. So much to do & not enough time. Buffet breakfast is sublime - best I've ever had.   The downside was the hidden costs, partially but not solely related to our vouchers. Food…

title: Yes, it's still a perfect piece of heaven!
review: Dear Heidi S,  Greetings from the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa !  Thank you for taking your valuable time writing us with your feedback, this is sincerely appreciated.   We appreciate your  kind feedback about our swimming pool and rooms despite the issue you have encountered. We do try our best to request our guests to exercise courtesy to other guests when reserving sun loungers at the beach. Our associates do monitor the seating at the beach to ensure that empty chairs are not blocked off without being used.   We do apologize about the lapse in communication with luxury escapes vouchers, their website does specify the inclusions for set menus and venues, however we have taken good note about your concerns and shall bring this to their attention.  Special events such as theme nights are not included in this promotion however the voucher may be utilized with a supplementary charge. Food and beverage offerings  are subject to 17% government tax and service charge.  This information is mentioned as per local regulations on all the resort menus, bills and receipts.    We sincerely thank you for your valuable comments  and we all hope to have the opportunity of welcoming you back to our beautiful resort in the near future.  Sincerely,  Luca Forges Davanzati Resident Manager JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa  Tel: +66 76 584 888

title: Best place I stayed in SE Asia
review: We stayed as a family of 4 in September 2015. Overall we had a nice time -- the beach was nice, they had a wonderful lagoon pool which was a lot of fun, and there was a good choice of dining facilities on the property. I'd recommend this Marriott.  My only complaint is that I am a Silver member of Marriott Rewards, and when I arrived, Khun Money (not a good choice of a nickname) started talking to us about an upgraded room. I was excited, since I assumed we would get upgraded because of my Awards status. But then I discovered she was just trying to sell us an upgrade. We hadn't even asked about upgrades -- she was just doing some sales as we waited to check in. That kind of disappointed me.  Our second issue was that the hotel has not way of getting a stroller from the upper…

title: Truly an amazing property and staff -- one of the best
review: This is one of the top 5 properties in the world my family and I have gone to for a vacation.  We have stayed in fancier places with better restaurants, but when you experience this place the total package is unbeatable.    ARRIVAL -- We arranged for the hotel car service to pick the four of us up from the Phuket airport.  They  greeted us warmly and offered cool towels and cold water to refresh us from the heat.  They whisked us away in a luxurious van with wifi for the 80 minute drive to the hotel.  En route the duty manager called the driver to speak to me and welcome us to the the hotel and ask if we had any special requests the could address before we arrived.   When you arrive the lobby is a beautiful open space with a staff that greets you as a favorite relative who has…

title: Wonderful place, perfect service, dream beach!
review: The rooms were just amazing, since they were spacious and smelled pretty nice (even though it was to fend o bug) The food was pretty good and was just a relaxing Resort overall. My only complaint is to close the door of the dining room since bugs could get in.

title: Just perfect
review: Dear Helpfulguy11,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our hotel.   We have well noted your comments about bugs in the dining room. Please accept our sincerest apologies and we will certainly follow up with our team evaluating these points for further improvements  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Amazing holiday, beautiful Resort
review: Like last year: Wonderful hotel in best shape, amazing beach. Great staff! Extremely nice, polite and competent. Congratulation to the management! Everything works perfectly including WIFI. Breakfast is from another world. We will definitely come back!  Only two requests to the management: - the straining dogs in the morning on the beach are rather aggressive. They multiplied heavily in comparison to last year. They attack us joggers and beach hikers. Even children. I can anticipate an accident happening in the future! - please take care that your guests will be informed about the IUCN fee on their bills. We have not been asked and informed about it and it was just added to our bill without any notice. We found this out later and got it back.

title: Fantastic early Christmas Holiday
review: We had a fabulous 8 nights at the JW Marriott - we met our daughter who is living in London and our son who had been travelling around thailand for a relaxing early christmas family holiday.  We purchased the holiday via Luxury Escapes so it included all meals and luxurious spa treatments.  We had a great time and were looked after by the staff so well the Thai people were all so friendly and accommodating. We would highly recommend visiting this resort - it is 1hr 30mins North from the Phuket airport - we did not do a great deal except relax, visited the town centre for the markets on 2 occasions and also got all our christmas presents made at the tailor just outside the gate - we also recommend them.  The following staff really made our holiday memorable - Wat, Mook, Boy, Sol,…

title: Lovely hotel with amazing pool
review: Dear mjwnjw ,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.  We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our hotel accommodations and service staffs.   We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Good resort
review: Stayed here in December and enjoyed ourselves immensely. We had a swim-up room, which was fantastic (a great idea, as it saves having to go off and find a sun-lounger, and solves the problem of what to do with your room-key when you go off for a swim). Loved the restaurants. The Japanese restaurant especially was very entertaining. Breakfast was very good, with an extensive choice available. We also had some nice snacks in the Cafe on one or two days. The staff are incredible, very attentive and efficient. We also used the little shop just a short walk outside the hotel entrance to stock up on cokes and beers for the fridge in our room. (Plenty of complimentary water available in the hotel though). Only negatives were the beach towels, which were very old (and some very…

title: Great resort hotel
review: Dear Rosanicedog,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.  We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our pool, breakfast, the beach and Sakura - Japanese Restaurant.   We have well noted your comments about the beach towels. Please accept our sincerest apologies and we will certainly follow up with our team evaluating these points for further improvements  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Darika Wechsawarn Senior Marketing Communications Manager

title: Brilliant
review: We had a good time at JW Marriott Khao Lak. But we think this resort is definitely more recommended for families than couples. It's too big for romantic holidays.   The beach is beautiful but you have to fight to get a good seat. Great choice of food for the breakfast.   We stayed in the deluxe room with direct access to the swimmingpool, which was really convenient to swim everyday in the largest pool of South East Asia.   Rooms are big but should already get a refresh according to us, but in general the infrastructure is pretty well maintained.   We had a blast in the Japanese restaurant the last day! Totally worth it.

title: Nice resort poor standards
review: We have just stayed at the resort for 5 nights which is very big and kept spotless by thr staff the staff are very friendly and helpful but after checking our first 3 receipts for food and beverages we found that we had been over charged for items we had not had i e bottles of wine and drinks so a tip if you are coming to this resort is to check every bill before you sign it as they seem to make a lot of mistakes and always in there favour even when we checked out both ours and our baughters bills had items that we had not had long distance phone calls and bills for food and drinks which we had not had and had not signed for the service at the beach restaurant is very poor and the food is of a poor quality the rooms are very nice we stayed in a swim up delux room 4021 which was…

title: Beautiful resort with great pool and beach
review: Dear  Simon M   Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are happy to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our rooms  and overall resort experience. Please accept our sincerest apologies and we will certainly follow up with our team evaluating these points for further improvements  We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours, Luca Forges Davanzati Resident Manager JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa  Tel: +66 76 584 888

title: Beautiful resort
review: we arrived here on 19th December 2015 and were pleasantly surprised, entering a stunning lobby with amazing Christmas tree.  Lobby is bright, spacious and very clean, so very good first impression.  Lobby is at one end of the resort and has a magnificent view of the resort.  We booked a duplex suite so we could all be in one room but kids slightly separated so adults also had a private area.  Lovely room, spacious, clean, and bathrooms on both levels. Balcony overlooking the pool area with cushioned seating.  French doors weren't secured very well so this could be improved. Walkway to our room was also an area for improvement - it looks out onto waste land, which is a bit of an eyesore.  Breakfast is outstanding - wow - amazing choice and quality.  We all looked forward to…

title: Another time in paradise
review: Staying at JW Marriott Resort & Spa, Khao Lak  It is a truely pristine and beautiful resort. Every where you walk, every where you look it is designed to look impressive and it is.   I had read all the reviews that raved about the breakfast buffé, and I will admit that I was a bit sceptical. But having been here I now know I was wrong, I have never seen or experienced anything like it. Food from every corner of the world makes sure that there is something for everyone. I liked the little things, like the freshly squeezed juice pre-poured in little glas bottles... Invovative and fun!  Besides the beautiful design of the resort, the main advantage I would say are the entire staff. Everyone you meet greats you with a smile and asks if there is anything they can do for you, and they…

title: Nickle and dime; abused staff; horrible - not Thailand!
review: Dear pafrTrip,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa! We are thrilled to learn that you enjoyed your fantastic and had such a memorable dining experience during your holiday. Sincerely yours,  Chatlada Rattana  Guest Relations Executive

title: Restaurants on site
review: As I have already reviewed the hotel ( it's amazing but for the ultimate, go for a poolside room) here's some information about the restaurants on site.  We ate at the Italian on site a couple of times. The service is excellent as is the food. There is an Italian chef here and it shows. Expect to pay around £100 for four instead of the local £25-£30 in the restaurants along the beach or at the entrance to the hotel. The food is better though & make sure you go at least once whilst you are here. The location is beautiful as you can clearly see the ocean. tables are in or out. You may need a  reservation.  The one notable disappointment is the Deli inside the marriott. We tried the Deli for a light snack and wanting a change from Thai food we ordered a hot chocolate & cheese & ham…

title: Amazing hotel.
review: Dear thegees1,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website. title: A slice of Paradise
review: We visited here in November. It's the best hotel we have ever stayed in and the breakfast is the most sumptuous you could ever wish for. There's a Japanese corner, fresh eggs/omlettes to order/ fresh fruit smoothies, a cooked asian corner with Thai & Indian cuisine. There is also fresh fruit, a pastry section with muffins & crepes are made to order too. You will be seriously spoilt for choice.  The huge pool meanders throughout the couple and never seems busy. There are plenty of sunbeams both at the beach and also around the various parts of the pool. Dual beds are also found in discrete locations.  The best rooms are the swim up pool rooms. They do command a premium but are definitely worth it. When we arrived it was £400 per room for two weeks and we didn't regret upgrading. …

title: Pretty much the most incredible resort in Thailand
review: Dear Geegirl2,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.  We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our breakfast, the pool, the beach and the guest room.    We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Chatlada Rattana  Guest Relations Executive

title: We will be back
review: This was our second trip to this resort and I was nervous that it might not be as good as the first time.  Instead, it filled every expectation and then some.  While I think it's best for a quiet get-away, there were many families with children as well.  One improvement the resort made was to designate areas for age 12+.  That made a big difference.  The pool meandering through the resort is unmatched and the beach has to be the best in Thailand.  The food is plentiful, diverse and safe to eat given their standards.  I would suggest if you have teenagers,being closer to Phuket might be better as there is not that much to do other than beach activities or tours off property.  But, if you love peace and quiet with a touch of luxury, this is a great stop.

title: Christmas 2015
review: Visited JW Marriott in Dec.15 Stayed in room with pool access.  Having direct access to huge pool is an attraction on itself and very convenient even with small kids.  We travelled with 3kids age:7-5-1,5 Kids club was great, so the gym and tennis court. Restaurants offered varied food types and environments. The beach was kids-friendly too (!)  The complex is kind of remote with limited amenities walking distance, but never felt as an issue during the 5 days we stayed there.  Best breakfast buffet I have EVER experienced. Fantastic.

title: Amazing pool
review: Beautifully maintained hotel with lovely staff and an amazing pool.   We booked Pool Access Room and upon check-in were offered an upgrade to a "Spa suite". It turned out to be located in a separate building with no direct access to the pool, had a jacuzzi and a sauna (who needs a sauna at 30C+?) and a quite bare terrace area surrounded with walls. We did not like this room at all and asked for the original pool access room, which after some wait we got and really loved. Make sure you see your room before accepting any upgrades.  Hotel - buildings and grounds are beautiful and are kept meticulously. Lush gardens and lawn with resident birds, gekos and some lizards  Beach - has some surf but nice enough to swim. Get up reasonably early and you will always get some loungers.  Pool…

title: Best resort I've ever stayed at!
review: Dear Lovelytrip1,   Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.  It is lovely to see that you had such a pleasant stay and we thank you for your compliments about our guest room, the flora and fauna, the pool, the well trained associates, the high speed internet, the breakfast and the other facilities around the resort.   We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Chatlada Rattana  Guest Relations Executive

title: Nice resort!
review: Stayed in a pool access room in January 2015, and have been dreaming about going back ever since! The room itself was good, with nice details, good cleanliness and direct access to the ENOURMOUS pool!  The staff was very friendly, and we had the pleasure of meeting the bartender "Meen" at several occasions. He is very friendly, makes great drinks and is knowledgeable about the area.   The beach is beautiful, and I love that there are noe people selling anything there.   While writing this I'm in Thailand again, and regretting that I did not book Marriott this time!  Will for sure come back!

title: Lived up to Expectation
review: Dear JorgenNB,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.  We are thrilled to learn that you enjoyed your fantastic stay and had such a memorable experience during your holiday. It is indeed a pleasure to read your comments about the guest room, the pool, the friendliness of our bartender ‘Meen’. We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future! title: Brilliant Hotel
review: The JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa offers something for everyone. A enormous, crystal clear pool, a wonderful beach that never feels crowded to begin with. Then there is the unbelievable kindness of the staff: from top management to all the hard workers in the restaurants and house keeping, every single one of the staff members stands out in kindness and willingness to help. The gardens of the resort are lush and well maintained. The buildings and restaurants are very well looked after as well. Worth mentioning is the quality of the breakfast buffet: absolutely amazing. The beach lounge with its entertainment and beautiful sunsets ad another dimension to this hotel. In this resort everything is right and it is a place to return to, over and over again!

title: Can't swim in Amsterdam canals but you can certainly do it here
review: Dear Rheinbergen,   Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.   We are thrilled to learn that you enjoyed your fantastic stay and had such a memorable experience during your holiday.  It is indeed a pleasure to read your comments about the pool, the wonderful beach, the associates, the grounds, the restaurant, especially the breakfast and the beach lounge with entertainment.   We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Chatlada Rattana  Guest Relations Executive

title: Wonderful stay
review: The moment we arrived at the hotel: What a beautiful setting ! The second moment when we walked out to the balcony: We were speechless.  The final moment of truth: first of all, staff were extremely well-trained and polite. Loved their charming smiles to dear.   Secondly, the breakfast layout just felt like the staff were ready to welcome kings and queens for the refreshing juices, sumptuous hot dishes, mouth watering pastries and the juicy tropical rainbow fruits.   Thirdly, the well-designed room was immaculately clean and comfortable. Loved the balcony design which leads to the canal or just had a lay back attitude on the sun deck. The evening ambients of the hotel was so serene and charming that made us felt so relaxing and enjoyed every single moment.   The enthusiastic…

title: A beautiful beach resort
review: Dear Kenny C,  Warmest greetings from JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa!   Thank you for making our resort as preferred holiday destination and thank you for spending time to share your feedback with other travelers on this website.  We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed a memorable stay with us, thank you for your comments about our associates, the breakfast, the guest room and the beach.   We sincerely appreciate you taking your valuable time sharing your feedback with us; we all look forward to welcome you back to our beautiful resort in near future!  Sincerely yours,  Chatlada Rattana  Guest Relations Executive

title: A Grand 31st Night Spent on this lovely beach side property
review: Family of 4 had a superb time at this hotel. We basically just floated around the extraordinary pool all day. Had meals in the hotel and on the beach (different and all good). One of the best buffet breakfasts, calm, impeccably well presented and so much choice. We stayed in a one of the mezzanine style rooms and did not miss the direct access to the pool. Some maintenance works happening which are needed from general beachside wear and tear.

title: Best Hotel and best beach
review: JW Marriot is a super hotel with a staff that does its best to make your stay as good as possible. The rooms are nice and air condition works super for being in Thailand. We stayed in doodle room and in Duplex suite. Hotel was quit full when we were there ( 2 adults and. 2 teenagers) so the sun beds were everywhere, wich is understandable.  At breakfast and on the sun beds area they have a no kids zone, wich is VERY good. The staff at breakfast made sure that the rules were kept at the no kids zone.  At the sun beds area the staff did nothing to advice families about the no kids zone. Lots of kids there. The hotel also had a big sign saying that reservation of sun beds were not allowed before 10.00 AM. This the staff did nothing about. So when we came down the fronrow of sun…
