There was some varnish missing from the wood panel in the bathroom basin, but it hardly seems worth remarking on. We left the doors…

title: Rooms are Tired
review: Well after a great deal of research and good trip advisor reviews we booked the JW Marriot in Khao Lak for our long haul vacation this year.   After an hours drive from the airport we arrived at the hotel to a warm welcome by the reception team and we're taken to our room, which we found to be a good size and on first impressions of a acceptable standard.   The hotel grounds, public areas and beach were what we had expected from reading many of the reviews. However on closer inspection we found the rooms to be tired and in need of redecorating, especially the wood panels, flooring and furniture which all require re varnishing and are of a dark colour that creates a sense of gloom in the rooms.  There are two major flaws with this reputed 5 star hotel and these are as follows: …

title: Long weekend trip
review: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for choosing our resort as your preferred destination during your recent visit to Thailand and for taking your valuable time writing us with your feedback.  We will follow up immediately to find a solution for installing door handles on the sliding doors outside and identifying an alternative bedding option for guests who prefer softer beds, ensuring a comfortable rest.  On behalf of the team we all look forward to welcome you back to our resort in the near future. Please contact me directly, it will be my pleasure to assist you making your reservation arrangements.  Yours sincerely,  Jan-Hein Breitschaft

title: An oasis in the north of Phuket region
review: fantastic place for a relaxing, romantic stay excellent food and service the pool is just great. You can swim through the whole resort area If you want to go into town (bars, restaurants, shopping) on a daily basis, its probably not what you are looking for

title: Lovely stay
review: If you can put up with the long trip from Phuket airport - approx 1 hour taxi - you will be rewarded with a little slice of Thai heaven!  5 star service with everything you need in the complex - possibly the biggest pool in Thailand too? It's right on the beach and if you don't feel like eating in the complex restaurants, there are small Thai family-run restaurants immediately on the right as you step on the beach. Excellent food and service, right on the beach! Stay a few nights and you won't regret it!

title: HEAVEN!
review: The rooms, the grounds, the beach, the spa--all beautiful.  And the staff redefine hospitality.  The pool runs all throughout the property, kind of a maze-like moat inside the property walls.  It's a very cool setup for access, but that also means people swim right past your sliding glass doors of your balcony.  There's not much to the town of Khao Lak, although there a cool little market every few days and a nice waterfall to bike to, so really you come here for the proximity to the Similan Islands.  All in all, a great value.  My only criticisms would be that (1) it's quite popular with young families so it's high on the screaming kid factor (but I'm one of those ornery types), and (2) the concierge set me up with the Love Andaman tour company for snorkeling, which was not a…

title: Really nice hotel
review: This hotel is a delightful hotel with good service, great food, masses of pool area, brilliant beach, really nice room with a large balcony.  There are plenty of restaurants from European to Thai to Japanese and more.The hotel seems uncrowded and pleasant.  Breakfast buffet is the only time it's a little manic, noisy and you realise how many people are there.  It is a little difficult to be understood even at reception. It can be a little frustrating if you have a problem and you are just being smiled at. Bottles of wine as in all Thailand are expensive (regardless of what they say in the rest of Thailand it can be cheaper by the glass, we found this in Chiang Mai).  We bought half board before going and the set menus had lots of really nice options. You can use the tokens for…

title: Long wait for our room on arrival
review: My partner and I have just arrived at this hotel and after a long 12 hour flight and hour and a half drive we are very disappointed to be told we have to sit and wait three hours for our room!   We have had a look around the hotel but as it is quite a small resort it didn't take long. It is very quite here and run down.  After talking to others who are currently staying here they also had the same problem so this is obviously a common situation! I have been to plenty of hotels and not once have I had to wait three hours for our room! There is nothing to do but sit and wait bored in reception! I hope marriot sorts this problem in the future it is not a great start to our holiday!

title: Fantastic
review: My husband and I stayed here from 21 to 28 October 2013 on a SureDeal Voucher.  I was a bit sceptical about using the voucher but everything went off without a hitch.  Check in was efficient and whilst we were waiting we were offered a lovely sour plum drink with a cool refreshing towel.  We got upgraded to a pool access room.  Wow.  What can I say.  This resort is amazing.  Yes, it is looking tired in some areas but whilst we were there, maintenance crews were constantly fixing things.  I don't know where to start.  Breakfast is excellent.  All kinds of food are available – every nationality is catered for.  The fresh juice/smoothie bar is also great and the staff are very attentive and friendly.  The bathroom products are also a very nice touch.  Lavender and Ylang Ylang…

title: It has it all
review: My wife and I have just had a wonderful week at this hotel.  From the minute that we arrived,the whole experience has been fantastic.  The staff, the food, the cocktails, the room, the beach, the pool, yes the lot.  The breakfast buffet offers foods from all over the world and gives the opportunity to vary from one day to the next. The Olive and Ta Krai restaurants were great.  A pool access room in my view is an essential. The twin palms cafe outside of the hotel served great Thai  food for the unbelievable price of $7 per head.  All of the staff were fantastic but in particular Nicolas on the front desk and Mod and Wat in the pool bars rate a special mention and helped to make our trip so memorable.  Yes, some areas of the hotel need maintenance, but in that climate it would…

title: Made for families, not for couples
review: We purchased a 10 day holiday on a group buying website. Our reservation was perfectly handled and our dates were accepted by the hotel. Our room was a pool access room - awesome. Straight from the deck to the pool, and you can swim up to one of two pool bars for drinks at happy hour (5.00-6.30 each day). Our deal included massages at the spa and some dinners. The spa is fantastic, one of the best I've ever visited. We used 2x half hour vouchers to have one hour massages and upgraded to relaxation massages from Thai massages. The spa is beautifully set out and luxurious. The staff are attentive and really know how to get you Into the zone and help you stay there.  The dinners we had as inclusions were real surprises. The menu was fabulous. We expected a limited choice but the…

title: awesome property
review: This is beautiful property with long pool. pool next to the room was good fun.nice spread for break fast,  beautiful beach with few massage places and awesome thai food. little far from airport and no night action. look forward to going again.

title: A Water Wonderland
review: What a beautiful Resort – a water wonderland and now my all-time favourite hotel in Thailand. This is just an amazing resort, water features everywhere, the waterways meander in and out through tropical gardens and past the 4 wings of this enormous resort finally reaching the main pool area which fronts picturesque Khuk Khak beach.   From check in our experience was 5 star all the way. We were allocated a beautifully appointed room, couldn’t fault anything, the bed very comfortable, a bonus for Thailand. Our room was a reasonably close walk to the breakfast restaurant and to the beach but with the resort being so large did take us a few days to get our bearings.    Our Travelzoo deal included an upgrade to the water access rooms, (ours being Wing 3) our patio area gave us direct…

title: Good until it's not good
review: I love this hotel but unfortunately I have just had a awful experience. I stated here with a travel deal which entitled me to 2 x free dinners at the Thai restaurant. The food was ok (wouldn't waste my time, go to Blue Mist). The problem was that when I went to pay the bill they said that one of my vouchers was not valid. The voucher was in fact valid and I had been given it when I checked in 7 days prior. It was extremely embarrassing and also annoying that I had to argue with several people on the phone to resolve. Take this review as you will. The resort itself is great. Beach amazing, and if you eat at Blue Mist you will be happy. For me though, after staying for the second time in 6 months (booking over 40 nights with friends and family) I expected to be treated with a bit…

title: great hotel could be better
review: This hotel is beautiful. Surrounded with long pool around the resort. We had pool accessible room and it was nice to be able to jump into the pool from the room. Pool water temperature was nice too.  They have no elevator so be ready to carry your luggages up stairs when you are checking out or call a person beforehand. Breakfast buffet is very good but same thing everyday. Beach at the resort is just ok. Not whitesand beach and water is not blue at all so if you are expecting that white sand blue water , you need to leave the resort . They have dinner buffet every night and we went to thai one. Not impressed at all. First of all everything in this hotel is way over priced. Even more expensive than US prices . For example the buffet dinner was about 1200 tbs per person which is…

title: Excellent service, grounds and quiet beach
review: It's not close to town, but there are some shops next door.  Also they run a free shuttle every two hours that goes to town.  Tours come and pick you up so the location is fine.  The beach is clean and quiet with almost no waves, at least for us in late October/early November.  Great breakfast buffet.  Great dining and snacking options across the grounds.  Wonderful rooms and the staff very attentive and so polite. There are some reviews on here that talk badly about some of the wear on the place.  It is true that you notice some areas that could use a power wash or some touch up paint, but you really don't notice it that much and it doesn't impact you.  The areas that matter are great.

title: Nice Resort
review: This resort have a very big pool, one of the biggest I have ever seen.We stayed in a room connected to the pool, we would just jump in the pool.The service is excellent and the staff took care of us really well.The room is spacious huge and very clean.The resort is connected to the beach,very beautiful beach.We would sit at the beach an watch the sunset.Very nice Resort!!

title: splendid time! Perhaps one of the best hotel resort I've stayed in.
review: I don't even know where to begin with our great experience at the jw in khao lak.  We had an amazing time here! Definitely splurge on a pool access room. I was a little skeptical with the privacy, there was no issue as the pool is like a canal and you rarely see others.  Great things: -swimming pool all around the hotel/resort. -the aromatherapy amenities. Especially love the lavender and ylang ylang body wash. -super well trained and friendly staff.  Everywhere we go we were greeted with smiles and hellos from all the staff -very very clean pool. -pristine beach.  It was glimmering with golden sparks! -the spa was out of this world.  You were to fill out a questionnaire of your preferences and then were let into an area with a lotus pond where there are separate private rooms…

title: Best hotel I've stayed in
review: I could write all day on the positives of this hotel and it still would not give enough credit!  Absolutly amazing, we will definantly be returning!  If you stay there, try the restaurants on the beach, we liked the ones (if you are looking at the beach) to the right to eat in and the one to left to organise tours 'Geko Man'

title: great holiday resort
review: Its about 90 minutes out of Phuket and quite isolated , perfect for a totally relaxing holiday where you do not need to leave the resort. Its exactly what I needed. Great food, great pool, great service.  The rooms are looking slightly run down , particularly in the bathroom areas but they are stll a very high standard with good air conditioning and ceiling fan too. Wifi service is free and had good reception throughout the hotel. Overall a great stay and well worth a visit for a relaxing holiday.

title: Amazing hotel
review: I thought this Marriott hotel was AMAZING and beautiful. The hotel is located right on a sensational beach with the longest pool in the whole of Asia! We stayed in a room which you could access the pool easily which was so great.  The restaurants and breakfast buffet were lovely :).

title: Does not disappointed
review: This is a high quality, excellent value, resort.    The swimming pools are the stand-out feature of this resort.  Various water canals trace the perimeter of the resort.  These canals coalesce at two giant pools, the largest of which has a swim-up bar.  While the bar is well stocked, it is, as you'd expect from a 5 star resort, slightly overpriced compared to what you can get locally.  Nonetheless, the convenience cannot be beat.  The water is cleaned by an army of staff who tend to leave extraction and gardening.  All pool suites have direct access to the pool, allowing those within to waddle into the water from the backdoor of their suite.  If you are like most guests, you will find yourself spending the majority of your time eating, drinking and splashing about in and around…

title: Lovely short-stay holiday
review: Traveled during the rainy season at the beginning of October with my sister's family who has two young daughters and her husband, I booked myself my own room with the pool access and everything was prepaid since early September. I arrived in the early evening and check in was easy, fast and from the moment I set foot into the resort it was so welcoming, the staffs are all great and friendly, drinks on arrival with wet towels. A young reception guy who was so nice we talked all the way while he took me to my room which was 8 rooms down from where my sister's room was but it was the closet they said they can get, no problem, a little bit of walk doesn't hurt.  The room was spacious, clean and smells lovely!! They bring me my luggage, I inspect the room and I was so satisfied,…

title: Amazingly Relaxing Tropical Resort Experience
review: I bought the JW Marriot Khao Lak voucher from Travelzoo and I'm really glad I did! It was not only an amazing price for the value but we had such a great time at the resort!  I just love Thailand as a country. As soon as you step off the plane, beautiful purple orchids great you in the airport. Plus, the food is amazing.  At JE Marriott, the staff are all very friendly and helpful. if we had any issues in the room, they sent someone straight away. The management are primarily German, so very organised and efficient.   The 3km wrap around pool is like no other pool I've ever been to. it's only about 3-4 ft high, so perfect for a leisurely swim, or slow walk through the water, and all the hidden pool bars providing drinks and food help you make the swim easier.  The daily buffet…

title: Excellent
review: This Resort is just amazing,its like a town in itself.Very huge pool,we would swim all day and sit at the pool bar,very peaceful too.Excellent service..big and clean room spacious too,and directly connected to the pool.Breakfast was too good and restaurant serve good food.But could check out premrudi and antonio just outside the resort. Overall Excellent Resort.

title: Families and couples resort with lovely pools
review: This is a large resort which caters to both families and couples. We could tell it was busy from the attendance at breakfast but it never felt busy at any other time of day and we would often ask ourselves where everyone went in the evenings.   Facilities: lovely pool area, well maintained with some jet spas and two swim up bars. Also pool river that runs around the resort in front of the rooms. Ground floor rooms therefore have pool access. There are some with glass walls which make them safer for children.  There is a kids club. table tennis tables available free to use. Good gym along with area for yoga / Muay Thai which you can sign up for with instructor for a fee. (I did yoga and I ended up with a one to one session).   Food: around THB 340 for Thai curry. There is a deli…

title: JW Marriott
review: Had a great holiday at JW Marriott, everything was fantastic.  The staff are very friendly and go out of there way to make sure your holiday is enjoyable.  Buffet breakfast  is good and the food at the themed Italian night was absolutely gorgeous.  Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Wonderful
review: We really enjoyed our stay! Khao Lak is much better than the other beach resorts like Phuket - I suppose I like it because its quieter and not as touristy and this hotel and the fabulous really made our stay there so enjoyable. Would recommend fully!

title: Fantastic property but too far away from the action
review: We stayed a couple of nights here, on a firm offsite. There is just one, but very major drawback. The hotel is simply too far away from the real tourist attractions of Phuket. That aside, the property is fantastic. Very very scenic. Great view of the sea. Good unspoilt and clean private beach with a lot of activities (like volleyball) and wifi :-) Fantastic idea to combine most of the waterbodies into one LONG pool. Very spacious rooms, with good woodwork and a relaxing seat-out. Among the better breakfasts. The sea food dinner that had been arranged for us, rocked! Lot of activities for kids.

title: Great place especially for families
review: Fantastic pool, unique in its size with some rooms granting direct access.  Wonderful beach with stretches of it beeing completely untouched.  Great food in the different hotel restaurants and some local restaurants along the beach. Good gym offering various possibilities.

title: Fantastic hotel and staff
review: I just spent 9 days at the hotel and could not get over how friendly and efficient all the staff were.  I will definitely stay at a marriot hotel again because of my great experience. the spa was absolute bliss and all the masseurs excellent. overall great facilities . It is over an hour from Phuket but if you want to chill out and relax it is the place to go. cheaper restaurants can be found outside and on the beach.

title: Family Holiday
review: Stayed in the JW in the last week of july first week of august. Khao Lak is a few hours drive north of Phucket and, from our point of view, is a much quieter and more relaxed resort, away from the bustling tourist trap of Phucket.  Firstly the weather was great for that time of year, with fairly high temperatures and occasional showers(still warm though). I think we only had 2 days where it rained most of the day but there was still plenty to do.  Secondly, the pool is incredible.  There are two large pool areas, one for over 12's only and the other for everybody and includes the swim up bar. The remainder of the pool snakes its way around the resort in front of all the accommodation blocks. A POOL ACCESS ROOM IS A MUST!! If you have small kids that you are worried about there…

title: An amazing beautiful and relaxing place to stay
review: This was our first time to stay at the JW Marriott. My husband and I spent 5 days here in September. From the drive from the north of the island to arrive at this resort there is so much to see on the way. Our arrival was greeted by such kind and smiling faces. I have been to a mixture of places but there is something to be said about this Resort and the treatment given by the Staff was just sheer politeness. Even if someone was rude they never reacted they just smiled. We could all learn a lot by being around such lovely people. From Job and Sandy at Reception to Neah and Hah on cleaning and of course Pooh in the Breakfast area. What amazed me was with an area full of people having breakfast every morning Pooh acknowledged my husbands name and mine every time. Now that's…

title: Fabulous resort
review: This hotel is stunning. All the rooms are located around a vast complex of pools, all of which are kept amazingly clean all the time. The beach is beautiful, lots of white sand and the loungers are in the shade of trees at the edge of the beach. Although the hotel seemed fairly full and there were quite a lot of families with young children, it was big enough to absorb everyone without it ever feeling crowded, although breakfast time was a bit noisy! Breakfasts and lunches were fine, but the food available in the restaurants in the evening was pricey and not that good. We took to walking along the beach and eating in the beach bars. Those to the right of the resort were particularly good. Our room was a good size and the bed was extremely comfortable. We had a pool access room…

title: Luxury resort with private beach
review: We arrived at the resort just before 11am. The receiptionst asked us to take a seat at the comfortable sofa while she check in for us. After 10mins we were offered wet tissue to freshen up ourselves and sour plum drink. I kinda like the sour plum drink because of my motion sickness. It is great and ease my motion sickness. Another 10 more mins, we are finally "check in" but was informed that our room is not ready and we can only check into our room at 3pm. Yikes! That is like half a day!   When I entered the room, I found that there is slight yellow stained on the floor. Kinda disappointed though. After few hours of cleaning, I expect my room to be stained-free. But for the rest, I very happy with it. A nice comfortable big king bed with several pillows. Clean, spacious bathroom…

title: Perfect for Young Families
review: I recommend this hotel for families with small children. The enormous pool wraps around the huge hotel area and kids just love it.  We had a pool access room which has several advantages - easy access to the pool and large covered verandah.  If you need to get away from the sun or the rain the large covered area allows you to enjoy the ambience of the pool and provides a great area to relax and read.   If you do not like kids, then beware, this place attracts lots of families with children because of the many activities provided for them. Most of the guests were from Korea, other close Asian countries, Australia and then Europe/ Russia. There is not much to do in Khao Lak for adults and we felt  somewhat isolated. We were on a 8 day package and found it to be about 3 days too…

title: BEST PLACE I HAVE EVER STAYED
review: LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! The boyfriend an I stayed here the 2nd time I traveled to Phuket and it was amazing, from the second we walked in to the minute we left we had the best experience the staff where so amazing!! they where like a little family we didnt want to say goodbye too. our room was just stunning with pool access it was not peek hour so wasnt very busy and even though it was raining on and off it was a great experience thanks to the staff  the beach was nice, and great local restaurants where nice for something a little more laid back. the resort had many restaurants and most of the time it was just me and my boyfriend there and they stayed open as long as we liked. We are back to Khao lak in December and wish we where going back to the marriot! unfortunately it was a…

title: Amazing Khao Lak
review: This was our 2nd visit in 12 months to the JW Marriott Khao Lak where we spent 10 wonderful days enjoying all the facilities, the hospitality of the staff and their friendship. With our promotional vouchers and upgrades it represented excellent value for money. Our pool access room was extremely comfortable and clean with house keeping only too happy to assist with any requests. Breakfast was a highlight and we consider it to be the best of any hotel /esort we have stayed at around the world. The staff at breakfast were very professional and greeted us with a smile each day. The photos say it all. The spa treatments were excellent and staff demonstrated skill and experience. We stayed in block 4 and thought that it was great location and would ask for either block 3 or 4 when we…

title: Great value resort good for couples & families
review: We stayed at the jw twice. In June and sep/oct this year. Overall I really like this place as it looks beautiful and has lots to do. Definitely happy to recommend. A few comments though: other than the breakfast (which is very good) we didnt find other food very good considering 5 star hotel. We had one of the seafood bbqs (or something like that) and other friends ate in their thai restaurant and were not impresses. however, since there are a number of wonderful little restaurants along the beach and in town dont worry about that. Next feedback is that the hotel has not managed to keep some small things up to standards, but these are small things such as the door knob not being kept clean and issues with temps true of bathroom water. Also, tv selection is poor if you do need…

title: Serenity
review: This was our 2nd trip to the beautiful Phuket. My wife and I saw a deal on Cudo giving you 6 nights at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak. We both went OH YEAHHHHHH lets check out the reviews on tripadvisor. There were a few mix reviews, but we said hey can't be that bad it's the "JW Marriott". When we arrived we were met by 2 hotel staff 1 from the JW Mariott in Khao Lak the other from the JW Marriott in Phuket (caution just remember which JW Marriott you're staying at....hehehe) Anyways after all that we were escorted to our private vehicle and was informed the trip will be under 2hrs due to traffic, we both looked at each other and went "Where is this place...2hrs really...no way" But the driver was right it was a trek, but we just took all the beautiful surroundings in and enjoyed…

title: I've Found Heaven on Earth
review: We just spent 4 days at this resort.  I'm still in ahh of my stay.  I have some very valuable feedback for all, but I'm not sure where to start.  I'm a big believer on living my life in a positive attitude, being a good customer gets you great customer service, however, I have to address the more recent negative comments first.   There are one or two very negative feedbacks below about this property.  I have to say, these reviews really upset me because sometimes, maybe you need to be a good customer to get good customer service.  There is one review below that talks about how rude the staff was to "her".  I/we can honestly say everything in her review is a lie!  She is one of those customers in life that believes the world revolves around her.   She continues on to say "this…

title: 10 outa 10
review: stayed 7 nights in sept 2013 on a voucher deal.excellent staff and hospitality.breakfast was the highlight as catered for most nationalities ,pool and swim up bar great but  abit overpriced , above all excellent resort and staff  would not hesitate to recommend to anyone one .

title: Great resort experience
review: I have a very relaxing and excellent resort experience in JW Marriott. It takes about 1.5 hours from Phuket airport but it is truly worth to choose this resort. We (3 couples) used voucher and confirmed bookings thro emails with JW before the trip. I also contacted F&B / spa dept. for the arrangement of romantic dinner and spa treatments (free and paid session). They replied promptly and was very helpful.   :Room: We booked the pool view room and I found my room with a very good view in both day & night time. I went to infinity pool for a swim during my trip and was still very convenient to go there.  :pool: Too windy during my stay and I didn't dare to swim in the beach. But if it's in good time the endless beach should be awesome. I went to infinity pool twice, and enjoyed the…

title: Fab Five Star
review: Had a comfy, relaxing time at JW Marriott. The spa and rooms are divine and the food is fantastic. The Italian and Japanese restaurants are a standout. I loved the spa ambience and had a great massage. The staff are professional and genuinely accommodating.   My daughter and I spent time in the central pool and we were both content with a pool bar and lovely deck chairs in the shallows.   The only concern was when a jellyfish stung my eleven year old daughter in the surf out the front of the hotel. The staff was fairly quick to treat it with limes and vinegar. I'd like to see a first aid kit floating about. Yoga class was ok - fitness centre was good. The Deli was fab with lots of western food for the pie lover in the family.   We didn't venture outside the hotel much during our…

title: Awesome resort!
review: Awesome resort!  A family of five, we stayed here for five nights in August 2013. Hotel upgraded us to a two suites (I’m Marriott Gold).  They were among the nicest rooms I’ve ever seen with a large main floor, balcony, and a loft upstairs that included the bed and a second bathroom.  Everything about the resort met or exceeded our expectations – fantastic breakfast buffet, the incredible pool that winds throughout the property, good workout room, and a great beach. As Marriott Gold, there is even a free happy hour for drinks at the pool.  While we were a bit concerned about the weather in August, it was really a non-issue with only one very rainy day.  Dinner buffets (we had a couple) were hit and miss – an excellent Italian buffet, but a very mediocre seafood BBQ buffet.  As…

title: Perfect Stay
review: I and my family stayed for 3 nights in the JW Mariott Khao Lak and I am very happy we did it, staying at this resort .They treated us like real guest. The service is amazing, incredible, very high standarts, they really care about your needs and do whatever they are able to see you happy. The beach is beautiful and very clean. The breakfast is AMAZING...and I really mean it!!! they have hot croissants (crunchy and delicious), very good and hot coffee, juices, fruits, cheeses....for me it was a pleasure having breakfast every morning overthere! The room was very big, spacious and very well located, connected to the pool.VERY BIG POOL. The restaurants are of an excellent quality but a bit expensive,so we had our meal at premrudi restaurant outside the resort.A perfect stay!!!

title: Two visits and we can't wait to go back again...
review: We stayed here just after it opened in June 2010 and again in June 2012. It is an amazing place. The staff are superb, facilities are outstanding. I can't fault the place. It is nice to have the little convenience store/massage/restaurant out the front now as it gives you more options for dinning. Can't beat the restaurants/shacks on the beach for a great meal as well. I also maintain that they serve the most diverse and high quality buffet breakfast that i've ever had at a hotel.

title: Great Resort and friendly staff
review: We had a Great week at the JW Mariott. Service ,food,staff and lacation were all brilliant. The resort is on the beach and next to khaolak village. Staff went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable and room was clean with everyhing we needed.They have a huge pool and we spend all day at the pool.Great breakfast!!!  Would highly recommend this hotel to other travellers.

title: The last part of our Thailand trip worst of all
review: We had been so looking forward to the 3rd part of our Thailand trip but I will never return here again.  We arrived in the late afternoon after a 1 hour flight and aprox 2 hour drive. We were taking into the reception area by a bell man with the name of Sopon. We are asked to take a seat in one of the coaches and immediately after that this Sopon came to my husband asked in a very rude manner for our passports, the voucher which we didn't had since we booked true the Marriott website and our credit card. My husband stood up and went himself to the front desk to check us in.  My husband asked if we could get an upgrade so we would also have one of these rooms with direct access to the swimming pool the girl at the front desk said it wasn't possible but if he would pay it would be…

title: Paradise
review: Stayed here last year for 6 nights and it was that good we came back this year for 8 nights and it was still paradise. This is the place to totally unwind and relax.  If you are looking for action go else where as there is not much to do in Khao Lak in low season.  The resort is set on a beautiful clean beach.  The pool here is just the best. 3.2km of pool to laze away in. We had a pool access room which was just great.   The rooms are beautifully decorated Thai style.The buffet breakfast is 1st class.  What sets this place apart is the staff.  All of them are friendly, polite and willing to help.  Management should be proud of them all.  Eating and drinking here can be expensive.  But on saying that, there are a few great Thai restaurants on the beach where the food and drinks…

title: Second Visit
review: The JW Marriott Khao Lak is about a 90 minute drive from Phuket airport. The hotel will arrange transfers for about $90 USD each way but you can get there for about $50 through other services.  The welcome is wonderful and friendly.  The rooms are nice. We had a pool access room for both visits. This is a must. They really make the stay. With one of the biggest pools I have seen, having direct access to it is very enjoyable and allows to to dip in and out at any time.  Another must is the breakfast. Again one of the better ones I have had.  I didn't care to much for the other restaurants and much preferred the ones on the beach where the food is very very good and dirt cheep. It is also nice to have your feet in the sand for dinner (Mumas).  The hotel itself is starting to get a…

title: Coming back!
review: This will be our sixth or seventh visit to the JW Marriott Khao Lac from when it first  became a Marriott hotel a few years ago. Living in Bangkok we have a lot of choices and have been to most of the local islands so why do we come back here? We love the flat walking beach, birds and lakes and often wave less sea, the great swimming pools and the excellent food on offer at the coffee shop/deli for lunch and the great breakfast with plenty of choice and the evening dinner outside with excellent Indian options.  Yes its a bit of a hike up from Phuket airport but believe me unless you really want the noise and mess of most of Phuket you will do better to seek out a bit of what Thailand is all about. Don't stay in the hotel all the time, try to get to some of the fine inexpensive…

title: BEWARE OF BOOKING ANY TOURS FROM THIS HOTEL
review: Asked advice from the tour desk for the safest elephant ride and they told me it was best to use 'Marriot taxi' to take us to the elephant ride, I was told that they would bring us to the place and then collect us after the ride. Specifically asked for the ride that included the waterfall. Wanted the safest possible option for a 5year old to enjoy. Went to the elephant camp, once we arrived we were shown two price lists, as guest of the Marriot ours was the most expensive. Thinking this was the safest option as advised by a 5 star hotel thought all would be okay. Once we were in the jungle our elephant rider kept spitting some foul red 'gunk' and then towards the end of the ride kept asking for a tip, the tour did not include any waterfalls. Felt very vulnerable and scared. Once…

title: very nice resort in the middle of nowhere
review: Choose this resort if you want to calm down and relax totally. Enjoy the hotel beach and the XXL pool, actually the whole facility is surrounded by the pool. Want to do yoga on the hotel beach with a instructor in the morning? No problem. Just enjoy the days without being disturbed.

title: Excellent resort
review: This is a such a great resort with very well trained staff who work hard with a smile for everyone. The room, although slightly dated in decor, had a luxurious large comfortable bed and although it's a large resort, we never seemed far from the pool, beach, restaurants or bar. The pool itself is the biggest I've seen in S.E. Asia and consists of 3 large pools and a lazy river type pool that wraps around the resort so you can swim for what seems like miles around the place. The ground floor apartments in one area have direct pool access, which is a great idea. The breakfast on offer covered everything you could want to eat, and if the buffet didn't have it they would make it. We tried the Thai and the Italaian resturant on site and both were of a high standard....albeit a little…

title: Irina - 5 Star Duty Manager
review: There is no doubt that this a 5 Star resort, excellent facilities especially if you are travelling with children.   1. The beach was excellent and very clean and despite the time of year the ocean was good for swimming and safe in my opinion, a little bit choppy but the children did enjoy this. 2. The breakfast room and location was superb with ocean views and the range of food was both vast and of good quality. 3. The swimming pool again was great, do go for a pool access room if you want to frequent the pool regularly, however if you are looking for a bit more seclusion the rooms on the upper floors have great balcony areas to catch a sunset. 4. I would strongly recommend watching a sunset or two, with westerly location this was a magical time of day with the backdrop of the…

title: Loved this place
review: Next time we are in Thailand, I would stay here in a heartbeat. Staff is friendly, breakfast was amazing. The hotel room was nice and big, we had a pool access room. So we could step off our balcony into the pool.

title: Stunning
review: Amazing property and excellent service. Only thing missing was the sunshine but not the hotel's fault!  The room was awesome and the swim out to pool was incredible. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious (mmmm chocolate crossiants and crepes!!and the soup was also a hit!)

title: Great place and qualified staff
review: Very nice hotel with outstanding price/quality ratio. It is my second time to this property in low season and each time my expectations are exceeed.   Very special thanks to Sea Bees Dive Shop (one of the offices is located on the territory of the hotel) and diving instructor Mr. Lars Pohlmann, naitive German with outstanding English-language skills and exceptional attitude to his job and customers.   Being certified PADI-diver, I could see Mr. Pohlmann's professionalism "in action", when he conducted several introductoruy courses with my 10-year-old son. I was impressed by his special attention to details to secure combination of safe dive (even in the pool) and pleasant experience. I would like to highly recommend Sea Bees Dive Shop in JW Marriott for divers with any level of…

title: Down to Earth Luxury
review: The hotel was beautiful! Staff were excellent! The room was clean and the Marriott's signature bedding and linen were pure luxury. I was truly well rested in the comfortable room, hotel grounds, and overall feel (culture) of the place. We went during off-peak season so there wasn't a crowd to contend over for facilities and services. It's definitely a place I will return to for rest. We were able to benefit from their superb groupon promotion.

title: super resort
review: this resort has all that one is looking for for a chilled out holiday, great food , great location, great service, very good rooms and the best pool one can experience. it is just not too easy to reach being far from the airport and also has nothing near it as concerns shopping eating or entertainment so if you are looking for all of those this is not the place for you. this is a place where you spend time with family and friends and loved ones in a very calm beautiful tranquil location and it provides you with great facilities for a relaxed vacation. It has a great clean beach which is very very safe and fantastic sunset views, the choice of cuisines is vast and food to suit all palates, the restaurants are very well located and have a great ambiance, the negative is all seem…

title: very nice resort
review: This resort is next to the beach,the beach is very nice and clean .We sat and watch the Sun Set everyday:Amazing scene!! The room we were in was big and clean,the staff was very good and speak good english.AMAZING Pool!! We swam the full day. Breakfast was great too.

title: Paradise
review: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights in August 2013. The resort is gorgeous as are all the staff who all stop and warmly greet you. We stayed in room 1031 which was a perfect location to the pool, restaurants and beach but very private as we were the last room. We had pool access which is a must. Our days consisted of sleeping in until 10am, a sumptuous breakfast until 11am, getting clean beach towels then relaxing on the sun lounges for a couple of hours in the over 12 years area. Staff bring you Ice water to keep you hydrated throughout the day. A stroll along the beach to the right for a massage- 300 Baht for 1 hr, then a swim in the beach. Back to the room for a rest, drinks and snacks on the verandah then swim from our room to the pool bar for happy hour - cocktails…

title: overrated 5* hotel: resort beautifully arranged, nicely designed, but inefficient management causes unpleasant athmosph.
review: First, the positive: - the sports program offers very good activities with qualified trainers; - the German speaking personnel is very qualified, efficient, motivated and caring; - the romantic dinner on the beach is nicely arranged and organized. But then the negative: - during high season the resort is understaffed; - drinks and meals are over-priced; - the big events parties are overpriced, and not family orientated. The stage is too big, too loud, and the big DJ staging is too much for the small crowd of hotel guests; - kids club for 10 years olds does not offer interesting activities; - too less restaurants to choose during rainy weather; - the reception staff barely speaks English, and is not knowledgeable and not trained; - 10 paid postcards sent from the reception never…

title: Wonderful stay at JW Marriott
review: We just had a fantastic stay at the hotel using a deals.com voucher. The hotel is just gorgeous. The most amazing pool, unbelievable breakfast, great kids club, great restaurants and its in Thailand which I just love. We really couldn't fault the hotel and found the voucher amazing value.   We travelled with a 4 and 6 year old and all managed to fit in the room easily. They provided a rollaway bed and one of the kids slept on the couch/day bed. The hotel is great for kids. The staff just love them. It has a kids pool with a water slide, an elephant that visits twice a week, plus the main pool which goes on forever and can keep anyone entertained for ours.  The Spa is amazing and all the treatments we had were great. It is so tranquil and the staff are brilliant.  The meals we…

title: first class resort
review: the marriott was everything that it's promotional material suggests- fantastic pool, great food choices on site, friendly and helpful staff. We were delighted with our experience. Our travel group totalled 9 including small children and teenagers- all felt well catered for. The resort was well laid out with easy access to all facilities. Areas for improvement were few but- a little more choice in casual lunch options within the resort would have been good- together with more information concerning services available in the local area- khao lak has some great little restaurants and bars but without tripadvisor you wouldn't find them

title: Gigantic Pool!!!
review: One of the best resort we have ever stayed in. Our room was on the ground floor and it has a direct access to the pool. We spend most of our time in the hotel itself, swimming, sunbathing on the beach, drinking by the pool\, at the bar. it was just amazing experience. Very beautiful resort. The breakfast was excellent and the service was second to none. They made us feel very welcome. The room was spacious, the decor was modern, something like a balinese touch to it.

title: One stay is not enough.
review: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights with our 2 children (ages 12 and 8), nephew (13) and niece (9). Travelling with 4 kids can be challenging, but staying in this hotel made things easy with the spectacular 3km winding pool and private beach, tennis courts, snooker table and 2 table tennis tables. The breakfast area and pool bar was excellent and the hotel's Thai restaurant is a must-try, but there are also 2 nearby restaurants (Italian and Thai restaurants) which are just a walk away from the main entrance of the hotel. JW Marriott is an excellent choice in Khao Lak, which offers a "quieter" location compared to the island of Phuket. The highlight of our stay was a half-day trip to James Bond island which is relatively closer from Khao Lak than from the main island of…

title: Beautiful area of Thailand
review: The hotel is as expected of a JW Marriott: sprawling grounds, good food in the hotel restaurants, and great value at the restaurants on the beach just past the hotel boundary. The beach itself is beautiful - many a sunset evening was spent there. The Marriott in Phuket has more mature tress and foliage, which made the Khao Lak resort more bare (and hot!) in comparison but the landscape will mature and it will keep getting better. Khao Lak is a much quieter and more authentic place than Phuket these days: more nature on its doorstep in the form of the National Parks and their waterfalls, more unspoilt beaches.

title: Blissful!!
review: We had an awesome holiday at J W Marriot, Khao Lak.  Their huge swimming pool and the private beach are the major attractions. The Beach was clean and well maintained, my son just loved playing in the Sand and waves!!  For the Swimming pool- Pool access rooms are an intelligent choice, giving you privacy and convenience at the same time. We had a memorable evening witnessing the glorious sunset from the sunken Bar !!  Our package included couple spa and a private dinner on the beach. The Spa was heavenly! Dinner on the beach was very well organised, and we were treated royally.  The shacks on the beach were not very well managed. The food was not that great and the place was unhygienic (I actually saw huge lizards and insects there). Food inside the resort was reasonable. We…

title: GREAT VIEW, RIGHT ON THE BEACH , great landscaping, infinity pool good food
review: this has been one of the better hotels i have stayed in. from check-in to exit, staff is very friendly we travelled with our 2 years old who was pampered thoroughly. Infinity pool that has direct access from rooms. Room are REALLY BIG (almost like the size of 2-double rooms put together) kids meals are free...... amazing experience, great bed, cleanliness maintained. bathrooms are nice..... restaurants, bars all good....

title: Beautiful surroundings and position. Friendly staff.
review: Our family (2 adults, 2 children) stayed for 12 nights and had 2 interconnecting rooms in 3000 block on the first floor. The rooms were beautifully furnished with huge, comfy beds and pillows. Lovely large balcony with 2 steamer chairs and a sitting area overhanging the pool. Unfortunately due to the season the seating area cushions needed stowing away and had some signs of weather but the steamers were fine as they were under cover. Beautiful clean and well stocked spacious bathroom with twin vanities and good lighting options.   The service in the hotel is outstanding. Every member of staff is very friendly and they really cannot do enough for you. Special mentions to Poo, Fia and Pui in the breakfast room and Roj the beach towel attendant.   Pool areas are stunning. Good to…

title: Simply Perfect
review: My wife and I stayed at this resort recently for 4 nights . After a 1 hour trip from Phuket airport we arrived safely. The staff opened the car door and said goodafternoon . This was an excellent way to start a holiday. Everything about this Resort is just so good. The check in staff so friendly and helpful. With their help we managed to get the  room connected to the pool. The lady who looked after our room always had a smile and it was interesting to try and have a few words in Thai with  her and we enjoyed her helping us learn some new Thai words. The service and the food in the restaurant was just perfect.  Also every day we drank cold watermelon or a slice of pineapple at the pool bar. The setting is excellent and huge amount of breakfast was just delicious; Its buffet…

title: Big resort but unique enough to be worth it...if you arrive in 1 piece....
review: Spent 4 days at the resort and food was excellent service very good and although a big resort the fact you can swim from each room to the bar and beach is a unique and nice feature.  All good and worth a visit. Love the lay out with great beach for kids and families. For a big restaurant the buffet offer was very good and the quality in the Thai and Italian were excellent.   Only issue was idiot driver on way from Phuket airport. Should take about 90 mins. It took 60 and although I live in Manila and London and am used to crazy driving the guy was nuts.  For a 5 star they need to sort this out. . Guy on the way back was ok. When they lose a guest on the way from the airport maybe they will control them in a smarter way......  Did keep telling him to stop driving like an idiot…

title: Perfect!!
review: This hotel is so good that not only have I been compelled to write my first review, but we are also planning a second visit (something I normally avoid!)  - Picturesque beach - Superb rooms - Mind-blowing pool (Yes... it really is 3km-worth of pool) - The friendliest of service - Great value (especially if you manage to get a deal)  Almost perfect in every way... but there were a few minor gripes:  - The cocktails in the bar above the reception were really awful, but the staff were so lovely that it didn't really matter - My gf and I are nightowls, so the bars didn't open late enough for us (so don't expect this to be party central!) but then again there is Khao Lak town just a short taxi away - The hotel restaurants are quite pricey (by Thai standards) but as many reviewers…

title: Beautiful place
review: This is a simply beautiful resort.  The building, views and beach are all stunning.  The pool is the best we have swum in, and we have been all over the world in some lovely hotels.  The beach is superb, and I would recommend long walks in either direction.  Minibus into town a bit pricey but worth a look for a change of scenery - however don't expect a busy town, this is a quiet place.  The beach restaurants to the side of the hotel are great.  For kids head to the Andaman, they were really welcoming and the food was fantastic.  We used Phen for lunches as our diabetic daughter was keen on western grub  for lunch and they did a cracking job.  We tried Blue Mist also and the food was lovely but didn't enjoy the atmosphere there so much. Service in the breakfast was very slow,…

title: Still a great place, but slipping a bit
review: First I have to say that this is our second time at this resort. The first time was in August 2011 and we stayed for three nights. This time we stayed for seven nights. We would definitely stay here again. That says a lot, because there are a lot of interesting choices of places to stay in Thailand.  The good parts:  I love how the staff always greets you with a smile and a "Sawadee Ka" when you pass them in the hall. We were checked in while sitting on couches near reception and given complimentary cold drinks and cold scented towels - a lovely touch after the drive from the airport.  Our hotel babysitter, Som Oh, was so wonderful with our son, we honestly wish we could take her back home with us. The breakfast (part of our deal) is very good. The pool is mind-blowingly…

title: Excellent beach gateaway
review: Spent a week here in September during a monsoon season. It was quite rainy, but you still get a fair amount of sun everyday. The place is lovely, the service is even better. Everyone from the staff smiles at you everytime you accidentally run into each other on those small pathways of the resort. We had a pool-access room and I thought it was really cool to soak straight into the pool from your patio. The breakfast was excellent: great selection of food and drinks, especially smoothies. I personally liked beach restaurants that are stretched along the beach area. Try the one called "Blue Mist". The owner, Mo, is a great guy that would be willing to accommodate any of your food requests.

title: Great resort, great staff - relaxed and wish I was still there!
review: We got a 10 night voucher deal here and have just returned.  The deal included breakfast and 30 minute Thai massage each day plus 2 restaurant meals whilst there. Everything was great! Ok, parts of the place are starting to show a bit of wear and tear but we observed maintenance and cleaning going on that did not obstruct guests so I think this is an ongoing schedule. Great check ina nd check out. All staff are happy, smiling, polite and well trained. A real credit to the company who treat their staff well and in return get loyalty and wonderful staff who are proud to work there. This for us was the over-riding feature. A resort can have great amenities but if the staff aren't happy in their work, the guests don't get the benefits. Well planned resort which although is large,…

title: Nice relaxing place but not 5*
review: We had 5 nights at this resort in July using a Travelzoo coupon. For the price we paid it is fantastic value. Overall it is a great resort. Majority of the staff are fantastic.  Housekeeping is a hit and miss, I had to ask for shampoo, water, coffee on diffferent days and even ask for our room to be serviced by 5pm one day.  A lot of maintenance is required in many areas of the resort. I cut my foot on a broken tile in the pool near the Spa. We had a pool access room in Block 1 near Quan Spa which is very private and quiet.  Quan Spa is fabulous but expensive. It is a wonderful place for a chill holiday.

title: Nice place
review: We recently stayed 5 nights in a pool access room in the 3000 block with steps down into the pool.    We arrived and our room wasn't ready (they said they were fully booked which I find hard to believe in low season and as some rooms were being renovated) so we went for a swim.  We were later shown to our room which was large clean and lovely and smelt devine with the lemongrass oil in the oil burner simmering away.  I did note that the rooms and the buildings in the resort itself are starting to show there age and if they want to retain there 5* rating then some serious maintenance and updating needs to take place.  We had a travelzoo deal which included a massage which was beautiful and the spa area itself is really lovely and tranquil, so all in all it was great value but I…

title: Fabulous
review: The JWMariott was a fabulous property. The defining feature of this property was the winding swimming pool,very huge pool and very well maintained. We had a pool access room and it was a pleasure to get into the pool at anytime. We certainly enjoyed our morning swim. The breakfast spread was fabulous too, that was very impressive. Being in Thailand the variety and the quality of fruits were also amazing. The rooms are big and spacious.

title: Delightful Staff
review: We were spoilt by delightful & engaging staff. This made our stay a special experience. The setting is tranquil. The pool areas are great to explore. Our room was exactly what we wanted. This is a large complex so it is worthwhile getting to grips with what room types are on offer. We were never disappointed with the breakfast. The three neighboring beach restaurants are all worth a visit. A visit to the market (Saturday in particular) is worthwhile also. Also went to the Hill Tribe restaurant in Bang Niang town & really enjoyed this. Naturally this location is much quieter that Phuket but I would have traded 3 nights in Phuket for another at Khao Lak.

title: Good Resort but PR a bit shabby.
review: Got off to a shaky start as had a deal which included transfer pickup from airport to resort (90 mins.) which did not happen! On arrival this was mentioned, they said we would get the return transfer instead which was fine - asked for them to investigate why it happened, said they would get back to me - even with a follow-up the next day they never got back to me. To the credit of this resort and its facilities we spent a week here and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Once we went through check-in, we were escorted to our room on the second level, quite pleased with the size of the room - king? size bed, very comfortable, lounge, TV, work station and chair, floor to ceiling sliding glass doors leading out to a balcony which had 2 lounge seats to lay in and a nice view of the pools,…

title: Gorgeous family-friendly resort
review: We have just returned from a 10 night stay at this resort. It's a beauty! 3 kilometres of salt water chlorinated swimming pool meander around the rooms, many of which have direct access to the pool from the room balcony. In addition there is a large central pool and kids' pool. On site restaurants, including the casual eatery "The Deli", and room service, cater for every taste. There are also a few casual Thai eateries next to the resort on the beach . These offer great meals considerably cheaper than the resort. There is a state of the art gym, a spa, and the resort sits on a long stretch of beach on the Andaman Sea. Rooms are spacious and comfortable and quiet but the resort is in need of some refurbishing. Staff are amazing, courteous and friendly and the resort's best asset.…

title: Amazing hotel, beautiful beach, quiet area
review: We stayed there with our 2 kids in a swiming pool access room. Hotel is beautiful, in a quiet area, close to Phuket and its vibrant life. Beach is beautiful. Swiming pool is awesome. Breakfast was the best ever. I'll definetely return !

title: Superb - again!
review: This was our second stay @ JW Marriott Khao Lak and we loved it. Same room as last time - Family Pool Access. The resort is starting to show affects of weathering and will soon be in need of a good refurb, but one thing remains as excellent as always - the staff. Nowhere in Thailand have we met such friendly and helpful staff - we loved the way they would stop as we passed, give a greeting in Thai - a very nice touch. Pool bar is great with the daily happy hour and the ladies in the kids club kept our two busy for hours. We will be back, thats for certain. Oh, and the breakfast buffet - the BEST :)

title: Best hotel ever!!
review: This hotel is the best hotel i have ever stayed in. Simply stunning. From the rooms to the pool to the service to the atmosphere, oh my god, no words. It is little bit expensive but i would say its defintely worth it. Dream hotel.

title: Good for family
review: We are staying there for 5 nights. Our room is directly connected with 3-km-long swiming pool. During our stay, it was rainy almost everyday. But our children could enjoy swiming pool everyday while we were drinking at pool bar.  The only one problem is the resort is far away from towns. Better use of free transportation service offered by some restaurants.

title: 5 days at JW Marriot
review: Let me firstly begin by saying this resort is amazing, we have stayed in several 5 star resorts in Thailand and this is the best by far. Our pool view room was amazing the room more than we hoped for. Good to see the bed was so comfortable the bathroom very luxurious and housekeeping very detailed. Please note all meals can get quite expensive with a 17% tax put on top of all advertised prices. The Italian night buffet was incredible food selection very tasty and value for money, don't eat prior to this or you will regret it. . The staff are a bit over bearing with there attention to detail, no sooner than you empty a plate they are taking it. (full on) The guy working the tiramisu bar (Gun) was awesome with a great smile. The Infinity bar had a great vibe and happy hour was…

title: Very friendly staff
review: A typical Marriott hotel, which is very well run.  But I am most impressed by the staff: they are all very friendly and helpful, and they greeted virtually every single guest they met.  The buffet breakfast is amazing, offering a wide variety of choices.  I bought a packaged deal for this hotel which is value for money; so I cannot comment whether the 'normal' price is reasonable or not.  The hotel has 3 storeys.  Rooms of ground floor have direct pool access and thus command a premium.  Most restaurants are on the ground floor too.  Second floor is on the same floor as the lobby.  Third floor has a nice view over the pool and the beach, but one has to take the staircases.  The gym is a bit small though.  There are a number of restaurants (Jap, Mediterranean) in the hotel, and…

title: Mixed Reviews
review: Stayed at the JW Marriott Khao Lak for a 8 days in a family room with pool access. Although the hotel is far away from pretty much everything worth doing/seeing on Phuket, the resort is much nicer and significantly more quiet than the other JW option on the island. We accidentally booked this hotel rather than the JW Phuket where our friends were staying, however, after spending the day at the other JW I was happy we didn't stay there. The JW Phuket is packed, over crowded and just simply loud. There were just too many people for it to be relaxing. However, the JW Khao Lak was peaceful, much more elegant and allowed us to do what everyone wants when they go to Phuket - relax and unwind.    First the positives;  1) My 7 year old son developed a rash on his face earlier in the day…

title: Girls holiday inThailand.
review: Stayed at JW marriott for 3 nights in July with 8 other women and really enjoyed it. The rooms were spacious and the beds were great. We all loved the pillows too. The breakfast buffett catered for every taste from Bircher muesli to Miso soup. We especially enjoyed the huts along the beach which contained restaurants and a great massage parlour. Highly recommend the hour longThai massage for 300 baht.  The staff in the hotel were very helpfull especially Irina at reception. The pool was very clean and enjoyed by all from our swim up rooms. Would happily revisit.

title: Very nice stay
review: Overall I love this hotel. I will surely comeback with my kids. The room is spacious. They had a special arrangement made for me and my wife as its our anniversary. My wife love what they had prepared for us.   I love the service, the facilities are excellent. I don't find that I need to go out from the hotel. They have very very very big pool, beach, and I love the programs they have prepared. The Thai food is also great.   There is only 1 thing we don't prepare is the trip from the airport to the hotel is actually very far away. around 87km away and at that time we arrive at night and the way going to Khao Lak is dark. My suggestion is to prepare for the transportation since before you arrive. Don't take is lightly as its really far away and to put it worse if you don't know…

title: 5 star luxury
review: We booked this hotel through an internet deal after researching online. I have stayed at many top hotels around the world over the last 30+ years of travelling but this is certainly the best. From the moment you walk into the foyer, the friendliness and attention to detail from the staff is just exceptional - nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. As a self contained resort, the facilities provided are just amazing from the 3 km pool (yes 3 kms) which traverses the complex to the sports facilities (fully equipped gym, squash /tennis courts, cycles) to the 14 private massage rooms. There are 4 restaurants on site plus a snack/ deli providing quality and relatively inexpensive meals - the breakfast buffet is just awesome. If there is a negative, it…

title: Recommended!
review: Wow, this place lacks nothing.  It is amazing. The only criticism - it's a little out of the town area so a tad isolated.  There are shops, restaurants, etc around, though.  And really you want for nothing.  There are taxis/tuk tuks outside the hotel.    Beds & pillows = amazing!  I think the best we've ever had!  The people here are just beautiful.  Their friendliness & little touches just add that something special to a holiday.  We went as a family of 4 with another family of 4.  My husband had a birthday whilst there.  We ordered him a birthday cake from the cake but & he also received a surprise birthday cake in our room.  Prior to those cakes, at breakfast after we told staff it was his birthday, they came over to him singing with cake in tow.    Hot days you have staff…

title: So far excellent, however..........
review: We are on day 3 of a 14 day stay and are finding the place fantastic. The check in was very smooth and the staff welcoming, we were shown to our rooms that have pool access and the first thing we did was go for a swim!  Staff are very friendly and attentive and nothing has been too much trouble.  The setting of the hotel is idyllic and backs onto the beach.overall a great place to unwind, not for people looking for a wild time.  The beds and pillows are brilliant and have been having a great nights sleep.   Now the 'however' as has been mentioned previously the price of food in the restaurants is over the top for the actual food being offered.   We have had drinks at the beach bars which are not part of the hotel and they have been good, not eaten there yet, plan to do that…

title: Beautiful Resort
review: We stayed at this resort in July, 2 familes of 2 adults and 2 kids each.  The resort is stunning.  We had pool access rooms and they were supurb.  The breakfasts, pools, pool bar and gardens were wonderful and it was the best bedding we have ever experienced.  The resort is isolated but as long as you know that before you go and want some R & R then this is the place.  We ate all our meals at the beach restaurants which were great and if you turn left at the beach, the first restaurant, Famai, has tour organisers, laundry and a very competative money exchange.    The JW Marriott certainly has lovely touches that make it so appealing.  Iced water delivered to he beach & pool lounges, birthday cakes for guests, and all of the staff are so warm and welcoming.  Poor things must get…

title: Dream Stay!
review: Completely rebuilt after the 2004 Tsunami and re-opened in 2010, this is simply the best hotel I ever stayed in, a hidden gem amidst tropical forests on the alluring Khuk Khak Beach! Occupied two rooms with my wife and adult daughter. Both rooms were large and of understated elegance featuring chilling ambient music, the smell of lemongrass, a traditional Thai painting above the bed and a slow- spinning ceiling fan, like a Thai version of paradise! Bathroom - fantastic! The hotel's signature laggon pool is an outstanding feature, the breakfast so good I am lost for words! To keep budget in check we sampled the inexpensive but good Thai restaurants at the beach. If you want a relaxing holiday away from the hustle and bustle of Phuket, that's the place. And Phuket is still only an…

title: Outstanding experience
review: Needless to say the resort is stunning, it is absolutely beautiful everywhere, starting from interiors of the lobby to the outside greenery. The rooms are great with easy access to swimming pools. The highlight of the resort is undoubtedly their spa, an absolute delight. Great selection of restaurants with great food and selection of wine, especially the Chef's special Snow Fish with truffle sauce at the Olive Restaurant made my wife extremely happy. Even if it is a lazy cloudy day and you don't have much to do or feel like going out, the breakfast area sitting outside overlooking the sea makes your day, and by the way the sea is just a few seconds of walk from the resort. The service is impeccable and the staff is very polite, efficient and helpful. A MUST experience for…

title: Enjoyed our stay but improvements required
review: We stayed for 3 nights in June booked using a Travelzoo deal. The resort is about an hour drive from the Phuket airport in a quiet area, perfect if you're looking for somewhere just to relax, away from the hustle/bustle of Phuket. First impressions of the property were amazing. From the lobby you look out to see beautiful landscaping, a 3 km pool snaking around the resort, traditional looking Thai buildings with balconies in all rooms, and the ocean in the distance. Simply breathtaking.   Check in was smooth, however, the assigned room smelled musty, the A/C was not working properly and also the sink handle broke off. We were travelling with family and, by comparison, they had no complaints about their room. Staff did come to our room promptly to try to address the matter, but…

title: Beautiful resort in an idyllic location
review: My family thorougly enjoyed our 8 night stay in Khao Lak.  We've previously stayed in Kata Noi and this time enjoyed the quiet remote location of the JW Marriott.  Our rooms 5005, 5006 and 5010 were pool access and just fabulous.  My mother (70+) loved the easy access to the pool and my children swam for hours most days.  We had no problems with odours etc.  The pillows on the bed were absolutely devine and the bed was very comfortable.    The breakfast was fantastic and the fruit shakes and coffee were both as good as anywhere we've been in Thailand.  The breakfast area is busy but I'm not sure what else you can expect in a resort this size??  The breakfast staff were efficient and helpful.    One of my only critisisms would be the very unfriendly Clinic nurse or receptionist. …

title: Pure Bliss
review: I cannot say enough about this resort - everything from the fantastic pool level room to the "to die for" breakfast was above anything I had experienced before. Used the resort bike guide to go to the waterfall - relative easy ride, the climb to the waterfall is more difficult - I even got a leech for my troubles!  Ate at the resort one night but for a really friendly meal - go to the beach, turn right and go to Mr Mo's restaurant - ate dinner & lunch here most days - great value. Also ate at restaurant to the left - beautiful tiger prawns !   A fair distance from the airport - but if you want a relaxing time compared to Patong - go here.

title: Lovely location, but ...
review: We stayed there for 5 nights in June 2013. We had a good room - 2014, which had a balcony that led to the waterway just outside. We loved the shower - powerful jets of water. The room is beginning to look aged though - scratched flooring and a little musty. Overall, it was peaceful and quiet, near the lobby, gym and indoor amenities like table tennis, billiard table and children's area. We mostly had simple breakfast at the Deli, which worked out fine, but would recommend more choices. Not everyone wants to spend US$35 on a buffet breakfast daily. We loved the tennis courts, which was laid with artificial turf. The foosball and air hockey games area needs refurbishing - peeling paint, water-stained walls and old machines. However, the gym was wonderfully maintained.   Food and…

title: Wouldn't stay here again!
review: Check in was simple and quick.  Breakfasts are huge...but get in early for a peaceful breaky.  Our room was situated on the bottom floor near the septic or sewage.  Ohhh the smell as we entered our room was just awful.  I complained several times and only got an oil burner lit to try and disguise the smell.  The balconies above are rotten and generally the place needs some maintenance.  At night we could here weird sounds coming from outside our room near the sewage area.   The pool is awesome!  Pool bar closes early though.  Massages at the Quan Spa were so relaxing.  Staff at lobby were friendly, but everywhere else not so...some staff are quite rude.    Everything is at a cost $$$$ no free children activities which was a big surprise.  it's too far to Khao lak to walk so $300…

title: Average, if I put it nicely
review: The resort is about 1.45 hrs away from Phuket and not much is there around the resort. To get to Khao Lak town you need a taxi which is a bout 300 BAT one way and it takes  about 25 minutes. The setting of the hotel is nice. The rooms are a nice, too. But if you look closer, the rooms are smelling moldy, which is being tried to be covered with lemon grass candles. The buildings are moldy. The vast tiled walkways are a slip hazard when it rains. You will be (over-)charged for every thing you ask for. The price level is similar to European and Australian price standards. The room service is average, one day shampoo is not being replaced, another day it is the body wash. Toothbrush and tooth paste you may get if you ask and get lucky. The waterfront breakfast area is a hall. Loud,…

title: Beautiful break
review: We have just returned from a two day break in this hotel,check in was amazing they sat us in a beautiful lobby offered us cold drinks and towels the smoothest,quickest check in ever experienced. The hotel was first class,breakfast was unbelievable we sat there till noon nothing was a problem. The pool was lovely clean and very large,the bar staff were lovely nothing was a problem. The room we stayed in was large,the bathrooms amazing. Ty the manager got us late check out,and again nothing was a problem. We will recommend this hotel to family and friends and would love to return for another break very soon.

title: First time at this property!
review: As said it was our first stay here and we stayed with our daughter and family also. Check in was great, entered room and that was great, a lovely smell by the oil burner! Pool access we had. Breakfast was great with such a big assortment and lovely location, great staff who were very friendly and helpful.Pool bar staff was great as was the food and happy hour. Beach staff could bring the water around a bit more often.You can walk or swim around this pool for hours its massive, goes round the whole resort. Thai restaurant was excellent staff were incredible and food great.Nice bar up stairs near lobby for a relaxing wine in the evening.Do the Spa it was totally amazing regardless of price. Phens and others on the beach cheap and very good.Italian at entrance near 7 Eleven was…

title: Remote paradise (in the right month!)
review: Me and my boyfriend stayed here on June 22nd for 2 weeks. Check in was nice and smooth after 2 7 hour flights to get there and a 90 minute taxi ride from Phuket; however if your staying for 2 weeks like us the deposit on your credit card is just over £600 (a little steep for a deposit I'd say!) room was lovely we stayed in a pool access although the gate had rotted due to the rain I'm guessing so the first time I opened it it fell apart! Food in hotel expensive but nice enough for a 1 off every now and then! Beach restaurants you can't fault. Andaman and blue mist are delicious! A great location if your going for complete relaxation and don't want to do anything else as there is nothing much around! If the weathers bad you could find yourself bored as we did so checked out early…

title: Pristine setting for a relaxing break
review: I recently visited the JW Khao Lak resort and Spa for a 6 day break with my daughter from 25 June to 1 July.I had just spent 3 nights at another JW Marriot property in Dubai. The Marriot chain is becoming very attractive to me recently especially the JW properties which offer that bit more.  Although Khao Lak is quite a distance from Phuket central and Patong Beach I certainly made the better choice in chosing this resort. It is situated on a very beautiful stretch of beach, probably one of the best that I am familiar with in Phuket.  The resort is large and spacious although not too huge to get lost in. Set in beautiful gardens with meandering pools easily accessed from ground floor rooms , the feeling is indeed one of luxury and nature.  Our room was very comfortable with a…

title: Only thing we didn't like was the rain!
review: My partner and I stayed here in the middle of June and from our arrival, we were blown away. We had asked to be upgraded to a pool access room but unfortunately, this was not available. Our room however was lovely, very spacious and modern.   We arrived quite late and were tired so we ate at Olive restaurant at the resort on the first night. Food was execllent (but very expensive for Thai standards) and our server very friendly. Breakfast was faultless, extensive choice of food from all around the world, always replenished. The crepes and omelettes were particular favourites. We looked forward to breakfast every day! It was always busy, but we found going before 8am was much better. We ate at the pool bar frequently during the afternoons, service always with a smile, and food…

title: Great hotel with excellent beach, pool and local beach restaurant!!
review: My wife and I are frequent visitors to Phuket Thailand but this is the first time to Khao Lak.  We had the hotel pick us up at the airport which went well.  The reception at the hotel was very good and they upgraded our room to one on the first floor which is great because you can walk out your deck right into the pool.  The pool is a series of canals the connect to the bigger pools.  The beach is great.  The beach restaurants to the right are all great.  We really like the Andaman.  The Seafood Salad and Green Curry Chicken are outstanding.  Do not go to the restaurant to the left.  The food portions are much smaller than the other places and more expensive.  The service was not good.  The food at the hotel is more expensive than the beach but the presentation and service are…

title: Great hotel for relaxing
review: Just returned from a relaxing stay at the JW Marriott,this hotel is first class.Great range for breakfast,loved the smoothies.rRooms very well appointed,loved the rain shower ,best pressure ever experienced.Food was great,bit high by Thai standards but have to expect that at a 5 star resort,found a restaurant just out the resort called Antonios best food I've ever eaten in 7 years of travelling to Thailand, great host Bruce.the staff at the resort where all first class,very welcoming and would do anything for you.Thanks again JW Marriott.

title: Gets better and better
review: Have stayed here 3 times during the past year (Sep, Oct, and May).  Each time has gotten better and better.  First stay in September was great although the resort was showing some wear and tear.  There was a hole in the pool deck which a guest fell through, a loose railing on the stairway going to the downstairs bathroom by the pool and some uneven spots on the walkways.
