These were all fixed by the my stay the next month in October.    Checkin has always been pleasant.  No need to wait in line at the reception.  You are seated in the lobby, brought cool drinks and cold towels to enjoy while checkin formalities are completed.  You are then shown to your room and given a brief tour of the resort.  Being Platinum,  I have been upgraded on all 3 stays - twice to the huge executive…

title: Great hotel but not perfect
review: My family and I stayed at the JW Marriott at Khao Lak in June 2013, which is the off season here due to the rains. Something that was immediately apparent was that the Marriott management uses this place to train their junior staff during the off-season. I would say 80% of the staff were inexperienced. This severely affected the quality of the service.  The hotel is gorgeous. The pool is huge and a lot of fun to swim through.   Restaurants: Sakura for Japanese food and Olive for Italian food, both are really good. It's worth mentioning again that the service left a lot to be desired. They got my order wrong in the Italian restaurant and took half an hour to serve what I originally ordered after everyone else had finished their meals. The lights went out in the Italian restaurant…

title: Paradise
review: I've stayed at this resort twice - a year apart - and believe it is one of the most stunning locations along the coast.  The resort itself is starting to look a little tired however the rooms are well designed for 2 adults with ample space, spacious bathrooms and great air conditioning. The buffet breakfast is one of the best I've ever had and the staff do remember your order each day if you stay for longer than a few days.  There's 2 Happy Hours daily, Ball at the Pool Bar will take good care of you and the onsite restaurants are good - I can highly recommend Chef Tham at Ta Krai - one of the best Thai chefs in Thailand and an absolute gentleman. For a more local experience and much cheaper dining options there are several beach options that can be accessed directly via the…

title: Fantastic and above
review: We stayed at the JW in Feb. 2013 for 7 nights and it was fantastic. After arrival into Phuket we picked up our car and made our way up North to Khao Lak, drive was easy even thought it was in the middle of the night.  Arriving at Hotel at around midnight, but regardless of the late time we where greeted very friendly, offered cold towels and drink and the check in was done after that we had been driven to our room ( Pool access room)  The room was great and In good condition, fantastic bathroom, cosy bed, great terrace with comfy furniture.   At next morning we encountered the breakfast, which was the only negative point, the breakfast itself was superb with all you can ask for, the Breakfast room itself is very large and does not feel welcoming at all, but if you have a couple…

title: Awesome resort
review: We have been here only one night but what a great place.  Rooms are just fantastic with great furnishings and bathroom.  Pool access room excellent as you just jump in 2 meters after opening your balcony door.  Never seen a bigger pool in my life.  As per other reviews, the resort is bit far out of town - too far to walk.  Restaurants (non resort ones ) right on beach look like something out of castaway, but food and service is good and cheap as!  Got a travelzoo deal so paid about AUD 290 for three nights incl breakfast, massages.  Really good deal if you can get one.  Plenty of other things to do when weather is wet.  Prices in the resort are reasonably high for Thailand standards, but hey youre on holidays and this place is absolutely five stars.  Highly recommended, but…

title: A great resort like a island of love
review: It like living in Venice. you can swin all around resort. We stay there for our honeymoon. For 4 days, and got package deal on our stay. Only thing that's negative is it's distance from main market. Everything else is just superb. Cons: Distance from main market,city not so good english speaking staff(but they will understand) pros: nice rooms, nice bistro, great message therapy  you will feel like living on a deserted island with all the amenities.  It's not recommended for group, only if you seek quite and silent time with your partner and family.

title: Paradise
review: The resort is huge! with a 3km pool all around the property, this was the perfect getaway for us. staff were so friendly and helpful, the selection of restaurants were great. it was nice just to relax at the pool for hours on end just dreaming away. the spa services were also phenomenal. this truly was paradise.

title: A first experience at Marriott
review: I stayed here for four day and three nights in late June. During my stay I had upgraded to a room with a pool view which had a novel concept of an interconnecting pool around the hotel. This meant that those rooms with a pool view had a sliding door leading to a verandah from which one could jump right into the pool. The first thing that struck me when we arrived at the hotel was that it was huge. It took a few mins of walking just to get to the room. The hotel has five wings and you could easily get lost if you are unfamiliar with the layout.   I liked the fact that there were many activities available to do during the day. However I felt that there were just too many people in the hotel and that the service stuff was a little inefficient at times. For example, on my second day…

title: Wonderful resort
review: My review is slightly biased because of a great (ie. cheap) promotional price, but the resort is wonderful- great location right on the beach, wonderful pool with canals that wend around the resort (with access right outside our terrace), sumptuous room, very friendly & helpful staff, an indulgent day spa and great facilities.  The only negative was the high price of resort food and drink, but that was easliy remedied as the town is only 6km away and there are numerous low cost bars and restaurants each side of the resort, just off the beach- we mostly ate at these.

title: "Great resort, relaxing - even during monsoon season!”
review: We brought Travelzoo package and stayed here for 8 days . This resort is quite isolated location but so relaxing to stay there.  Not a right season stay here during Jun – Oct as it is monsoon season, famous of Similian Island and Surin Island were closed.   So lucky we are enjoy a sunshine especially in the morning, smell the sea and feel the sky with a beautiful beach scenery. We still enjoy beach side with rough wave even with the unpleasant weather last.  Hotel staff all have a warm greeting and a wonderful smile for you always, the room was just perfect right , tidy and comfortable. Housekeeping kept it looking very fresh. Great outdoor swimming pool with Jacuzzi, so relaxing…..  The big bonus is beach restaurants, walk on the right hand side along the beach where you can…

title: So relaxing!
review: Using complimentary room vouchers..thanks to Rennaisance KB! This resort is quite isolated but so relaxing to stay there. Upgrade our room to pool access with some payment. Room was just perfect with great Swimming pool. We spend most of our time in the resort. there's also a few games for indoor activities in the main building. We had breakfast at the restaurant but limited option for halal food. The staffs were very helpful. We had to check out early in the morning to catch our flight and they made arrangement to pack some food. Definately would come again

title: relaxing stay
review: Just returned home from a very relaxing stay at this resort via a1 night stop in Bangkok and looking back you just don't realise how relaxing this place is , the staff are just so fantastic they all have a warm greeting and a wonderful smile for you ,the room was just perfect right by the pool just wish we were still there ,the breakfast was really good such a big selection from western to Asian food ,although it was the low season not so busy in the local areas around the hotel it was still enjoyable , there is some renovation in parts of the hotel but it does seem to impede on the pleasure the hotel gives you ,if you are there on a Friday don't forget to see the special guest on the beach ,an Elephant who drops in for a couple of hours

title: SOoo Relaxing
review: Used Travel Zoo vouchers to book this wonderful hotel. We were upgraded to a Pool Access room. It was so relaxing to sit on our patio and jump into the pool when we felt like it. The pool was clean at all times. The breakfast was very good. Dinners were a bit pricey but with our buy 1 get 1 free vouchers it was fine. We mostly ate at the little restaurants at the beach or outside the Marriott on the street. The spa was excellent. The staff were always very friendly and very welcoming. Would definitely come back to this hotel.

title: Fantastic facility
review: We made 7 nights at this fantastic resoret. During our stay,we did not step outside hotel except having meals.  Thanks to great service and smile by the team of front office and fitness trainers,our stay had become wonderful and healthy. We also quite appreciated in a free wifi access and drinkable water supply ,   which are quite unusual for an superior international hotel like Marriott.   But,I must say this for the improvement of this hotel, I think the drain of washing stand in a bed room was terribly durty.  (I happen to see it,normally the drain is hidden by a wodden board.So you are not supoposed to see it ) I believe this hotel can aim No .1 position at tripadvisor when housekeeping service is improved.  Anyway, we loved the stay and will def come back !!

title: good time there
review: Good hotel with the gigantic size  pool. We stay 3 nights there and very happy with everything there. Nice room big and various pool beautiful  beach .  My kid enjoys kid pool and kids club . My wife love the spa there .

title: Great place but poor restaurant
review: We loved our stay at the Marriott and enjoyed the casual beach restaurants but were disappointed with the Resort Restaurant. We only tried one night which was a seafood buffet.. Not good. Service was excellent with a young German waiter, but the food left a lot to be desired, I settled for Caesar Salad. I think when you have such a beautiful Resort in Paradise why not invest in a good head chef to go with it. The Resort loses most guests to the cheap beach shack restaurants more due to cost but when the food is better at a fifth of the price ..... Why wouldn't you. Would I stay again? Only if the food improves. I would like to add that breakfast is very good

title: Fantastic yet again
review: We visited this hotel again this year after we were blown away by it last year.  This year we came away with two other couples.  They were also very impressed with the hotel.  We booked the pool access room again which is fabulous.  We often jumped into the pool at night after we had been out for dinner.  We had a problem with our television as it didn't seem to have as many English channels as last year.  Within 10 minutes the technician was in our room fixing it for us.  The staff were so friendly, every time you passed an employee they acknowledged you, smiled and said hello no matter what their role was. The weather was raining the whole 7 nights we were there but we stayed the same time last year and had great weather so it is just the luck of the draw.  We still felt like…

title: Excellent holiday
review: We stayed 11 nights in this hotel early to mid May. Bought Travelzoo vouchers which is great value. Arrived midnight very tired from the long flight and had very efficient, friendly and welcoming check in service. Nice cold drink and cold towels - an extra bonus. We also had room upgrade to pool access room - which was perfect! Room is large and pleasant whith large balcony leading to the pool. Toiletries provided are very extensive. We used dinner vouchers for buffet dinners, which was very good value. Especially liked Italian buffet at Olive restaurant - very tasty food.  Buffet breakfast is amazing- everything you can imagine! Smoothies are great! We also enjoyed nice coffee at Daily with freshly baked cakes.  Kids club is very good. Our son wanted to stay there all the time…

title: Relaxing Stay
review: We purchased a Travel Zoo voucher and enjoyed a 4 night break in this lovely resort. I emailed straight away on purchase, got our preferred dates and also room up grade to pool access. We stayed in 3001 which had a glass pool fence on the balcony, we liked this though as it gave us a railing to get out of the pool with. It is close to the reception end.  Over the 4 days we were at the resort 3 were red flag days on the beach however despite the rain we still swum everyday. We tried the cocktails at both the Infinity Pool bar and the Aquamarine and both were very good, the Czar bar was also a nice choice even on a dark stormy night.  The room was not large however was nicely appointed and well maintained. Housekeeping kept it looking very fresh and supplied drinking water on…

title: Great resort, complete relaxation - even during monsoon season!
review: We have just returned from a 5-night stay at the JW Marriott Khao Lak using our TravelZoo voucher.  We stayed in a pool access room (2001) and we could not be happier with the location (block 2, next to the gym), the size (with the huge king size bed!) and the decor of the room! We arrived at 9pm and the transfer to the hotel was smooth and took approximately 1.5 hours.  Check-in was swift and smooth- after a 9-hour plane ride and a 1.5 hour transfer we just wanted to relax in our room. The bathroom is huge- great bath and the amenities are top notch (Aromatherapy Associates).  The only problem we had was with the shower drain which was sunken into the ground but since it did not affect the flow of the drainage we did not ask to get it fixed.   We agree with some of the reviews…

title: Excellent hotel
review: The hotel is excellent, the problem was weather. We went there in wrong season, if look at any picture about the beach in Khaolak JW Marriott it would be claim, flat and blue; yes, it is if you go there in winter (November to March).  During our stay the sea water on the beach was rough, muddy and strong waves; the waves could be up to 2m high no one could swim there.  The bright side of our stay are, our package was from Travel zoo it provided a "buy 1 get 1 free buffet coupon", we used it in a restaurant named "Olive" for an event called "Italain Fiesta" it was the best italan food we ever had, strongly recommended. We tried all restaurants on the beach, in average all restaurants on right hand side are good, if you like Thai food go first one (PHEN) if you like western food…

title: JWM Wife & 2 Kids
review: Visited JWM in Easter 2013, bit late writing this review but better late than never.   PROS: One of the best Luxury Hotels we've stayed in outside of Dubai, pool access rooms great no need to leave your room. The pool meanders round the hotel. Hotel & grounds immaculate. Buffett breakfast room is huge selection is extensive food to cater for all palletes. The juice bar is amazing select your ingredients and your smoothie is made created right in front of you, my kids loved this. There is also a 24x7 coffee bar/snack bar, great lattes. Kids club is good very modern and all safe equipment. There are local hut restaurant on either side of  the hotel on the beach, which server great food and are literally mins walk, good for lunch and dinner. Outside the hotel there's a small parade…

title: Excellent quiet resort
review: it was our second stay at this resort. We so loved it first time that we decided to go again. On our first visit we were given pool access room, this time around it was pool view room. It did not make much difference as we spent majority of our time on the beach and wound not notice a difference anyhow.  Hotel staff is just fantastic. I did not experience better service in any hotel within Marriott network. Prompt, polite and courteous - invisible when not needed and available to help at the first instant help is needed.  Hotel selling point for me was its grounds - hotel is located on the sandy stretch of the beach with no other hotels in sight, hotel grounds represent tropical garden with enormous amounts of swimming pools of various shapes and depths. Pools are cleaned so…

title: Not really clean...
review: I was there for four days in mid May using my travelzoo voucher. The price is at very good value including daily breakfast, massage and buy one get one free drinks. The staff is nice and helpful. The one helping us to check in is very pretty. However, when I once got into the room, I was so disappointed.  The room, other than the bed, was quite dirty. The wood furnitures  were old and I was first shocked by a spider on my toilet carpet when I got in. I cleaned it up and wanted to put the carpet near the Terrance as my room was a pool access room. It could prevent watering the floor when we later finished swimming and back to the room.   However, it was very nasty when I walked to the Terrance. There were many litters, pieces of food there. You could imagine the wood Terrance…

title: Good stay!
review: we stayed at this hotel last month. we had a deluxe pool view room on the 3rd floor.   first the upsides. well furnished, spacious and comfy room. very comfy sit out in the balcony, which offers a great view of the sunset and the andaman sea. lavish breakfast spread with several options, all fresh and tasty. very helpful staff, who even sent our bags into khao lak town centre by the shuttle bus, and that saved us a 10km trip back to the hotel. the shuttle bus service for 100 baht to the centre of town or back is a life saver, if are not renting a bike or car, and is very cost effective, as a taxi will not take you there or bring you back for less than 250 baht. kudos to the hotel management for pricing the shuttle service so moderately. most hotels would have used this…

title: A Quiet Retreat
review: Located an hour and a half north of Phuket Airport. This is a fabulous resort if you are looking for somewhere to get away from the hustle and bustle. The resort itself is large with amazingly huge lagoon style swimming pool and right on the beach. The staff are extremely friendly and welcoming. The breakfasts are scrumptious with a massive variety to suit all tastes. Rooms are well appointed with nice bathrooms, comfy bed and pillows and all have a private balcony.  There are a variety of restaurants and there are numerous local restaurants beside the hotel - one highly recommended is Blue Mist (see my review) which was so good we dined there three times.  Overall a great resort catering for all ages.

title: Just amazing. I love this resort
review: Stayed in a direct pool access room and it was worth it. You never get tired of just jumped into the water. The resort is simply womderful as well. Very clean and all of the staff are so welcoming and friendly. They all greet you whenever you walk by. We had one issue with our air com and someome came in 10 mins and fixed it.  The breakfast is as expected from such a resort and in fact the food in all the restuarants did not disappoint. The beach restuarants offer a nice, cheap alternative for food and massages. Bluemist proved to be the biggest hit for us. I simply cannot find fault with this place.

title: everything you could ask for
review: we puchased our holiday on deals.com and were very pleased with the value.  we had a couple of hiccups with our aircon and no sooner than we had put down the phone and staff were there to fix it. no complaints.  room was extremely comfortable.. loved the pillows. very quiet for sleeping except for one night when a lavish indian wedding went till 3 a.m. . loud music was very audible ..having said that the 3 day spectacle was an added treat. great restaurants just outside resort. would recoomend antonios for pizza and other western food. also thai massage next door great value and  very clean  .  only $ 18  .. maybe massage on beach could be lacking in hygiene and was only $ 3 cheaper.. we used hotel for some lunches at  hotel coffee shop and food was very fresh .  even my husband…

title: Very Good Stay
review: Classy par excellence!! My wife, 12 year old daughter and I stayed here and concluded that this place makes for an ideal 4d/3n kind of stay..Spacious rooms with balcony, a never ending pool, beach, good food and lots of space. Things may become dull after 7 pm but so be it!!

title: Solace for all senses
review: It was a family holiday after ages, made worth it by the hotel. The room was fantastic, the staff great and extremely courteous. Food selection was great, specially the breakfast. The hotel has its own pristine beach with enough sun bathing beds. The highlight of the hotel would be the never ending pool! It stretches the length and breadth of the hotel, circling the rooms and the restaurants. Truely amazing. I'm definitely going back.

title: We took our 4 yr old...and had a blast!
review: My wife & I decided to take Andy, our 4 yr old on this vacation together and it ended up being the time of his life! Things began a little shakey:  this was Andy's very first airplane ride and amazingly I had booked us into the middle seats on Thai Airlines, what a numbskull I am, but that was quickly fixed, Thai Airlines service was great. Then, we got to the airport and went to the wrong hotel, completely my fault again. Make sure you have the right JW Marriott name, there are two in Phuket. Strike 2. It is a pretty long ride to the hotel, I suggest you have this arranged well ahead of time, (its over an hour). The hotel has a shuttle bus if I had only asked?   Upon arriving at the "right" hotel, we were warmly greeted by the general manager himself (from Europe) and given a…

title: Still my favourite resort in the world!!
review: Was lucky to enjoy my fourth stay at this stunning resort in May while traveling around Thailand for work.  I was incredibly excited when I learned that this was one of the resorts we'd be staying at, having had three very memorable visits previously with family.  I couldn't stop raving about it to my colleagues in the lead up to our arrival, setting some pretty high expectations in their minds!  Some of them have lived in Thailand for years and are extremely familiar with hotels and resorts throughout Asia.  However, the JW Marriott Khao Lak won them over, just as I knew it would, as there is something so very special about this place.  I've also traveled extensively throughout Thailand and Asia, and this stay at the JW has only reinforced its position of my absolute favourite…

title: Amazing resort - expensive but worth it
review: Really great place. I loved spending my time sitting by the pool and at the beach. Great spa at the resort, had an excellent full body massage. The spa was a bit more expensive than what is available just on the beach, but it was worth it for the added luxury and ambient surrounds. Food was yummy too, we ate at the resort's restaurants although there were lots of other options all along the beach, and also local places nearby. My only issue was how expensive this resort is, but I guess you get what you pay for!

title: There needs to be a button above excellent for this one
review: If you are looking to be pampered beyond you most wildest reaches of your imagination, you've found the place here. From the cool exotic fruit drink & floral scented refrigerated towels to the "Kob koon krab" that ends every sentence from a staff member you will be transported to a world you've always dreamed but never thought really existed but it does and it is here.   I recommend staying in the pool access rooms, we (currently) reside in room 2020. It's a HUGE, what is referred by staff as a family room. It is like a temple inside huge bed, with lounging beds that with 4 in the room you could comfortable sleep six people. The dark mahogany floors and ascents give you a feeling of peace & tranquility, couple that with the staff and the stress of life just floats away.  The…

title: Faultless
review: We travelled to the Marriott in February. We had an amazing time - other than one day of bad weather where we travelled to Patong. The hotel (and especially the staff) were amazing.  The resort is in Khoa Lak, which is a drive from Phuket airport (Patong is far closer but also a lot more overrun).  Service was perfect throughout, while not quite a five star hotel in say London (the vibe is different in Asia), the staff were very super friendly and would go out of their way to help if we asked for anything.  Rooms are quite large and stuff like flat screen TVs are all included. (There wasn't a specific German channel that we could find, but we are fluent in English so it was fine).  The beach is really nice, far better than any European beach we've been to! We loved the table…

title: 5th time there - Best Resort in Thailand
review: My husband and I travel regularly to Phuket and Vietnam for our holidays, and after discovering JW Marriott Khao Lak in 2010, we have been back four times already.  The resort is simply enormous, the pools endless, the quality of the rooms and amenities are always impeccable, and the staff remember us and welcome us back like we are family. It is by far and away the best resort in the South of Thailand (other than the Conrad in Koh Samui).   We have always stayed in a Pool Access room - which makes life easy, but this time we brought my nephews with us and stayed in the Family Suite.  The kids had a ball in the swimming pool, and there was plenty of 'junk' food for them to tuck in to while we had some great seafood as well as Margarita pizza at Olive restaurant.  A minor…

title: JW Marriott Rocks in Khao Lak
review: This J W Marriott did stand up to its name and was a superb stay. We had organised here a FULL ON wedding party for three nights. Guests came from all over world. We had 220 rooms booked for us.  It has a exclusive beach front which is almost 3 Kilometers long with white sand and plenty of waves for surfing or just relaxing. They do yoga classes on the beach if you want. Nice sports room , gym and spa. Food is just perfect with  in House Chinese, Indian , Italian, Thai and continental chefs. They have staff from almost all countries so language will definitely be NOT a problem. They have huge swimming pool and the feeling is of staying in Bunglow rather than hotel rooms. The structure of the building roof tops is similar to Thai temples and is eye candy.  Its quite a distance…

title: Location excellent, service not quite what you pay for.
review: I struggle to review this hotel. Is it value for money; if you consider the poor service: "no", if you look at the location and pool "absolutely". We travelled in December, two weeks at Christmas time. Our children, 5and7 loved loved LOVED the pool which is endless. At first we were given a room with difficult access to the pool, there was a little path down to the pool which runs by the rooms as a river. Especially getting back to your room was hard as there were no steps so the children couldn't easily get out. After requesting another room we were given a room in the "3000" part which was brilliant. There was a little transparent gate keeping kids from falling/jumping in the water, and steps to easily and safely get in and out of the pool. The beach too is very nice, a broad…

title: Good but not Great
review: We've stayed at many many JW Marriott properties, including JW Phuket Thailand.  We were a bit disappointed with  JW Khao Lak.  It felt a little run down, service was not 5 star and many of the details commonly found at a JW were missing.  Beach Towels could only be found in 1 location (by the beach) and not at the other 5 pools, a very long walk with young children to get towels (if we were by the pool we had to wait 20+ minutes for my husband to go retrieve towels and bring them back)!  There was NO pool side service as far as beverages/food.  We had to constantly go get them and ask them if we could eat by our seats.  Even on the beach, there was a tiny makeshift "food and drink" bar but again, they didnt come to us to see if we wanted anything.   There really werent any…

title: 3rd Time At A Fabulous Resort
review: Well, it wasn't 3rd time lucky for me as I knew the Resort was brilliant; that's why I keep going back.  This time I enjoyed more of the Resort activities that were available.  Played tennis; did Yoga almost daily; hired a bike and did a trip to a local waterfall. The Resort is still perfect in my opinion.  Fabulous pool access rooms; the lagoon pools are just divine; breakfast has everything and the staff are just wonderful.  You can do lots or nothing in Khao Lak.  We went to the local Bang Niang market twice and it's fun.  Cheap clothes or gifts and lovely food stalls. Had a massage at the resort which was divine.  Also had a massage in Khao Lak town and that was also relaxing.  We went to the Japanese and Thai restaurants at the Resort and whilst they are more expensive than…

title: Beautiful & Relaxing
review: Perfect place to end our 5 1/2 month trip through South East Asia . We were here beginning of May for 8 days . Beautiful beach , great staff, wonderful pool ! It was very full when we were there but never felt crowded , except breakfast. We were on the 2nd level room . Room was very nice and spacious, we had reserved a king bed but when we were taken to our room it was 2 Doubles. They sent house keeping up to push the beds together. Not a huge issue but I never understand why when you reserve something it is not ready for when you arrive. We were very tired from our travels and had to wait for it to be changed . Plus I don't think this is how the king beds normally are since there was a big crack in the middle and had to have 2 duvets to cover the whole thing. Meant only one end…

title: Disappointed to see cut backs and deterioration
review: Returned to this hotel with friends this time for a 3 night stay. Quite disappointed to see offering going down in this resort.  There were a lot of power disruptions - to the point where the entire resort balked out up to 6 times during a day. Extremely annoying and not something I have expected - given that I have just came from Cambodia and did not even have one power issue.   The air conditioning can be described as random at this hotel. On most days you can just feel that ventilation and air conditioning is poor at the restaurants and lobby while A/C can be article in rooms regardless of how you switch it around. Given how humid that the area is, it is not nice to be eating spicy Thai food in doors with limited ventilation and covered in sweat.  TV channel options can be…

title: It offers great rooms，pools，foods and JW standard service with perfect price.
review: JW Marriott Khao lak is a fantasitic resort near phuket，Tailand.The only suggestion is that the opening dates of Similan Islands near by lasts from december to april.the pools are great because they are in frount of every rooms.

title: Sensational
review: My husband and I stayed here for a week of bliss in April. We could not fault this resort and wanted to move in forever! We had a room with swimming pool access which for us was the icing on the cake.The pool was amazing and how cool to be able to swim from your deck around to the pool bars. [ they accept wet money] We also liked the canoe that was like a floating drinks bar in the afternoon, that came past the room. The grounds are beautiful lush gardens and very well maintained. Our room was really spacious with the best comfy bed and what a bathroom! Staff are always on hand and seem to always be available to freshen up your room. There are about 4 restaurants at the resort and a deli for lighter snacks and coffees etc.The breakfast which was included in our room rate was…

title: Overall We Enjoyed It
review: First the very good: Great room, great gardens, fantastic huge pool, efficient quiet air conditioning, great breakfast with huge choice, great beachfront location, plenty of loungers (it was low season), great air conditioned gym, great massages, and free parking.  The not so good: After walking around the resort we noticed that all the balconies except ours had side tables. After requesting a table, housekeeping arrived with one that had obviously been in the storeroom (covered in dust) … four days later the top was clean but the bottom was still dusty.  When they arrived with the table, I pointed out that the bedside phone wasn’t working … the answer: “there’s another one beside the TV”.  When we returned from dinner that night we noticed that someone had been in the room and…

title: Love it!
review: I have been there in December 2012 with my boyfriend and have spent a few wonderful days! Nice, spacious rooms with a beautiful bathrrom, excellent breakfast in high quality and a huge amount of choices (try the fresh smoothies!) and two very good pool bars. Service quality was always very good. There is a beautiful pool scenery  with two large pools connected by various pool canals that surround the thotel (you can literally explore the hotel by swimming around it, it takes more than half an hour in medium speed to make one round). Always enough towels and staff also sometimes walks around with free water.  The hotel is directly located at a beautiful beach with various little Thai restaurants, so if you need don't want to have dinner inside the hotel then there is plenty of…

title: Amazing Stay
review: We had an absolutely incredible stay at the JW Marriott Khao Lak! The resort is on the beach and is very quiet and relaxing. We loved how the pool wrapped around the resort and opened into larger pools. Our room opened onto the pool and I highly recommend upgrading to one of these rooms if they're available. We rented a car and went to dinner in town nightly. The cooking class at the Thai Restaurant was great and what I learned has been a big hit among friends and family! This is a great place for quiet walks along nearly secluded beaches. We talk about the JW Khao Lak all the time and recommend it to friends and family.

title: Nice resort but quite far away from Phuket
review: We stayed with our kids for 3 nights at this property. Moving about with the baby stroller was a big problem when changing levels as there were no slopes except for the ground level.   Staff were very polite and went out of their way to ask if we needed anything during meal times. We were spoilt for choice of food. One area which made the hotel appear money minded. We ordered room service for a kiddie pasta for my child who prefers to add olives herself into the pasta. So the hotel charged Baht 50 to serve 4pcs of whole black olives which otherwise would have been included in the price of the pasta if ordered to be premixed by the chef.   The meandering pool around the resort was nice and convenient to jump into directly from our room which also led to the infinity pool. The…

title: Nice and relaxing
review: I stayed with my husband for our honeymoon and I really enjoyed our time. I bought a travelzoo voucher and was able to stay for about $100 per night. I decided to focus on price of things in this review as it was something I was looking for before we left. The voucher included breakfast which was excellent each morning! It also had buy one get one free dinner at the buffet. We chose the Thai buffet and it was about $33 USD for one meal (and two after the bogo). The food was decent. I think we had 3 beers with dinner and some water and I our total bill was about $65. We were on a budget and most other lunches and dinner were at the surrounding restaurants on the beach. I believe there was 1 to the left and 2 to the right and all of them were okay. (We had just eaten street food…

title: Incredible!
review: We stayed for six nights as a part of a package from deals.com. Usually, I do not expect much from hotels advertised on various discount websites, but this resort is definitely an exception.  There are lots of reviews here outlining the very obvious - an amazing beach, great pools and rooms, variety of dining options etc - all the things you would expect from a JW Marriott resort. What impressed me the most is the courtesy and helpfulness of all staff. Everyone, from managers to cleaners and gardeners would always greet you with great courtesy and would never hesitate to help if help is needed. As someone working in this industry, I can not speak high enough of the staff at this resort.   Again, there are lots of reviews describing the hotel facilities, so I am not going to…

title: Expensive hotel taxes imposed
review: We had a travelzoo voucher-fantastic value for 289 Aussie dollars-3 nights.We were lucky to get one of the voucher upgrades to a pool access room.The minute we arrived the push to get us to upgrade our room type began(they are very convincing) so we went for the upgrade to the family deluxe pool room-The room was lovely but they impose a nightly room upgrade tax also we paid for a 3rd person so also paid an extra nightly tax for this.I'm not talking about the 7% VAT,this is the hotel imposing this.I had estimated about 400 Aussie but the bill came I nearly died-650.I was so gobsmacked I kept the bill.We went for happy hour one night and again the bill much more than it should have been-possibly an added happy hour tax.I think it's this resort way of making you pay full price…

title: Will definitely come back
review: Wonderful world class resort, good value package  Breakfast is really good, especially the artistically mixed fruit juice, full of imagination, a must have  Tried all the four restaurants in the resort, olive, the Italian restaurant is my favorite, seafood served there is fresh enough  Walk by the beach and turn right, there are many restaurant and outdoor spas, worth trying. Day trip to nearby island is available for booking at these restaurants. We tried a day trip to similan operated by fantastic Similan, which was quite nice, 2000b per person  Also joined a cycling tour to local market organized by the resort, very interesting experience. Local food at the market is so different from what the hotel offer, nice try. The cycling journey itself is peaceful and relaxing, can see…

title: The staff and property were brilliant, just brilliant!!!
review: I stayed in the hotel together with my sister for 2 nights - and they were really unforgettable!!! As soon as we walked in the lobby we were immediately greeted by the most friendliest and helpful staff - excellent personnel! The room - Deluxe Pool Access - and the amenities had everything and even more you would expect on an amazing holiday in  the tranquil, white sand beach resort... The pool was never crowded and noisy with a great swim-up bar where you could enjoy selection of tasty and refreshing cocktails. The ultimate stretch of white sand private beach with blue water is perfect for a family oriented vacation or a romantic gateway. Everything is done to make your life as relaxed and peaceful in JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa. From the spa to the beach to the delicious…

title: Nearly perfect
review: Stayed for 2 weeks in this hotel together with my wife, it's a great place to stay. The pool is magnificent and when u have a poolside room the u can just hop in, it's a big hotel but u barely notice the people it's that quiet. Service is excellent, great people working here nothing is impossible. Only slight minus is that the rooms are a bit worn, could do with a lick of paint and refurbish. I'd easily recommend this hotel if u enjoy a quiet place to stay for your holiday. We had breakfast and dinner included which was good, though the dinner selection gets tedious if u stay for a longer period.

title: Value for money but food is a bit overpriced
review: I stayed 2 nights here with my husband. All in all, the experience was great. I love the activities on offer. They have a functional gym room, table tennis tables, beach volleyball court, tennis court & basketball. You are never short of ideas. The best is the private beach. It's such a beautiful beach. The next best thing is the pool. Even though the hotel was busy, you never feel that it's cramped.   A bit of a let down was food. Breakfast was above average but can be better in terms of western food. A am particularly disappointed with the dehli. Instead of only offering western food, how about some thai dishes such as pad thai etc. also food is pretty pricey. Fortunately, they have some restaurants in huts by the beach and their food was cheap and delicious. That saves our…

title: very popular nirvana
review: you have to know that all hotels on this beach agreed not to put on sand anything (chairs, umbrelas and other items). I consider regarding JWM's location - it is the best place in Khао lak to plunge into a nirvana: when you will come to a long deserted beach and wil see horizont, such feeling you will not forget. Only one inconvenience is the size of hotel:  it is necessary to go on foot much and many people - are especially felt it during a breakfast when crowd is looking for food

title: Absolutely spectacular
review: Great resort. Great food, the staff was friendly. Loved the breakfast buffet, especially freshly squeezed smoothies, great rooms. The Spa was magical. late check out facilities was an excellent touch. My flight was leaving at night. I was able to enjoy all of the facilities, take shower and change at late check out place. Only down side is a long drive from Phuket.

title: Amazing spa
review: I have stayed there in March 2012 for a week. NIce pool, nice beach, good selection of the local restaurants on the beach just 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel. However my favourite place was the hotel spa. Also breakfast was worth recommendation.

title: Might be slipping a little...
review: I've been to and reviewed this resort in the past and I still really like the location, pool, staff, beach, exercise room, massage, etc.   It seems like the breakfast was not as good as last time, the van had worn out suspension (people getting sick), and things were a but shabby around the edges.  My worry is that if they stay on this trend and I return in 6 months that the place will be second rate. I'm tempted to try another hotel in the Khao Lak area.

title: Wonderful place to stay
review: This was a last minute booking, and I did have some reservations about spending my holidays in a chain hotel (only because I spend so much time in them for work and like to try different 'boutique' hotels)  From start to the end, it was just a fantastic experience.  The service was first rate on every level - very natural and thoughtful staff without being overbearing.  The room was spacious and clean, and the pool access room meant you could step into the swimming pool literally from your porch doorstep.  The swimming pool runs along all the residential blocks.  This is a massive resort, and the swimming pool was akin to a mini-Venice.  At it's deepest point, the pool is 150cm and it's fun just to paddle/swim through the waterways.  Many families with children (incl. young…

title: Amazing and spectacular
review: We stayed here for 4 days, as something different from our usual Thailand holiday. The service from the first moment was nothing short of wonderful. We were greeted with warm smiles and check-in was fast. We had a pool access room which was private and intimate. The grounds resulted in me feeling instantly relaxed (and I had already been relaxing for 10 days in Phuket). The level of relaxation was felt to our core.   My partner and I enjoyed the beach restaurants, as well as the restaurants in the main strip of Khao Lak. We didn't want to explore too much - just spend our last days floating around in the Marriott's amazing pool.   I had a number of treatments in their resort Spa - and it was possibly the best facial, body massage, manicure and pedicure I have ever received - in…

title: Beautiful well maintained resort
review: We stayed here for our silver anniversary and got a good deal for it on Scoopon. The resort is as beautiful as the pictures on their website. We loved the personal complimentary touches they did for our anniversary :). Stayed in a pool view room rather than a pool access room, since I am not a big fan of having a pool at my doorstep, also the pool view room, I felt, was more private being on level 1 rather than ground level. Their buffet breakfast is excellent (served from 6.30-11AM). Fitness room is good. The spa is beautifully appointed and very transquil, but also very pricey. I would recommend this resort highly.

title: Amazing Resort
review: Quite an amazing experience in Khao Lak.  We traveled on Travelzoo vouchers and combined 2 of them for a total of 6 nights.  The price was amazing at $100/night and included a couples massage, daily breakfast, and a dinner at their formal Thai Restaurant for each voucher.  So, we qualified for two of everything.  The pool was amazing.  I've never had so much fun being lazy with my wife swimming around the entire resort.  The true added bonus for such a rural area, were the restaurants on the beach that you could walk to on the perimeter of the resort.  You aren't forced to pay the typical inflated resort pricing on food for each meal.  $3US for a dish, but the serving sizes are a little smaller than you might expect if you are from the US.  Services at the spa are cheap for the…

title: Paradise!
review: Very nice hotel. It was one of the best I have ever been. Rooms are cosy and large, with a very stylis design. Bathreoom is useful - bath and shower. I had a room with balcony  (nice view for swimming pool). There is cleaning service twice a day. Breakfast are perfect! I have never eaten better. I will vist that hotel in the future. Unfortunately, restaurnats and spa are expensive (TOO EXPENSIVE!!!). Ther are local pleace to eat and massage (outside the hotel) in the beach - rather cheap.

title: Professionally run hotel.
review: Can't really add a lot to previous reviews. Had a very relaxing 6 night stay here last week.  Sits right on a gorgeous beach, plenty of swimming areas, never seemed crowded (with the possible exception of the breakfast room, but even that was well managed, and food was regularly replenished). Breakfast is worth a special mention.  Excellent choice, some food/drink freshly prepared to order, coffee served at the table and topped up with no fuss.  Other nice touches eg iced water brought to you on the beach, fresh coconut deliveries to your room, well maintained sports areas eg tennis, table tennis, table football etc.  Generally, the staff throughout the resort were exceptionally professional, with all front line staff speaking and understanding adequate English.  We had…

title: Amazing resort with great service in paradise!
review: I am currently still at the JW Marriott Khao Lak and wanted to put my review in before things were long forgotten.  My wife and I have stayed 4 nights at this beautiful resort. From the moment I made the booking over the phone with my travel zoo voucher the service at this hotel has been amazing. The staff are very friendly and are always more than happy to help. In particular I would like to thank Tom at the Aquamarine pool bar. He is always on hand to make those holiday cocktails and makes you feel very welcome indeed. He does a great job. In regards to our room we paid to upgrade to a pool access room and got room 4019. My wife and I could not be any happier with the room and I think it probably improves your experience in the hotel 30% by literally being able to pop straight…

title: Out of the world
review: We spent 5 nights with our 9 year old daughter. A very relaxing place and the pool was a big hit with our daughter  Would recommend the pool access rooms, try and go for rooms 1020 onwards.   The plus points  Great place to relax   The breakfast buffet one of the largest selection we have ever seen  The resturants are great try the Buffett nights great selection of food and good value  Large number of pools   Great kids club   No negatives at all

title: Complete Paradise - loved it!!
review: My wife, my 8 year old girl and me have just recently returned back from 9 nights at the begining of April from what I can only say has been the best holiday experience ever! We simply loved everything about the resort! We checked in at around 6PM, greeted by the most beautiful sunset which could be viewed through the open lobby, a picture of tranquility. Our hearts rose and we felt this was it, paradise. Cold flannels and a cold drink, then swiftky taken to our room, pool side access, you will have read all the reviews, I can' tell you just how fantastic this was. We all jumped in straight off our vernandah.   We ate on our first night at Blue Mist! we couldn't stop grinning, we all love authentic Thai food, doesn't get much better and Jackie was so good to us on the several…

title: Amazing resort, amazing location,
review: This is a very well designed, tranquil, and large resort a very nice location on the beach. Has excellent room and facilities. Free WIFI all around including around gardens. It has 3 restaraunts, the Buffet Breakfast is one of the best and most extensive I have seen. The Thai dinner buffett was also very yummy with so much variety. Amazing and tranquil Spa with experienced massueses for a real Thai massage. The prices are all good value for money for the food, spa and accomodation.

title: Perfection in Paradise
review: My wife and I have just stayed for 7 nights and wish we had been able to stay longer. We arranged for an airport transfer through the hotel and despite landing early the driver was waiting and the transfer comfortable.  The hotel room was fantastic. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had an enormous bed with a separate rain shower. There was free bottled water which is always appreciated when you can't drink the tap water.  The breakfast buffet was one of the best we have had. All the usual egg station (cooked to order including eggs benedict), noodle soup (also cooked to order), western, asian, pasties, crepes (cooked to order), cold meats, fruit etc. Our favourite feature, however, was the fresh juice/smoothie section.  The pool is enormous and snakes around the…

title: Beyond expectations
review: Growing weary of exaggerated claims of five stars, it was with some skepticism that we checked into the Marriott Khao Lak.  The approach is unprepossessing, the lobby soulless, but from the unremarkable start, everything went up, up, up.  We will definitely be back, and have already recommended it to friends.  Service:  wonderful, attentive, without being cloying  Food:  good, at your basic 5-star prices.  One of the chief appeals of this hotel was that there is a choice of small Thai restaurants down the beach -- good food, better prices, and a break from the muzak (yes, there IS muzak at this resort, too) of the resort.  It provides a good counter-point to the more polished restaurants within the bounds of the resort, and leaves you feeling less 'stranded' in your gilded cage.…

title: Honeymoon!
review: Just returned from our 14 night honeymoon!  Beautiful hotel and excellently maintained grounds!  We had a top floor room which was excellent, i did consider the pool access room at a supplement but didn't feel it was necessary.  Viewed these rooms however and they were convenient for the pool but i don't think you would be disappointed without one as the rooms themselves are identical either way.  The downside with the pool access we thought was that they weren't 100% private, in that when you sit outside to sunbathe etc everyone can see you or can swim past.  The beach was more popular it seemed so we were always happy down there rather than in the pool.  There are plenty of sunbeds and there were always free ones late morning/lunch time so no need to rush down like some…

title: What a relaxing resort
review: After a night at the budget hotel, we arrived at the JW Marriott just around 12:30pm.  All the check in was done while we were seating at the lobby, came with a welcome drink. They we were leaded to our pool access room.  The room was big, clean, everything you expect for a 5 stars hotel. The pool access was very conveinent, we just got changed then can jump to the giant pool right there.  The buffet breakfast was lovely, lots of choices with western and oriental foods, freshly juices... We went to the Spa as we got 45mins free Thai massage each. We upgraded to oil massage with THB300. The massgae was one of the best I ever had. The atmosphere, massage, the room, everything was 5 stars. The beach was nice, easy access and not crowded at all because it was so big. We had a very…

title: Never thought I could afford luxury like this!
review: Khao Lak was the last leg of our explorations through Thailand.  We had visited Bangkok, Chiang Mai and then finally Khao Lak.  Making the south and the beach the last leg of our trip was the right thing to do, we put in a lot of miles and now it was time to relax.    We made two very good decisions.  First, was to choose to stay in Khao Lak rather than stay at one of the beach locations in Phuket.  It was quiet, the beach was not over run.  Because the general cost of everything is inexpensive, we could hire a driver to take us to Phuket for the day, and then come back to our quiet, beautiful home base at JW Marriott in Khao Lak.    The second good decision we made was to choose JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort and Spa as our place to stay.  I have never stayed in a more beautiful…

title: Perfect
review: Stayed for 6 nights at the beginning of April with a Travelzoo voucher. We had booked a standard room but when checking in was upgraded to pool access rooms free of charge. The rooms were very impressive, big comfortable bed, spacious, lovely shower and massive bath. Upon arrival they had lit candles in the room which was a nice touch. The pool area is stunning and the beach lovely too. The location is perfect for relaxing with just a handful of restaurants a short walk along the beach. The restaurants offer great food at decent prices for the area. Personal favourites were Blue Mist and the Andamen. The breakfast in the hotel was the best I've ever experienced, there was literally everything on offer! We used the Spa on 2 occasions which again was brilliant. Perfect hotel in a…

title: Heaven! :)
review: This place is amazing, when checking in we recieved a cold drink and towel and everyone had a smile on their face, they do everything for you and wouldnt even let us open a door for ourselves! The rooms are so nice! Very spacious and hugeeeee bed. Breakfast had everything you could want, english, european and asian foods. Swimming pool goes on forever, we spent ages exploring the pool and drinking at the pool bars. The beach is picture perfect and the local beach restaurants make it seem alot more of an authentic thai experience. Soooo glad were only 2 days in, might just stay here forever. Some people have complained about it being run down but for the size of the resort there are always going to be issues, just embrace the whole experience and dont let silly little things get…

title: Family paradise
review: We stayed at this resort as part of a Deals.com voucher. We travelled with our 2 children (5 and 7) and stayed for 8 nights. We loved being in Khao Lak which was away from the busyness of Phuket but still close enough to activities. We went on a half day elephant ride just out of Khao Lak, a speedboat tour of Phang Nga Bay (long day but so worth it!) and into Bang Niang market on an afternoon. The resort is beautiful - the staff are so friendly - everyone from the restuarant staff to the gardeners greet you warmly.  The pool is the highlight of the resort - because it is so large and interesting to explore. Even though the resort was busy we felt we had the pool to ourselves many times.  The exterior of the resort is looking a little run down but I think this is the result of…

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: My wife and I have just returned from an 8 night stay at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak. The hotel is fantastic!! After reading a few of the "negative reviews" of the hotel it seems some people will always find something to moan about! From the minute we arrived at the hotel the staff were polite and friendly. We received a drink and cold towel on arrrival whilst checking in and in our room we had a complimentray fruit and a cake congratulaitoing us on our recent wedding. The rooms was fabulous with a huge comforable bed, 2 sofas, large bathroom with walk in shower, massive bath and two sinks! We had a pool access room with a private deck leading straight to the pool, and a short swim to one of the pool bars!   I have read one review that compalined about privacy but not sure what…

title: Paradise!
review: This is not so much a hotel with a pool as a pool with a hotel built around it! I realise it has been said many times, but the size really is breathtaking; some corners of the lagoon alone are the size of regular hotel pools. With all that choice and the stunningly beautiful beach, the main problem is knowing where to park yourself. Mostly we chose the beach, which is postcard perfect.  The resort exudes an air of service and luxury and I loved that it was very Thai in style rather than an anonymous chain-style hotel. The gardens are beautiful and well maintained, especially around the Aquamarine pool between wings 3 and 4.  We loved: the beach, the restaurants along the beach (the one at the very end is the cheapest and best), the Japanese performance cooking, the swim-up bars,…

title: That's resort ! but...
review: As lots visitors stated, huge pool and sunset seen from beach are super. This hotel is isolated resort, far away from main street in Khao Lak, just for people to relax themselves and to do nothing. Accordingly, that means good service, food and comfortable room are essential.   Reviewing my 6-day stay,  1) ROOM ; Not surprising in southeast Asian resot hotels, ants were mate. Except it, room is clean. 2) FOOD ;  Breakfast buffet was boring. especially coffee...  but Khao Lak juice was good. Dinner was better in freshness and taste as much more expensive than breakfast. 3) Service ; Most people were friendly and attentive, especially at Japanese and Thai restaurants. But staff at "Olive" Italian one was awful. They did not clean our table at buffet and finished plates were piled.…

title: Wonderful resort
review: Spent 6 nights.  It is a beautiful resort and a pool access room was awesome.  A pool access room is far better than a pool villa at other resorts unless you need a lot of privacy on your deck.  Swimming around the resort was awesome and the pool is warm.  The ocean is also really nice.    Beachside restaurants are nice.  We ate often at blue mist and andaman restaurant for half the price and arguably better food.  Booked tours for better prices from blue Mist amd guitar massage to save.  Tachai island had good snorkeling with life coral and the most beautiful beach I have ever seen but It is a long journey.  Overall khao lak is a beautiful peaceful place.  We took long walks in the mornings and were the only ones on the beach for miles.  We woke up early and went on excursions…

title: Satisfaction guaranteed
review: Dream Beach, THAI WARM & GREAT "Amuse Bouche" What else would you need ? If you even forget about your bad habits and just enjoy, thats what I call a real getaway. I would though not recommend it further as then the place will get crowded where it is so nice now.

title: Fantastic hotel in a beautiful remote area
review: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 4 nights. The hotel is approximately a one hour drive from the airport, and depending on the length of your trip (and if you are likely to want to leave the hotel) I would advise a hire car - Thai rent a car is only about 1100 baht per day, whilst a taxi to khao lak from the airport is around 1700 baht. We didn't rent one, and as we were there for 4 days, we ended up spending more on taxis than we would have done renting a car, so later hired one in Phuket when we continued our holiday. Of course if you are happy to stay in the hotel, and eat at the beach, taxis would be better.  The hotel itself is beautiful, very lovely grounds, and of course that amazing 3km swimming pool makes it seem like it's mostly empty of people!   The beach is…

title: What an experience
review: I stayed here after purchasing a scoopon voucher. Best voucher Ive purchased yet. The resort was amazing, the pool was a lot of fun. Although it rained nearly every day we were there, we still had a great time.  The resort breakfast was fantastic, it was a huge spread of everything you could dream of. The local restaurants on the beach (in particular to the right) were sensational, the food was so good and fresh, and very cheap. it was a lot of fun trying all these restaurants, and was great interacting with the locals that worked there. Rooms were great, internet was fast, air con worked, showers were great, can't really fault anything. Would stay here again.

title: Excellent Stay - More 4 star than 5 star
review: We spent 4 days at this lovely hotel after some time in Phuket and Bangkok. It was such a relief to be in a nice hotel on a beautiful beach. The kids loved the swim up room and we had one that did not have stair access (some do). Both my husband and I are fit and of course the kids are but I could see how this could be an issue for someone with any physical limitations or older/elderly. If you fall in the category, ask for a room that has stairs to the pool. We loved the breakfast buffet. Lots of variety (even gluten free items avail) and very tasty. It can be a bit hectic but I'm fine with that. Its a big resort so I expected that. The service was excellent and when I requested anything, they went out of the way to take care of it. Even while dealing with a packed restaurant.…

title: All Is Not Ideal Under the Surface Charm
review: With an amazing offer from travelzoo (does anyone pay full price here, I wonder?), I spent 6 nights at the Resort. Arriving at 12:30pm, there was a conveyer belt atmosphere at reception when the few staff on duty (I counted only 4) clearly could nowhere near cope with all the work. Why so few? Some arriving guests were given hand towels and drinks. I was not. I expected a long wait, but was thankful it was only 15 minutes.    My pool access room itself was large with no less than 3 day-beds in addition to a wide and comfortable double bed. The age of the property is certainly beginning to show, however, with lots of scuff and other marks on the teak furniture. I also fail to understand why hotel managements install rain showers when they do not seal the shower door. Having water…

title: Absolutely delighted!
review: My wife and I stayed at the Marriot in November 2012 and we were very happy with everthing.The standard of accomodation was first class as was the food in the main restaurant where we had breakfast every morning.The other restaurants we tried were the Thai and Italian restaurants,both very good and not too expensive.Staff were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble.The swimming pool was something else,winding its way through the entire complex, but the best part was the main pool area where the swim up bar is located.The guys behind the bar make fabulous cocktails at very reasonable prices by our standards.For a great holiday in one of the quieter parts of Thailand we highly recommend the Marriot and hope to return one day.

title: Relaxing holiday destination if you don't want to do too much
review: We stayed at the JW Marriott Khao Lak for a week in March 2013. It's a big hotel located an hour by taxi from Phuket airport which cost us 1100B +tip.  Its a stunning looking hotel with the biggest swimming pools we had ever seen. It is located right on a beautiful white, sandy beach with crystal clear water. The hotel food was fine and affordable although we mostly ate out on the beach which was a lot cheaper and we love eating local food with sand under foot. We recommend Bluemist restaurant (turn right onto the beach) and have the fried whole fish - amazing! Massage on the beach was also fantastic, we tried a few but preferred Guitar massage.  Our room was the duplex suite so our 2 kids slept downstairs on the day bed and in a cot, while we were upstairs which worked really…

title: Lovely Hotel But Parts Of It Need Refurbishing
review: Stayed at the Marriott Khao Lak in June 2012 and from reading other reviews thought that there would be quite a few restaurants on the beach and also shopping in the near by town, but unfortunately when we were there in June (which I know is not the high season ) there was only I think three restaurants on the beach because the week before the high tide had washed the others away !!! and because it was their low season the owners didn't think it was worth rebuilding them. In the near by town which was a taxi drive away many shops were not open because of the low season and lack of tourists which was a shame. We go to Thailand every year at the same time and have never experienced such a lack of eating places or shops but speaking to locals Khao Lak was badly hit in the tsunami…

title: everything is nice
review: we spend 4 nights in this hotel , the hotel is nice. The stuff is very warmful .we upgread the room to the pool access room ,it's great . After  you drink in the infinity bar you can swim to your room.There is 4 restrant in the hotel . i think just waterfront and Thai food is good, i don't like the Sakura and Olive.and the restrant on the beach just next the hotel have a nice price, from there you also can reserve taxi , similan trip ,bla bla bla . If you want the first beach chair you may get up  early .

title: Work in Progress
review: Location, Location. A beautiful place, great facilities, wonderful beach. A nice place to relax. Great Thai restaurant. Great coffee shop opposite Kids club. Kids loved the kids club and free games such as Air Hockey ,Pool Table etc  On the downside was that the service and food Quality in the Olive restaurant was poor while the price was high ( for Thai standards). Breakfast : Same story. lots of choice but quality of food lacking.   Very slow wifi.  As it was spring Holiday the place was overrun buy package holiday guests which maybe explained the slip in service quality which is normally high at the JW Marriott.  All in All not what was expected from a 5 star. Still a very good rating due to the Location and facilities.

title: JW Khao Lak was fantastic!
review: JW Khao Lak was fantastic!   ROOMS We had a direct pool access room in the 3000 area which has a balcony with a clear glass gate and steps down into the pool.  This was the perfect type for us with a small child and thankfully, I read about it on this website!  Our balcony got alot of sun which we loved, but also had a shady section.  There were other types of balconies like those with a wooden fence and small garden and ones with no gate/fence.   Our room did have a slightly weird smell as some people mentioned, but it was hardly noticeable and we're very sensitive.  The room was well appointed with two nice chaise lounges inside and two on the balcony.  The bathroom was not cleaned that well when we arrived, but the staff came back in and remedied the problem.   BEACH Beach…

title: Pretty good
review: Only just registered hence delay in writing this review.  Visited with my wife as part of multi-trip to Hong Kong and Thailand.  Beautiful resort, rooms and beach with good service and breakfast. Amazing pool with activities and spa available, and good local shops/ restaurants.  Not cheap but probably worth the money overall.  Cons - 2-3 hour drive from Phuket, poor quality food in restaurants so we ended up walking along the beach and eating at amazing, cheap local restaurants al fresco. The spa was also expensive so we elected to use the local services on the beach which were excellent.   Not sure I would recommend again but excellent resort in itself.

title: Out of the way but nice. Used points. See room tips.
review: We cashed in points and stayed 5 nights. The hotel is nice, large, but well laid out. The wrap around pool is great and the water is really warm. Here are some room tips...originally they wanted to stick us in 1001...which is a horrible room because it's right after reception by the main area so everyone can peer into your room and see what's going on...not so great for privacy for a couple.  In our tour of the hotel...rooms 2003, 2004, or 1028 have the most plants by their balconies to provide additional privacy if you want a direct pool access room. These rooms are in either wing 2 or 1...which if you're a couple is what I'd recommend. It's also close to the infinity pool with the fun swim up bar and the beach and all the restaurants.  If you've got kids, like to be near…

title: Great property for a family vacation
review: Just back from one of our best vacations ever and the resort had a lot to do with it.   Pros:  Breakfast -- this was one of the best breakfast spreads I have seen, Fantastic smoothie bar, great selection of cold cuts, 2 egg stations, a great spread of pancakes waffles and crepes. One caveat though, like another reviewer mentioned, the Kids corner should have something other than chicken nuggets, fries and porridge every day.   Staff was very friendly and always ready to help and greeted us everytime they came across us. Varun in F&B was especially helpful  Beach was very clean though the cocktails were just avg (mojito was disappointing)  Kids club and recreation area was great. My 6 year old would spend hours there making new friends and busy with the organized activities (some…

title: Jyrki ja Mari
review: The Longest swiming pool area, about 3 km. Nice thai style rooms and entrange was cool. Good pool bars and beach services. Spa was special but treatments were expensives. Try this hotel, you feel like a king. Walking in hotel area is easy. Hyppy hour in poolbars start 17.00-18.40

title: Superb resort with great style and hospitality
review: I stayed here for 3 nights and was overall very pleased with the experience.  This is a large resort with a lovely meandering pool situated on a long quiet palm fringed beach.  Service was generally excellent and I felt the staff to be generally hospitable and eager to please.  The resort is exceptionally well maintained thanks to a veritable army of gardeners and pool cleaners.  I stayed in both a pool view and pool access room- I found the pool access to be surprisingly handy and enjoyed being able to go straight from the balcony into the pool (probably worth paying extra for upgrade).  The interior of the room was essentially the same and these were pretty stylish with nice Thai touches and very comfortable beds.  I ate in the Thai restaurant and ordered room service one…

title: Superb hotel & amazing service
review: I have been to Khao Lak before and this is the best hotel in town without any doubt. The hotel was full to capacity it being the Easter holidays but at not point (possibly with the exception of Breakfast) did the hotel feel full or crowded.  The whole layout of the hotel gives the feeling of space and tranquility.  The location and the beach are superb and at no point over the 4 days that we stayed did we feel the need to leave the resort - other than to go to the local beach bars/restaurants to eat.  The first beach restaurant (Phen Restaurant) was some of the best Thai restaurant any of the 6 in our group have ever had and so cheap with great service. Moreover at no point did we feel ripped off or gouged by the Marriott the prices in the hotel were very reasonable and fair…

title: Honeymoon bliss
review: We're just about to check out and can easily say this has been one of the loveliest trips I've ever been on. It was our honeymoon and all the staff really just went out if their way to make it beautiful. We had the deluxe pool access room and it was lovely sitting on our balcony knowing we could walk straight into the water. The only things I could possibly say was the temperature of the pool was very very warm and not exactly refreshing for us. Oh and watching how some of the other tourists (mainly Asian) treated the hotel staff was pretty hard at times. The entire experience was beautiful!

title: Dissapointed.
review: My wife and I have just returned from Thailand from a 10 day Holiday. We spent six of those days at the Marriott Resort in Khao Lak. We paid a little extra and upgraded to a Pool Access Room and so glad we did as it was an absolute treat to walk out of the room and jump straight into the pool, I actually stepped in as I am 70 years young. Initially we were dissapointed in our room, this was due to a couple of reasons, (a) the first room we were placed in was at the reception end of the resort far and away from the restaurants and the beach. secondly the pool access was down a rocky path and entailed sitting down on your haunches to lower your self into the pool and believe me the slate tops of the pool were hot enough to fry and egg on, after a call and complaint to the…

title: Wonderful hotel & wonderful people!
review: This is a wonderful, peaceful resort, yet is a short taxi trip to Khao Lak (300BHT - 7.50GBPs). A swimmer's paradise - wonderful pool which meanders around the resort, but also with different areas for poolside drinks and for doing laps in peace (there's also a great sports centre with tennis and squash courts). The beach location is also beautiful - and perfect for swimming and for children. The managers of JW Marriott are to be congratulated as we had a truly wonderful stay...........and this was largely due to the best resource in the resort.....the staff. We found staff to be courteous and without exception, they were keen to make our stay the best.  Thanks to all and especially Yoh, our room was always beautifully maintained and always with a smile :)  The beds / pillows…

title: Great location for long walks on a fantastic beach
review: This was the third and final leg of our recent trip to Thailand. Stayed at The Marriott for four nights with a great deal through TravelZoo which gave us the chance to check out the Khao Lak area.  On checking in, you are seated and given a cold drink and wet towels while you wait for someone to check you in. You are given a map of the resort with your room marked on it which you need at first as it really is a large resort.  We had upgraded our package to a pool access room which was great. The room opened out onto your own private balcony with direct pool access to a 3 km long pool that meanders around the resort. We found the direct pool access meant we jumped in for a dip more often than we probably would have as it was so convenient. Just found getting out a little hard…

title: One of the worlds best resorts.
review: This resort is as good as it was on our last visit and the one previous to that. The beautiful setting and the magnificient beach are just the same but the restaurants have improved. Fabulous themed meals,some in an al fresco setting. Every single staff member is pleasant and desperate to please. The breakfast is the best and most varied that I have experienced anywhere. The gym is well equiped and excellently maintained. There is even an elephant that visits the resort twice a week. The small touches such as cold towels and water presented personally on the beach just oozes luxury. Impossible to find anything to fault.

title: Khao Lak, my new favourite place !
review: Khao Lak ....... simply amazing.  We had planned a 2 week trip to Bangkok and Patong Beach mid March, and then an offer to stay at J W Marriott Khao Lak for 3 nights in a pool access room including breakfast for just $289 AUS via Travelzoo came up so we decided we could squeeze this stay into our holiday by moving things around a little.  This is a classy resort with the most amazing and huge lagoon type pool which was easily accessible directly from our room.  The room was large with a large extra comfy bed and all the mod cons .... very nice to come back to after a swim or dinner.   The pool is just amazing, if not a little warm, but then the weather was around 36.C every day, so I guess thats to be expected.  Drinks at the swim up bar can be recommended during happy hour as…

title: Gorgeous property, stunning location and great service
review: We a current,y staying at the property and its absolutely phenomenal.its very kid friendly and I see kids of all ages having a great time as there are activities for all. The property itself is very unique in that I can step out of my verandah straight into the pool and there is something to be said about this stunning setting. The beach is beautiful and we have had a bast swimming in the ocean. The rooms are a great size for our family of 4. The staff is very friendly and cater to all your needs. They have UN limited free Popsicles made of fruit juice at the waterfront bar in the afternoons which the kids love and they have great sport facilities like squash,tannins, water activities all for free. You can do tai chi on the beach as the sun sets which is magical.   Tips to…

title: Amazing piece of Thailand to visit... Lived up to all of my expectations
review: First ever visit to Thailand, picked up an amazing deal to stay here thru Scoopon so it was very affordable.   Perfect white beach, beautiful waters, very clean rooms, unbelievable swimming pool and the best breakfast buffet I have ever seen!   Best part of this place was the amazing staff, always very helpful and polite. One of our guides for the bike tour wouldn't even take our tip we offered as he felt we had paid enough just to be staying there!!! Couldn't recommend highly enough

title: Not Happy!
review: I'll write a balanced review at the end of our stay but at the moment we're not happy. We arrived at 11:30am after travelling for ten hours Perth / Singapore / Phuket / Khao Lak. We can barely keep our eyes open and have been told we have to wait until 3:00pm for our room. The hotel mini van picked us up from the airport, so our arrival was no surprise. I can only hope it gets better!

title: JW Marriotts a Star
review: This Hotel is fantastic.  We were upgraded from a Pool Access room to a Deluxe Split Level Balcony room for our honeymoon.  The room layout and furnishings were wonderful. We had fruit delivered to our room and cut up and layed out for serving, a beautiful chocolate mud cake with piping on top of Happy Honeymoon.  It just went on and on with little details of offering happiness and romance over our stay. Food at the various Restaurants with the Hotel are excellent and good prices, but you can also walk along the beach to various local Restaurants, and they were very cheap with excellent menu choices and prices. The pool and pool bar, fantastic, and the staff can mix anything you like and taste devine.  The staff no matter what area they worked in were so helpful and friendly,…

title: Beautiful piece of paradise, highly recommend
review: We arrived here 5 days ago with 4 left to go and we are loving every minute of it. Our room is a lovely pool access room, and the pool goes on forever a stunning setting. Clean room and drinking water provided daily, it comes with hair dryer, iron and even a DVD player so no need to pack these things. The weather has been fantastic since we arrived.
