The resort beach is beautiful with plenty of sun loungers, fresh beach towels provided daily and cold drinking water freely provided. You can use body boards for free provided by the hotel which is good fun. When it comes to eating, we highly recommend the blue mist restaurant on the beach, friendly staff and great food! A meal for 2 with a couple of drinks about 600/700 baht. Had fresh Seabass which was lovely. Jackie and No are…

title: Lovely Hotel for a peaceful holiday
review: We had the opportunity to visit the hotel during the first week of March 2013. We were picked up at Phuket airport and driven to the hotel. The roads are pretty good and with not much traffic we made it to the hotel in about an hour or so. Upon arrival, the bags were pretty quickly dealt with and we were offered a cooling drink in the lobby. Wonderfully refreshing after the long trip from HK.   The hotel has two floors with the ground floor rooms having direct pool access and our room was one which had the added benefit of a small screening of plants to offer a modicum of privacy. The rooms were clean, well provisioned and everything worked! We had to request a bellboy once for something we had forgotten and he was there in just a few minutes, so pretty good response times.…

title: Not a 5 star hotel !!but a good 4 star !
review: I write this as I sit in the pool bar of this hotel it's not a bad hotel it's well located . My problem is the standard it is set at. It does not offer 5 star service. From the moment you arrive there is the feeling you ar on a conveyor belt to be processed and out by staff dressed no better than in a fast food outlet . One is shown a map of the area no questions about the individual facilities can be answered as that is for someone else. This goes for all the staff in the resort  everyone is very friendly but in an amateur fashion.Breakfast is a little like a large very large family breakfast with children running round but the food is good except the fresh juice counter mixes concentrated orange to his finished blended glasses !! There is no secondary breakfast area!  On the…

title: Almost perfect
review: We returned to this hotel after a wonderful vacation here last year when we gave it 10 out of ten. This year we felt it was still excellent but just a few small things had slipped and it only gets 9/10 this time.  For the positive, this is a wonderful location with a fantastic pool and other facilities. The staff are outstanding and I would mention Ann and Olive at breakfast and Rahel in the coffee shop but there were so many others who went our of their way to make our stay wonderful. The breakfasts are of the very best standard and the chefs will prepare almost anything for you. The gym and business centre are good.  And for the small downsides - five times on separate days we complained that the shower was not draining properly and flooding the floor but it was not solved…

title: Fantastic stay
review: We had a great time at our stay at the JW. We had a great room, that we could enter the pool from our balcony! The rooms were big and spacious. Whilst the resort is big, there a plenty of little spots you can sit and relax without feeling like you are surrounded by people. All the facilities and restaurants were of high quality, so much choice at the breakfast buffet! The beach is perfect for swimming it was beautiful.

title: A 5 star oasis in Khao Lak
review: My partner and I have spent 8 of 10 days in this lovely resort . It is big but never seems to feel crowded . We have a garden pool access room. It is important to distinguish these rooms from the other pool access rooms as they are different . There are pool access rooms that are much less private however they , as opposed to ours have steps to the pool . Could be difficult to get in and out of the garden access ones if you were not particularly agile . With children I would suggest the pool fenced ones near the children's play area . We preferred the privacy the garden rooms afford.   Breakfast possibly the most varied of any we have experienced and we travel for a living ! The fresh juice and smoothie bar a standout .  Pools very good . Both with swim up bars. Water warm but…

title: Perfect!
review: We stayed here on our honeymoon and it is simply a beautiful hotel with fantastic service in a fantastic location!  We had a ground floor lagoon access room.  Extremely well appointed and comfortable, well serviced and spotless.  Pools are lovely, Information on local activities and customs (like the water festival) timely and relevant, very cheap shuttle bus into khoa lak where you can shop and book excursions and activities.  We ate in one of the one site restaurants on the first evening but then discovered the beach restaurants..wow!  Food superb, prices very low and service fantastic so saved the hotel for breakfast only!  Which was superb.....amazing choice and friendly attentive service.  Happy hour in the bar from 5 til 7 meant drinks were affordable.  Suspect we will be…

title: Lots of options
review: This place is what you make of it.  It is located out of town but the resort offers many options so there is no need to leave (water aerobics etc).  Many places to eat & get massages.  The best and cheapest options are along the beach (turn right).  I can certainly recommend Mama's for food and there is a vast selection of massage huts.  The pool is magnificent, although it is very warm which is good if you're swimming late at night but a bit warm for my liking as I prefer to cool down when swimming.  The beach at the back of the hotel is very clean and no one bothers you.  Our shower drain blocked which I reported to reception so although the room was large and well set out, there are some maintenance issues there.  The most fun we had was hiring scooters.  The roads are quiet…

title: Back again
review: Had another very nice stay here. Khao Lak is a beautiful location and this is an excellent beach front resort.   One slightly negative comment is that the Resort could benefit from a higher standard of maintenance than it seems to have received over the last year. Whilst the condition of the buildings  still currently acceptable it is clear that they are not in as good a condition as when we last stayed 15 months ago. The climate and proximity to the sea make a high standard of building maintenance critical. Several members of our group who have previously stayed in the Resort noted this.

title: Good hotel with magnificient beach
review: It is very good hotel with beautiful beach and big swimming pools. Great for people with children. Very nice and helpfull staff. I specally recomend the Andaman massage ceter with Mrs Wa - she is extremaly good .

title: Amazing experience!! Fantastic!!!
review: Amazing hotel!!! I was there in Feb 13 with my girlfriend!! On of the best I've ever been!!! Perfect for couples and family, very very calm!! Charming, nice staff, wonderful rooms!!! The location is excellent and you have cheap options of Food and Massage with locals just by the beach!!! Spa was perfect, pools amazing, great food, best breakfast ever!!! Just perfect!!!

title: Paradise
review: I have nt been at this resort for 24 hrs as I write this but feel compelled to express just how lucky I feel to be staying in such a wonderful resort. The ambience of this piece of paradise is amazing the beautiful resort itself the magnificent beach and staff who cannot do enough for you. I am not going to want to leave here I just know and will make the utmost of my remaining 4 days. Congratulations to JW Marriott you have indeed created a Paradise.

title: Nice resort in beautiful location
review: After a beautiful stay in the Movenpick in Karon Beach, we came here for 5 nights. I must say that after the fantastic service at the Movenpick, I found this resort a bit underwhelming. Check-in was a long process as it seemed that no one knew what they were doing and we were taken on a long convoluted walk to our room ( the lobby is somewhat disjointed). Our room was nice, with pool access, however missing a few luxuries, such as a coffee machine. The pillows are very big and soft- not my kind of thing, but I couldn't find a pillow menu. You can hear foot-traffic outside your room all hours, but the room itself was very comfortable.  We were very excited about the elephant visit, but missed it. Elephants are there Monday afternoon and Friday afternoon. Unfortunately we also…

title: 2nd Time is still a charm
review: Everything we expected. Even better this time around as they have added more chairs and re-arranged where the lounge chairs are. The spa is to die for, but if you don't want to splurge you can always head to the beach. Great place for couples, friends and families. Two minor issues: We've been there before, but were never made aware of the late check out lounge, which is fantastic. We found it by accident and had we known about it sooner it would have made our hotel exit more relaxing. We booked golf through the hotel. We were dropped off at the course to find out that they only took cash. Thankfully, the driver was still in the parking lot to flag down so we could go find cash.

title: Fantastic , fantastic , fantastic !!!
review: This hotel is not 5 star , it's more ! An amazing place to spend our family holiday . We booked a pool access room where you can swim 24 hours a day if you want . The room was large with the most comfiest bed with massive pillows , and a bath that fitted all our family ! The breakfast is what you would expect from this standard - we especially liked the smoothie bar and pancakes - I'm missing my daily banana smoothie . We didn't eat in the hotel restaurants as we chose to eat at the beach huts - we especially liked phens .  The pool is amazing and you can loose yourself in it - we loved the swim up bar at happy hour . The staff were always friendly and helpful - we called guest services a couple of times and there was someone at our door within minutes to help .  My husband had…

title: 5* Marriott Resort but not an upper level of J.W. Marriott
review: This is an amazing 5-star resort with an amazing service, but there are some details missing which would classify this hotel as an upper level J.W. Marriott.  Some pros (+) and cons (-) in our opinion are:  (+) excellent location if you want to rest and relax in a nature scenery – located a little bit out of the way but in a walking distance from the resort you have everything you need (few beach restaurants with excellent food, money exchange, small shop, massage places on the beach and excellent local spa just outside the hotel gates); (+) very kind and fast service in main Waterfront restaurant serving breakfast (food for breakfast also very tasty); (+) access to wide and sandy beach, foldout chairs and sun umbrellas for hotel guests, cold towels and cold water provided…

title: Paradise
review: Stayed 4 nights 25Feb-1Mar. It was great, absolutely no complaints at all, every was perfect. The staff were a credit to the Hotel, I know this is expected but not always the case. I would agree with most reveiwers here that pool access is a must, we had a pool access room and it was pretty awesome. Hotels restaurants were great but pricey of course, but there are a few beach restaurants immediately beside the beach, I would recommend the "Blue Mist'. Breakfast buffet was excellent, with vast choices available

title: Comfy bed, nice staff, good foods
review: The location is great with the private breach in Khao Lak. There are many activities in here such as swimming, sun bathing, spa. The staffs including maids are very nice and very helpful. Varieties of breakfast.   Recommend to stay!

title: Very Relaxing,peaceful friendly hotel.....
review: We stayed here for 10 days in February. The check in was smooth we were offered a welcome drink and cold towel. we had a room in block 1 in the middle opposite a fountain on the 1st floor. the room was very quiet.   Pros-   Very friendly staff we saw them on several occasions going out of there way to help other people and were genuine in thier approach.  The rooms are well equipped there is an extensive amenity pack including razors and toothbrush and toothpaste, sewing kit etc. there was tea and coffee facilities and a mini fridge with beer and soft drinks (payable). There were lots of english speaking TV channels including ITV asia.   The Beds and bedding were very comfortable with a good mattress and oversize pillows, there was also two day chairs one is a chaise longue the…

title: a great hotel
review: stayed here for 3 nights early this month and had a great time exploring the hotel. The hotel stuff were very helpful and friendly. Got our rooms upgraded from pool view to pool access. Good breakfast selections, pool is divine and various programmes for adult and kids (the only down side is you have to pay).Rooms and bathrooms are big and comfortable. Wish there is more tv channel selection. The most important....we are going back to this resort!

title: Feeling tired need of update
review: Having stayed at this hotel last year we was disappointed with the poor standard of room and the cleanliness. The hotel needs refurbishing and looked tired.  The staff at reception were also rude and  not helpful. Children at times were out of control and nobody stopping their behaviour.  I will not be returning to this marriott hotel

title: Very good - if you like really big resorts
review: Stayed for 10 nights. Good experience. Mostly impeccable hotel. Shiny clean throughout, helpful staff, excellent breakfast, wonderful - and a very peaceful! - beach. And the pool really is 3 kms long - the size of 2,5 football pitches. Kids might be disappointed to see that diving is forbidden.  Some of the pool access rooms (at least those starting with the number 4) face directly north so there's practically no sunlight on the terrace at any time of the day. Be sure to avoid those if you're into sunbathing on your pool access terrace (or reserve one of those if you want to be in the shade).  Small signs of wear and tear in the rooms. The wifi (it's free if you're a member of the Marriott Rewards thing) worked pretty good almost everywhere - considering the size of the resort.…

title: Zen...
review: Summary:  5* resort and spa hotel with exceptional service and amenities, 1.5h from Phuket airport, with local beach restaurants right next to the hotel, ideal for zen oriented individuals.  Pluses:  - staff (never without a smile and promptness to satisfy your every need, no matter how small or big it is; truly the absolute asset of this hotel)  - grounds and rooms (perfectly maintained, zen feeling in both)* Room tip: avoid ground floor rooms due to the absolute lack of privacy; first floor rooms and Wing 2 are the best  (unique terrase sitting areas and nice views)  - breakfast absolutely amazing! (we could not find a thing missing; they even had on the spot baked bread and sushi as part of daily offer!)   - smoothies - absolute gem!  - zen parts of the pool area  - local…

title: Very large resort in a nice spot- but full of package tours
review: This hotel has a fantastic pool and is on a lovely unspoiled beach, BUT be aware that is is HUGE and packed full of package tourists mostly from Scandanvia and Germany. As a result, it's a bit of a grim experience if package tours and package tourists aren't your thing. Also, the hotel lets itself down by being generally tired in places and dirty in others (rubbish in the bushes by the main pool for example). The local restaurants along the beach are good and cheap compared to the very expensive hotel food. If you are looking for a resort hotel with big pool, restaurants and kids club, but don't like the sound of this, try the Sheraton in krabi, which we stayed in 2 years ago and loved.

title: Beautiful hotel in Khao Lak
review: We stayed 4 nights. We booked a swim-up room so we had direct access to the 3km pool. The room was very nice and the bed was very very comfortable with big pillows!  Breakfast was more then oke with plenty of choice, but the restaurant during breakfast was way too busy and too loud! Try to sit outside if you like it more quit or have breakfast early in the morning. If you don't have breakfast included in your roompackage, they will charge you 900 bath per person!  We never had dinner in the hotel because it was very expensive. We always went to the small restaurants on the beach: much cheaper and very good food and cocktails. When you check in, they will immediately charge 8000 bath on  your credit card which they say they will return on your creditcard at check-out. We left 2…

title: Wonderful stay!
review: We have just spent a week here with our 15 month old twins and we don't think we could have found a more ideal place to stay with kids! The staff were outstanding throughout, even down to the guy cleaning the pool who would always stop to play with the kids, we couldn't have been made to feel more welcome. We had a pool access room which we would highly recommend - being able to get into the pool from the edge of your balcony with kids was brilliant and the fact that you could access the whole resort via the pool was really good fun. Breakfast was outstanding and the fact that no one minded when our nippers ran riot once they had eaten made it more relaxing for us. Most evenings we ate in the beach restaurants which served delicious food (Blue Mist was our favourite) and were…

title: Very nice
review: I stayed there from 6. - 18. February with my wife. The hotel is quite large and consiting of several buildings in a nice garden setting surroundend by a huge pool. I first wanted to be in a high floor room because I thought it would be nice to see the beach from the room (there is no direct beach view from any room) but I got a pool access room and we loved it. You can jump in the pool directly from your room terrace. The rooms are very nice and the bed is very comfortable.  The bathroom looks nice and is quite comfortable although one of our bathroom water tabs was broken from the moment we checked in, they tried to fix it but it was not really fixed in a professional manner and it kept leeking during the entire stay. The beach is also very nice and also offers a lawn for…

title: Excellent - with recommendations !
review: We had a great time here. The resort is absolutely fab - we had a pool-access room, which was wonderful - the pool was great (more like an inter-connecting system of canals) and fantastically clean ... And mostly nearly empty. The staff were without exception, excellent, and the room was just great. Breakfast is fantastic.  And now the "buts" .... the lunch/evening food isn't particularly marvellous, and it's expensive, but just walk 200m on the beach (turn right) and you'll find the Blue Mist restaurant, where the food is approx 1/4 the price, and much nicer .. We ate there every night after the first one. After the meal, try Deedee massage next door (last massage at 17:00) - 300 Baht for an excellent massage, with the sound of the waves breaking in the background.  Absolutely…

title: Must Stay!
review: This hotel is a must stay!!! It was an awesome experience. The room was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. It is also just walking distance to the Khao Lak Village where there are amazing restaurants and a spa place, very convenient after a long day. The hotel is in the perfect location.

title: Great hotel
review: We have just returned from the JW what brilliant hotel and beach. From the moment we checked in to when we left I can't praise thi hotel enough. Nothing was to much trouble if you asked for anything within reason you got it. The breakfast was very good and the couple of times we ate there in the evening was also very nice. They do have a problem with saving sun beds you had to get on the beach by 8 to get the front row of beds,by 10 most of the beds have gone. The problem is the hotel supplies the beach towels and lay on the beds and when they have had enough sun, people just get up and leave the towels on the beds so any person wanting a bed you do not know if the beds are being used or not. I think some kind of deposit for the towels and when you have finished sunbathing…

title: Our honeymoon in a little paradise
review: Cannot fault this resort one bit. From the moment we arrived, we received a honeymoon cake and an towel display. We also found lots of activities at the resort including thai cooking classes. The food was excellent we also found the near beach huts to the right of the resort a real treat. The bar staff are friendly and have a great selection of long cocktails to our room. This resort is everything anyone could ask for. We had a pool access room and I would strongly recommend it for anyone looking to book. There is a wide selection of food at breakfast which runs from 6.30-11 and there is no rush. The only problem is going in January, you come back to the worst of England.

title: Excellent hotel
review: Beautiful family resort in a quiet area, one and an half hour drive north from Pukhet. Very good breakfast buffet. Large choice of dinner options: plenty of  good local restaurants nearby so do not hesitate to book breakfast only package. On a less positive note, we were travelling with our 3 year-old and the hotel website was mentioning a kids club as of the age of 3 but they forgot to mention that from 3 to 4 a personal babysitter was needed at the price of 15$ per hour. Our all-day diving trips (booked with an external diving shop) ended up to be quite expensive due to the sitter charges...

title: Great Pool
review: Great family resort.  The pool was impressive and great for kids.  The beach was nice and clean, but the sea was completely flat with no waves what so ever.  I wouldn't go so far as to say it was perfect, the buildings and our room were showing some wear and we had a maintenance issue, which was eventually resolved, with the room.  It was very nice though and we would definitely return.

title: Amazing Property and Service
review: From check in to check out, our stay at the Marriott Khao Lak was an incredible experience.  The breakfast buffet was delicious and the staff was always so helpful.  We had massages in the spa and felt so relaxed that it just blended in with the rest of the trip.  Our kids loved the extensive pool and the children's area.  We would go back in a heartbeat!

title: perfection
review: We had been back packing around Thailand for two months and in need of a well deserved treat so we had booked and paid for this break in the uk before we left.   It was amazing, hop straight into the largest lagoon pool in south east asia from your terrace balcony!! shops not to far away to grab snacks and drinks for your room.   The asian restaurant (seated on the floor) was great, lovely family atmosphere, food and service excellent.   The room was to die for, huge! bath big enough to swim in, large sitting area, super king size bed. and for the massage... bliss. you can pick how hard your massage is which really suited us.   Great value, if you get a deal as good as ours from travel zoo.

title: Just so perfect!
review: I am in love with this resort. Great service, beautiful and elegant rooms and delicious food. WE stayed in pool access room and I thought this concept was amazing. Just step out in pool from your balcony! Rooms were very beautifully decorated and the staff was attentive. Deli served tasty sandwiches, smoothies and ice creams quickly. Olive, the Italian restaurant provides tasty food with great view. The breakfast selection was best thing. Various vegetarian options..Loved the bakery counter! Spa is expensive so did not try. Entire atmosphere in resort is pleasant and relaxing. Go ahead and book your room in JW marriott khao lak to experience the perfection!

title: Phenomenal!
review: I cannot speak highly enough about this property. My husband and I spent 3 nights here during our honeymoon to Thailand and our only regret is that we did not spend more time here. From the moment you enter the Buddha lined drive to the property, you are in awe. Immediately upon entering the lobby, we were offered a welcome drink and chilled cloths. This was so welcomed, as we had been traveling for nearly 30 hours at this point. Check-in was quick and efficient and we didn't even have to stand at the reception, as the employee assisted us as we enjoyed our drink and sat on the couch. We were then escorted to our lovely room, which was so gorgeous, clean, and we loved the Thai decor. Service was excellent; we ordered ice nightly for our cocktails and we never waited over 3…

title: Wonderful 11 out of 10
review: Wonderful Hotel, really picturesque setting. The Pool, as has already be said is amazing. The communal areas are stunning and clean.  Our Room was beautiful, with comfy bed and over sized pillows. Bathroom was a good size with lovely Toiletries, also nice to have Dressing Gowns and Slippers, and a Beach bag!!  Breakfast was delicious with lots of choices.We ate in  L'Olive Restaurant twice and both meals were lovely. All Staff we met were very friendly and helpful.   We also had the pleasure of feeding an Elephant which comes to the Hotel twice a week, it was lovely to see the Childrens faces when the Elephant took the offered bananas from their hands.  The Beach is lovely and the whole setting is gorgeous.  Seems all rooms have good views so go for what you can afford.  Only…

title: Excellent!
review: We went to JW for our honeymoon. I can not recommend this place enough. We took the pool side room and it was fantastic. The place is well planned and maintained very well.  The staff are very courteous  and helpful.  We saw a lot of families with little kids as well.

title: Resort like no other.
review: JW Marriott exceeded our expectations by far! This resort like no other has a pool which goes all around the resort 3km long like a water channel with amazing gardens, pool bars, bridges and fantastic views of the property. The beach is long and good for a nice walk or run. Service is six star, buffet breakfast with endless variety of foods and five star quality rooms decorated with the traditional theme. We will be back !!

title: Excellent hotel and good value(look for special deals )
review: We got a special deal as it was post new year high season period and we have to say JW Marriot has not let me down. I have stayed in in its bangkok property as well and the service is equally commendable... The area is nice and isolated and the beach is very nice... The pool is also very large and well kept. Over all, an excellent 5 star property

title: Beautiful Resort - The Best
review: The staff were lovely, resort was clean and LOVED the pool which was right outside the patio.  Request a pool level room. A lot of activities, bike rides to waterfalls, pilates, yoga, water exercise class, many secluded places around the pool also. Definitely eat at the beach - we love Mama's, the very last place on the left.  Went there every day for a massage ($10 - $12 AUD) for an hour massage.  Great food, and since there were 2 of us, they always gave us a discount on the massages.  Food at any restaurant on the beach was 1/4 of the price of the resort and food was good. Elephant on the beach a few days while we were there.  One of the most relaxing holidays I have had.  Only down side was that it is an hour drive from Phuket airport.  Arrange for cab before arriving and…

title: A place to visit. Especially with kids
review: Just spent two weeks with the Family in this wonderful hotel. My boys (7 and 10) just loved the possibility to go swimming directly from the room. The beach was really nice, clean and not too crowded. Both sides of the the hotel you can find nice little restaurants from which I have to mention Blue Mist restaurant. Really good place to eat!  We ate only twice at the hotel. Once in Japanese buffet and once after long day in-room dining. Japanese buffet was okay but nothing really special. In-room we tried some Indian foods that were really good.  One thing you have to mention when talking about this hotel is definitely the breakfast it is maybe the best I have ever seen in any hotel (well maybe some Beijing 5 Star hotel have something similar but anyway).  Service level was…

title: Easy to recommend
review: We enjoyed this hotel very much.  Good clean beach with plenty of nice chairs.  Nice pool with pool bar.  Be sure to walk down the beach to get your massages and eat some delicious Thai food at very reasonable prices.

title: beautiful resort with great beach
review: we stayed here over new years as part of our honeymoon trip and were impressed with the layout , design and luxury of the resort. It takes approx 1hr to reach this resort from the Phuket airport. the pool is one continuous canal throughout the resort and is very unique among luxury resorts. the beach is pristine with plenty of beachfront chairs. one point to note is that there is no adults only section in the resort, for couples traveling alone. the gym facilities are good with plenty of classes and outdoor excursions to choose from. Our check-in experience could have been smoother however the duty manager was very helpful in locating our lost luggage at the airport. Our spa experience was amazing with great service, although a bit overpriced. further down the beach you can get…

title: Happy relaxing time
review: We spent  6 days in a pool access room. The room was big enough for a roll away (though uncomfortable). Bathroom was beautiful with stone bath, separate shower. Our major disappointment was there was no direct access into or out of the pool.  The pool was fantastic but we had to walk around into the main corridor to get back from a swim. There were other rooms with steps so ask for these if getting in and out of the pool difficult. Cocktails were hit and miss. I had strawberry daquari given to me 6 different ways. All drinkable but different.  The pool was great. The beach was fantastic-warm water, swaying palm trees, lots of chairs and bountiful amounts of towels you didn't have to sign for every day. Staff happy and smiling but communication was an issue at times but nothing…

title: I would love to come back again!
review: I love the ambience of the resort. There's a beach right in front and a plaza,khaolak village, right before the entrance to the hotel. The hotel has an amazing architecture and all room are adjacent to the huge swimming pool; our room is directly connected to the pool and our children love it so much!  The staffs are very friendly and take full effort to serve us... I'm very impressed with the hotel and really had a good time here!!!

title: Khao Lak over Christmas
review: Beautiful beach setting with a canal type pool environment. Outstanding selection and service at the Breakfast Buffet. Beach and poolside service was limited to those who were willing to pro-actively flag someone down as staff never made regular rounds. Great location to tour surrounding national park, but the town of khao lak is nothing special.  Not impressed with the restaurants at night. One of the problems with eating Thai food in a hotel catering to primarily Northern Euopeans is the staff feels compelled to dumb down the spice level so as to not upset sensative stomachs. Rooms were nice as you would expect. Great hotel for kids.

title: Never a dull moment, unless that's what you are looking for.
review: While I've stayed in several luxury resorts in my life, I've can't recall being in one where not a single guest looks, well, bored. Except for here. There's just too much to do. Drop by the gym to pick up a list of scheduled activities, all reasonably priced: Tai chi and yoga on the lawn in the morning (B100 only, about US$ 3.50), boxing classes (B 200 if I remember correctly), bicycle tours of the area, volleyball matches, and more. Swim the length of the pool and it will take you 30-45 minutes. Enjoy sunbathing with the masses on the beach, on the lawn, in private areas around the pool, or on your own pool deck. The hotel movie collection is impressive. Want to meet others? Head to the pool bar for sunset happy hour, the bartenders entertaining and good at creating…

title: Wonderful beach, Comfortable resort
review: We stayed 5 nights at JW Marriott for a conference. The breakfast spread is first class however the cutlery is unbalanced. The two baby elephants wandering through the resort's garden and on the private beach is very special. The elephant swam with the guests which everyone enjoyed. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. A great family resort too.

title: SpecTHAIcular
review: Aussie family, three females (aged 40-ish, early 20's and late-teens) visited this establishment in Sept/Oct 2012.  As our first trip to Thailand, we were unsure what to expect.  Quite honestly, this resort exceeded any expectations we could have had, by light years.  The staff are extremely helpful / friendly & happy hour is divine! We purchased our package through 'Scoopon' and upgraded to a 'Pool Access Room'.  Several changes to our holiday dates were a non-issue.  Highlights included: brilliant brekky, ENORMOUS pool, restaurants on-site (both Thai & otherwise), beach restaurants nearby, on-site Thai cooking & boxing classes, swim up bars, the staff (esp. 'Ball' & 'Ann'), nearby Bang Niang markets, day-trip accessibility, Aussie atmosphere during the AFL&NRL grand finals...…

title: Nice atmosphere
review: When you see the hotel you will have a feeling of relaxation. The location is very good. You can have sea view room type. And just next to the hotel you will have khao lak village which is a combination of food and spa. You can enjoy eating there also. They have Thai food, Italian food and spa.also they have 7 days supermarket. Try khoa lak and you will like it.

title: Ahhhhh..mazing
review: Everything was perfect...lovely rooms with instant pool access, beautiful beach, good food and excellent service. Stayed here for 7 nights and just relaxed. Quan Spa was a treat as well set in beautiful surroundings within the hotel. One of the best hotels.   There is a small strip of shops just outside the main gate with a tailor, spa, couple of restaurants and grocery store. Taxis also available.  Will definitely go back.

title: Biggest swimming pool in town
review: I went with my family.We had a great time;the staff n service were excellent,room were spacious n very clean.They have biggest swiming pool in town it was just amazing for the children.The location is on the beach.The ocean was very clean on the white sandy beach.

title: Thai Luxury....Spectacular.....the best!
review: I am a returning traveller(4 times) to Khao Lak, having first visited in 2005, and previously stayed at Le Meridien Khao Lak (this trip also for 6 days: I returned to give it another look) My first impression of the hotel was exactly what I come to Thailand for: Thai dress, service and a great welcome. A lovely surprise, as I know the East is changing, progressing and westernising at an alarming rate, and increasingly, the World is becoming the same wherever I travel. Vietnam and Cambodia really surprised me with the change in 4 years. This hotel is an absolute delight! Each member of staff has a permanent and genuine smile and greeting. The rooms are lovely, with a great terrace, and every comfort. And that Thai feel! The hotel and gardens are exceptionally well maintained, in…

title: Loved The Marriott
review: We recently stayed at the Marriott for 9 days before moving on the La Flora where we had stayed the previous year. I thought the Marriott was lovely, we had a nice big room, we didn't have pool access because we like being on the top floor and enjoy the beach and sea more than pools. Having said that the pool was brilliant and I am sure it would be lovely having the access from your room. On the beach we were given glasses of cold water or juice regularly which I thought was a lovely touch, all free. The breakfasts at the Marriott are amazing, so much choice and the staff are so friendly. There were restaurants along the beach that we used regularly and enjoyed them all. Mamas Greetings was a nice little place for lunch further along the beach. We really enjoyed our stay at the…

title: Amazing Resort
review: They have a huge swimming pool and room access directly to the pool.Our kids loved it.Very nice room and the staff took great care of us.The beach and the sea water was very clean.It was magnificient to sit and watch sunset every evening.The resort was just AMAZING!!

title: Best resort we have ever stayed in
review: We are checkingnout tomorrow (jan 14 2013) we have been here for 6 nights. We travel frequently and have been to a fair amount of Thailand. This resort is so fabulous. We have a pool access room which was just fabulous. We can walk out of our room, jump in the pool, swim to the beach jump out swim in an incredible beach, then walk out to these amazing restaurants that are right on the beach next to the hotel, have lunch in your togs (swimmers) with your feet on the sand and then walk back to jump in the pool and swim back to your room!!! It's incredible!!! I have never had that sort of experience before.  The staff are so lovely, they are very helpful, very friendly.  We booked a day out at similan reef, which I would highly recommend, but the hotel were a very expensive option…

title: Was great…..now even better!
review: Was great…..now even better!  We first went to the JW Khao Lak last April and had a great experience. There were some things, especially in food & beverage that needed improving. Overall though, my impression then was that this was a terrific, family-oriented resort, near the top end (Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton) level at a far more reasonable price.    We recently returned to the JW Khao Lak this past Christmas. What a joy! I know it wasn’t my feedback from last time that did it; but it sure seemed like they improved almost every point I had mentioned. Visually the buildings within the resort were even better than last time. They took the time to spot paint and install some molding which covers up water stains you always associate with resorts in the tropics. I know it’s a…

title: one of the best resorts in khaolak
review: I am staying there for 13 nights since the last day of 2013. I still could not swim in every surface of huge swiming pool. It is 3 km long and you may lose your way back to your room.  Nice rooms, friendly staffs and my favorite pool. We can hardly ask for more.

title: Fantastic hotel and friendly staff members
review: We spent 5 days in that hotel, in a room with pool access - we paid about USD30 more per day it's really worth the money. Beautiful design and very friendly staff members, Ann, the breakfast restaurant manager and the rest of the team were very helpful and polite. Spa was great, we enjoyed 2 hours there and did not want to come out~  Food in all restaurants were tasty with reasonable price, we tried the cafe, Thai and Mediterranean restaurants, we even ordered twice the Tom Yum soup in cafe, you shouldn't miss it~  Only concern we had was the room condition. It seemed like maintenance job was not that efficient - broken AC, mildewed wall and artpiece in bathroom. TV signal reception was poor in some of the channels too.  Overall that JW is a ideal place for vacation and relax…

title: Just Perfect
review: I spent 7 nights at the JW Marriott Khao Lak in November with my daughter (who had decided she would prefer a trip to Thailand than to the Gold Coast for Schoolies). We had the most amazing time. The resort is devine, the staff are so friendly and helpful, the rooms gorgeous, and the surroundings are beautiful. We travelled as part of an internet deal and it was worth every cent. Breakfast was included and everything imaginable was served....try the freshly squeezed juices! Also included was a massage in the hotel spa which was nothing short of devine!! We didn't eat at the resort for our evening meals and instead walked up the beach to the little resturants. Our favourite was the Blue Mist Cafe. Delicious and cheap...approx $20 for 2 including drinks! I even got our laundry…

title: A Magnificent Resort
review: We stayed at the Marriott for six days during Christmas week. What a magnificent resort! The service was outstanding, the breakfast buffet substantial and the beach pristine and perfect for swimming. We have stayed at some great resorts worldwide however this resort stands out as one of the most beautiful places that we have seen. Despite the fact that the hotel was fully booked, never once did we feel that it was crowded. It is located in on an amazing beach with plenty of room to stretch out and soak up the sun and surf. We will definitely return in the near future.

title: A very Happy New Year in Khao Lak
review: This was our second stay at the JW Marriott Khao Lak, and we love it.  We pretty much always stay in 5 star hotels and had just arrived after a few nights at the Fullerton Bay in Singapore....the JW Marriott is not quite at that same level but it is still one of our favourites overall.  We used the hotel transfer from Phuket airport which, at THB2500, is not the cheapest you can get but you get to ride in comfort, with a welcoming cold towel and cold bottled water. We requested a Pool Access room in Block 1 as per our first stay, and the hotel arranged this for us (many thanks go to Jan-Hein Breitschaft who is the GM of Rooms).  The pool really is amazing and for us, Block 1 is by far the best.    We really like this hotel and, for those Marriott Rewards members out there, they…

title: A true five-star hotel
review: Even though this is a big hotel, Marriott manages to melt nicely into the environment and you don't get the feeling of a huge complex. The rooms are fantastic, we were four people who stayed in one of the suites. The service is also five-star, the breakfast as well. One remark though is that the breakfast dining room could be divided into smaller areas or make more seats available outside. The dining room was very noisy and it was not so nice to sit to eat there. The hotel has three main restaurants, one italian, one thai and one teppanyaki. I think it is a waste to eat european food when in Asia so we only tried the italian once. Sakura, the teppanyaki restaurant, became a favourite! Fantastic food and you get entertained by the skilled chefs at the same time. As for Thai food,…

title: Amazing hotel, top class
review: This hotel is just amazing, we spent 11 nights here and didn't want to leave. We found the rooms spacious and clean, the pool goes on for ever and enjoyed long walks along the beach.  The resort is so big, we easily found quiet places to relax in the sun but still access the pool. We didn't each much in the resort, but the breakfast was tasty with lots of choice.  The only gripe was the cost of the shuttle bus, the hotel is outside the local town but they charge a premium to use the shuttle bus in and out. They shouldn't make money off the fact they are not as well located as other hotels.  Overall, we would highly recommend this resort. Loved it!

title: Okey hotel, old and worn down rooms.
review: Went there for one of the three weeks of our honeymoon, the first impression of the hotel was that the reseption area smelled bad, dont know what it was bud it was not nice.  Then the reseptionist said he would get us a really nice room cuz it was our honeymoon, but the room we got was in fact so old, smelly, dirty and worn down that we had to change rooms the next day. The price is waaaaaaay to high for the standard on the rooms. The rest of the hotell is quite nice, though it seems to be old.. The staff is very nice and friendly! Liked the Olive resturant though some of the food there was horrible. Do NOT order the seafood plate-it's expensive and I couldnt even eat it, it was so bad. I would highly recomend the massage place at the end of the beach there, dont remember the…

title: Amazing !
review: Stayed there for 5 nights for my parents 65th birthdays and 45th wedding anniversarys. We had stayed at the JW Marriott in Bangkok for 3 nights and travelled to Phi Phi Holiday inn and the Marriott in Phuket. This hotel however blew them all away. We had a 2 bedroom suite and an ajoining room and only was meant to stay for 3 nights but immediately changed to 5. The hotel is immaculate and spotless - the staff are the friendliest we found in any of our stays in Thailand. We already want to go back - its pretty much perfect. Breakfasts were amazing, rooms were clean and the cocktail bar was wonderful especially if your platinum. Sunsets are divine, what I liked about this hotel in comparison to both Phuket and Phi phi is that you have options. We ate in the Japa enese restaurant…

title: Surreal Idyll
review: This resort is truly secluded, about an hour's drive from Phuket and a 10 minute drive from the nearest village.  The position is spectacular, and our room, with pool access, was pleasantly spacious, tasteful, and well equipped.  The Andaman Sea is intimidating -- not very suitable for swimming, at least not when we were there, but that's not a problem as the pool is so massive.  Swimming in the pool at night was dreamy.  The restaurants were a bit hit and miss though we enjoyed the breakfast buffet a LOT, and there was something appealing about the slightly sad deli area.  We ate on the beach, including at a restaurant called, I think, the Andaman, and that food was really good, especially the whole fish. There's a very odd "library" stocked with a strange assortment of books…

title: Christmas in Paradise
review: We just got back from an 8 night stay at JW Marriott Khao Lak. If you are looking for a serene and beautiful Thai beach experience -- this is your place. The resort has a smart layout and never seemed overly crowded even though it was fully booked for the Christmas holiday.   Room: Get the pool access room on the ground floor. It was a unique experience to enter the pool directly from our room. We were situated in the 200 block which was quite private and gave us the feeling we had our own private pool. This in itself is worth a stay at this hotel. The room was a bit worn but easy to overlook as we were always in the pool or beach..  Pool: Amazing 3K lazy river that ran throughout the whole resort and led to several other pools including an infinity pool, a kid's pool with…

title: Truly a Paradise
review: My wife and I just returned from a trip to the JW Marriott Khao Lak, and it was fantastic - so good, in fact, that we extended our trip by two days just to enjoy the place more. Great location, beautiful beach, excellent service, this is one of the best hotel/resorts we've been to.  Highlights: Location can't be beat (although it's 1.5 hours away from Phuket airport by shuttle); the beach is unbelievable; the staff is always friendly; the rooms are clean, well-maintained, and the air con makes sure it's nice and cool; the restaurants are good and consistent; there are a ton of things to do; once again, the beach is beautiful; the facilities are top notch; the pool is excellent and so well designed.  Drawbacks: As others have mentioned, this is a great place for families - if you…

title: Lots of fun! Great for families
review: Great fun!  Good: - amazing never ending pool - beautiful property - beach is quite good, sand is nice, lots of wave (great for bogey boarding) - watch out for jellyfish though - my wife got stung twice in two days (I was fine though and had lots of fun :)) - every facility imaginable - kayaks, bogey boards, table tennis, fooseball, pool table, bikes - love the snack store near the kids area  Downside: - FOOD - while it wasn't horrible, it was certainly not the greatest - I would categorize it as good cafeteria food, but bad 5-star hotel food. Many things just tasted a bit off - room started to show some wear  All in all, great experience and I'd return in a heartbeat had it not been the food ...

title: No trouble in Paradise
review: Outstanding hotel in the north of the island. Staff was extremely friendly. Don't come here if you are trying to avoid kids as lots of families with small children. Spa is amazing. Staff give traditional Thai massage.  Deep tissue but with care and kindness. Not cheap but not too pricey. Fantastic beach kept in pristine condition.

title: great beach, great room
review: we chose this hotel because we are really fond of walking the beach every day and we were delighted with the large, unspoiled beach at Khao Lak. our room was everything you could want with direct pool access and great facilities.  Staff, especially at breakfast were very helpful and friendly and the at your service button on the room phone always worked to schedule. where we were disappointed was the lack of atmosphere in the hotels, especially in the restaurants in the evening. despite 293 rooms, only a handful stayed in the hotel in the evening, as the vast majority headed for the restaurants in Khao Lak. these were very much cheaper and of good quality. especially expensive in the hotel was any form of drink, with the cheapest bottle of wine around £ 35.  A really good hotel,…

title: Almost perfect
review: We have just spent 5 nights at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak. Firstly the staff here are wonderful. They are friendly, helpful and extremely warm people. From the moment we arrived nothing was too much trouble. We had a room on the ground floor so you could access the room from our balcony. This was fantastic for us because when our 2 year old slept during the day we could sit on the balcony with the door open and still watch the older kids in the pool. The rooms were spacious, the bed and pillows were very comfortable, good size towels and a huge bath.  The buffet breakfast was fantastic, we loved the juice bar and the chicken noodle soups. Kids couldn't wait for breakfast. Happy hour at the Infinity pool with music and snacks were great. The kids loved the mocktails! Only…

title: Amazing & Divine......
review: We were on our honeymoon and JWM was recommended by our agent and we really happy about the choice. Had the fastest check in ever, we were upgraded to a pool access room on arrival and a chilled bottle of champagne was waiting for us. I mean it so wonderfull to be treated and pampered so well.  One might have problem with the mobile phones, as the network coverage is less and also the resort is far from the city. But if you want moments wout any noise and lot of people, then you cant ask for any better location.  We enjoyed every single moment we spended in the resort, right from the breakfast, beach, poll access, lovely evening walks, Deli coffee shop it was an un-forgettable experience. I am short of words, I would suggest that just go there and experience the beauty and the…

title: A great property. Excellent for families
review: About 70 minutes north of Phuket International Airport and a comfortable 15 minute drive from Khao Lak Town, the JW Marriott Khao Lak is a massive resort with a roughly 3Km long lagoon snaking around the property. There is a lovely pool facing the beach with a happening swim up bar. They have happy hour and live music daily in the early evenings. Rooms are very comfortable with a local slant to the furnishings. Each room also has a balcony and all ground floor rooms have direct access to the lagoon (enabling you to swim around the property right from your balcony. A lot of families when we were there and they are also supposed to have great kid's and teen's clubs. Breakfast is great with a huge selection of western and eastern items and it is recommended that the room be booked…

title: Wow......they think of everything at this hotel
review: Often hotels in this part of the world look great in pictures but one is left disappointed by the reality once you are there. Firstly, the staff are amazing! Everyone has a smile and greets the guests and happy to oblige and best of all the majority understood English. Our pool-access room was clean, the bed comfy, bathroom well-stocked with good quality toiletries. Everything was well-maintained and in excellent condition. The 3km long pool was a great way of exploring the complex and getting some exercise, especially after the awesome breakfasts.   The spa was a haven of tranquility and relaxation and staff well-trained. Beach towels are in abundance around the pool and beach areas and there is no restriction on the number you may use per day - the only place where  we have…

title: Just Relax
review: Stayed here for 4 nights. One of the quickest Check-ins I've experienced, very efficient reception staff. Room was clean, with plenty of space, the balcony was off a good size and the balcony bench is a great idea- perfect place for a cup of coffee on a sunny morning. Bathroom was great, again plenty of space, clean and well lit. The linens were clean, no odours and no stains. The swim up pool bars (there are 2 of them) were super. If the main pool is busy you can walk over to the other one, this one was quieter during our stay, with much quicker service. The lazy pool around the hotel is fantastic.  Breakfast had a good spread with a mix of local Thai and international food. Restaurants are good, but expensive, for the local Thai stuff you can step outside the resort or visit…

title: Incredibly peaceful and relaxing
review: This hotel was absolutely beautiful, and we found the staff to be extremely helpful and polite. The quality of the room was outstanding. One thing to keep in mind is that this is a beach resort rather than a standard hotel, so 5 stars doesn't necessarily translate into what some of the reviewers seem to have had in mind before staying. In my opinion, JW Khao Lak epitomizes what you can expect from a 5 star beach resort: good service, well maintained grounds and pools, and a beautiful beach with chairs and towel service.   Breakfast was included in our package, and we found the quality to be good and the selection excellent. The options included traditional Western items like eggs, bacon, etc... Eastern options like congee and soup, and an excellent fruit and fruit juice bar.…

title: Faultless - Really reccomended
review: One of the best hotel / resort stays that I have had. Fabulous location faultless hotel, staff,and services. Well done to the manager and all of the staff, we had an excellent stay and really enjoyed our week.

title: Pretty much perfect
review: Our 5 night stay was the ultimate in relaxation, just what we needed! The property is beautiful, we loved the private lounge areas by the pool, was great not have to lie directly next to other people.  The room was very nice, great bathroom, big balcony, comfy bed, only negatives -shower pressure wasn't that great, and my husband thought the pillows were too soft. Breakfast was great, excellent selection, and good quality. We dined at the restaurants outside the property mostly, we did have the seafood buffet once at the hotel, I thought it was good but expensive. The fitness room was great, everything was really top notch, we loved our stay, we just wanted to totally relax and that's what we did, we only left the property for meals to the nearby restaurant!

title: Lovely pool but rooms a bit run down
review: Pros:- never ending pool! Happy hour drinks at the pool bar and the bar near the reception  easy drive to near by restaurants in Khao Lak town where you get much better food for a quarter of the price. Lovely soft pillows big rooms  Cons:- Restaurants in the restaurant are pretty average but very expensive for the quality Damp smell in the room - we were there end nov 2012, possibly due to the rainy season Damp floor upon stepping into our room Charged for 2 x extra person as we travelled with our 2 boys, both below 12. (this was not conveyed upon checking in, but management waived the charges after we raised it with them) Balcony bench cushions could not be used as they were dirty and mouldy

title: Brilliant holiday
review: We had a week stay and we loved this. It is the sort of place you go to if you don't want to do anything but relax. We had a pool access room which consist of a pool canal that runs past all the ground floor rooms in th hotel and allows you to swim/walk to one of the 3 main pool areas. It was also great for a late night swim to cool off though the water temp is like bath water, which I loved. The only complaint about this is there were no steps to help you get out in our section, which meant you had to climb out of a 1.2M pool which was less than graceful. The breakfast was great and the prepare on order smoothee bar was fantastic. Atfer week though, a bit of variety in the breakfast food would have been better as it was the same thing every day.   Another nice touch to the…

title: Underated 5* Magnificent hotel
review: Firstly we bought this hotel on a deal voucher and I have to say it was the best money I have ever spent.I would pay full price after knowing what you got for your dollar .Firstly transfers went smoothly on the 1.45 hr trip to hotel from the airport.On arrival fantastic service and speedy check in,then when taken to our room,it was just Wow wow wow from then until the end of the holiday.The staff were fantastic ,the room was so inviting comfortable beds down to even mood lighting, the pool was just unbelievable the beach was magnificent and service impeccable and food was great ,cant really say too much more about it but if you dont experience this hotel if your heading to Thailand your loss. Thanks again Mr JW Marriott Jr for the opportunity to stay in such a wonderful hotel…

title: Best pillows ever
review: The hotel complex is large and very beautiful in its architecture. Everything is so nicely designed.  The hotel room is large and the bed and its huge soft pillows are great. Better than home. Bathroom has both a large shower room and and big bath tube and two basins. Glass walls everywehere - so no privacy. The cleaning of the room is perfect. Twice a day you get a chance to get new towels.  The breakfast has everything you may wish. If you don't have breakfast included in your room rate you have to pay about 30 USD per person. The prices at the different reastaurants are very expensive compared to local restaurants. About 500 percent more expensive. The taste is not better - maybe the display of the food.   We had quite early dinners. At that time  there are more servants than…

title: good - but not a lot to do
review: If you like a holiday with very little to do, then this is the place for you. The rooms are large and comfortable, the staff are fantastic, and the facilities are all great. The restaurants are disappointing and overpriced,  but there are some great choices outside the resort.  We had a pool access room and found it really great. They may try to upgrade you to a garden pool access room, but many of these have no shade on their balconies. I would prefer the shade, so therefore a standard pool access room was better.  The beds are a little on the hardside, and if you want a spa treatment, I would recommend booking early as it fills up fast. (it is very good though!)  My only gripe is the cost of renting their bicycles. It costs nearly  as much as the shuttle service into town. I…

title: Nice Hotel but not perfect.
review: My husband and I stayed 6 nights in this hotel. I had asked them before to upgrade our room to Pool access but after arriving, I regretted and asked them to change our room to upstairs. (We didn't have privacy in pool access room because all the guest were swimming and passing in front of you - Maybe some others like this but we didn't like and in reception they changed it for me without any hesitation and thanks them again. (Of course the pool in front of our room was shallow and people were walking in it)  The room was Ok with nice and comfortable design and smelt very well (very good smell of Lemon Grass Oil was always in the room and it was really relaxing for us)  The balcony although had very nice design but in fact it was useless! The bed in front of the balcony was…

title: Perfect for holiday
review: My wife and I stayed in JW Marriott for 7 nights .  Our pool access room was great, big enough, and very quiet. The 3km length pool is amazing. Staff very helpful and attentive at all times.  Breakfast  was definitely worth getting out of bed for and buffet had plenty of choice. Khao lak is a place for relaxing , swimming and explore the nature . If you want to have night life then go another place. Overall, I would recommend this hotels for families

title: Serene stay
review: This was our second stay, first time was really during "soft opening" so not all areas or rooms were renovated. It was lovely to return and see the resort busy . Beach is great for walking on , also more small local cafes on beach now. Staff attentive , courteous and helpful. pools and "canals" are fabulous.  Breakfast buffet superb, too much choice!! We went to an evening themed buffet.... Curries and kebabs, very authentic, delicious Indian food.  Overall one of my favourite Thai hotels.

title: A Trip to Remember
review: This trip was for our 25th anniversary.We arrived in the middle of the night so we didn't get to see the property until the next morning.The property is beautiful ,however it is in need of some repairs, especially the roof. The beach is breath taking. You can walk for miles and hardly pass  another couple. The service is top notch.The staff are wonderful, have good communication skills and most spoke pretty good English. We always ate breakfast in the resort because it was included but we had most of our other meals on the beach next to the hotel. The Blue Mist became our favorite place to eat on the beach. We also had a massage there, used their laundry service and booked a Snorkeling tour. A One stop shop!! To book a tour just stop by the restaurant or you can call Nu at…

title: A good hotel, but not suitable for families or people with disabilities.
review: We just arrived after staying at Le Meriden (just 10 minutes away) for 6 days. The hotel is quite fresh, with clean and modern rooms. The facilities seem to be up to the standard you would expect of a five star hotel. Personally I like the fact that they have a squash court and that they have free wireless internet in all rooms. The staff at the front desk didn’t speak adequate English, something that shouldn’t be the case at a five star hotel.  So the hotel is fairly good, but one thing really pissed me of and made me deeply regret the booking. This is a five star hotel with no elevators. That’s fine in its self, but when you book with a newborn, that needs a trolley (or it could have been a disables person), they place you on the second floor (or third, who knows) The only way…

title: Quiet weekend getaway
review: Having no expectation at all (given that I was meant to book a resort that offers Private Villas instead of rooms) I was pleasantly surprised by the facilities and the overall atmosphere of this lovely resort.  Stayed there for 3 nights and I can see myself going back there again with my family in the future.   In short, from the moment we were picked up by the chauffeur from Phuket Airport, to the service-level of their staff, to the surroundings of the resort, I'd say this place is definitely value for money.  FYI - you will notice that they charge 30THB per day in your bill for donation (SOS Children's Village).    On the contrary, I was little disappointed by the choice of food offered during lunch hour as their Thai and Japanese restaurant are both open for dinner only.   …

title: Way overpriced
review: This hotel is way overpriced for what it offers.  We stayed one night and had dinner and a few drinks in a standard pool access room--total came to $375 USD!    The place has the look and feel of club med but don't be fooled.  Breakfast is just plain weird despite the extensive spread and the Thai restaurant is horrible.  Worst food of our trip including lunch on our day trip dive boat, etc.    The pool access is a joke also.  You have access to a pool corridor 1.5m deep which doesn't even lead to the main pool.  Perhaps good for lap swimming, not sure.  Honestly, I wanted to really enjoy my stay here but could not.  We also stayed at the Ramada in Khao Lak and that was much better.

title: A perfect resort where nothing is a problem
review: My husband and I stayed at the JW Marriott Khao Lak for 5 nights and we loved every minute. From the moment we were met by our transfer at Phuket airport to checkout we felt we were always in very capable, reliable hands. Our room was very spacious and clean and comfortable, as were all the facilities at the hotel. The staff we encountered were always friendly and efficient. We were particularly impressed by a supervisor whose name was Ms Nook - she was exceptionally helpful. There isn't much to do around Khao Lak but we didn't mind so much as the resort pretty much catered to our every need for a relaxing holiday. The hotel did offer a shuttle to the nearby market and local shops, which was handy. We tried a few of the restaurants in the resort and they were all very good, but…

title: Pure Relaxation
review: We stayed six nights in a pool view room and loved every moment of it. Set on a beautiful beach front, away from the busy crowds.  JW Marriot is 10kms from the town center, but the distance is worth the quietness and privacy. Although we did some tours, it would have been quite easy to spend each day lounging on the beach or swimming in the amazing pool - 3 kilometers of it!   The expansive choices for breakfast was the start to our day. On the beachfront are a number of restaurants where we had luch and dinner with amazing prices for food and alcohol.  Amazing massages can be had along the beachfront, and these were one of the highlights of my trip. We also arranged a tour at Koh Soc National Park with Geko Man who can be found at the restaurant on the left side of the beach. …

title: Fantastic location, luxury hotel
review: Bought a scoopon for this hotel and was blown away by what we got for the money. We did upgrade for $30 a night and the upgrade made our holiday. We had the pool side room and it was amazing. The rooms were very luxurious and spacious. The service was faultless The location was breathtaking, straight on the most amazing beach. We hired a scooter otherwise it would have been abit isolated too far to walk anywhere. The breakfast was part of the package and it was the best buffet breakfast that I have ever had, had different stations for different nationalities of food and even had a fresh smoothie station. My only gripe had to the prices charged the meals and drinks were double the cost of other places, which was disappointing and ever tab we had was asking for a tip!! Overall…

title: Excellent Service
review: Stayed now for the second time and can confirm that this is the best resort in Khao Lak. The only disadvantage are the high prices for alcohol , especially wine. Very professional and also friendly service staff. Will surely come back. For divers: See Bees dive center located in the resort offering daily trips to the Similan Islands, also well organized. For dinner: You can enjoy good and cheap Thai food directly on the beach, several small restaurants very close to the hotel.

title: Relaxation and lovely sunsets
review: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in early November 2012. We enjoyed the whole resort, and covered every angle of the hotel area itself, with the pool that goes all around the resort, with greenery all around, one can walk or swim in the water from one bar by the pool to the next. (Makes you feel less guilty of eating or drinking unless you 'worked' for it).... The Filipino band in the Olive Restaurant was very good. Service of all staff there were outstanding. We made use of the club's facilities, like their gym, dance exercise routine by their instructor (thought it was more like kick-boxing), squash, a competition  with their staff as opponent, hired a bicycle at the hotel, with one of their sports staff accompanying us as we rode through the village of Khao Lak, heading…

title: Recent 10 night stay JW Marriott Khao Lak
review: My wife and I stayed 10 nights in November 2012. Let me say at the outset, anyone who finds complaint with this resort is truly either kidding themselves OR is someone who simply complains for the sake of it. The resort is simply stunning in every respect.  Regardless of where you might be standing within the grounds, you will be faced with a scene from paradise. The pool defies belief and the staff could not be friendlier or more helpful.  As you would likely have read previously, the buffet breakfast is as good as it gets. Everybody is catered for, regardless of their culinary needs. The restaurants on site are exceptional but (and this will be my only but) you must visit the restaurants out on the beach. We ate a number of times at Phens Thai and Seafood Restaurant, the first…

title: A beautiful and relaxing resort.
review: The JW Marriott Khao Lak is a beautiful resort located on the beach with white sand and clear waters.  The pool through the resort is great, even if it does take a while to do a lap.  With every room overlooking the pool (ground floor rooms have direct access and some you can step off the balcony into the water), it makes it a very relaxing experience.  The staff were all friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was delicious and the service was fantastic.  Overall, a fantastic holiday.

title: Fantastic Hotel but Too Far from Civilisation
review: Just returned from a weeks break at the Marriott Hotel at KhaoLak in North West Phuket. What an outstanding resort ! the buildings and water channel layout is stunning. We found the staff to be probably the most helpful and interesting of any hotel we have ever stayed in, definately Ten out of Ten ! The hotel room was a little musty but in this part of the world this is often the case so this can be excused. The geograghical position of the hotel did leave a lot to be desired. It became neccesary for my wife and I to catch taxi's on a frequent basis to venture into the local town area's of interest. The hotel does provide a shuttle bus but at a fee twice that of the taxi's. It would be a better situation for this to be free, it would improve the hotels image immensely. My…

title: Magical Honeymoon Destination
review: We were super impressed with the JW Marriott at Khao Lak Resort & Spa.  We were able to make travel arrangements with the hotel to pick us up from the airport before our trip which made the experience getting through the hectic airport more relaxed.  It's a bit of a distance (about an hour) from the airport but once you are there it is paradise. The 3km length pool and swim up bar where to die for.  In mid November we didn't need to compete for a seat at the restaurants, swim up bar or reclining beach chairs.   The breakfast buffet was amazing and Samosak was a lovely kind host.  They are very happy to receive feedback to keep their service the best! We went here for our honeymoon but I can see us asking friends with children to join us next time as it has a great little kids…

title: Beachfront Wonder
review: Exceedingly good hotel,with every amenity.Staff greet all guests on arrival and from then on its like being part of a big family.The breakfast buffett really wonderful with a great selection to suit all nationalities.Swimming pool always clean and well kept as were the surrounding gardens.Plenty activities for the children.The restaurants had great menu,s and value for money. All in all be very hard to beat.

title: AMAZING. Couldn't imagine anything better for the value.
review: The staff are incredibly friendly, efficient, helpful and defiantly go the extra mile. The location of the resort is beautiful and peaceful on the beachfront. The pools are amazing including two pool bars which was personally our favourite and a 3km pool that goes around the resort. The architecture is truly incredible with a big variety of facilities, services and activities available. Not to mention the fantastic breakfast buffet which we enjoyed daily with a huge variety of food available. The report is always in spectacular condition and room service is great. Overall we have utterly enjoyed our experience at JW Marriott Resort and Spa, it never be forgotten along with the bright smiley faces of the staff. Definitely recommended!!

title: A great resort
review: It is hard to find fault with this "JW".   Staff were wonderful and friendly as one has come to expect of many top places in Thailand.  The breakfast buffet choices would please even the most discerning diner & the fresh fruit smoothies provided a most refreshing 'pick me up'. My only criticism would be the frankfurter type sausages and the overdone crispy bacon.   We had the Indian buffet dinner on one evening and I cannot recommend this highly enough. Everything was so delicious it was difficult not to try a little bit of every dish,but given the myriad of different dishes the result is that one ends up being uncomfortably full!  The pool table and the 'air-soccer' tables are somewhat 'tired' & need to be mended or replaced.  It is just a personal thing, but I hated the square…

title: Beautiful Resort
review: I stayed here for 4 nights with 2 adults and 2 children. This resort is fantastic. The grounds are well kept and beautiful. The pool is amazing. An easy walk to the lovely secluded beach and the beach restaurants and massage huts. The buffet breakfast was really good, so many choices and the staff were very friendly. The only fault was with my room, it had a musty odour and the furnishings were a bit worn, but the king size bed was extremely comfortable. I would recommend this resort to anyone that wants some peace and quiet and a relaxing holiday. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Thumbs up Khao Lak
review: We had a really nice stay here. From the moment of pick up at the airport, everything was organised, staff were friendly, and every effort to make sure our needs were met.  We wanted a quiet and relaxing holiday doing nothing - and this was the perfect place for it.  We had a family suite with pool access. The room was impressive - big, spacious and always immaculately clean. We had no issues with housekeeping, it was always done in a timely manner and up to an impeccable standard inside. We noticed that our side of accommodation (starting with 1) was quieter, and more private. Pool was divine and we mosied and swam everyday, snaking around the 3km   Food wise: Breakfast did feel a bit school hallish - but to be honest, beyond that we didn't really notice how busy the resort was…

title: a great place for relaxation
review: A great resort from the hectic city life! 3km long pool, infinity pool bar, connected beach, well equipped gym, squash & tennis court and many more recreational activities offered by the hotel. Staffs were friendly and room is relatively clean and comfy with inevitable wear and tear.  Con is its an hour odd ride from Phuket International thus airport transfer is quite costly but the peacefulness makes up for it.  A well spent 4 days 3 nights getaway for both hub and I.

title: Paradise in khao lak
review: The hotel is fabulous. Staff very friendly. The pool is extraordinary. It's lovely to be able to swim without feeling crowded. The location is a bit out of the way which is delightful if you want to stop and relax with some very good local restaurants just up the beach. They do have a shuttle bus that runs into town if there are a minimum of 4 people and at a cost. My only criticism is that because of its remote location the shuttle should be a free service and run regardless of minimum numbers. An amazing resort to relax or with a young family. Teenagers would probably prefer somewhere with more nightlife.

title: Nice Surprise
review: Not being a fan of the 'big brand' resorts after disappointments in Phuket at Hilton, Westin and JW Marriot, this was a stay approached with some trepidation.  But from the start the property has the air of sound management and high maintenance. As with any not-brand-new resort, a fastidious reviewer could find chipped woodwork and cracks in marble floors but here it's a surprise rather than an annoyance when it's noticed.  The grounds and general upkeep is of a high standard. They're very proud of their lagoon-style pool in which one can apparently manage an unbroken 3km swim in.   Beach is expansive as the breakfast buffet.  If you don't want to stump up for hotel restaurant prices there are local places right on the beach and right outside the main entrance.  There are great…

title: Khao Lak dreaming
review: Firstly let me say to find fault here is really a first world problem! The pluses. The pools just keep going. If you like swimming laps how about 200 m stretches and you have a choice! The gym and associated activities almost professionally stand alone. You couldn't want for anymore. The breakfast is great and the view uplifting, you feel almost on the beach but you are in air conditioned comfort. The service all round exemplary from every position and staff member. Our room was beautifully presented, Thai style and yes we had direct pool access. Absolutely worth it. Restaurants were top rate. The grounds and gardens beautifully kept. Departure lounge great for waiting in when you have a late night flight. WIFI in room good. The Spa brilliant and a class above everything else.…

title: Great place to be if you are looking for a tranquil holiday!
review: Great service and nice pool. Very relaxing ambience with good rrestaurants. The beach is clean but seawater is murky. Definitely not for snorkeling activities and waters ports. However Similan is about an hour away by boat for diving and snorkeling enthusiasts. Overall a good resort.

title: What a fantastic location and amazing resort
review: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights from the 5th of November and wish it was longer.  Resort has the most amazing pools, connected by river type channels so you could swim the 3km if you wish. The resort is large but very private also. During the day we felt the resort was quiet, the breakfast was the busy time, when we noticed the other guests, but not too busy. Plenty of selection on the buffet, everything you could want for breakfast. Smoothies (made fresh), egg station, bakery items, cereals, cheeses, meats, salads, yum-cha selections, asian noodles, rice dishes, sushi, fresh fruits, tea and coffee served fresh to your table. Beautiful! We ate dinner the first night room service as it was quite late, about 1030pm. Food came quickly and very fresh, green chicken curry and…

title: Not 100% Sure - Lovely hotel, but it's missing something
