review: Staff brilliant, room lovely, bed lovely, beach lovely, service faultless, but it was just missing some ambience...maybe it was because we were there out of the main season (literally the main season was starting the weekend we were leaving), but there was just something lacking - things I'd like to comment on are the pool rooms... we had a pool view room on the second floor with an outside seating area (which would probably be lovely if the seats were cleaned and not damp)..obviously they had rain then lovely sunshine but the seats were stained with what I assume was paint and smelled musty..so we didn't actually use this area at all... the pool rooms had access to the pool..sound lovely but as we could swim around the entire pool I wouldn't want to be in those rooms for two…

title: Stunning Hotel, Spa and Location
review: This 3 year old hotel is flawlessly designed with the most incredible pools and water ways on which the entire hotel is based. The setting is jungle either side on a clean beautiful beach - so suitably remote - the rooms are clean, large and for us opened onto a stretch of internal waterway that leads to the large pools that lead to the beach. The service is also quite incredible and very much 5 star. All staff are very friendly and remembered our names from the onset ! All smile and stop what they are doing when you pass - they make it all special and are obviously extremely well trained.  Although this hotel is large at almost 300 bedrooms - the hotel is so large - that you do not feel that it is in any way crowded - except for at breakfast time - when unless you arrive early…

title: Dream of a beach hotel with gorgeous pool but too high prices
review: The hotel has outstanding garden and pool area which directly at a fantastic beach with white sand, hardly no stones and no waste. Go beachwalki for hours without Interruption. Rooms ar large, newish, clean, with big bathrooms Services like water service at the beach or huge towels and nice beach bags provided are Great. breakfast buffet is very big.  However, there is one drawback: Prices at the hotel for food, drinks, snacks or Spa are Even for 5 Star resort inacceptably high! We are afraid this is why many people eat outside and the Hotel Management is eager to fill the Hotel with more Russian guest...  This is also the reason why we went very often to the right side of the hotel directly at the beach. There is a restaurant called "Andaman Restaurant Massage & Bar" (2nd…

title: Consistently excellent
review: We are delighted to be back at this JW, a particularly lovely hotel by the sea.    This is our 3rd visit in 3 years and we already plan a return for 2013.  The 3 kilometer lagoon, the pool, the beach, all are fantastic.   Our room is again a pool access room, meaning that from our terrace it is only 3 steps down into the lagoon.   The water is warm but refreshing and the area is kept sparkling clean.  The room has lots of thai accents and is very comfortable with a chaise and a built-in sofa plus a huge king bed.   The bathroom is large with a toilet room, a shower room and a huge stone tub, plus a unique double sink, a make-up mirror and fab water pressure for the rain shower plus the hand held unit.  Internet is free and very fast.  Breakfast is fantastic and seemingly…

title: perfection
review: very high standards, we were collected from Phuket airport, the transfer is about 80kms so it takes over an hour. luxurious resort, amazing pools, very nice beach, very friendly staff, the gardeners gave our boys coconuts to drink. also, when you spent some time relaxing on the sun lounges (plenty to go around..), staff would come around with chilled glasses of water - most impressive!  buffet breakfast is an endless array of good quality food, never seen such an impressive display before.   kids club was great for our boys aged 3 and 4, big and inviting space, great staff, plenty of activities such as t-shirt painting and candle making.   bottled water replaced in the rooms daily and the housekeeping tended to come past in the evening to check if we needed anything else. bags…

title: Almost heaven... An I ain't talkin w.virginia !!
review: Nothing is perfect .. But this comes pretty dang close !!  Absolute and total peace and relaxation on a beautiful beach .. The staff was incredible the hotel awesome and the local people big hearted and welcoming with nothing but smiles.. high end dining if you like and local cheap dining on the beach as well,,,, half price drinks 12-1 pm.   4:30-6 pm. And 9-10:30 pm every day at the hotel bars ,,,, fantastic weight and exercise facilities ... 9.9 out of 10.  Go back in a second

title: If you want a holiday got to JW Marriott Khao Lak!
review: We stayed at the resort for 12 days,(23rd Oct-4thNov 2012) we enjoyed every minute of our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful and always try to make you feel special, attentive to your request. The resort looks good and feels good. If you look at the pictures what you see is what you get. The Beach is wide,not crowded with people, the water is  warm and clean and a great place to spend hours as we did. We had two small children with us and they had a great time, did not get sick but had lots of fun. The pool access room was fun to have, my kids loved it, they could easily go into the pool and swim when they wish to. The pool are not too deep, max 150m. There is a children pool with a slide and all the pool canals are connected and you can walk around the resort.  At…

title: 5 star hotel?? but beutiful beach and a big pool and good restaurants
review: I stay there for 8 days last year in october. It was a little durty her and there. We had a room where we could jump in to the pool at the balcony. One day there was a big rat on our balcony. The Kids-room was better in Phuket Marrriott hotel, but the gym was excellent. The restaurnats was very good but expensiv. The Japanish was the best. The hotel is a little to fare from the town center. You have to take a taxi evry time you go some where.

title: Great Resort Fantastic Water ...
review: Fabulous design with a continuous pool running through the entire property and ALL guest rooms. Like someone before me mentioned ... this truly is heaven for water lovers.   Just the concept of being able to walk out onto your deck and plunge into a massive pool is really Amazing!! Loved getting up and just stepping into the pool literally :)   The JW is a new property here and is rather state of the art. Great pools and lovely food outlets. The F & B team was superb when I was there.   I happened to be there to scout for my wedding and I really really wanted to have it there BUT the one thing that was a Huge put off was the sales team at the hotel which was the Only reason I paid more and finalised with another hotel in Khao Lak itself.   That being said ... If I'm back in Khao…

title: Outstanding hotel at one of the most beautiful beaches
review: We are travelling to Thailand every year and this hotel is one of the most beautiful we have ever stayed at.  These are the reasons: - outstanding garden and pool area which make you feel being in paradise - fantastic beach with white sand, hardly no stones and no waste. You can go for a walk for hours without Interruption.  - great rooms, large, newish, clean, with sophisticated furniture and, with luxury bathrooms - great services like water service at the beach or huge towels and nice beach bags provided  - huge breakfast buffet for any taste imaginable  However, there is one drawback: Prices at the hotel for food, drinks, snacks or Spa are ridiculously high and surpass even European standards - in Thailand!!! We agree for a certain surplus at the 5-star hotels vs. local Thai…

title: Nice scene , facilities & comfortable Resort
review: I stayed in this resort on 13-16 Oct 2012. The room is spacious with bathtub, nice decoration and design. I love the room very much just I don't have much time to enjoy it. They have a nice swimming pool with jacuzzi. The beach is clean and the scene is nice. Near the beach have a lot of local food stalls and massage stalls. Is a great enjoy place.

title: Great resort for water lovers
review: Stayed for ten days with husband and two kids ages 8 and 11 and we all loved it and were very sorry to leave. We had interconnecting rooms, which worked out very well. The beach is beautiful, the service excellent and the pools very well maintained. Some places don't live up to the expectations of the photos you've seen. This one does -- it's as great as the pictures show.  Tip: there are small places to have dinner at on the beach very close to the resort. We particularly recommend "Ma-ma's greeting", the very last one on the right as you face the sea.

title: Beautiful resort
review: Loved this resort - amazing pool, great gardens, comfortable rooms, delicious breakfast, semi-private beach, and good selection of local restaurants and massage huts right next door. Would definitely stay there again.

title: A great place to unwind - we will be back!
review: We were at the JW for a 4 day long weekend recently and had the duplex suite. Much can be written about the JW, awesome beach and the greatest aquamarine ocean views, the resort is amazing with a meandering swimming pool across the length of the resort, the service is great.  If you love the water, the pool access rooms are probably a worthwhile investment. Food wise, breakfast has a great spread and is really good, the Olive restaurant is worth a visit - do try the spinach & goat cheese ravioli and the deli is an interesting pit stop for a quick satisfying bite.   On the flip side, the rooms are nice enough and quite comfortable but fall short of the premium-ness of the resort itself. The service at the front desk could do with some improvement,  which is a bit of a shame given…

title: Wish we could stay for a bit longer- amazing place!
review: Hi, my family and I just got back from staying at this beautiful resort! We had a lovely family suite with a swimming pool access. The beach is great with a few little restaurants serving all sorts of dishes from Thai to Euro style meals, for those who do not wish to dine at the resort all of the time. Needless to say it is much cheaper to dine outside of the resort. Never the less the resort's breakfast is something out of this world. I must say it was the most impressive buffet breakfast we have had so far on our Thai trips. Staff is lovely, friendly and speak good English as well as other languages. Great spot for a family holiday. One thing that was a bit painful after a long flight was a 90min mini bus trip to the resort, it stretched the kids' patience a bit. It was worth…

title: An amazing experience.......
review: We had the most amazing stay at the J W Marriott Khao Lak. We stayed 7 nights and no complaints about anything at all. The staff were so friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. A 3km long swimming pool!! Amazing. We had a poolside room with direct access to the pool. Food was fantastic. We met several managers all of whom were so great to talk to and deal with. They even remembered our names when they would meet. Huge compliments to manager Ty and his wife Kim. This kind of attitude comes from the top down. A beautiful experience in a beautiful part of the world.  Thank you to the JW team at Khao Lak......and they do work as a team.

title: Hospitality at it's best
review: Just back from a week's break at this amazing resort and I can honestly say that we really did not want to leave. We booked the hotel at a recent Travel Expo in Singapore. We weren't planning on going to Thailand but our 10 year old son was smitten with the beautiful Thai lady (and she with him) on the JW Marriott stand and so we followed his instinct and are so glad that we did. From that first encounter at the Expo stand, right through to checking out yesterday, the staff at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak were a pleasure to deal with...in particular the beautiful Orawan who took the initial booking, dealt with subsequent unforeseen changes to our booking and made us feel like VIP guests the whole time we were there. Every staff member we met just could not do enough for us and…

title: Amazing Resort
review: Stay 1 night on my Bangkok - Hatyai trip by car. Arrived in the resort around 1pm, we got lunch at the small restaurant outside the hotel.  There's a mini market, some shop and restaurants outside the hotel's main entrance. Checked in was fast and the staff informed me everything about the resorts very clear. The room was big and nice. Balcony view to the swimming pool, with big sofa. Very nice to relax there. Swimming pool open 24 hours and the size is16.000 square meter.  Beach was beautiful, no rocks around the beachfront. Buffet breakfast with good variety but the taste a little bit tasteless. Wifi was free with no password access everywhere at the resort. Parking space also free. Overall, this is the best resort in Thailand that I ever stayed. Will be come back someday.

title: Great place with great staff!
review: We stayed at the Marriot for 6 nights in January 2012 with my husband. We had some – let’s say not all so minor – problems in the beginning of our stay. As I travel a lot, I know that problems like ours may occur anywhere, despite the amount of stars that hotel may have. The way the occurring problems are solved is what makes the place 5 star – or not. In my opinion, they absolutely treated us with 5 star quality. We sat down with Jaan-Hein, the room division manager, and he truly handled everything perfectly. My most sincere thanks to you and also to your always so helpful staff! (By the way, Jaan-Hein, did you get the bread I sent you? I promised to send you that Finnish bread and so I did, in February 2012, I just wonder whether you got it or not?)  After we got these issues…

title: Wow - The Pool!
review: I had the good fortune to stay here for two nights with a large group, about twenty people. From meeting at the airport, check-in, meals, etc, nothing could have been better. The hotel staff was beyond accommodating for our group.  The pool is one of the most gorgeous creations ever. If you are lucky to book a ground floor room, you can swim to any location in the resort. The infinity pool, the swim up bars and the jacuzzi beds in the pool all make it a unique experience.  The meals are expensive so don't be afraid to venture off the property for a great beach side meal or drinks.  Be forewarned, the crowd gets interesting at night.

title: an amazing beach vacation
review: JW Marriott khao lak is an amazing property. its suggested for beach vacation. you have the Spa and in addition to that, there are masaage centers right at the beach. Great cuisines to choose from- Thai, Japanese, Italian. Buffet Breakfast with good options for veg as well as non veg folks.

title: best hotel!
review: Writing this review as I sit at Quan Spa after my massage. This is one of the best resorts we have ever stayed at. Rooms are impeccable with a mixture of traditional and modern and one of the best beds I've slept on. Unfortunately there were no pool access rooms available but happy with the pool view room anyway. Breakfast is the best buffet spread I have ever seen with a selection of freshly made waffles, pancakes, different kinds of bread and pastries as well as omelettes you could customise, fresh fruits, yogurts, Bircher muesli and even a fruit smoothie bar where you can make your own smoothie. Khuk kak beach is just outside the Waterfront restaurant where breakfast is served and every morning we sit by the window overlooking the beach. There are plenty of deck chairs set up…

title: beautiful resort, but bad quality food and some improvements needed
review: The resort is beautiful. Nice and large rooms. The beach is not great but at least it is peaceful. Very nice and large swimming pool, around a fantastic landscaped garden, very well taken care of. The hotel does not seem to mind that people reserve sunbeds early morning and only show up much later, which is very bad practice, but it becomes shocking when witnessing that the hotel staff themselves reserve sunbeds for some guests. Beach towels are not clean, many have suspect stains and sometimes blood on them. Are they even really washed ?  Major issue is the food quality. Breakfast buffet offers terrible bread, salad is terrible as well. Boiled eggs are not fresh, poached eggs are prepared in advance and just re-heated when ordered, and the staff complains when asked to make…

title: 5 star...??? Errrmmm, I don't think so...
review: Where do I begin...??? My wife and I have been staying in 5 star hotels for a number of years now and this is definitely the worst. I'll start with the good points first.  The staff were suberb in all areas of the hotel and all spoke very good English.  We stayed in a pool access room which we found to be very well equipped and the bed, bedding and towels were of the highest quality.  The hotels facilities in general and the grounds were very good.  The breakfast which was included in our package was possibly the best breakfast we've had at any hotel.  Now for the bad points.  On entering our room, there was a musty smell. This remained for our whole stay even though we always had the terrace doors open.  There was a distinct lack of hot water which I reported. Two guys came to…

title: Relaxing Times
review: Stayed for two weeks from 3rd October which  is nearly the end of the rainy season.  Most of the previous reviews are accurate and this really is a great place to  stay. Contary to  reports by many there was constant  building  maintinance going on with  painting, wooden  balcony railings being  repalced etc.None of this was noisey or disruptive.  Smooth and welcoming  check  in  with  cold drink  and towels and then  taken to  our room  by reception  staff and porter on  a golf  buggy.  We stayed in  a deluxe pool  access romm which  as far  as we are  concerend is the only room to  have if you like swimming. We were located very close to  the beach  and our pool  balcony had a step  but no railings or fence. The room was great, nice big comfy bed and  a large…

title: JW Standard? Not sure
review: I am a frequent visitor to Thailand,  a Gold Marriott member and have stayed stayed at 7 Marriott properties across Thailand. While this is a lovely resort and we thought our pool access rooms were of a high standard I believe the current set up lacks that the final touch that the JW brand usually stands for (eg Executive lounge in BKK). If you are travelling for an intimate resort experience I would warn that this is a very large resort that does not have the intimacy adults might be looking for.   While the standard of the breakfast offer was as expected of a Thai resort, the breakfast hall is massive and at peak periods is like eating in a school canteen with screaming kids everywhere. Queing 10 deep to have an omlette made is not up to standard.  There was also no real venue…

title: A must visit
review: We spent 2 nights at JW Khao Lak.  It is about a hours ride from JW Phuket. It cost 1800 Bhat in a local taxi. The car was good but then Thais drive crazy. The hotel and beach are fabulous - a must see   We were in a split level suite which was amazing.  I think that the pool access rooms are a bit over hyped.  Would definitely come back if we are in the region.

title: Fabulous family holiday
review: Our 3 adult children purchased our holiday through Scoopon for us, and them and their partners for an anniversary gift. Their choice was brilliant - the resort had everything required for a fabulous family holiday. The Scoopon deal which included upgrades to the Deluxe Pool Access Rooms were sensational value. The resort is well equipped for a family holiday - 2 tennis courts, squash court, gym, Pool table, the huge pool areas and the beach. Our Pool Access rooms had a terrace, then a small garden area which provided privacy and then the pool. Our only criticism would be that pool ladders at each room would have been an improvement. The rooms were large, well furnished and with huge bathrooms. The beds were FANTASTIC - so comfortable, probably the best sleep I have had in…

title: excellent resort but in the middle of nowhere
review: We spent a week in this resort in a direct pool access room. It was very comfortable, the rooms were always clean and the staff were always friendly. The pool view rooms are on the second floor so you will have to go up the stairs. All the toiletries you need are provided such as shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and soap but i would recommend you bring your own stuff if you want a nice bath, things like bath bombs, salts and oils. there is nowhere nearby where you can get this.  the breakfast was always nice, they have a noodles corner, bread corner, fresh squeezed juice and smoothies corner, an asian breakfast corner, an eggs corner, fresh fruit, cereal, cheese and crackers as well as salad.  they have a shuttle bus that takes you to the shops, it takes about 15min. it is not…

title: Miss this place, heaven on earth! Relaxation-Haven!
review: We stayed here during there wet season for our honeymoon. 7 nights in total & if I ever go back to Thailand I will definately be returning here. The staff we so friendly, always offering to help. The rooms were spacious and comfortable & with housekeeping everyday, everything was always impeccable. The pools are magnificent! We stayed in a pool access room which is a must! Food - SO GOOD we didn't want to eat anywhere else! All 3 restaurants served Devine food with the Japanese being our favorite (we went here 3 times in the week) & with 24hr room service u were never left hungry.  The breakfast buffet was magnificent with so many different fresh options! The drink prices at the bars were also very reasonable so we could lay around the pool and drink all day. Very secluded and…

title: Miss this place, heaven on earth! Relaxation-Haven!
review: We stayed here during there wet season for our honeymoon. 7 nights in total & if I ever go back to Thailand I will definately be returning here. The staff we so friendly, always offering to help. The rooms were spacious and comfortable & with housekeeping everyday, everything was always impeccable. The pools are magnificent! We stayed in a pool access room which is a must! Food - SO GOOD we didn't want to eat anywhere else! All 3 restaurants served Devine food with the Japanese being our favorite (we went here 3 times in the week) & with 24hr room service u were never left hungry.  The breakfast buffet was magnificent with so many different fresh options! The drink prices at the bars were also very reasonable so we could lay around the pool and drink all day. Very secluded and…

title: Beautiful resort, but a few annoying flaws
review: Pros - 1.5km long lazy river connected to every pool. Awesome. - Great food, good variety, cheap beach hut restaurants close by - Very friendly and respectful staff - Beautiful Spa with private hot tubs - Thai cooking class will teach you wonderful recipes - Swim up pool bars with seating - Rooms on the pool edge, walk off your porch to the water - Many activities local and in the area to keep you busy for a few weeks - Diving trip is a 2 hour ride to Phuket, but worth it  So/so - The resort is beautiful, but due to large amounts of rain many rusty and moldy surfaces make what could be amazing sometimes unsightly for a JW Marriott. - As an american the language barrier can be frustrating.  placing orders especially through room service, many times  you'll get 'close to what you…

title: My favorite resort in Phuket
review: Love the pool access room, love the pool, love the beach... The seafood buffet was the best I've ever had!! You have so much to choose from for breakfast. I miss the fresh mix juice and the noodle! And rate is reasonable.

title: a beautiful place to unwind
review: a little way from anything else, but oh so wonderful!! The Resort is beautiful, rooms are tastefully decorated, the gardens luscious and the staff really friendly. Daily decisions between the 3+ kms of pools to wade around and the stunning beach with waves big enough to body surf, water refreshingly warm. Buffet breakfast worth getting up for; as was the Japanese buffet dinner worth waiting for. The Spa was a real treat however overpriced. Great Thai massages on the beach a mere $10 AUD for 60mins. Beach restaurants next door and Antonio's Italian @ the front of the resort all excellent. Hoping to get back here next year!!

title: I really like this place; Khao Lak leaves something to be desired though
review: I really loved this hotel. It's nicely appointed, as a Marriott Rewards member we were given a great upgrade to a 2-level suite overlooking the pool. The food's good (avoid Italian restaurant...Japanese buffet is worthwhile though), especially the breakfast spread. That is one big monster pool...and it was quite nice to while away the time. The beach is nice although the surf was a bit rough when we were there. They have a good Happy Hour, although the staff have a hard time keeping up at times. Unfortunately, for those looking for things to do, I found Khao Lak a little stale...if you're looking for action, you won't find it here. I would have loved to check the spa, but they were always booked solid...

title: A beautiful place
review: After reading all the positive reviews, we were looking forward to our stay and the place lived up to our expectations - even with all the rain.  The pool is stunning, as are the gardens and grounds and the facilities are excellent.  Rooms are large and comfortable, lots of towels, pillows and toiletries.  Breakfast is great, with a huge assortment of choices and I'm missing those banana smoothies!  The place is right on the beach and there are plenty of sun beds.  Several lovely restaurants on the beach (don't be put off - they might look like they are about to fall down, but the food is great) if you want a change from food at the hotel.  And finally, the staff are super friendly and made our stay extra special.

title: Best of Khao Lak!
review: Everything was taken care of from the moment we stepped in till the time we depart! My husband and I took the first flight in and arrived early, and the hotel was nice to arrange for an early check in as there was room available at that time. The check in process was top class as we were seated at the lobby and were given a welcome drink. The rooms were very cosy, we were so in love with the bed and pillows!   Breakfast is good with wide variety, just that its the same everyday. If you fret about paying high prices for food, just walk along the beach, there are some pleasant Thai restaurants.  We were able to keep ourselves occupied throughout our 4 days trip with so many activities to do. About 2pm there was even an elephant at the beach! The infinity pool and the private beach…

title: Didn't want to leave!!
review: The Marriott was a superb hotel for a much needed relaxation holiday! Although its a long drive north of Phuket airport, the hotel is fantastic. We had a Scoopon deal which ensured we had a pool access room which was incredible - comfy bed, great bathroom and the ease of walking out onto a private deck and straight into the pool!   We found the staff so friendly and helpful, the food in the hotel restaurants was delicious (especially the seafood buffet!) we participated in happy hour at infinity pool bar every day (even though it rained for the majority of our stay). There were absolutely no issues whatsoever with regards to the scoopon booking.  I have one gripe, being that somehow a family who had booked 3 rooms were given 2 rooms on either side of our room and we had the…

title: a peaceful oasis in the middle of busy tour
review: Although it was rainy season and we had some rain everyday, we were able to enjoy the pool and the beach. At least once a day we swam the entire pool which is more like a canal system passing by all the different sections of the hotel. The large pool areas had a swim up bar that also provided snacks. There was a separate kiddy pool as well. Beatifully decorated and landscaped, it was the perfect place for a few days of relaxation during our busy vacation itinerary. The restaurant meals were very good, and the breakfast outstanding. I would highly recommend this resort to my family and friends

title: The best
review: We have stayed in many very good hotels in Thailand - and there are many of them - but this was the best of them all. The room, food, location, staff were all without fault. The breakfasts were wonderful. And if you want a break from the great restaurants in the hotel then there are three good ones at a much better price just outside the gate in a small parade of shops. We mixed and matched between these and the hotel ones. They will also do your laundry here if you want to make a saving from the hotel rates. The hotel is some way from the town but a pleasant hour walk along the beach and a low cost cab back makes a good break. I hired a bike in the town for the ten days (the hotel has some for hire but I had arranged before we arrived) and used it as a base for some great…

title: Great stay - just short of perfect
review: For our last trip before our first child is born, we stayed here in August - monsoon season. Having stayed in Phuket in May during the "rainy" season we thought we knew what this entailed - a refreshing 30 minute shower each day to cool off.  Monsoon season is not like that. It rained almost continually for 5 of the 7 days. So it was important that the hotel had plenty of things to keep us entertained when we couldn't be lounging by the (fantastic) pool area.  The rooms are large, with king-size beds, good LCD TVs and DVD players. Even in monsoon season, you'll want to keep the ceiling fan and/or air conditioning running to keep it comfortable. There's a fairly limited selection of (pirated, naturally) DVDs available at reception. But with the weather as it was, stocks were…

title: Forced relaxation
review: We have found while staying at the resort the staff are lovely and we would highly recommend the Thai cooking class with Chef Tham as he was outstanding.  Sasha in reservations was also very helpful.  The restaurants have been great and the set menu at the Thai restaurant Ta-Krai was superb and the atmosphere at the Olive was great with the added addition that you overlook the ocean.  The only negative regarding the food was breakfast leaves little to be desired if you compare it to other 5 star resorts in Thailand.  The criticism here is the hot food was cold and refilling of empty dishes was very slow.  Best bet is to get in before 8.30am at the latest.  So the staff are friendly and the food overall was good, so why have we rated this resort as average?  These are two the…

title: Great Holiday
review: Have just returned from Khao Lak and had a fabulous time there. Food was excellent in two restaurants and OK in the other two.  Staff were amazingly helpful and friendly. Comfortable, clean rooms. Amazing welcome in reception - cold drink, cool towel and personal escort to room with complete explanation of room facilities and hotel amenities.  Only downside was the very slippery walkways between rooms and restaurants when wet and with rain every day they were usually wet or at least damp. Wear shoes with good grip. Otherwise it is a fantastic holiday and we had no other complaints.

title: Absolute paradise and and a hotel above the rest
review: This has got to be the best hotel/resort we have ever stayed at. When you go, you wont want to leave. We stayed for the week (left today Sept 2012) with a coupon deal. First of all if you are booking to stay, make sure you get the taxi to drop you at the right JW Marriott. We made that mistake- this hotel is about 1.5hrs from the airport compared to the other JW Marriott in Mai Khao Beach- but the extra travel is worth it. Check in was easy and from the second you walk through the doors the attention and care from staff was amazing. The grounds of the resort are beautiful with the standout being the 3km pool which winds around all buildings. We stayed in a pool access room which is a must- step off your deck straight into the pool. There was also a swimup bar perfect for the…

title: Beautiful start to our trip
review: We arrived at the resort very late at night, after a long journey from Toronto and were welcomed with cold towels, a refreshing beverage and excellent service. Since it was dark and we were jet lagged on arrival, I wasn't able to appreciate just how beautiful the resort was until the next morning when we were completely in awe. The breakfast buffet had a huge selection and amazing smoothies. While we were there we also had the pleasure of doing a couples spa package. Totally relaxing and an excellent place to start our trip to Southeast Asia.

title: Perfection
review: We stayed for 5 nights in August and absolutely loved this resort! Travelling with two little kids we found the JW Marriott Khao Lak to be perfect, the staff are so warm and friendly always greeting you as you walk past them. The rooms were beautiful and clean, beds were super comfy, housekeeping were generous with extra towels and additional complimentary water every evening. Free Wifi was a bonus. We had a pool access room, initially we had one with the garden out the front in Wing 2 (that doesnt have a step into the pool) but we asked to swap to one with the glass pool fence in Wing 3 (near the kids pool) which had the step into the pool and was a bit safer with the kids. The pool access rooms are a must, it really makes it that extra bit special. Having pool access means you…

title: Excellent
review: We spent here two weeks on our honeymoon.   Pros: - breakfast was amazing, the best we have ever had - the pool was simply stunning - the room was great except few minor details - service was overwhelmingly friendly - the gym was great  Cons: - the hotel is located quite far from the village - we were given a room that had a mouldy smell so we had to switch rooms - one of the room closets had a faulty light bulb (the light kept blinking all night)  I would recommend it to everyone except party goers.

title: Paradise
review: We stayed 10 days in March in a pool access room. At check-in we had some little problem with our room. Even we booked this type they wanted to give us a regular room. But finally everything was clear and ok.The rooms are nice and pool access room is a must at this resort.The food in this resort is excellent but the prices are little higher. I recommend to try the restaurants on the beach ( very good food ) and very cheap !! Also go to Khao Lak and try the Smile Khao Lak restaurant,the food is amazing. Specially the spring rolls.There is a free transport service to the city,book in advance on the concierge. Internet in room is very slow and even the IT guy installed a extra router to our room it was still slow. The beach is very nice and very clear water.The big pool is great.…

title: A perfect resort for relaxing
review: Stayed 1 week in August 2012 in pool access room. Third time at this resort. A perfect place to spend a week in high or low season, as the resort has great facilities in house, a clean beach, and low cost alternative dining on the beach just next to the resort too. Now has a convenience store tailors restaurants and a spa off site near entry to resort, which also give you alternative options  Resort now offers shuttle trips to nearby towns, and excursions, so is even better than ever. A fabulous breakfast, beautiful grounds and a good beach. Perfection at a very affordable price.

title: A high quality hotel with one defect
review: This is a high quality hotel, no matter the room facility, food, spa, or the service, it is up to its level.  However, one  defect makes a bad recall to me. I choosed pool-access room as the most people do, it means you could jump into pool from back terrace of the room which looks fantastic. But, from terrace to the pool, there is no STEP! Literally you do have to JUMP into pool, and afterwards struggle pushing yourself or jumping out onto the terrace. And the terrace is about 1.4m high!  My friend hurt his back seriously by pushing himself and lifting me out of pool.  After I reported the injure to front desk and asked for some medical help, I was asked to pay for the medicine myself. It was small money, but the injure was made by hotel design defect, how could hotel even ask…

title: Fabulous Stay
review: We bought a 4D3N Insing voucher and stayed there from Sep 3-6. This is a great testimony to Marriott's International franchise ( It is not a surprise that Marriott's shares have tripled since 2009) as our stay was perfect. This included the massage at Quan Spa. The breakfast spread was very good although i had secretly hoped for some pad thai. I remembered the hospitality of the staff - Jane, Stefan and Mew. Thank you for making our stay a great one. My son was so enamoured with his stay that he suffered a withdrawal syndrome upon coming home, insisting that he wants to go to his room.  I suspect that they deliberately made it difficult to switch TV channel so that we can enjoy swimming within the canal like pool. Although it was raining for 2 days, our kids had a great time at…

title: Everything you Need - Amazing
review: I have recently returned from 6 nights at this magnificent Resort (15-21 August). Check in was a dream and we were led to our Pool access room which was beautiful, clean and welcoming, the bed was massive and very comfortable. The resort was at 60% capacity and the only time you knew there were so many people around was at breakfast and occasionally when someone swam past your patio. Breakfast was the highlight of every day, SO much to choose from, fresh smoothies, eggs cooked how you like, on the spot and a pot of tea or coffee brought to your table, the array of food was as spectacular as the view. We at only twice in the resort, we chose instead to eat at the Restaurants on the beach. Our favourite by far was Blue Mist on the right, Mr Mo and his staff made every meal with…

title: I cannot rave enough about the JW Khao Lak
review: I love this place so much, I have been twice in two years.  And will be going back again.  The resort is brilliant.  Rooms are peaceful, ours was a pool access.  King size bed was heaven; very plush with crisp sheets.  I've got to ask them the next time where they get their pillows as they are super king size down feather.  It is like sleeping on a cloud.  They should get a merit badge for their beds :)  Going straight from your room into the pool cannot be beat.  We began and ended each day with a peaceful swim.  The resort staff is unassuming, and pride themselves on lovely Thai hospitality.  We really enjoyed our daily chats with the wait staff at breakfast.    Each time I go to this JW I feel spoiled.  Between the location (quiet and peaceful), beach restaurants, service and…

title: Beautiful Hotel-Beautiful People
review: This resort is everything you could wish for in charm, beauty and relaxation..Our pool access room was such a treat and an upgrade along with breakfast because of our Platinum status with Marriott. We were thoroughly spoiled by the thoughtful, smiling staff who it seemed went overboard to make our stay memorable.  The pool is the largest in Thailand but has a way of making you feel its private as it meanders like a maze throughout the resort.Breakfast is temptation at every turn. The Bluemist restaurant a few steps to the right on the beach has great food for almost nothing. The hotel has a shuttle into town twice a day and taxis are plentiful and inexpensive.  We will definately be looking for a way to return in the future!

title: Absolutely amazing
review: Resort is spectacular. We had a pool access room and had asked for a more private pool access room. Our room was beautiful and being able to get into the pool from the garden at the end of our patio meant that we were swimming even when it rained. Definitely worth the upgrade to pool access.  Swimming around the massive pool was a great way to check out the rest of the resort.  Staff were all so friendly and helpful, and we ate at the resort for our whole stay (6 nights) because we didn't want to leave it. Plenty of restaurants to choose from.  Resort meals may have been more expensive than other places to eat but were still good value, especially when compared to the overpriced lack of hospitality we suffer in Perth restaurants!! Considerable restraint required at breakfast -…

title: Amazing!
review: Canot speak highly enough of this hotel. We purchased a Scoopon deal, 7 night, breakfast every day and 1 dinner for $499au. We thoroughly enjoyed this resort. The pools is magnificent and the rooms were great as well (deluxe pool access) A favourite part of our day was walking/swimming to the swim up bar.There is 3.2km of pools. We used to do about a 20 minute walk in the pool so we got some exercise before our cocktails ( Banana Colada!!) We travelled in a group of 8 and we all had our rooms in block 4. The restaurants were good and we also enjoyed some meals in the shacks on the beach. Massages were also a hit, either at the hotel or on the beach. The staff at the Marriott were very helpful even going as far as getting us an AFL match live in their business centre between…

title: So very relaxing!
review: A beautiful hotel with staff and service to match. Happy, friendly faces all trying to make your holiday exceptional. And it was. Don't feel guilty about doing nothing as there is nothing to do! Loved the pool access room. It was a great buffet breakfast with everything available for every taste. I'm missing someone to cook my omelette and make my smoothie now I am back home! Their website really shows the hotel as it is. No airbrushing! Rooms are large and tastefully furnished, bathrooms luxurious and pool access is definitely the way to go. The only thing that could be improved is the television and channel selection. It needed a better selection for movies etc and news coverage and although DVDs are available at reception, it wasn't always convenient to go to the lobby.…

title: Our piece of paradise
review: We arrived 6 days ago after a long day traveling from Melbourne and a very slow taxi ride from Phuket airport. Check in was very easy and we found our pool side rooms to be great. 4 couples were staying here with the first two arriving a few days before. As we were booked all over the resort Stefan managed to get us all in block 4 which made swimming up and collecting our travel buddies very easy for a rendezvous at the Infinity Bar and numerous banana coladas.  The extensive pool is amazing and the staff excellent. Buffet breakfast is far too good ( with over indulgence a trap) but nothing a bit of exercise in the gym couldn't fix. Many resort gyms are just adequate( as my sister said why would you exercise on holiday) but this was excellent with up to date equipment, air con…

title: Just the best
review: Stayed for 6 nights in August.  We did not want to leave.  This hotel is paradise, set on the best beach in Khao Lak.  From the moment we arrived we were impressed.  It is a large hotel set in beautifully maintained gardens.  But what makes is stand out is the 4 massive swimming pools and the 3.2km on canals that link to the pools.  It is always possible to find a quiet place to swim as well as getting a good daily workout walking the canals.  The staff are all friendly, helpful and show Thai hospitality at its best.  A special thanks to Nook at reception, Ball at the pool bar and Jane and Nuch at the Waterfront restuarant.  The buffet breakfast is superb and there is a choice to suit everyone.  The standout is the fresh smoothie bar made to order with the fruit of your choice. …

title: A week's retreat in Khao Lak
review: To commence our holiday through Thailand, we started by a total relaxaton at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak.  Here we had the opportunity to lay back by the pool, either on our private deck from our pool access room or at the various large pools around the resort. We found the staff and service impeccable as we were greeted constantly wtith smiles and hellos and our requests were responded to in a very timely manner.  The resort is isolated, so if you are there for shopping you will have to find a way to the centre - taxi on call was 300THB each way.  But this wasnt the reason we were here, so we did not find this inconvenient.  I could not fault the staff or the complex itself, as it was easy to get around, and felt secure. You are able to walk and play along the beach without any…

title: superb
review: i enjoyed my stay there. the marriott standard is just the same as the one in kuala lumpur. im impressed. thank you for those who attended to me. i would definitely want to come back again. it was a great vacation.

title: Be careful when you visit!
review: I just returned yesterday from a 7 night stay at this resort using a scoopon voucher. When we arrived to check in i was told that the resort was overbooked and they would relocate us elsewhere. despite me confirming my booking 2 days prior to arriving, they told me they had contacted my travel agent to tell them, on calling my agent this was not the case, they never heard from them! After a terrible argument with the manager of the hotel they found us a room which was not the pool access room we were supposed to have a free upgrade too. 4 days later an indian wedding of 550 people arrived and they closed all bar 1 restaurant in the resort, closed the spa and took all the beach front and had music pounding until 5am. I spoke to management who moved us, along with all the other…

title: A Tale of Two Parts
review: We stayed from the 3th to the 10th August. The 3rd to the 8th was superb. The hotel facilities and the staff were fantastic. We loved our pool access room. Swimming from your room was a fantastic bonus. The restaurants served great food. A special mention for Chef Than of the Thai restaurant, we did cookery school with him and learnt, hands on, to do an authentic meal. He was a great teacher and chef. Everything changed from the 8th. The hotel had booked in a very large wedding, taking over 250 rooms. The beach became a building site, the Spa closed to non wedding guests, the Thai restaurant and the Japanese restaurant, the Deli and the main bar closed to everyone but wedding guests. Other services deteriorated. Many guests were moved to other hotels without prior warning. We…

title: False advertising
review: We booked 2 Vouchers, each 3 nights at the JW Mariott, which included accommodation, breakfasts, 2 x 1 hr massages, and 50% contriubution to the return fare to Phuket airport. The fare was quoted as 1500 Bhat ( each way) approxately 50 Australian Dollars. The Hotel is a 1.5 hour ride from the airport! Theoretically the hotel should have repaid us 3000 Baht for the 2 Vouchers. In fact they refused to pay anything at all. After a heated discussion with the manager we were offered a 1250 Baht compensation. We find that pretty unethical. Dining: We ate at the Italian Restaurant. We expected better quality and service for the relatively high price we paid. Relative in terms of what fantastic quality, freshness and service one gets at some of the Koa Lak restaurants.  The good side:…

title: An enormous disappointment
review: I have stayed at more than 20 Marriotts of various Marriott brands, and I now have met the worst.  In terms of hardware, it is below average (yes, it's better than some of the Courtyards, but for the price?!).  In terms of service, it is at the bottom.  Go to the new Renaissance Phuket or the not-as-new JW in Phuket.  The manager here really needs to take some lessons from the two managers there.  Here're the details, building from the below-average infrastructure to the very inconsistent service:   1 - When my family of 4 (2 rooms) in the morning, the electricity went down, for the better part of the day and the next.  When the electricity came back up, then we realize some of them (like the TV) doesn't work.  Calls to the front desk and engineering took at least an hour to…

title: Great Escape
review: I spent a few days at this resort in May 2012. Needed to get away and this was the perfect spot. The rooms are very comfortable and well equipped. Your spoilt for choice when it comes to dining. I think they have like 5-6 options plus a great bakery and a bar in the main building. The spa was the best, i must however say you need to make advance bookings else like me on arrival, i couldnt get a session. by the way expansive pools and a on the beach property

title: Nice, quiet and relaxing
review: This resort takes about 1.5 hours by car from the Phuket airport, but is well worth the drive.  The property is amazing, and all the pools are unlike anything I've ever seen before. It was like we had the resort to ourselves at times. If booking a package, make sure to include the breakfast as it has a lot of selection, and if you don't pay for it as part of your package it's around $30 each person.  The rooms on the main floor that allow you to walk out your deck to the pool/canal are worth the upgrade cost (~500 baht a night).  The resort has decent prices, but if you walk outside the resort there are a few stores, including a convenience store, that is much cheaper - Singha is about 1/3 the price of the resort!

title: Great swimming pool
review: Highly recommend to those who love pool swimming, nice beach, and big peaceful gardens.  Although it is located in a very small town without shopping malls,  you would never be bored due to the attractions of all in house activities such as cycling to see waterfall, beach yoga and Thai boxing class which are free for hotel guests.  I am looking foward to my second visit this year for canoeing and another visit in future for snorkeling and scuba diving as many islands only open for a few months for water activities.

title: This is customer service at it's best.
review: A beautiful resort with amazing staff and service. It's not in the hustle and bustle of Phuket town but it's still such an experience. There is a little village just outside the resort in the beach and the Thai massage was brilliant (and extremely cheap). The buffet breakfast is tremendous and we ate in a couple of the restaurants inside the resort and recommend them all. Friendly and fantastic. We'll be back!

title: Magnificent resort but with a few minor annoyances
review: We (my husband and 11 year old son) stayed for 6 nights from July 1 to July 6. Overall, we loved the Marriott, the grounds and pools are unbeatable and super clean. There is an army of staff continually working to maintain the gardens and the buildings. The Thai staff are fantastic, the breakfast is excellent and has everything you would expect and more, I loved that you were given a whole pot of coffee (or tea) instead of having to ask for refills, great idea! The infinity pool and swim up bar was a lot of fun, our son really looked forward to his happy hour mocktail (Kiwi Collins) each evening. The canal like pool that meanders around the perimetre of the rooms was another highlight, especially if you have a lilo. The rooms are spacious, and well appointed with ample wardrobe…

title: Nice hotel.
review: We have stayed there for 4 nights. The pool access room is great if you are with kids. The bathroom facilities are a little bit old with stains. Breakfasts are excellent with so many choices. Quan Spa is a must to go, nice rooms with professional staff. It is a hotel worth staying again and again.

title: Fantastic in every way
review: Rather than reiterate all the good points that so many other travellers have made, if you are looking for a relaxing, luxurious holiday - go no further.  No complaints, no faults.  It is true testament to the Thai people that they have recovered so quickly after the Tsunami.  For all those whingers, just remember many of the locals/staff have lost someone in the tsunami.  Khao Lak was hit very hard and if there happens to be a bit of mould or a broken rail (not that we saw anything like that), suck it up or go somewhere else.  It was divine, Blue Mist is a must and we'll be back.  Did a scoopon deal and would not hesitate again.

title: ~Don't listen to bad reviews~This place is amazing!!
review: My boyfriend and i stayed at the JW MARRIOTT KHAO LAK for a 1 week last month. This place is seriously amazing. We were picked up from our other accomodation in Patong by the Mariott and the amazing service started from there. On arrival we were greatest by a lovely girl called Job who went through some details with us while we relaxed in the lobby with a cold drink and a refresher towel. Our room was beautiful, we had a pool access room. Unfortunately I have bad knees so struggled to get in and out of the pool but managed to find a spot two doors down that I could into the pool without having to squat. Some rooms have easier access to the pool, if I'd known I would have asked for one of these. I lost one of my credit cards while away and a lovely girl called Finny helped me get…

title: excellent hotel & location
review: We stayed here for a week after being in the centre of Patong Beach - it was amazing and so relaxing! The pool access room was wonderful, if I could have packed the bed and pillows I would have!!! The food was excellent, room service and the Olive & Thai restaurants were delicious! plenty of access to tours and the small towns are close by and also have excellent restaurants. The hotel itself is beautiful, yes its a bit scruffy on the outside but inside it it outstanding and the staff were very nice. Breakfast was excellent and what a view to start your day! Would go back here at first opportunity!

title: Straight into the pool from any ground floor room!
review: I only stayed over a weekend (using a Travelzoo voucher) but I will definately go back!  The pool is amazing - like a river that meanders all around the hotel.  Breakfast buffet is extensive, but best enjoyed if the price comes with the room rate!  Khao Lak is just over an hour from Phuket airport, and definately get the hotel to arrange for a car to pick you up.  Explore the restaurants on the beach outside the grounds.  A very very relaxing place.  Free wifi to keep in touch with the outside world if that is important to you.

title: Not Impressed
review: We stayed at the JW in Khao Lak at the end of a 2 week stay in Thailand following excellent hotels in Bangkok and Yai Nang, Phuket. While this hotel wasn't outright bad, it just didn't compare to the other two we stayed at. Here's what we felt was lacking. The staff was just less friendly, competent and helpful. For example, got a deal on TravelZoo and needed a voucher number to book the rooms. We provided the voucher number when booking the rooms online and then were asked for the voucher when we got the the desk. The staff member provided us with an email address that didn't work (bad recipient). The next day we received yet another email from a different staff member and this too bounced when we tried to send them the voucher information. We finally printed the document off…

title: Could have been perfect !
review: First the good .. The property is a little slice of Heaven hidden away in amazing Khao Lak. Your close enough to the craziness of Phuket if you want to chance that yet far enough to relax and rejuvenate in luxury. The pool is off the Hook! I would Highly recommend getting the Pool access room.. They are worth the extra money!   Coming to my 3 star rating - The property has a lizard and bug infestation. There are lizards and creepy crawlies all over the place. If that kind of thing creeps you out like me then stay away. Another problem was the service - We got to see the worst and the best of it. On the first night of our stay at around 1:00 AM we were greeted by an unexpected visitor -- There was a Rat in our room. Unfortunately this was not a serious enough situation for the…

title: One word: SUPERB.
review: I absolutely loved staying at the hotel. I can fault NOTHING.   I must admit when our driver took us from Patong Beach to Khao Lak, I was a bit worries... where on earth are we going??? Well, Khao Lak may be a small village, but it is simply charming. Totally refreshing after the tourist-filled bustle of Patong.  The hotel is breath-taking. We stayed for 6 nights, and loved every second. The grounds of the resort are amazing - with 6km of pool twisting trough the resort. If you so choose, you can swim around the resort, to all the restaurants, and back to your room (especially good when you have a pool access room).   The staff were lovely, and the room service is prompt and delicious! And the breakfast!!! OH MY GOD it was heavenly. It is served in the Waterfront restaurant, and…

title: Extremely good value, rooms, food and facilities
review: Great hotel, excellent food and service.  The family room was briloiant' pool sensational.   Overall we would highly recommend it.  The outside of the hotel is a little tired and could do with tidying up, bu otherwise we couldn't really fault it.

title: In Khao Lak Choose Marriott---a true "best" experience
review: I spent 5 nights in this resort in late July and loved every minute of it. I have never experienced such attentive staff, superb food, comfortable and beautiful rooms...all in one facility. The breakfast buffet is simply phenomenal...definitely the best I have ever experienced in 35 years of traveling in Asia. If you need anything, helpful people will arrive quickly at your room and take care of it. Example: the airconditioner control needed to be replaced so they sent an engineer who fixed it in about 15 minutes flat. Also be sure to try the spa and the Japanese restaurant, both of which are world class. I was at a conference at the hotel and I noticed that every aspect of the event was perfectly organized and catered. Count yourself luck if you can stay here!

title: truly marriott
review: honest 5 stars. food is great. pools are awesome. guys from reception have fluent english, their speach is perfectly understandable, that's a great rarity for thailand. interior and exterior  - no comment, so authentic and modern at the same time. i really like it. minus: don't believe guys from gym, they say, that bike trip's 8 km, but it's outrageous lie, it's 15 km, soooo long and trying!

title: Relaxing and impressive
review: I arrived home from our 7 day stay at the JW Marriott today and have been raving about it to our family and friends.  The resort is beautiful and the rooms spacious with very comfortable beds with quilts and pillows feeling like we were sleeping on clouds.  We were lucky with the weather and only had one afternoon of rain besides a few short showers in the early mornings before we were up.  My daughters and I had pool access rooms in block 4 and it was fantastic to be able to go straight into the pool - the water was always warm and the whole pool extremely clean.  The pool cleaners and gardeners were always working hard around the resort.  Swim up bar was popular with us and has really good cocktails and light meals.The staff in the resort are friendly, always smiling and…

title: Secluded 5star paradaise
review: We stayed in the resort in monsoon season - 5-13 july as part of the scoopon deal and it was great! Although it was an hour away from the airport and 2hours from patong, it's a fantastic place to relax if you want peace and quiet. The staff are friendly and would aways greet us "sawasdee" and they are very well versed in english. They have both thai and german staff working in the resort. Wifi access throughout the hotel, rooms and even in front of the beach which was a plus!   Our deluxe pool access room was perfect coz we can jump to the pool straight from our room! Rooms are serviced daily and kept tidy. Beds are comfy and big. Bathtub is huge! The pool is 3km which we really enjoyed- to have drinks and snacks at the swim-up bar. The main pool is elegant looking nd overlooks…

title: Huge pool, great beach, excellent service!
review: We spent 5 nights at the JW Khao Lak resort in July.  What an amazing pool and property!     The staff at this hotel is excellent, everyone greeting you as they pass by.  Our first room was a pool entrance ground floor room.  It is beautifully furnished and very large, however quit dark and damp.  The next morning, I woke up with a headache, not sure what the smell was, either mold or insecticide, whatever it was, it caused a headache.  After breakfast, I reported this to the front desk. I asked for a high floor room, close to the sea, which was my original request. (the pool access room was an upgrade.) A new room was quickly found.   The new room was much more to my liking, as I always prefer a higher floor to a ground floor.    You can get in the pool from anywhere, as the…

title: Great resort! 7 night deal!
review: Pool access room is a must! Loved having the pool accessible from my patio. Dinner at the local Thai beach restaurants is also a must. Best food ever! And so cheap.  All meals excluding Breakfast from the resorts restaurants were not worth the money. They either were uncooked or not what I ordered. Local Thai restaurants are a must!  The brekkie buffet was amazing! The best I have ever experienced :) it has everything!!  On arrival they withdrew $500 from my credit card, which I was not informed about and then reception claimed to have lost my credit details.. Midway threw my stay it was credited back on. That was a bit stressful and made me unsure of the resort.  Hotel taxi is amazing! Yes it is pricey but well worth your money!   Very little English is known by the workers in…

title: Wonderful stay in JW Khao Lak
review: Stayed in JW Khao Lak for 3 nights, very impress with the hotel features and facilities. Hotel is surrounded by the swimming pool which is extremely huge and nice! The infinitely pool area deserve a "WOW"!!!! The best pool in Asia.  Breakfast time is a bit early, but they have lots have choices and it was good!!  The only bad thing about this hotel is the location. Really in the middle of nowhere!! Overall, it is the best place to relax!!

title: We we staying at the same place?
review: With all these positive reviews, I'm really wondering if I was at the same place...  We too were here on a cheap deal - and thank goodness. This place has an unexceptional packaged holiday vibe. Breakfast in the morning is akin to eating in a cafeteria. We LOVE the JW Marriott in Phuket hoping this would be on par with this, and many other JW's we have stayed at around the world. This place falls far short in my view. Hot tip: stay at the one in Phuket, it is amazing AND cheaper!!

title: Very relaxing and very enjoyable
review: Swim forever.  The lap in this pool never stops, no flip turns, just a great workout. The workout is needed so you can enjoy and eat all the breakfast.  This is a breakfast spread that has enough choices so you do not get tired of it after a few days.  A couple of the wait staff at breakfast were not very "smiley". The staff in general were absolutely fantastic - helpful, courteous, kind, smiles. The beach is great. The staff played beach volleyball against my 23 year old daughter and myself, as well as, bringing water to everybody, every day.  The swim up bar has decent food and good drinks.  Dinner on the beach at a "local" restaurant was delicious (go out to the water, turn right, 2nd restaurant), tables on the beach. Phuket is crowded, dirty, full of scams and overpriced.…

title: A Touch Of Paradise
review: After over an hours drive from Phuket Airport we were warmly and efficiently greeted on arrival at the hotel and given a welcoming drink and a cold towel while formalities were completed. The lobby was comfortable and gave us our first glimpse of the 3 kilometres long swimming pool which is such an impressive feature of this property.  Our room was large and comfortable (perhaps just a tad dated) but perfectly adequate for all our requirements. There was the usual safe (big enough for ipad and small laptop), fridge, coffee making facilities etc which might be expected and a small bowl of delicious fruit (rambutans).  The bathroom was large and had both a shower and a double sized bath tub. Unfortunately the bath did not appear to be quite at clean as we would have liked so we…

title: Best for relaxing between cities.
review: We had 3 days in Saigon, 3 days in Bangkok, at the end of our fortnight and a week in Khoa Lak sandwiched between. The hotel delivered exactly what we wanted which was total relaxation.  The highlights of the hotel were the service which was impeccable- the breakfasts which kept us going until dinner at night - everything you could wish for and more, suiting all nationalities and lastly the swimming pools which were the biggest and best I have ever seen. The fact you could go out from the patio door of the bedroom and straight into the "river" was a real plus. We went on a 22k bike ride from the hotel with a guide from the gym and were impressed by his professionalism which made for a great day out. He ensured that he went at our pace, provided a towel at the waterfall and even…

title: Great Hotel
review: My wife and I have stayed here 3 times in the last 2 years. Very nice hotel and excellent service. The breakfast was excellent had Thai, Western, Chinese, Japanese etc...the pool and the beach area are nice and quiet. The rooms are nice and spacious, we had the pool room... you just sit on your deck by the pool or just go swimming from your room. The hotel has shuttle service to the town center where you can have nice seafood, get a massage or do some shopping.... you can also go island hopping, scuba diving or on fishing trips from the town center This is an great hotel for people looking for a relaxing vacation away from crowded Phuket.

title: Paradise in a quiet location. Amazing pool (and pool bar)
review: We stayed that the JW Marriott Khao Lak in May this year which was bought from a deals website - seven nights including a free dinner and breakfast daily.  The resort is clean, beautiful and traditionally decorated. Reasonably big, not huge and the pools are expansive which was the most amazing experience.  We stayed in the pool access room which was spacious, clean and tastefully decorated. The patio area was quite large with glass doors then straight into the pool. Occasionally people would swim past so we kept our curtains closed while changing etc but otherwise wasn't an issue.  The pool bar was expensive - except for the daily happy hour when prices dropped to the same prices as the restaurants on the beach - only in the main pool bar. There was no better feeling than…

title: wonderful week
review: We have just returned from a wonderful week at the JW Marriot. We had 2 connecting rooms on the top floor in building 5. Most people recommend pool access, but  i enjoyed the fact that we could leave our blinds and doors open at all times to see over the beautiful resort and were not  bothered by people swimming past. Our room was large, the bed extremely comfortable. The room is showing a little wear and tear but for the price you pay you cannot complain! The children used all the facilities, including Table Tennis, the gym was clean and new. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh. Made to order smoothies were delicious. There is a lovely cafe on the premises which we used a few times for toasted sandwiches/rolls etc. We ate one night at Olive which was lovely, but for the rest of…

title: Low season bargain
review: I just got back today from a week at the Marriott. Fantastic resort and the staff are wonderful especially Irina at the front desk and Falco in Olive. Do not get any other room than a pool access room - just divine to step of your patio into the pool. We stayed on a Scoopon deal and we were treated as if we had paid full price. Low season meant it was very quiet which was a bonus for us even if we did cop some rain. Breakfast is the best I've ever seen. The food in the resort was great if a little expensive but as others have said, give the places on the beach a go. Much cheaper. We ate in the little local village Bang Niang as well and the food there was delicious. If looking for transport, go to the boom gate at the end of the driveway to ask the local taxi drivers. We had Mr…

title: what a dream hotel in khao lak
review: My hubby and i have travelled for many years in many places and theJW Marriott Khao lak was every luxury you could ask for. The pool access room is a must, The swimming pool is 3km in length, fabulous. We went in june/july .(Off season) The sun shone most of our two week stay. We also found the resort tranquil. Lovely  garden in the resort grounds. Our room was clean, beautifully furnished. Attention to detail, bathroom spacious and equipped with all you need. the staff could not do enough for us and the food was delicious. The breakfasts were amazing. Cold drinks served on the beach without asking. This is a first class hotel.

title: "Still Magnificent"
review: Second time visit to this resort and still the perfect place to stay (stayed from 19-26 June).  Everything is still in great working order.  The lagoon pool is the big attraction, but you also can't go past the beach access (even though in low season, the open water conditions may be a bit rough). Pool access rooms are still the best option.  I can't see how anybody can complain about the breakfast options or staff service.  The staff are extremely friendly and very attentive. The low season means that a lot of shops/restaurants/bars/tourist places are closed.  I reckon about 40-50% of shops were closed, but that is because of the low number of visitors.  However, you can still get a very good meal in Khao Lak town or one of the Resort retaurants or one of the restaurants…

title: Nice, but would not stay again
review: I actually arrived a day later than specified on my reservation. The hotel staff is very responsive via email communications and I was able to maintain my reservation. Other than that, the front desk staff provided less than ideal service. I was hassled when attempting to change my payment method and double-charged. The grounds themselves were nice. Pool was a bit too cool but tolerable. The drinks were weak and overpriced. Definitely not a place for young singles unless you're planning to do things mostly outside of the resort.

title: Relaxing
review: What an oasis of a hotel, although slightly far from Phuket Airport, the JW Marriott in Khao Lak is a dream resort.  The rooms are perfectly up to the standards expected in any good hotel in Thailand, the best part was each room on the ground floor of the hotel was by the huge meandering pool.  So you could dip in to the pool directly from the terrace of your room.  Great property, fantastic beach, awesome staff, good choice of food and again a GREAT pool with a huge pool bar in the center. The spa is also huge but slightly expensive I would recommend the small and clean thai massage place as soon as you walk out of the gates of the hotel.  Overall a great relaxing stay and look forward to being back there. Most of the staff are german and very helpful.

title: The perfect getaway!!
review: When you stay at a hotel for a wedding you expect a "One size fit all" service.However, my family was in for a surprise.The service for each one was highly personalized and they took care of all our needs so graciously including ferrying me from one venue to another because I had hurt myself while dancing. The beach is like heavens have opened their doors for you.When you step into the crystal clear water, watch the sun go down with the majestic view of the property behind you,it makes you wish the trip would never end.The food is good and the best option is Thai as the Indian is a bit bland for our tastebuds.We recommend this for anybody and everybody.

title: Amazing Trip of a Lifetime!!!!
review: This review is long overdue!! My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in November 2011 and were treated to an amazing experience!!! This resort is one of the most relaxing places in the world and the beaches are beautifully maintained!   What really stood out most to us were the staff. Everyone at the resort went out of their way to make sure we were happy and enjoying our stay. The people always would great us with a smile and were there for anything you needed!  The rooms were amazing as well. It was a perfect combination of Thai culture but still maintained a modern feel. We stayed in the pool access room which was perfect for a quick swim.   A tip for anyone who plans to visit: Stop by some of the local restaurants along the beach!! The people at each of the restaurants…

title: Paradise
review: Jw Marriott koah lak was recommended to us by our travel agent as we wanted a realllllyyyyy relaxing holiday without the hustle and bustle of Phuket .  We found a little slice of paradise when we arrived.  CHECK IN - was lovely after a long trip from brisbane via Singapore  - greeted with a smile, cold drink and cool towels - no standing at reception - seated in a nice lounge and all the check in arrangements were done from there - quickly and with ease.  Then personally escorted to room.  ROOM - we had 2 interconnecting rooms (as we have a 8 year old) in block 5 - pool access room ! Make sure if you book pool access you request blocks 3, 4 or 5 as they are definitely the best.  Rooms cleaned daily and an amazingly good bed with huge pillows ! Exterior of rooms a little worn but…

title: Great honeymoon stay
review: Recommend the duplex suite as it is spacious and offers views over the whole property! Great choice of 4 restaurants with the pick being the Thai and Mediterranean dinning. Would also be great for families as a quite area!

title: A great hideaway with excellent services and amenities.
review: The JW Marriot was a great resort to stay at.  The staff are very friendly and helpful and you are made to feel welcome once you arrive.  The rooms were stunning and decorated with rich woods. The room has a sizeable balcony where you can enjoy the view. Most rooms overlook a pool that winds its way throughout the property. In the five days I stayed there the pools were not overcrowded at all. But the resort's beach is nearby so why would one sit at the pool when you can sit near the Andaman sea whose waters are warm and inviting.  The resort has a gym along with wonderful spa that I tried on two different occasions. Don't miss the moisturizing facial or the Honey, Yoghurt and Coconut body scrub.  Dining onside was lovely as well. I spent my time eating in the Thai restaurant…

title: Wonderful, relaxing, affordable luxury
review: We arrived around 4pm and our rooms weren't ready. Our room smelled musty, mouldy and we found it hard to sleep for the smell. I noticed it has brought on my asthma slightly, not had it for decades. Not surprising since the Sofitel was decimated during the tsunami (it's old name), check out the pics of the Sofitel before/after the tsunami. http://www.google.com.au/search?q=sofitel+khao+lak+tsunami&hl=en&rls=com.microsoft:en-AU:IE-SearchBox&rlz=1I7ADRA_en&prmd=imvns&tbm=isch&tbo=u&source=univ&sa=X&ei=zOjbT63tLIfg2QWUysDODQ&ved=0CFwQsAQ&biw=1065&bih=736 This may account for the smell, maintenance issues, staining on the tubs and sinks. We spoke to a staff member who helped clean the mess up and said it was like watching a child grow, bringing the hotel back to life!  If you dine…

title: Stunning resort
review: Recently honeymooned at this wonderful resort. We loved it so much that we stayed there for the majority of our time. The restaurants are top class and relatively inexpensive. Breakfast is amazing, as are all the other facilities. The swimming pool is a 3k lagoon all around the resort, genius design, you can swim from your room to the beach. The staff are very amiable if a little inexperienced. I will certainly return.

title: Flawless stay, words cannot describe
review: Must note we purchased this as a Scoopon voucher and it was extremely cheap our budget would not allow it otherwise. I must say this hotel is amazing and the service A+++. We have a room on the 3 km of pool 4 steps and you are in. Soft bed, tv, even a phone in the loo.  The room is large, with mood lighting and the size of the bath is enormous. Just perfect. Breakfast has that much food you don't know where to start. It caters for everyone they even blend whatever fruit & vege you want to make a fresh fruit juice, what ever you want I'm sure they have it. The staff are willing to help, nothing is a problem. Internet in the room included, they have kids club, deli, squash, tennis, volleybeall. Here is an information sheet with activities for the day, some are free. They even have…

title: Superstar Service Staff!
review: This is one of the finest properties I ve stayed in. I believe that hotels are more that bricks and mortar, its the people that make the difference. We were always greeted by smiling faces and eveready staff going out of their way to help us. The rooms were fantastic, the pillows and the bed were super comfy, I was very impressed with the quality of the linen. We had a pool access room, which was the best feature of this resort. We could literally swim to all corners, though we didnt try that ;) considering that the pool in its entirety is around 3.6km long! God only knows how they manage to keep the pool in pristine condition. The staff from room service 'Po' his name was, came to meet me on the first day as I wanted someone to understand how to make my protein shake. I told…

title: 10 wonderful days
review: Greeted with cool towels and drinks on arrival and taken to room within 20 minutes. Staff all friendly, attentive and wecolming throughout our stay. Swim up room was definitely worth the extra. Pools were clean even though surrounded by beautiful gardens, and therefore leaves. This is humid, wet Thailand and therefore wood is going to get effected by weather and especially surrounded by so much water but maintenance was discreetly ongoing throughout the resort. We left the resort only once to visit market, spent time walking beach, the sea is quite rough at this time of year but warm and the rest of our time spent in the pools. Lots of towels available and iced water served direct to your sun bed. This is rainy season but we were lucky and had 10 days of sunny days, not even…

title: Relaxing
review: We enjoyed our 6 night stay and found the quality of the hotel to be up to standard. The facilities were excellent and even though several days were rainy we still found things to do. The staff were very helpful and any problems were solved promptly. The breakfasts were amazing, the selection and quality and service was outstanding. We were surprised at the distance from the airport but the transfers were luxurious and we ultimately enjoyed the journey and the fact that we were in a more secluded spot. The opportunities for shopping we're very limited, which did not bother us too much. Overall a relaxing and comfortable stay, our bed was very comfortable and clean, and our visit to the spa was wonderful.

title: Khao Lak an excellent resort
