review: This is one of the resort that i would preferr visiting again. The location, Room Size, room view, swimming pool, room service etc, you name anything and each one of them is AA+. one of the best location which is actually on the beach.  excellent choice of food for everyone.

title: Not worth the time and money
review: This hotel is a big disappointment from day one of arrival.  Room and bathroom decors were old, worn, and cheap looking showing signs of lack of maintenance.  I was particularly put off by the disgusting yellowish granite which was used as bathroom wall, basin, tub, shower & floor as there were discoloration and stains all over the place.  The piece of wood used to separate the face basins into two parts was worn and disgusting (see photos).  I had to use a white towel to cover it in order to put my own bathroom amenities.  Before I booked this hotel, I had tried to find room photos on the internet but was surprised to find none.  Now, I know the reason why.  Furthermore, stains and holes were found in the face towels, quilt cover and pillow cases on arrival which I had to…

title: Oh my word - out of this world!
review: This place is phenomenal - simply amazing.  Everything from the mile upon mile of pool, top quality restaurants through to the delightful staff (who seem to vastly outnumber guests), this place is great in every way!  The dining in the restaurants was excellent but we did enjoy going to the beach restaurants - great food and amazing value.  On out first day, we went to the first restaurant on the left (cant remember name) and met 'Gecko man' who organises day trips.  He was fabulous, such a lovely guy and really looks after you.  He did an elephant safari day trip with him and canoeing - a great day out!  He also took us to a local tailor later that day (our request, he wasnt trying to 'sell' to us) which saved us a cab fair.  When we returned and were exhausted, he then serves…

title: Blown Away
review: We went to Khoa Lak for the second part of our holiday to unwind.  We wanted to compare it to Koh Samui as the relaxing part of our holiday.  Khao Lak is about 2 hours north of Patong and we hired a taxi which seemed the only way to get there.  It cost us 2500 bht and we checked around and this was the going price with everyone.   We were constantly blown away by the JW Marriott  from the moment we arrived.  The pools wound around the resort for about 3 kms and it took about 45 minutes to walk the pools.  The beach is beautiful and very safe for swimming, a few waves, but safe.  Whilst you relax away on your deck chair at the beach they bring around chilled water or you can order food and alcoholic beverages of course.  There were plenty of tours you can do from Khao Lak but we…

title: "Just what we had hope for loved Thailand "
review: We stayed from the 16th April 2012 for 9 nights and  booked a interconnecting room with the help from Roger who works for the Marriott head office who was just  amazing thank you ;)  this room type is only available  on  request as there are only 5 rooms in the  resort with a swim out  ( block 5 ) this room was for our 11 year daughter and she loved having her own room, and we loved having the two bathrooms the rooms are excellent .  The swim out rooms are a must. The hotel shuttle works well to go into Khao Lak .  It was my husbands birthday when we were there and when we got back from dinner and fireworks on the beach that night there was a lovely cake in the room for him very sweet.  We found the service outstanding from the bar to the Japanese restaurant and kids club.  We…

title: very Marriott. very good. Very Comfortable.
review: i only had ONE problem with the hotel - The rooms seemed a bit low for a 5-Star resort. But not massively low. just a little low. I expected a bit more. (that's all)  but, once you experienced the rest of the hotel, it doesn't matter any more ;)  the service was incredible. the food was amazing - really.  the breakfast buffet was so good. and the head chef was extremely helpful. he made me some extra dishes when he found out i was vegetarian. he even had some special vegetarian finger food ready for me on my following days at the hotel :)   5-Star service.  the hotel is lovely. its typical Marriott.  perhaps a bit conservative... a bit boring maybe... but its impeccable.   Khao Lak is great for people that want to be isolated. its a great place to relax. I stayed there for 4…

title: Perfect resort for relaxing and doing nothing
review: We went to this resort for my birthday, 8 nights, and it is abosultely one of the better ones I visited.  Even when almost full it does not feel crowded at all.  Overall the hotel is in perfect shape and very well maintained and up to today's standards.  WIFI works very well all around the resort.   The staff is very attentive.  For example for my birthday my wife went to see if they could do something special like a small cake and they told her that they already arranged somehing (they had seen my birthdayon my passport) at the restaurant we had reservations.  They organized a special desert and a wishing balloon for us which was very nice.  The rooms are spacious and very clean, as are the bathrooms. A lot of the other reviews recommend the pool access room.  With the package…

title: Heavenly!
review: I've stayed at this beautiful property on two occasions - once in October 2011 with my mother, and again with my husband and parents in April 2012, each time for 7 days.  It's a great shame to see some negative comments among the reviews, as our experience has been overwhelmingly positive, and we're quite picky!  My husband and I in particular travel frequently and stay in 5-star hotels and resorts around the world, so our expectations are quite high.    My only (very mild) disappointment, and one of the two points that I agree with from some of the other reviewers, is that on our second stay one of the things we loved at breakfast was no longer offered - an area with small shot glasses to sample a special juice of the day (eg pandamus, lemongrass) with an explanation alongside…

title: Beautiful
review: Absolutely beautiful.  Lovely staff, clean rooms, amazing pool.  Very good restaurants and food.  Beautiful day spa. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Still very nice, but not perfect anymore
review: Returning to a place that you once enjoyed very much is always a bit risky. You never get the same experience twice, and alas, it was like that with this hotel as well.  We stayed here as a couple in 2010 when the hotel was brand new, and loved every minute. But at that time the hotel was operating at about 10% of its' capacity, so of course they had the time to spoil us completely. This time it was 60% booked and felt quite different.  The service is excellent, what a wonderful staff they have at the Marriott! We met again several of the people we remembered from last time, so it is probably a nice place to work. Also, the pool is of course still great, we very much enjoyed swimming this long meandering water trail. The fitness room is large, well equipped (also with loose…

title: So far a bit disappointed
review: We are currently on day 3 of 13. The hotel seems lovely, our room is a family pool access room, which is spacious with lots of seating area and massive bath tub. Unfortunately we didn't get the welcome we are used to... We have stayed at JW Marriott Phuket 5 times and always get a consistant welcome and service throughout our stay.  We are used to being welcomed with the floral garland and drink upon arrival and check in but at Khao Lak did not receive this. The manager was even in the lobby when we arrived so he would have seen we did not get this but did nothing. (we were the only people in the lobby at the time).  When we were checked into our room it was lovely but no towel art or flowers like we're used to at Phuket. Those little touches are what make the holiday special,…

title: Fantastic
review: A much overdue review- we stayed in April as a family with 3 teenagers.  Loved everything about the resort including pool, spa, breaKfasts, friendly service and happy hour as others have reported.  We were there during the tsunami warning and could not fault the way it was managed by staff.    However the best thing about this place for us was the proximity to Blue Mist - one of the beach restaurants on the right hand side of the resort.   The food is fantastic and very reasonably priced, atmosphere laid back and a good change from the more 'sterile' resort feel the cocktails  delicious, massages superb and the laundry service reliable and also very reasonably priced.  What sets Blue Mist apart though is the fantastic owners and staff - not only did they arrange  really well…

title: Tranquility
review: Currently staying in this resort on day 4 of 7. This is the second stay in 12 months. Like last year this hotel has very good accomodation (comfortable and well maintained) with excellent staff and a great breakfast. The location is in a peaceful spot with some excellent restaurants on the beach.

title: An unbelievable resort experience
review: For some background--I have stayed in very nice hotels, done some of the middle-of-the-range resorts in North America/Carribean, and have recently done a tour across France and Spain staying in decent budget hotels for our honeymoon.  This place is absolutely incredible.  We booked through a deal voucher as it's the off-season, and it seemed like others were there on similar types of deals.  By far it's the greatest value I've ever received for the money, but the experience transcends "good value".  Pool access: others have raved about it, and it's all true.  The place is totally connected through various channels of pools.  One of our favorite activities was to open the patio door of our hotel room, jump into the pool, and swim to the poolside bar for lunch.  My wife and I are…

title: Great service, lovely relaxed resort
review: I was there as part of a work conference and the thing that really stood out was the service. The staff were all excellent and incredibly helpful. May is low season so the hotel was quiet and the weather was more wet than sunny. The beach is great with good waves, nobody on it, no hawkers and the sea did not have much of a current at this time of year anyway. I did not get to experience much in the way of hotel amenities but the huge pool was excellent and the rooms that go straight out on to it are a nice change. Some of our group had families with them and they were all very positive about the hotel from a children's perspective.  The resort is isolated and Khao Lak itself is pretty quiet with some bars and restaurants but this is not Phuket although only an hour away. If you…

title: Amazing! Wished we'd stayed longer....
review: We stayed 3 nights and it was way too short. Partly because we spent one full day on a snorkelling trip to a spectacular island (but more about that later...)  Summary: amazing huge luxurious resort with ridiculously good pools and a long expanse of beach. Very hard to fault. Having said that, we were on a Marriott redemption so cost wasn't an issue. The fantastic breakfast spread was included, and so were unlimited cocktails at happy hour. If we had to pay for the resort ourselves, I think the word expensive would feature in my review several times. I don't think it would put me off staying there but we would think twice about the buffet and cocktails!  I won't repeat the comments made by other reviewers about the rooms (wonderful!), service (excellent!), length of the pools,…

title: Best resort in the world. AMAZING!!
review: There is nothing to fault at the JW Marriott Resort and Spa. This resort is stunning. My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights for our honeymoon in May 2012 and we fell in love with this resort. The resort is huge, we discovered parts of the resort every day. The restaurants are great. The 8 ball and ping-pong tables were fun when it was raining outside. It's located about 1.5 hours from Phuket so when we wanted a day in Phuket/Patong we hired a driver for 8 hours (~$90 AUD in total). The markets in Khao Lak are fantastic, plenty of great restaurants and shopping near by. We will definately be back to this resort one day. Breakfast buffet was amazing.  The bathroom was wonderful and the bath was MASSIVE. The bed was so comfortable. Loved all the pools and the swim up bar. The…

title: Great place – some flaws but remember points of comparison
review: What this resort is and isn’t……  What it is……It’s a very good resort on a lovely, quiet stretch of beach. Perfect if you have kids and want activities for them as well as the presence of others their age. The beach is pristine, very good by any standards and is neither seedy nor full of hawkers as some others in Thailand. The rooms are large and well appointed. We were upgraded from the family studio to the duplex upon arrival and it was very spacious plus near the beach. Yes, in an all-wood room with wood furniture, you’ll get a few scratches here and there, but very nice and well insulated for sound, which is important as the meandering portion of the pool will be right outside your window.  What it is not…..The people posting the worst reviews have a flawed set of…

title: Heaven
review: Fantastic five star hotel in Khao Lak. If you are looking for a totally relaxing holiday experience this is the place to go. The hotel is immaculately clean, staff are friendly and helpful, buffet breakfast is fantastic, great gym and there are no words to describe the pool. There are several restaurants along the beach if you don't want to eat at the hotel or you can catch a taxi or shuttle bus into Khao Lak city centre (about 10 minutes away) for more restaurants, shops and supermarket. I cannot fault this hotel in any way, a very luxurious and relaxing experience.

title: excellent service
review: I was there from May 8-11,2012 for meeting and I also work in the hospitality business so I find myself demanding. Service at JW Marriott Khao Lak is superb.staff at the front desk took a good care of my requested and escort me to the room.Breakfast area is nice and a lots of food & beverage offer,chef & service staff are friendly and helpful. In the evening we had a cocktail reception and again I order fried noodles with the chef and he went out of his way to served my order at my table and polity told me to enjoy my food.Next day we were at the lobby area and find the way to Olive restaurant,along the way we met the housekeeping manager so we asked her for direction and guess what,she called the restaurant and told the restaurant that we were on our way for 12 people.we reach…

title: Best value holiday we have ever had
review: I would highly recommend this place.  We got a scoopon.com.au deal and with the price we paid for 7 nights, this has been the best value holiday we have ever had.  We will definitely be back.  The breakfast buffet at the waterfront restaurant is as good if not better than any breakfast buffet in resorts we have ever stayed in.  One minor thing - the whole restaurant could have been a bit more airconditioned.  The food at the resort was pretty good but the best dinner we had was actually at a place along the beach to the right of the resort called blue mist restaurant.  Excellent phad thai with chicken and the steamed white snapper with soy sauce and the steamed vegetables were absolutely amazing.  We finished with mango sticky rice.  it was a great meal in a great location with…

title: Beautiful hotel, water wonderland, very expensive, slightly isolated
review: We stayed at the J W Marriott Khao Lak for six night starting 5 May 2012.  We spent the previous week in Koh Samui (Centara) and wanted to experience the other side of Thailand to keep things interesting.  We arrived at Phuket airport and booked a taxi to take us to Khao Lak (1 hour).  There is a huge variation in taxi prices from Phuket to Khoa Lak.  The best deal that we could find was Boss on Email: cheaper_khaolak@ymail.com Local Mobile: 085 7861378 who charges 1000B to Khoa Lak and 1200B to the J W Marriott which is outside of Khoa Lak.  Our driver met us at the airport with a sign clearly showing our names and hotel, had a clean air conditioned car, and spoke a little English.  No detours, no hassle.  On arrival we had a pleasant welcome and were guided into the impressive…

title: Swimmer's Paradise
review: What sets this beautiful resort apart from its peers for us is the hours of enjoyment we spent swimming in the hotel's many interconnected swimming canals and pools. There are also many rooms which open right onto the canals. The sea in front of the hotel is also wonderfully swimmable, clean and with no strong currents and undertow. There were a few incidents of minor jelly fish stings, so check with the beach staff on times to swim.  Other notables for us are: the great breakfast variety of good quality offerings so definitely book your stay inclusive of this meal; the beautiful courtyard layout of the in-house spa is well worth a visit; and the magnificent cloud formations and sunsets over the Andaman sea.  In addition, there are also adjacent local eateries, massage stalls…

title: Beautiful hotel, great beach, wonderful pool
review: This hotel architecture is a nice blend of Western and Thai. The room is spacious with amazing bed. The swimming pool winds around the property with total lenght over 3 km. The beach is beautiful with a long strecth of beach front area. It is hard to imagine the sunami disaster happening here 7 years ago.  The food and drinks are expensive, which is to be expected for a 5-star hotel. There are a few local restaurants on the beach nearby for cheaper price. I tried one and it was very good, worth trying for both experience and wallet.  Overall, if you have money, it is a good place to indulge yourself.

title: stay here!!
review: A hour and fifteen munites drive from the airport.Stayed here for three nights at the end of april 2012.Booked three rooms for my Dad and brother and wife. What a fantastic hotel. I cannot fault it.The moment we walked in we were seated with cold towels offered to refresh ourselves and a drink. The room had a real wow factor high end finishes in the bathroom with all the fittings and fixtures. The towels are huge as are the pillows! We had a balcony looking out on to the pool with a kids waterslide. The pools are huge,3kms i read somewhere, and crystal clean, i spent most of my time either in the pools, which have spas, or in the ocean which has enough surf to do some bodysurfing with the free body boards provided.   Every night we would all meet for the happy hour and a half!…

title: Fanstastic Getaway
review: Stayed here for 7 nights in April 2012.    Words cannot express my feeling and thought about this place.  We had a pool access twin room.  This is the highlight of the stay!!  The whole resort is surrounded by this stream which connects to the main pool.  A slow walk around this pool takes approximately 45 mins.  Everything was in immaculate condition.  Service was fantastic.  Room service was a bit pricy but the taste was good.  Buffet breakfast was superb!!  A lot of variety which all tasted so good!!  The only downfall about this resort is - it's located more than 2 hours drive from Phuket city.  We didn't end up going there - which was fine with us as time seemed to go by so quickly anyway.  NOTE:  I mentioned earlier that room service is quite pricy.  Well, there are a few…

title: Beautiful beach and a mile of pool(s)
review: We were fortunate enough to stay at this hotel for 8 days and loved every minute of it.  We found all the other reviews to be accurate and only have a few things to add...  The hotel offers free Happy Hour from 5 to 6 PM for Rewards Members who are Gold and higher.  These members will also be offered a free upgrade to a two floor suite which are lovely.  When we were there the occupancy rate was over 90% and the hotel appeared empty because of its size and layout...except at the breakfast buffet which is quite busy.   The hotel has free air hockey, pool table, ping pong and other fun things to keep the kids busy including a very good Kids Club.  There is also a nice Business Centre with new large touch screen computers and reading areas.  You can borrow books and magazines from…

title: Great service, albeit an Aussie and German enclave...
review: This is my second visit to Khao Lak JW MARRIOTT.  I must say that the 5-star service standards are on the whole, still great. Staff are mostly attentive. I've noticed that there are additions to the staff: previously, there was only a Russian girl working at the reception but now, they've hired an Australian and a couple of other Nordic/German staff in other parts of the hotel.  The hotel is starting to look exhausted; there's noticeable wear and tear everywhere - balcony, flooring, wooden panelling, etc. But I understand that the tropical weather is very punishing so that mostly excellent service somewhat makes up for that.  My only gripe is that there appears to be some kind of double standards in service for some service personnel - the Thai staff seem to be a lot warmer, and…

title: Wonderful
review: Our young family (kids 5 and 3) spent 7 nights at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak and it was absolutely fantastic.  Even though the resort was 80% occupied, it really felt as though it was at 50% capacity.  The resort is so well designed, you can have as much or as little privacy as you want.  The pool(s) are what makes this resort so special.  Almost all the pools are contiguous and you can get to almost anywhere in the resort by swimming to it.  We bought an inflatable boat to put our things in and spent most of the day swimming along the meandering, seamingly endless swimways, stopping at the pool bars for a dink or the bubble chairs for some relaxation.  The Service is excellent and is always with a smile.  Staff are friendly and eager to please.  The buffett breakfast (included…

title: AMAZING... Best Hotel in the world!!
review: We just stayed at the JW Marriott Khao Lak in April 2012 and had the most amazing time.   I cannot fault the staff, location, rooms, pool, facilities. It was honestly. so great!! The staff are really what make the hotel what it is... they are so friendly, caring and considerate. They made us feel like apart of the Marriott family.   The pool is the best way to travel around the hotel. With 3.2km's of it, you can pretty much swim to anywhere you like. The pool bar serves delicious cocktails and food.   There are plenty of activities arranged by the staff, that you can be kept busy, or you can relax in your own space and not be disturbed.   During our stay we experienced a Tsunami warning. The alarms went off and the staff directed us to the safest location in the hotel. They were…

title: Great for relaxing
review: The JW Mariott in Khao Lak is a perfect place to stay for a relaxing break. Rooms, particularly the pool access are great, the resort did not seem busy, the breakfast was really great and there was nice cheap Thai restaurants either side of the hotel. We also went into Khao lak for dinner a couple of nights which was easy and a nice change from the resort.  If you are coming for shopping stick with Bangkok or Phuket but this is the place to be if you are looking for a beach/food/pool relaxing holiday.

title: 'Amazing......'
review: My husband and I went to the Marriott with 2 friends. We bought a 'Scoopon On' deal and we were very sceptical about the whole thing. To our amazement this Resort is just beautiful. We stayed in a 'pool view room', the bed was huge and the pillows were comfy. The bathroom was massive and the bath was fantastic. We literally walked out our back door and straight into the pool. The restaurants were quite expensive to eat at in the resort so most nights we ate at the 'Blue Mist Restaurant' (Mr Moe & Mr Picks) along the beach. You could also get wonderful massages, facials etc etc there. We also went into Khao Lak for dinner where there is a selection of great restaurants along the main street. It should only cost 200 baht in a 'Tuk Tuk'. The staff are very friendly and the service…

title: Pleasant stay
review: This was our first trip to Thailand and the idea was to have two days sightseeing in Bangkok and then a relaxing week in a beach resort. Bangkok was disappointing and we spent most of our time dealing with unscrupulous taxi and tuk tuk drivers - but that's another story. We were really looking forward to the peaceful leg of our trip and the JW Marriott and Khao Lak were exacly how we imagined after reading all of these reviews. Highlights: The large winding pool is great and there are plenty of quiet sunbathing spots dotted around away from the main pool/beach if you want them. Room was nice with big comfy bed. We had to be moved half way through our stay because of a leak with our air conditioning unit so stayed in block 1 and block 4. We had pool access rooms which were great…

title: Excellent and relaxing stay!
review: 3 friends and I recently stayed here for my birthday. We booked 2 pool deluxe rooms which turned out to be very nice. The beds were large and very comfortable with massive pillows. The bathroom was large and well equipped. We had some issues with our room key not working however this was resolved by the staff without issue. The buffet breakfast (included) was amazing and it was difficult to not overeat! The staff were very helpful and polite and everyone said hello to you as you walk around the resort. The beach was enjoyable but we preferred the pool which is amazingly large. The cocktails were good (and very good value at happy hour). The restaurants were OK, we liked Olive and Waters Edge best as they provided a mix of Asian and Western dishes and were good value and very…

title: Paradise
review: Stayed for one week with three other girlfriends. Also got a cheap scoopon deal to stay here. It was amazing. Best pool I've ever been in - you never have to worry about having people (in particular kids!) crowding you. Beach is really nice. Restaurants were on the whole really good and not expensive for a hotel. Drinks were reasonably priced. Great service. Squash courts and other things to do as well which was good. Awesome breakfast. Sunset is magnificent. Day spa is a bit exxy but you can just go to a massage pLace 20 meters up the beach for cheap. In all I was really impressed with my stay here.

title: What a joint.. !!!
review: We have just returned home after 4 fantastic days at this resort and all I can come up with is WOW!!  The room was all class - huge comfortable bed( eh, if you like them on the firm side that is!!), really elegant glass and tile bathroom and a sundeck overhanging the pool to watch the world go by! The  pool is simply sensational - the largest in south east asia - and so well designed that even though the resort was packed you never got the feeling of clutter or the worry of swimming into someone else head on! There are plenty of alcoves beside the pool, hedged in with plants and containing two loungers to ensure that you feel in your own little world!   Staff, across the board, are friendly and helpful but that is the Thai people generally ...  a special mention must go to…

title: Smelly bedding, confusing hotel layout
review: Have just returned home from KhaoLak after staying at Krabi and Phuket. This 5 star property was to be our final luxury. After hard beds in Thai hotels, the softness of the beds and absolutely enormous pillows was very welcome. However the smell of the bedding was unbearable. It smelled musty and mouldy and I resorted to wrapping my towel around my pillow to get some sleep. After letting management know the next day and being told the bedding be would be completely changed, we found only the pillow cases and duvet cover was changed, or the smell was in all bedding as it remained for the 2 other days we stayed. Management was very apologetic and said they would 'deal' with the housekeeping staff, which made me reluctant to complain again, feeling the poor Thai staff may suffer as…

title: Lifestyles of the rich and famous
review: I was fortunate to get one of those deals for a week at this resort very cheaply.  I would gladly pay full price next time. What a lovely relaxing place to stay.  Anything you might want is there but you can also shop or dine out at the local shopping area.There is also a small supermarket, restaurant and shops just outside the front gates. The room we had was ground floor.  Three steps off the balcony and you were in the fabulous pool. It winds all around the resort and it took us an hour to swim around and back to our room (not including stopping at the 2 pool bars). The beach is at your door as well.  It certainly did not feel crowded although I was told it was pretty much full.The breakfast had a very extensive choice and the restaurants were world class. The rooms were well…

title: A Great Place!
review: Awesome in every way. A great hotel in a wonderful setting. Friendly staff. Many activities for kids and adults. Huge swimming pool and a great beach. A nice an well equipped gym and a beautiful spa dapartment. Several nice thai restaurants on the beach. We stayed here for 12 days and did not want to leave.

title: Jw Marriott
review: First time here and loving it. Usually stay in smaller hotels in Thailand but decided it try this one and have not been disappointed. Great beds and rooms clean and well serviced. Recommend staying here for a complete break and rest!!

title: Fantastic for relaxing
review: Stayed 8 nights in late March in pool access room.  The service is fantastic and the property beautiful. The beach is long and well maintained and is great for jogging or taking a walk. Although the hotel had a lot of guests it did not feel crowded at all. The breakfast is as great as other reviewers have pointed out - it's difficult to stop eating! The food in the restaurants disappointed a little bit, but there was no problem finding great (and cheap) food at the nearby beach restaurants. We ate at most of them, our favourite was the one to the left of the hotel (great fresh fish and tiger prawns).   We used the gym, squash court and tennis courts - all in great condition and with good equipment. The spa is beautiful and we regretted only using it on our last day. A nice touch…

title: Best service ever!
review: Just came back from my holiday in thailand. Stayed here at the JW Marriott for 7 nights and I didn't want to leave! By far the best resort I've stayed at! Top service with friendly staff! I felt like I was being treated like a queen. Quick room service! Even though I was there when the latest earthquake happened in Indonesia, we were well looked after and comforted by the staff. We were evacuated to higher ground, then taken back to the resort and they put on a free Buffett dinner for us. Will deffinately be going back if I return to Thailand! Thanks JW Marriott Khao Lak staff :)

title: Depends what you are looking for...
review: Your experience at this hotel is going to depend a lot on how you approach it. If you are looking for a reasonably-priced hotel in Thailand with a ginormous pool (over 3km) and a sandy beach, this will fit the bill. My 4-year-old loved it. He spent the entire day in the pools... and there was plenty of variety in terms of pool options. There were also good food options for him - in particular the quesadilla and pizza worked out well. And the chocolate milkshake, of course.  If, on the other hand, you are attracted to this property because it is "5-star" or because it is Marriott's luxury flagship brand "JW", you may be disappointed. The property itself is not going to live up to those monikers. It is aging. And it's crowded - 292 rooms and 3km of pools are crammed together. I…

title: English Family visiting JW Marriott - Khao Lak
review: My wife and I stayed at the resort with our two children (aged 16 & 11) for two weeks during the UK Easter holidays.  This is a good time to visit Thailand as the weather is good and the seas are not too rough. Upon arrival to the hotel (located 85 minutes from Phuket airport) we we greeted by friendly reception staff offering cold towels and refreshing drinks. The booking in process took no longer than 10 minutes and we were escorted to our rooms (inter connecting).    The rooms were a good size complete with comfortable Super king size beds. The bathroom designed like a wet room had a very big bath, double sink, rain shower, soft closing toilet seat (nice touch) a phone and piped audio entertainment connected to 32" LCD tv in main room. The balcony comprised of a 3 seater…

title: Perfect
review: We have stayed there in our honeymoon for 2 nights, I definitely suggest honeymooners who are visiting to Phuket to add at least 2 more days to go to Khao Lak area. Khao Lak is 2-3 hours drive away from Phuket with a beautiful scenic route. Thera are nice hotels in this area and JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort & Spa is a great choice.  I may briefly say that; it was the best and most welcoming staff I have ever met. The Hotel is built next to the Ocean, on a large green area with water canals connecting all the rooms to the main pool. There is a great bar just next to the pool and there you may enjoy your drinks & food inside the pool with a great ocean-view.  Rooms are well decorated, large and clean. Welcoming drinks and massage was a compliment of the Hotel and that made us feel…

title: Absolute paradise
review: We recently spent a week at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak and had a wonderful stay - not a bad word to report on the whole experience!  We were picked up by the hotel from the airport in a new, air conditioned car and were given bottles of water and the hotel called to ask if there was anything we needed on our arrival. The trip took about an hour and we were blown away by how beautiful the reception is and the welcome we received from the staff, who provided us with all of the information we needed to make our stay enjoyable.  The room itself was gorgeous with plenty of space, a stunning bathroom and a very comfortable king sized bed. We also had a balcony overlooking the pools, where it was great to just sit, read a book and watch the world go by.  The breakfast each morning was…

title: Fabulous hotel and pool
review: We are a thirtysomething couple who stayed here for 5 nights in December, and we hoped it would be impressive because of the photos of the pool.  It was, and well worth the 1 hour transfer from Phuket.  The hotel is designed around the pool and to feel secluded, and it certainly worked, our standard room was spacious, and the balcony lovely (we were on the first floor), we spent a day or more there (which we have never done before), just because it was so comfy and had great views of the resort.  Lots of people had the pool entrance rooms, which did look great, and I would consider paying the extra for that next time (and we would go back).  We did pick Khoa Lak because it is quieter (go to Phuket if you want heavy night life), but the resort has nice restaurants, and activities…

title: Great hotel with a stunning beach
review: This is a nice resort, directly located on the Andaman Sea and it really looks impressive with lots of plants, trees and the biggest pool I have ever seen. The staff is very kind but too bad that some of them don’t speak proper English but I think you see that a lot in Thailand. The rooms are nice with a huge bathroom, we had the duplex suite, a good size balcony with partly sea view and very clean. Since this was a celebration trip for us, the management provided us with a nice bottle of sparkling wine.  The breakfast is the best with lots of hot and warm selections, great smoothies and egg and pancakes to order.   The location itself is kind of isolated and therefore for dinner you either need to take a taxi to a town nearby, use the hotel restaurants or use the privately…

title: Paradise in Thailand
review: We have just returned from a week at the Marriott in Khao Lak & what a great hotel this is, our room was on the 2nd floor overlooking the pool & gardens, very spacious & decorated in traditional Thai theme with our balcony overhanging the pool. the staff were excellent & always helpfull, the amenities very clean, bottled water delivered to our room every day. The resort has 4 restaurants, Thai, Japanese, Mediterranean & general themed each day. Breakfast was served in the main dining area with a selection that would satisfy anyone's taste. The hotel also had a deli for a light lunch or dinner, a gym, kid's club & an amazing spa, there was no shortage of sun lounges both at the beach & around the pool & also 2 swim up bars in 2 of the pools. The hotel restaurants are a bit pricey…

title: Great stay, even with the tsunami threat
review: I normally just read tripadvisor reviews but never actually comment. After an amazing stay at JW I feel compelled to write about it.  Having stayed previously at the banyan tree, I can certainly say that this was better. Atmosphere, guests and staff were all made our 10 night stay great.   This was put to the test when yesterday when there were 2 earthquakes and a tsunami threat.  The organisation and attitude of the staff was amazing and nothing could be faulted during the evacuation.  I would whole hearted recommend this hotel for any age group, and will compare all beau hotels against this standard next time. Well done JW!

title: Fantastic breakfast, long pool, family friendly beach
review: Hotel is nice, getting a bit older and some renewal would be required. Pool is long, if you pick family pool access room, you can literally jump into the water from your terrace and swim across the resort (long route!). Beach is nice, sand, kayaks available. Breakfast is large and one of the richest I have ever seen. No need to purchase full pension, nreakfast is really enough also for lunch. For dinner, you can go to the beach restaurants, cheap and very good food. My choice was the first on the left called FIRMAI. Beer is 3x less and food 6x less than in the hotel (with relevant presentation) but you watch sunset with your legs in sand with very authentic atmosphere. Trip to Similan islands organized by SEE BEES is great. On catamaran, you spend 20 minutes more than on the…

title: Fantastic for kids
review: Have just returned from a week at the jw Marriott khao lak. This is a great relaxing resort for families, probably a bit boring for others as the resort is away from town and not much happening other than activities organised by resort. The pool was amazing as most reviews state. We only ate at the resort Thai restaurant once and only because it was part of our package. Despite this the meal was added onto our account - check carefully! The Thai meal at the resort was pretty ordinary and cost over  TB 4000 for 2 adults and one small child. At the restaurants outside the resort on the beach the food was better and approx TB 600. Breakfast is great we were there at approx 7am most mornings (our 4YO was up anyway) and we didn't find it busy at all. Staff lovely. We used the kids…

title: Amazing place. Straight out of a screensaver.
review: This place was amazing. We were picked up from the airport by there personal shuttle. This I highly reccommend as the hotel is more than an hour from the hotel. So get to the hotel and the staff was amazing, very friendly. Our room was right off the pool with access from our porch. The food was great and again the staff was very nice. If your looking to lay around on the beach and enjoy a relaxing hotel this is it. Oh and use the Spa. The massages are great. P.S. Take bug spray or you will get eaten alive.

title: Stunning
review: I enjoyed a 5 night stay at this wonderful hotel.   The hotel boasts an amazing swimming pool which encompasses the whole grounds. I have never witnesses such an impressive pool of all the 5 star hotel I've stayed in around the world.   The rooms are spacious and all have balconies. Breakfast is good and there are many restaurants in and around the hotel.   Staff are good, there were some communication issues with the front office, however this should not detract from the fact that the staff were courteous even if their English was not up to standard.    I would highly recommend.

title: Lovely hotel in quiet location
review: We booked a pool access room and have room 3023 which is fantastic I am writing this review from the comfy lounger on the patio just two steps from the amazing pool. The pool(s) are amazing and great to swim around but can get a little boring for kids after a week. Good gym and small library available and nice touches like the times available to read in the lobby every day. We found the kids club just too young for our 11yr old but great for younger kids. We have only eaten breakfast in the hotel which is fine but as many say not really 5 star but great for kids with pancakes and smoothies the mango ginger and lime is lovely! The restaurants on the beach are all very good and amazingly great value last night we were in the Andaman restaurant with the 3 metres from our table 2 x…

title: Place to be with a big family
review: Even though it was quite a long drive from Phuket airport, but once we are settled in the memorable experience starts. We got upgraded to the pool access room 1018, within 15 mins of checking we found oursleves in a free flow pool. In the afternoon, I played tennis with a knocker at a reasonable price. Overall the hotel encourages guests to spend all their vocation within the hotel with happy hours pool bar/included breakfast.  Overall I recommend this place to a big family willing to spend from one to two weeks.

title: A relaxing girls weekend with great service, a fun happy hour at the pool, and a quiet beach away from the hawkers and traffic t
review: The staff were very helpful in getting us a room near friends and that met our needs. The lazy river is fantastic to swim around in but doesn't have any current so expect a small amount of effort from one pool bar to the other. The breakfast is open until 11 which is great to sleep in on the comfortable beds and eat enough to not need lunch. I gave the rooms a 4 only because they are a little dated and worn compared to the JW Phuket, but maintained quite well. There are a few local thai restaurants on either side of the resort on the beach selling cheap and delicious food at a fraction of the hotel prices (great for a break from the resort). Namely if facing the ocean walk to the right if the resort and visit Blue Mist. The owner speaks good English (though not all staff) and is…

title: Fantastic hotell but hit it between seasons
review: Clean, friendly, beautiful, good resturants, right on the beach wich is not to crowded. The thing i missed was the white coral sand and smaller waves maybe with a chans to snorckel right of from the beach. Quite at night but not a bad thing if you are trying ot charge the batteries after a long winter.Spice upthe stay with a couple of days in Bangkok before you fly home.

title: I love this hotel
review: This was a great hotel!! Great service, clean and  located by the beach.

title: Don't forget to bring your water inflatables!
review: Having read other reviews posted recently, we just wanted to remind those travelling with kids to bring inflatable rings, dinghys and other pool toys because this resort with its amazing connected pool/canals is made for it like no other place we have been to before - we couldn't keep our kids out of the pool. We took advice and ate our best meals at the restaurants that are very close by on the beach - at 50-60% lower prices than the hotel. Ma Ma Greeting at the end of the few along on the right hand side as you leave the hotel facing the sea is highly recommended. Also, make sure you stop at the Coffee and Cake house about 15 km along the road back to Phuket island which raises money for the local orphanage ( mainly from the Tsunami in 2004); the banana cake is delicious and…

title: Great facility, service leaves a lot to be desired
review: Stayed at the resort in earl March in one of the pool view rooms. Have really enjoyed the enormous swimming pool at the resort and the room itself, however on the service side there are lots of rooms of improvement required.  Our bag was taken by concierge upon arrival, however after not seeing my bag 2 hours after arriving in our room the alarm bell was raised. Calls to the front desk and concierge had them asking me what my bag actually looked like - a big sign of concern. We decided to check this out at the front desk and it took me another 30 minutes to locate the bag. Turns out that they have sent our bag to the wrong room. After the bag was finally being located there was no apology or service recovery offered by the hotel - not something that you will expect from a 5 star…

title: great place for familys with teens.
review: Great place for a family holiday.  Recreation team were wonderful with my 15 y son , tennis lessons, table tennis, bike rides and always willing to give him a challenge  at a game of chest. The rooms we found are well keep and service staff  service rooms twice a day, even turn down beds.  The pool(3km all around resort) here was the best high light. It made it easy for us to exercise and work off the extra calories we took in at the yummy BF. Best resort and will stay again. All stuff were lovely  and so helpful with anything we needed. Meals at resort were very nice but pricy. There are beach restaurant on left of resort. We found MA MA’s Greeting (last beach restaurant on LEFT) Served the best authentic meals and my 15 y an also self-acclaimed spring roll expert said they are…

title: The Best Hotel EVER!!!
review: Our family got an extremely special rate through Travel Zoo for this hotel.   If we had known this hotel was so deluxe, we would have spent more vacation time there!   Amazing hotel, and amazing attention to detail!!  We will be back, and it will be for a longer period of time!  Compliments to the management team at this Marriott!

title: Great Hotel!
review: A beautiful hotel! Very large. It is in the middle of nowhere but the hotel has everything you need. Breakfast was great. Big american style buffet. The rooms were beautiful! Clean, decorative with great view. I had a feeling of luxury from this hotel! Downstairs there are big gorgeous touchscreen computers for guests to use for internet. There was even a library and I loved taking magazines to read at pool. Huge bathtub! There were problems with hot water. We came on the once a year promotion from travelzoo.com for $87 per night. I suggest for dinner to go eat on the little thai resturants next door on the beach, much cheaper! The pool was fun (something to see!), gorgeous beach with chairs, drinks, umbrellas, whatever you need.  The only problem with the hotel is that the…

title: Great staff, perfect beach, good food, great rooms!
review: My wife and I spent two weeks here in Feb '12.  We absolutely loved the place.  Our pool access room was great, big enough, and very quiet.  not sure if we were lucky with no noisey neighbours, but we slept really well (in our huge bed).  It looked like we were in the newer part of the resort, which is quite big, but they seem to keep the place well maintained on a constant basis.  Some pool access rooms were behind small 'garden' areas, where as our terrace opened straight onto the pool.  Our terrace had no glass barriers wheres others did (might be useful if you have kids. The pool is absolutely wonderful and runs throughout the property.  This is probably why the property seems so quiet.  The beach must be a few miles long and a mixtures of nice sand and a few corally bits. …

title: Nice huge hotel but need to refresh all the aging equipment
review: Stay in this place as I had not tried Marriott before . I must say the place is fantastic and very kids friendly with lots of "canals" to swim around.  However our family did not enjoyed the stay here , was not comfortable with the stay . Maybe it was due to the multiple failure of the room equipment , I had a few changes of the bar fridge and to throw away a few bottle of fresh milk , the  TV work intermittently as the power to the set box just goes off every now now and then.  Housekeeping staff do not understand our requirement and we did not get what we want .   In the end , we checked out early and went to stay in another hotel and I can say the backroom reservation person ( Pxxxx) did her best to do make sure I had a better stay in Renaissance Phuket.  I choose Renaissance…

title: Great Hotel
review: We really enjoyed our stay in the Marriott Hotel Khao Lak. The rooms were nice and spacious (especially the bathroom) and the service was good. Although it took us over an hour to check in and get the key to our room. Also, our booking had a free dinner in the hotel included but neither did we get any vouchers for this free dinner (we found out that we should have received vouchers for it when we checked out) nor did we get informed that we are only able to use the offer in their Thai restaurant. We did however get informed of a special offer to upgrade to a pool access room, which we did. It was well worth it to get the pool access room as we could sit on our terrace and jump in the pool from there.   The Hotel and surroundings were very nice, the pool was huge, not very deep…

title: Miles and miles...
review: The Marriott is everything a luxe beach resort should be. Casually laid back with superb facilities.   I could feel the stress just melt away through the waft of lemongrass as I entered my room. Thais love using the expression “hi-so”, short for “high society”, and boy, am I ever living it up hi-so this week, with only "happy" problems to weigh me down.  When your happy dilemma is whether to (1) sit on the miles of beach with a cabana boy serving up ice water while staring at the pleasing blue-green ocean or (2) lounge by one of the four huge pools all interconnected creating 3.3 kms of a swim experience (the region’s largest swimming pool), you are definitely hi-so. I mean, who could possibly need 2 miles of swimming pool?  Happy dilemma number two is what to have for breakfast…

title: Paradise before paradise
review: We enjoyed our time thoroughly, the pool access room was so wonderful.  All the staff were incredible they really served and helped everyone and so friendly.  The fitness centre and classes were good and individualised, yoga infront of the beach it doesnt get better than that.  It's so beautiful we didnt want to go leave.   Buffet breakfast had lots variety and fresh fruit juice.   The Thai cultural dinner on tuesday felt like we were at a wedding so special and the dances with the young ones was precious.  Although it rained sometimes you can still swim in the pool. It's a bit far from the town but found ourselves wanted to stay just in the resort!  We are sad to leave and can't wait to come back.

title: Great resort, beautiful location
review: Original plan was to stay 6 nights, as a gap-fill in a 2 week Thailand vacation but decided to stay the full 2 weeks with our family of 5 including kids 2, 7 and 13. Can only recommend the resort   +++ The pool system is as fantastic as described in all the reviews. Several KMs of canals and pools, 2 great poolbars, a huge main pool - with the added benefit for families w. small children that the flanks of the main pool offers shallow waters for the youngest to play in while the parents can relax in the chic sunloungers placed in the water!  Beach is beautiful, spotless clean, wide and stretches for miles both sides of the hotel. Great for swimming. Absolutely the best we have experienced in Thailand   Hotel choice of food good, with an excellent Japanese restaurant. solid…

title: Superb
review: We stayed in this property in December 2011 for Christmas & New Year. We took a standard room for our Adult kids and an Executive Suite for myself and my wife. The Resort is gorgeous and is everything that has been written previously.  There were a several power cuts whilst we were there which apparently were caused by EGAT (the local electrical utility and thus outside the control of the resort).  This made me think that a battery operated emergency light in the upstairs bedroom and bathroom of the executive suite would be a good idea in the event of an emergency as using the suite staircase in the dark would be extremely dangerous. We also found the floor of the shower stall slippery when wet.    I wrote to the GM of the property on these points as I manage the construction of…

title: 5 Star ? Not a chance
review: I am writing this review whilst sat on the terrace of room 3024 at the JW Marriott Khao Lak and whilst I reflect on my six days here I can say that I have enjoyed my time in Khao Lak but the JW Marriott has very little to do with my time in this region of Thailand.  We travel 3 or 4 times a year and always stay where possible in genuine 4 or 5 star resorts/hotels. This hotel can in no way be classed as 5 star and to be honest it is barely a 4 star in my opinion.  It has the facilities to suggest it should be but it severely lacks in service and attitude.  Now then, one thing I should say to be fair to the Marriott is that whilst we stayed here for 6 days we actually only dabbled in the facilities on offer however, whenever we did we found them letting themselves down in pretty…

title: Was it all a Dream?
review: In Feb 2012, my husband, son, and daughter-in-law had a Thai vacation, which included 6 nights at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak.  We enjoyed 6 amazing nights, and 5 days at this beautiful resort.  We loved it so much, it all seems a dream now.  We  found everything perfect during our stay, from the comfortable downy bed, to the sweet, cheerful staff, tastey buffet breakfast, (with the best coffee), to the amazing beach and pool!  At the end of our stay we did not want to leave, as we had found paradise!

title: Checked out directly
review: Checked in with my wife and 4 children, went to the pool area. No sunbeds available by any pool. Many sun beds "reserved" without anybody using them.  Checked out.

title: Fantastic! Every Last Detail
review: It's an hour drive from the Phuket Airport, but definitely worth it. This is a fabulous property on Khao Lak's finest beach. We enjoyed the surf on their free body-boards, and were happy to be served cold glasses of water by the ever attentive staff. A nice touch on the beach that I have not encountered before.   Our pool room was great. The rain shower, the comfortable furniture and beds, and direct pool access made us reluctant to leave our room! Everything was immaculate, and all amenities were provided in abundance. The layout of the hotel, with long meandering canals, is such that the pool outside the pool rooms feels very quiet and private, unlike other hotels where a pool room may open to a cast of thousands. Our room was dead silent. We couldn't hear a peep from…

title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful team, but the small details are the issue
review: In Feb of 2012, my family had a Thai holiday were we stayed at the Courtyard in Bangkok dor 2 nights, then the Holiday Inn on Phi Phi Island for 6 nights, then the JW Marriott in Khao Lak for 6 nights.   We all agreed it was the most beautifully hotel and the staff are so very nice and full of smiles.   The our room was poolside which added to the pleasure. The pools are insanely huge and very nice. The room was nicely laid out and very attractive.   The issue with the room was many of the nice features did not work. The Entertainment system did not work, the wifi did not work, the shutters between the bathroom and bedroom were tangled and did not work. All were fixed promptly, but not what you would expect from a JW.    There was a great selection of restaurants, but again…

title: Relaxing week at the JW Marriott
review: A very nice resort on a lovely beach, the JW Marriott did not disappoint, except if you take seriously those reviews who say it is 'the best resort they've ever seen'.  Certainly it is no Four Seasons or Six Senses but it is very nice, well kept, clean and is on a nice beach. We went over Christmas/New Year (I'm very delayed in sending this review out) but the hotel never felt crowded.  There are plenty of quiet nooks to relax, read or swim. Our favourite part of the hotel were all the beach huts next to it for lunches and dinners with fantastic Thai food.  We ate spectacularly well each evening for about $25 for 3 of us!  Our favourites were Mama's Greeting (with the best spicy seafood glass noodle salad), Blue Mist for the best shrimp fritters ever, Andaman, etc.  They were…

title: Outstanding, tranquil resort
review: Wonderful surroundings, intimate and well-kept resort suitable both for adult couples and families. The immense pool is superb and the spa is gorgeous. Excellent restaurants with surprisingly reasonable prices. The only thing lacking was the English skills of some of the staff. Altogether a most enjoyable stay, am definitely returning to this place!

title: Attention to detail in a perfect setting
review: I stayed in the JW Marriott Khao Lak in December for a couple of nights. A seasoned Marriott guest I thought I was well aware of what to expect, blanket Marriott high standards wherever you are in the world. What greeted me at this resort however far exceeded my expectations.  This resort really has tuned into where they are, it has a very Zen feeling to it, simple yet sophisticated. The staff greeting you upon entry really make you feel welcome and special, the check in process is friendly and professional complete with a lovely welcome drink and much needed cold towel.  The rooms are a perfect blend of Western comforts and Eastern charm, they are spacious, comfortable and luxurious.  One of the features of this resort is the Pool. While it does have a traditional resort type…

title: Difficult to fault !
review: My wife and I just returned from a 10 day stay at the JW Marriott Khoa Lak and will find it hard in this review to say anything bad about our experience.  Positive resort points to note: 1) Great room - we had a pool access room which was large with a great bed and spacious bathroom.  Very good housekeeping 2) The resort is presented immaculately and even if there is a high occupancy (as we had) never seems crowded 3) Great beach for sitting on and for swimming from..never more than a few people in the sea at any one time 4) Fantastic staff who are always happy to help with any advice or problem 5) Great breakfast although the large room it is served in sometimes felt like a company canteen  Other points of note: a) We ate out every evening using either the local beach hotels or…

title: Great!
review: One of the best pool bars, great beach, nice location & outstanding service. Enjoyed every day of my stay at the hotel and would definietely come back for another week. The Khuk Khak Beach is amazing and there quite a few places to see closeby like Khao Sok National Park or Similian Islands

title: Good hotel... Bad food!
review: This Marriott Hotel is a great resort hotel, there's no denying that. It's incredibly beautiful, the rooms are comfortable and well designed and the staff are friendly and efficient. It also has a great location by the beach.   We stayed in a pool access room and, as other people have commented, this is a great option. Stepping out and swimming to one of the bars was far different to going out on the town in my native London! The pool is incredible and has to be seen to be believed. And the service is exemplary from the moment you step into the lobby and have your bags whisked away and a drink and cold towel placed into your hands.  My big problem, however, was the food. The, frankly, disgusting food! On our first night we'd had a long flight so ordered room service and, for…

title: Heaven On Earth
review: The best hotel stay I have had so far. Being upgraded to a pool access rom did help. Highly recommended if you don't mind have people swimming past your room. Very helpful and attentive staff. Also little things like giving cold water when you are on the beach, occassional cocktails, lollies etc..... Very ideal for relaxation and romance. Khaolak town is small but has everything. Go for a diving trip, trekking and island hopping. And the pool..... It seems to go on forever.....

title: Second visit ...keeps getting better!
review: On more than one occasion we have returned to a resort for a second time and have been for lack of a better word "let down".  Perhaps to no fault of the resort or hotel but our memories seem to become inflated. I guess we could not recreate the initial wow factor first impression on the second visit. In any event we have in the past have been a little disappointed on a return visit to many resorts and were a little apprehensive about booking a second visit for this reason. Having said all that I can tell you that our return visit to this resort was anything farther than from being a "let down".  My wife and I just returned from a second visit in as many years to the JW Marriott Khao Lak for eight days. The resort has indeed matured and developed into a world class Marriott…

title: Warm and family-oriented luxury resort.
review: Beautiful location, quiet and less traffic than any beach resort. It was isolated from all the other hotels around Khao Lak center (town center). It has it own clinic staffed with a nurse onsite. If you need to get a doctor, it can be arranged. It has a child care nursery, you could drop off your children for a fee, while you went dipping in the sea. Tennis court, squash court, sauna, spa, sandwich store, all within reach in the resort. Swimming pool swirled around the entire hotel, easily access from your balcony - very nice. Most of the lower ground rooms, you're basically just walk into the pool - very smart design. It also has a big children pool, where water slide  specifically design for children. Beach access just a few yard away from the main swimming pool, walking…

title: Fantastic Resort with Huge swimming pool
review: As usual with JW Marriott hotels you get what you pay for.  A five star resort about 1 hour drive north of Phuket airport.  The resort consists of town houses connected around the huge swimming pool.   The rooms are spacious and clean.  The service is excellent.  Easy check in and check out.  The pool access rooms are great and more enjoyable than those in level 1 or level 2 rooms.  The beach is clean and nice for swimming, walking and watching the sun set.  It takes about 10 min drive to the Kao Lak city.  There are some shops outside the hotel.  There are also massage, tours agents, taxi and restaurants on the beach but not belonging to the hotel.  I must say that most the guests are from Germany, north Europe and Russia.  One problem during breakfast as there are some tables…

title: 5* facilities 2* entertainment
review: We have stayed in a number of hotels that call themselves 5* but don't quite make the grade.  This was not one of them.  The facilities at this hotel were stunning - especially the connected pools and the beach.  The breakfast was definitely worth getting up for - fantastic selection of foods and freshly made juice.  The gym equipment was top notch (in-fact all the facilities were excellent). Couple of negatives:  first, the resort is very quiet at night - most things seem to empty at about 10.30pm!;  second, the on site food and beverages are VERY expensive for Thailand.  That being said, the hotel offers a seafood buffet on a Friday night and that is worth every penny - all you can eat fresh lobster, crab, mussels, tiger prawns and a selection of fish - not to be missed!  For…

title: Almost perfect..but
review: Our stay at JW Marriott Khao Lak was mostly great. The resort area was great, and I'd really recommend the Pool view room. A massive maze of connected pools available directly from your room, delicious!  The beach is lovely as well, beautifully prepped (I assume), nice beach chairs and decent supplies.  The 'but' is given for various service flaws, which shouldn't really occur at a 5 star hotel like this. House keeping, in particular, seemed pretty lax, and messages passed on to the front desk about things needed to get done in the room simply weren't acted upon. The food was adequate, but not great. We ended up having many of our meals at local restaurants down the beach!  Some things to improve upon, then, but still a great stay.

title: Could have been, should have been, but not quite there
review: I'm sorry the JW Marriott was nice but definately not a world-class resort.  The breakfast buffet was great, the pool was nice, the people were friendly but the service was lacking and some of the staff were dishonest.   Let's start with the communication.  My family and I were already planning a vacation to Thailand when I spotted the travelzoo deal.  Although I would never have thought to go so far north as khao lak i thought the room rate was reasonable so we decided to give JW a try.  We noticed that there was no 1-800 number to call for reservations.  My sister tried skype - the connection was so bad that both calls dropped.  Finally we decided just to book our reservation online.  I emailed and asked to reserve a taxi.  One person emailed back and asked for a flight…

title: Good but watch out for stinky rooms
review: We stayed 4 nights here and because we used rewards for part of our stay, we had to switch rooms halfway through our stay.  First room was nice and had pool access which was absolutely wonderful.  The room smelled fine, no complaints.   Bad: Second room was stinky.  The A/C had been running when we entered and the room smelled a bit off.  We returned the next day when the A/C wasn't on and the room smelled horrible.  My husband honestly wondered if something had died under the bed.  Due to the late hour and our busy schedule the next day, we didn't ask for a room change, which was a really bad idea.  We awoke to the nastiest smell.  Obviously the maids should have noticed the foul smell when cleaning and given us a different room or something.  It left a really bad taste in my…

title: Good hotel but caution if you have young kids...
review: There is a lot of potential for this hotel and I can see why it has great reviews here...   BUT if you are coming with young kids (toddlers), handicapped, trouble walking far, etc, then I would caution you on staying here.  It seems as if this place would be kid friendly-- kid pool separate from other pools, small climbing gym/slide outdoors, kids club, kids welcomed in the restaurants, etc but this property showed me that just because you have such facilities doesnt make it easy or seamless or fun.  # 1--  no elevators anywhere.  Even if you are on the ground floor, you have to take a few steps up/down to get on bridges or other pathways to walk to ocean/pool/restaurants.  This is not easy if you are using a stroller.  I'm pregnant and have a toddler so it made it very…

title: fantastic stay
review: This hotel is based in the outskirts of khaolak. fantastic room and facilities with a private beach, this hotel lives up to its chain name. we had a fantastic time there and i cannot recommend it enough. location could have been closer to town but nonetheless there were shops within walking distance.

title: Nice place but disappointing food
review: Stayed in the resort in January.  The resort area is reasonable large, with nice swimming pools. There are also many facilities for children. But the food was disappointing.  We tried both the Thai and Japanese restaurants where the food were not cheap. The food of both restaurants were considered below standard.  The Tom Yum Koong had in a small restaurant at the beach was even  better, with 1/4 of thr price. Luckily there are several small restaurants on the beach which provide good and cheap Thai food.

title: Good but expensive restaurants
review: We stayed here using Marriott Reward Points in January whereas a lot of people had bought the bed and breakfast option - good move!  We had to buy breakfast either in the restaurant, where we did not have the choice of the buffet or something from the deli, both of which were very expensive as were all the restaurant options for evening meals especially as you could go to one of the very good beach restaurants and eat at a fraction of the price.  When you know what the cost of food is in Thailand it is rather galling to be charged so much.  Besides this the hotel is very good with one of the best pools we have ever come across in our travels.  We had a pool view room with a lovely balcony. The saving of sun beds early in the morning is a problem the hotel needs to address as…

title: Fantastic hotel - for relaxation
review: It was a pleasure to visit this hotel. We spent two weeks here in January and had a wonderful time. Be advised that the hotel is located by itself, isolated from almost anything. This gave us the perfect calm feeling that we wanted, but that depends on what kind of holiday you are looking for. I must admit we did become a little restless at the end. But, a taxi to Khao Lak does help.   This is the most important things we experienced:  - the food at the hotel is not the best food we got in Thailand. The Olive restaurant was in our experience the best of the hotel restaurants. The restaurants at the beach was far better in our opinion. They do not have electricity, so everything is fresh. Someone else here on Tripadvisor recommended the restaurant Amandan, the second one when…

title: Loved it
review: Loved it all although no local shopping near By. Need to catch taxi to anywhere but the resort is gorgeous and the biggest bed ever

title: lovely but.....noisy children
review: Hubby & myself stayed here last August & we were so impressed that we decided to go back with our two teenagers. I'd contacted the hotel prior to our arrival to arrange for one of the hotel mini buses to pick us up, this cost us 2500baht, we didn't mind paying this as it's a luxurious mini bus with individual seats. The driver met us outside arrivals, on entering the car we were given a cold bottle of water & a lovely cold cloth. The journey took around 80 mins. When we reached the hotel we were seated in the reception area & given another drink & cold cloth. Check in was quick & efficient but whilst we were walking to our rooms, we were told that the room allocated for our children was actually occupied & would be for the next four days! we were shown to our room & they said…

title: Top pool(s) and beach; ideal for families
review: Great pool with access from all basement rooms (try to get into those, if you can). Beach shallow (and very clean) with decent waves, ideal for kids (and grown-ups) to jump around. Also beach better than at Marriott in Phuket. Good restaurant choices, also left and right of property on the beach. Hospitable as one knows it from Thailand. Remote location keeps is quite, but also farther to go, if one wants to explore outside resort. Sea bees, diving provider in property.

title: A beautiful resort in a fabulous setting.
review: Set on an idealic beach the hotel is one of the best laid out resorts, I have experienced. It has meters and meters of swimming pool that snakes its way around the grounds. Water fountains and water features add to the intrigue. The ground floor rooms have direct entry to the pool. Every single Manager, especially the General Manager, is visible and show a desire to help. All the staff have a smile on their faces and you really feel that they want to help also. The restaurants have a varied menu and there is a shuttle bus that serves the town that also has a variety of restaurants. Booze is a little expensive but it is everywhere in Thailand. It is possible to walk for miles along a perfect sandy beach. Excellent gym and many other sporting facilities are catered for. We didn't…

title: POOL
review: The hotel was amazing! The pool access rooms and the best and the pool is literally one step away. The beach was beautiful but get down early if you want good chairs. The sea was very wavy and the supplied buggie boards. In the afternoon they had delicious free icy poles for the kids. Around every three or four days theory bought an elephant in for everyone to see and feed which was a nice touch. The breakfast had a huge variety and the smoked salmon was great! Would come again :)

title: Excellent resort
review: A perfect place for family vacations. The resort is large with the biggest swimming pool we have ever seen. The interconnected "channels" lead to the main pool (the total length is said to be 3 kilometers or so).  The beach is actually very nice. Obviously it is neither Riviera Maya or Boracay but it is very clean and good for kids. The rooms are reasonably sized and well equipped (incl. very large LCD TV and DVD player). Everything in the room was in a perfect working condition. There is a big and extremely well equipped kids club. We did not eat in the hotel (except breakfasts ... extensive buffet and efficient staff) but who would eat in the hotel if there are small Thai restaurants (and massage places) on both sides of the hotel on the beach ... and the food there is…

title: Worth coming here for the pool alone!
review: It was raining most of the time we were here and the rooms suffered a bit from an overlying smell of damp.  Luckily we secured a de-humidifier and this helped ease the awful smell.  The rooms are lovely, but showing signs of wear.  The situation regarding the early morning reservation of sunbeds is irritating and really should be dealt with by the hotel management, but i can understand why they would be reluctant to do so.  Having said that there are plenty of sunbeds dotted around the resort, so if you're not too bothered by where you are, don't stress about it, you will find somewhere to go.  Overall though this is a beautiful hotel, the pool is awesome, as is the breakfast.  We ate one night in the on site Thai restaurant, but I resent paying extra taxes, service charges etc…

title: amazing pool, very relaxing
review: Overall an excellent experience and a very nice resort. It's a big hotel, but only felt big at breakfast - however breakfast was vast and excellent, so rarely had to queue for anything.  Great room - had a deluxe family room, so the children could sleep and play downstairs and we had some privacy upstairs. Very big, ridiculously vast bath, amazing showers, nice balcony, very happy.   Impressive pool was a series of pools interconnected by rivers, so really very big and great fun. A couple of kids' pools, water lovely and rarely felt busy even though hotel was pretty full.   Lots of towels on sunbeds by the beach/front pool at dawn but didn't get it - yes, lovely beach but could find plenty of quiet areas around the rest of the enormous pool. In fact, the well-designed spaces…

title: Very relaxing hotel
review: Stayed at JW with our 2 kids just after new year. The resort has huge area and gardens, which meant that although it was almost fully booked - it never felt crowded. It is a paradise both for kids and adults who like to swim: pools are amazing, as well as the beach! I personally liked the private morning swims in a 100 m long infinity pool with view!  Our family studio room was very comfortable for 2 adults and 2 kids sleeping in day beds. The extra space compared to std room was worth the price.  We got free vouchers on arrival to eat at the hotel restaurants, which was nice gesture. The thai Ta-Krai was very good and had nice ambience, tasted some quite unique starters (banana flower salad). But I can not understand why most of the people ate at the Olive which had just…

title: Beautiful hotel
review: One of the most beautiful hotels I have ever stayed in. Comfortable rooms, excellent facilities. Quiet, peaceful, great vacation place. Only negative is the very high prices charged in the restaurants but there are many good and inexpensive restaurants near the hotel on the beach.

title: Lovely stay for New Year celebrations
review: 4 of us (2 couples) stayed at Marriott for 5 days over the New Year period. It is a beautiful property - the pool is a striking centerpiece. We had pool access rooms and they were lovely. The pool itself was a bit cold so we mostly swam in the sea. Our rooms were right next to the beach, with very easy beach access, comfortable sunloungers and fluffy towels.  We were pleasantly surprised by the New Year gala dinner. The hotel had some entertainment in a big marquee on the beach and the largest buffet I have ever seen, with Thai, Japanese, Chinese and European food, including lobster and fois gras. The food was there for most of the night and was not at any point running out. The sight of fireworks and millions of lanterns in the sky on new year's eve was breathtaking.  We ate at…

title: JW Marriott made our Honeymoon extra special
review: Have reccomended hotel to all friends and family that are going to Thailand anytime soon. Location let's you relax, do everything in your own time and still have the option of heading into town to experience the "real" cultural Thailand. Going back for our 1 year anniversary.

title: Excellent location and amenities and but quality of foods should be improved
review: We stayed 5 nights at this resort just before Xmas. For transfers airport to hotel, we book a private car with PhuketShuttle.com (BTH 1500 each way). They were punctual and this worked out nicely.  Marriott Khao Lak is a very nice property with breathtaking landscaping. The infinity lap  pool adds a peaceful touch to the resort. Deluxe room where we stayed is large with all the amenities of a five star hotel plus a balcony overlooking the lap pool. Bathroom is clean and we appreciate the separate shower.  Reataurant is an area that Marriott Khao Lak should focus on improvement. Except for the nice buffet breakfast at the Waterfront restautants, meals are relatively so so at lunch time. For dinner, avoid the Olive restaurant, unless they have changed the chef since, long waiting,…

title: The ultimate place to stay, but a shame about all the kids
review: I decided on staying at the JW Marriott Khao Lak for my wife and I on our honeymoon after trawling through hotels around the world.   ROOMS: We chose a pool view room, despite most suggesting a pool access room, and was very happy with this choice. The rooms and huge and the bathroom is very well fitted out with amenities. The bath and shower are both huge. The pool view room has a nice balcony to sit out on. Drinking water is provided and replenished daily, as is a fruit bowl.  POOLS: We overlooked the smaller (and quieter) pool, located adjacent to the kids pool (which was little used). The larger pool is directly behind the beach and is the main hotspot for families and children. Both are large and clean, with spa jets and many lounges with umbrellas around the edges. All…

title: Relaxing but could be improved
review: We atteded this resort in August so the resort was a little quiet at the time which we found quite good. They pick you up from the airport for a fee and it is a 1 hour drive to the resort which can be a little scary with the driving skills of not just our driver but all thai drivers. We arrived late and were tired so appreciated the cold water we were given.
