We were greeted nicely at the resort, they were friendly and kind although the girl meeting us was not Thai which would have been nice. The rooms are beautiful but do have an underlying damp smell which you get used to. We had a pool access room which was the greatest part of the room as we swam so much because of this facility. The pool is magnificent, the nicest I have ever seen and the biggest. It is clean and you can…

title: Trust me!
review: Moved here from the Meridian on the last leg of my honeymoon (see my meridian review)..Such the right move! As soon as we walked in to the lobby/reception the atmosphere was exactly what you would expect from a 5star hotel in Thailand. Staff all happy and friendly too. The room (swim up pool room) was perfect...clean, everything worked well and the bathroom was a pleasure to use. The grounds were very pleasant with large pools and lilly pads (especially the spa area). The main swimming pool was very large, with a swim up pool bar, and never crowed and always very clean. Ample sun beds on the beach, or around the pool which fronted to the beach....there were also sun chairs/foot stools on our pool balcony if we wanted some privacy. Breakfast was truly magnificent, everything we…

title: Pleasant Stay, but not great value for the $$
review: pros: Lovely position and beach great restaurants next to hotel fantastic pool friendly staff ATM at hotel Cons: Ants in room blocked shower re-ses happy hr only reduced prices Happy not second pool bar slow bar service did not get room which we booked (pool garden access instead of pool access) kids club for young kids pretty much  Breakfast was ok, Hotel a distance from town, but not a problem being we had our car there. Value for money being peak season, wasn't there I expect value for money, and when you pay premium prices at Xmas New year, for me there is no exception Would I go back? It would have to be a very good deal to bring me back to the Marriott. Thailand has a HUGE choice of 4 & 5 star properties

title: The most wonderful hotel!
review: My husband and I arrived at the Marriott after a recommendation from our Thai friend and were not disappointed. The transfer from the airport was very comfortable costing 2500thb in an air conditioned minivan and took around 80 minutes.   The welcome from all the staff at the Marriott was impeccable, and the cosy, friendly feel from such a large resort was superb. We had booked a pool access room which was quite frankly, fantastic. Stepping off your veranda into the pool each morning was amazing and although the hotel was at full capacity, my husband and I felt like we were on our own private holiday!  The food was good although there are a number of fantastic beach restaurants and bars on the beach which are superb. Specifically The Andaman restaurant where the staff were…

title: Great property - poor management
review: Spent 15 nights at the resort over Xmas & New Year 2011/12.  Hotel is aprox 5 years old ,large and rooms well thought out. Marriott management have had the contract to opperate for aprox 15 months. The management team that Marriott have in place, lead by GM Ty Collins, are not experianced enough to opperate a property of this size and quality. The festivities were a disaster! Poorly executed and juvenile. All the restaurants were closed on New Years eve ( that wes a surprise to guests ) and Marriott management imposed a compulsolary Gala dinner charge of Batt8500 ( aprox £170 ). Result was a lot of unhappy guests and attendance at the Gala dinner was poor, a lot of guests left the hotel. Those who stayed but did not pay were put in a closed restaurant and told to eat from the…

title: Super property, Peaceful and tranquil !!
review: Spent three days at the resort this week and could not have been happier. Everything from check in to check out was top class  Check in was a breeze, room was huge and had direct access to the pool Service top notch,beach beautiful and location away from the bustle and peaceful. I suggest you take the pool access rooms,there are three kinds.. The first one has a few plants and a path leads to the pool canal, the second has direct pool access from a wood deck and the third has a glass partition for families with kids...So choose the one thAt suits you The pool is almost two kilometers long and is superb especially the pool bar Recreation is endless be it cycling tennis pool to even foosball and air hockey  Shacks by the beach great vfm for meals and very tasty Can't wait to come…

title: Loved it but NOT for New Years....!
review: We stayed at the JW Marriott Khao Lak from 28th Dec 2011 until 3rd Jan 2012 and I would definately return to this nearly perfect resort.  Resort Surroundings: Absolutely beautiful and well maintained The JW team: Very friendly and attentive Infinity Pool/Pool around the resort - Not really infinity and the majority of the time was dirty.  Although we did notice them cleaning it alot of the time - it obviously proved to be difficult due to the size. We had a Balcony View room which was absolutely fantastic and I would strongly recommend this for couples. As much as I would like the Pool Access room we opted put due to noisy children in the pool area. Breakfast - fantastic with alot of variety including fresh ftuit smoothies, crepes, pancakes, japanese, thai, indian, cereals,…

title: Great beach property coupled with a nice local Thai experience
review: The hotel is an all around good choice for couples or families.  The property is comfortable, well maintained and has great food and beverage options.  The rooms are clean, comfortable and well appointed.  The restaurants are a fair value for a five-star resort and offer good options.  Breakfast is great so book a package that includes this option.  As a Platinum Marriott guest this was free and the quality and options are great.     The hotel staff is becoming better.  I stayed here two years ago and many did not speak English and this has changed allot.  The staff is getting better, they are well trained and very helpful.  The cooking class was fun and inexpensive although not as polished as the JW Mai Khao it is still a great way to learn more about Thai cooking and is a…

title: Perfect!
review: This place is fantastic. Rooms are very well appointed with nice views. Excellent restaurants with mix of Thai, Indian and international cuisine. Beach is quiet with plenty of spots to sunbathe.  I went there for a conference (!) and their facilities for that were adequate.  The amazing feature of this place is the pool - it covers the entire resort, it's in front of all the accommodations, and its's all ONE pool. You could reach all parts of the resorts just by swimming in the pool.  This resort is quite far from Phuket itself, so it's a little isolated. Probably not a good base location to explore (although we did).  Definitely a place to forget about everything and relax. We're probably going back!

title: Perfect holiday
review: We stayed at JW Marriott for two weeks in December 2011. The atmosphere at the hotell where really relaxing and beautiful. The staff where extremely helpful and polite. The staff where also quite good in English. The hotel has a high standard and can be looked upon as quite expensive.

title: Best Hotel For Relaxation
review: I stayed at the JW Marriott Khao Lak in May 18-May 23, 2011.  I loved the hotel so much that I am going back there in February 2012 ( I have already booked my room!)  I have stayed at Ritz Carlton, Conrad, Trump, Hyatt, Riu and Hilton Hotels in the Caribbean, USA and Asia, and I have to say that this hotel is the best of all of them!  The deluxe pool access room was large, comfortable bed,  huge soaker tub and separate shower stall!  Direct access to a 3km waterway that circles all the rooms was amazing and clean!    The main infinity pool was huge and the most beautiful that I have ever seen.  Servers brought fresh towels and cold water to us at the pool and beach! The spa massages were amazing and service throughout the hotel was first class.   If you want craziness go to…

title: Beautiful resort!!  Opt for the breakfast, skip the spa.
review: This is an incredible resort!  You will be blown away by the beauty of it!  The trip from the airport takes a little more than an hour.  I'm not sure if the hotel offers a shuttle service but we read another trip advisor review that mentioned a transportation service that we ended up using.  The moment we arrived at the hotel, I was impressed.  Immediately you can tell that the grounds are beautiful but I was mostly impressed by the service at this point.  Right when we walked in, we were greeted by one of the desk clerks.  She brought us both a drink with a beautiful flower in it and lead us to a comfortable sitting area in the lobby.  We thought this meant that we would have to wait a little while to check in but she came and sat next to us, gathered all our info, and checked…

title: Nice property but room needed refurbishment
review: Just got back from five nights at the JW Marriott Khao Lak.  Overall, it is a nice property but not in the same league as other JW hotels I've stayed.  The grounds, beach and pools are incredible and the property's best feature.  The hotel is about 75 minutes north of the Phuket airport.  We took the hotel's limousine service to and from for 2500TB each way...well worth it and hassle free.  We ate at the hotel restaurants three of five nights and the food was good, although a bit more than you'd pay offsite.  I'd recommend the Thai over the Japanese...Olives was standard fare.  We also ate at the small Thai and Italian restaurants right outside the property.  Both were decent given the relatively low prices and the service was friendly.  There is a 7-Eleven type store and a…

title: Could be excellent with some attention to detail
review: We stayed for 5 nights over New Year in this vast but beautiful hotel in an amazing setting right on the beach. The rooms are good quality, the staff are as friendly and helpful as you'd expect from anywhere in Thailand and the amenities are as you'd expect from a luxury brand of an International chain. I thought long and hard about whether to only give this hotel 3 stars but decided that that would be too harsh as it is a great place to stay, however, what I find frustrating about this type of property is that a lack of attention to detail and a myopic view about running a business, mean that what could be an amazing hotel is just "nice".  I'm probably being quite petty but just a few examples and hope that the Manager (Ty) reads this and takes some notice.  - Sun loungers at…

title: Quiet and relaxing side of Phuket.
review: If you are wanting a holiday with a fabulous beach, local restaurants/massages on the beach and no-one hassling you to buy something then this is the place for you ... Although we went in high season ( January ) there were alot of families travelling from Europe and if it's quiet small and quaint that you are after then this is not for you .... The hotel itself is amazing. Big beautiful pools that can take you around the whole resort if you choose to swim it. Then there is the staff who are always polite and welcoming, which we find to be the opener of a fab holiday. There is a variety of restaurants at the resort which of course are quiet expensive as you would imagine. But we would like to take this opportunity to recommend a local restaurant to the right looking at the beach…

title: Morning swim at your back door
review: The Pool Access Room is a must at this hotel. Their lagoon pool meanders all around the hotel and each morning we would step out our back porch to take a morning swim before breakfast and what a way to wake up.  We would then stroll to the hotel's Waterfront Restaurant for breakfast (food galore, huge variety and fresh) whilst enjoying the beach view.  The beach restaurants left and right of the hotel were great - just as good day or night.  Good food and so, so cheap.  Beautiful beach at front of hotel.  Not too rough but fun enough for a body surf. Hotel provides boogie boards, volley ball and the friendly staff keep you serviced with water to keep you cool.  Fabulous hotel and place to unwind and relax.

title: Top Hotel!
review: Nachdem wir schon eimal vor Jahren in Khao Lak waren, haben wir uns diesesmal im JW Marriot einquartiert. Gebucht haben wir dann ein Doppelzimmer mit direktem Poolzugang, was ich jederzeit wieder machen würde. Das Hotel selbst ist sehr weitläufig und hat einen wunderschönen, riesigen Pool. Der Strand ist zwar nicht so schön wie vielleicht auf Phuket, da das Wasser immer etwas trüber ist.  Frühstück im Hotel ist 1A mit riesiger Auswahl. Die Restaurants im Hotel sind ebenfalls sehr gut, wenn auch natürlich nicht ganz billig. Man kann jedoch in den umliegenden "Strandrestaurants" auch gut und vor allem billig essen...  Alles in Allem ein wunderschöner Urlaub und das Hotel kann ich mit gutem Gewissen weiterempfehlen!

title: Stunning location. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed at.
review: We stayed one week at this resort in december 2011. Its a large resort but at the same time it never feels crowded. Not in the restaurant, not on the beach or at the pool. There is more than plenty of room for everyone and the friendly staff always greets you with a smile. The tranquil almost isolated location of the hotel in northern parts of Khao Lak makes this a dream destination for everyone looking for silence and tranquility. The beach is beautiful and large and stretches for several kilometers. Its nice to take a walk along the beach and youre almost alone when walking here. Plenty of sunbeds offered by the resort overlooking the beach. Staff bring you cold water for free and in the afternoon is offered complimentary ice pops. The pool areas are amazing they circulate 3…

title: Mind boggling swimming pool, lovely beach
review: The hotel is far away from the madness of Phuket and quite isolated in its location. Clearly about 90 minutes from the airport in Phuket. Even from the turn-off from the main road its about 2 kms inside. There are a bunch of shops outside the main gate and thats pretty much all around the place (except the shacks on the beach). However, its the location that makes this resort a great place - you dont need to step out of the property if the idea is to simply relax and do nothing. While the hotel has all the trappings of a luxury resort it does not seem to be a large property and one does get the feeling of being 'boxed in'. At the same time, it has an amazing swimming pool, something i have never seen before anywhere in the world. its more like a canal that snakes its way all…

title: Fabulous
review: A truly wonderful holiday- fabulous staff and food. We were extremely well looked after, and there was nothing that was too much trouble. Tang, our chamber maid was superb- her towell sculptures were something else! I even took my own mobility scooter, which arrived slightly damaged and 3 Thai engineers arrived and fixed the problem! A few more ramps would be a good idea.  We will definately return at sometime in the future.

title: Amazing setting, poor service, not 5 star!
review: The setting of the hotel was beautiful, things could have been so right bar a few major factors; there is not enough seating around the main infinity pool, only 30 loungers to 350 odd rooms, which means people reserve their spots early in the morning making the whole "hanging out by the pool" stressful! The kids pool is isolated and not very user friendly far from the beach and other pools. There is only one small restaurant with 5 tables(!) available for lunch, where an average lunch for 2 adults and 2 children was simply outrageous at £60! The Thai staff tried really hard and were always friendly but management is sorely lacking and definitely not up to scratch. The Buffett dinners were substandard and it seemed the busier the hotel got the less capable the hotel were at…

title: Top Notch in every area. One of the best hotels in the world.
review: Very happy we went north to Khao Lak instead of staying close to Phuket. This resort was fabulous! Flawless service abd amazing facilities. The room beat most at Four Seasons we have stayed at in other resort areas. The beach was great. The restaurants were good, the Thai place was average. This was a very tranquil and relaxing place to finish the year!

title: Loved this one !!!
review: We stayed here in a Deluxe room in November.   Got a great Early bird deal from "Sawadee".   Emailed hotel one week before to arrange transfer from Phuket airport, this went smoothly, a comfortable minivan was waiting for us.  The ride to the hotel was little more than an hour. Got a wow feeling when we arrived, and drove up to  the hotel as it looks really impressive.  We were given cold towels and a cooling drink. Check in was easy.    Requested to stay on high floor  in our booking and thats what we got.  The room was everything we could ask for. I loved the balcony with comfortable seatings.  The hotel is huge,so expect a lot of walking.   Overall the pools and the beach got plenty of sunbeds. Could have wished for more sunbeds around our closest , the Aquamarine swim up bar…

title: Very close to perfection
review: Nothing is perfect, but this hotel is getting really close...  The former Sofitel property had a very high death toll during the tsunami in 2004. It has been beautifully restored and reopened as JW Marriott just recently. The layout of the hotel is lovely, with one of the world's longest swimming pools running like a channel in between the buildings. The rooms are spotless, the gardens very well maintained, the pools are very clean and the beach is just stunning. The staff seems to be genuinely friendly and the positive attitude towards the guests doesn't seem to be like purely trained professionalism.  We also made a lot of use of the tennis courts (artificial grass courts, even with lighting) and had a very good time at the many sports and leisure offerings. There are some…

title: Excellent resort
review: Pools best in any hotel been to. I have stayed at jw Marriott Mao khao and thought this better. Only criticism is cost of food in hotel. It is 4x price of beach restaurants. Why pay 4000 baht for buffet for family of 4 when can eat on beach for 1000 baht. Ate at andaman and blue mist on beach. Don't be put off by appearance. Food very good and great value. In hotel we ate at Thai restaurant (aweful small portions) and olive which we enjoyed. Hotel restaurants very quiet when we were there I am sure because of cost compared to eating on beach.  Everyone puts books on pool loungers to book them before they go to breakfast. Irritating but just do same. Overall highly recommend for quiet family holiday.

title: A relaxing and tranquil resort
review: This resort is away from the hustle and bustle of Phuket town, about an hour north of the airport. You are secluded, 2km in from the main road and on a private beach. The resort is beautiful and the staff offer service that is the trademark of Thai hospitality.  If you are looking for a getaway that is relaxing and rejuvenating, this is where you should come. I spent three nights here in a deluxe room (not poolside access). There is nothing more tranquil than laying on a beach chair, right on the edge of the beach hearing the waves crash to shore. Poolside and beachside service are amazing. The spa also offered good services, but since this is the JW Marriott, expect to pay US prices.  The only downside is the food. The breakfast buffet was amazing and this could be your main…

title: Secluded beach resort
review: This resort is the type I dream abut when I want a vacation, amazing location, great staff and good food, also it is perfect for romance. The pictures you see do not do justice to the property it is much more beautiful than that, they have everything you could ask for and never do you feel the need to step outside the resort. The pool is 3 km in length and you can spend hours in it. Since the pool is so big it never feels crowded and we had a pool access room so we could step right out of the room into the pool. The staff is very professional and since thai people in general are so nice the service was exceptional. They even made some food that was not on the menu at no extra cost. The beach is huge and well maintained, the sea is safe to swim in and even kids were swimming in…

title: Very good hotel
review: A brilliant hotel in a brilliant country! The beach is fantastic, in fact everything is! We can really recommend to stay in this hotel! Great pool, rooms, breakfast!

title: Beautiful resort with wonderful rooms and amazing pools and gardens.
review: Our family of 6 stayed here for 1 indulgent week, we loved it. I think the rooms are the nicest I have stayed in, the bed is SOoo comfortable! We had 2 delux rooms (not direct pool access) and we were very happy with this. I think the out door area is nicer without pool access. The bathrooms are large and luxurious.   Some evenings when we returned to our rooms there would be a gift on our beds, a beautiful scarf or lovely note book and some delicious Christmas treats to eat. The hotel is on a beautiful beach which is clean and private. The staff are lovely, very attentive and provide a high standard of service. We also enjoyed the well equipped gym, squash court and table tennis tables. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast but would eat out for dinner. This meant catching a taxi,…

title: Great swimming pool
review: JW Marriott @ Khao Lak has great swimming pool and really like the breakfast. Can't say much about the beach since it was rainny and cloudy when we visited.

title: outstanding resort in paradise
review: This is a typical resort hotel.  The facilities are outstanding.  They have just about everything you could hope for on the hotel grounds, they appeared to be hosting one special event after another (Thai cultural evening, afternoon BBQ, Christmas Eve dinner), and the staff is absolutely fabulous. They are well trained.  The rooms are well-appointed and very comfortable.  The food was excellent and I agree this breakfast buffet was incredible.  Beautiful and relaxing location and atmosphere overall and thoroughly enjoyed it.  Two minor issues - the hotel was much further outside of Khao Lak than I realized.  Perhaps I didn't do enough research, but I checked maps and read reviews and just assumed it was closer to town than it really was.  I would recommend doing the 'stay at the…

title: Amazing stay in khao lak
review: On day 5 of a weeks stay and can heartily recommend the jw Marriott khao lak.  The resort is lovely with a great beach and huge meandering pool.  Ice water is served on the beach which is a nice touch.  The breakfast is terrific especially when you sit on the deck overlooking the beach and palm trees. The ink banana smoothie is amazing! Free wifi everywhere even on the beach ! The huts on the  each to either side of the resort offer massages ( most for 300 baht per hour).  We've each had one a day.  There are also restaurants there and every meal we've had has been delicious and cheap.  There are taxis available at the barrier entrance to the hotel.  A trip to town is 250 to 300 baht for 4.  Much less than the hotel shuttle.   The spa is beautiful but pricey do we have stuck to…

title: Perfect vacation spot
review: This hotel was not only fabulously luxurious but the staff were second to none!  Find a package with breakfast included or it's $50 per!  We had one with it included and it was the most incredible breakfast we've ever seen.  The choices and selection have to been seen to be appreciated.  Watch out for happy hour: yes, the drinks are 1/2 price, but only at select locations.  Don't just swim up to any bar, they're not all honoring happy hour and you get whopped with the bill at the end.  The beach was fabulous; even though the hotel was pretty full, the beach was still not packed and the sand was great.  The water isn't as clear as we anticipated but still really, really nice. Khao Lak is a wonderful town.  Although catering to tourists, it's a very enjoyable town to be in, dine…

title: Nice Hotel
review: My partner and I stayed here back in November for 3 nights on a package. My first impression wasn't too good as the reception staff didn't seem like the happiest or most helpful of people. However the room was nice and pool access....the entire hotel was pool access. Simply amazing! No need to leave your room or the pool that surrounds the hotel. I liked how they have daily activities that you can sign up for such as thai boxing classes, aerobics etc. A very very busy hotel! You don't really know until breakfast (which was very very nice and had a hugh variety!) or when you try to find a chair by the beach. To get in the front row, you may need to wake up at 5am as it is in high demand.  The staff at Olive were extremely kind! Probably the nicest staff members at this hotel. One…

title: Paradise Found: Fantastic Resort - Exceptional Staff
review: This resort appears to successfully cater for everybody: families, couples, singles, corporate guests, expats, divers, the young and the old from all over the world.   Our 15 day holiday needed to cater for two exhausted working parents with two children: aged one and the other seven. It was a tall ask, but the JW Marriott, Khao Lak excelled. Apologies for the long summary – but we loved it.  STAFF One word - Excellent. In reception, Kathleen is marvellous and helpful. If you need anything she can organise it, book it and get you on your way. The Waterfront team look after guests at breakfast and lunch. I wish to personally thank Nuch (I note an earlier review mentioning Nuch - she is truly wonderful), Mew, Oil, Nam, Mam, and the remainder of Ann's team for making sure we had…

title: Just Superb
review: Firstly: BEWARE of the taxi driver outside the hotel. I had enjoyed my stay in the JW Marriot Hotel, Khao Lak. The staff were nice, brilliant rooms!! and pretty much everything else was perfect. Good food in the Restaurants: Premrudi (Thai) and Antonio's (Italian) restaurants outside the hotel in the small plaza. Would really recommend to stay in this hotel!

title: Fantastic stay!
review: This resort offers you all pleasures of life. Green territory, awesome beach, spacious room and bathroom. Breakfast buffet is very rich and various. The spa is fantastic and absolutely worth its money. The restaurants of the hotel are not cheap but not too expensive either and the food was very good, I especially appreciated BBQ night (all you can eat for around 30 Euro is really a great deal with all their lobsters, crabs and tiger prawns!) I can mention only two weak points. The first is the staff speaking very poor English. This was quite a negative surprise. The second is the room cleaning. It was clean but some maids did their job worse than the others. It happened a couple of times when things were not systemized well but overall nothing bad to comment. If you want to have…

title: Great hotel for everyone!
review: We have really enjoyed our stay at the JW Khao Lak. From the minute we walked into the hotel the staff has been so friendly and helpful. The suites are spacious and very good for a family of 4. The restaurants at the property are a bit expensive, but the restaurants on the beach next to the resorts are really nice so for cheaper options it is worth to visit those.   The breakfast is great! Huge variation. The waitress Nuch is a star. We hope the hotel takes good care of her. She really looks after her guests. Every morning she has given our little boy his favourite fruit and make sure we have enough coffee.   The beach boys who looks after the bar and service at the beach is also great. Walks around and fills up your glass all day with water, fresh towels and makes sure the…

title: Great location, bad experience, hotel sold out to Indian wedding during entire stay.
review: Sadly our stay here coincided with a very large Indian Wedding that was taking place.  The wedding spanned 3 days and consumed the majority of the Marriott's facilities.  The  best views and locations by the pool and beach were inaccessible - unless you were a part of the wedding.  The beach and pool were unusuable ad you couldn't hear yourself think because the wedding music was blaring through loudspeakers.  It's a shame that Marriott would choose to turn their resort that has won Trip Advisor's "rest and relaxation" award into such a circus for 3 days.  Truly a dissapointing stay in Thailand.

title: Quiet, clean, nice resort.
review: I wrote a review about a month ago, but when I tried to submit, there's an error and it's gone, since then, I still feel obliged to write something about this Resort. We got the deal from a website, the price was very good, although later I found the resort is not really on the Phuket island.  It's about 70km north to the HKT Airport.  Nice place, hit hard by the tsunami in 2004, but it's recovered gradually, you can still find some ruin about 10 minutes north to the resort. We didn't find any public transportation from HKT to the resort, so we decided to book the car rental before we left home. You can find some links from the HKT website. It's a small Toyota auto at fair rental price, pick up just outside the terminal. The road from airport to the highway is pretty narrow, and…

title: Fantastic Hotel!!
review: One of the best hotels i have been to! what a amazing hotel. Nice staff, not more than 10 minutes drive to the Khao Lak city center. Also easy access to shops in the new plaza next door Khao Lak Village, which has lots of shops, Recommend to go and eat in the Premrudi Thai Restaurant in the Khao Lak Village

title: Great Resort !!
review: We had a wonderful time here, it is an amazing resort which maintains its standard, the beach is beautiful and you can walk long distance on soothing sand.  The layout is great, and feels lovely, not to forget the loong pool which adds to the beauty.  Also, breakfast is another story it its own, huge and also had some indian food, loved it :)  Also, there are several beach side shacks and massage shops, also a small plaza opened on gate recently, we had good pizza in the plaza.  Overall, recommend it, would definitely love to go back ..

title: Nice hotel but far from town. Food was marginal and expensive. No gluten free bread there!
review: I actually emailed the hotel reservation to inform them about our dietary needs and would like to have gluten free bread for breakfast. But the staff just turned a blank face until the fourth day, the manager from the restaurant overhead my complaint and he told me that he would personally worked with his chef to make me some gluten free bread.  I think his name is Falco? He was true to his words.  Although the gluten free bread was not anywhere close to the ones I had at Le Meridien Chiang Mai, nonetheless, the chef and the manager tried and we appreciated that.  The food was pretty much the same everyday but because we had to eat gluten free, our selection was really limited.  However, their freshly squeezed juice was great.  Our hotel room had direct pool access.  We got the…

title: Best hotel I've ever stayed at!
review: I never thought I could really say this but by far the best hotel I've ever stayed at. From the service to the ammenities to the room to the location, everything about it was perfect. My boyfriend and I stayed there Nov 22-25 and were not expecting anything at all. We were a little surprised when it took about an hour to get there from the Phuket airport but it ended up being our favorite feature that it was away from the tourists and in the natural environment of Thailand among national parks. Since it's over a 20 hour flight to get there, it would be hard to go there all the time but I will make it a huge effort to try to go again...and bring all of my family and friends!

title: Great JW property - Gorgeous beach away from the crowds!
review: My wife and I stayed at the JW Khao Lak for 3 nights during our recent trip to Thailand.  We were there November 21-24 and had a great stay.  Check in was typical for JW properties, no issues.  We are both Platinum members, used points for the stay, and were upgraded to a GREAT bi-level Suite.  We were very pleased with the room accommodations.  Comfortable beds, clean rooms, and nice amenities all around. Our room was not a "swim up" room but I actually preferred NOT being poolside as others swimming can look into your room and it's not as private.  I much preferred the 2nd floor.  The pool and beach area are gorgeous.  My wife and I made a lap around the pool and it took a half hour at least.  It's great.  Nice, wide beach and there were barely any waves while we were there. …

title: exactly the same as the last review...the best hotel we've ever stayed in!
review: Not the most luxurious but definitely the best in terms of service and hotel grounds.  I know the pool's been reviewed till death and by now the whole world knows it has the best swimming pool in the world, but I'm going to be repetitive and say this pools is the mother of all pools!  I've never stayed in the pool for so long in my life...it's wonderful swimming around the entire hotel grounds, kind of romantic at night.    Food wise only the main restaurant was opened while we were there due to low season, food was nice - fresh and nicely cooked.  Beachfront restaurants to the sides of the hotel much cheaper but not food not as nice.    We stayed on the third floor and the balcony area was very nice to hang around at night with a can of beer.  I'm a bit apprehensive though due…

title: Impressive and very comfortable
review: You seem to take forever to get here but once you do it is fabulous. Three k swimming pool and very helpful and friendly staff. Happy hour is great value and the array of edibles for breakfast is wondrous with fab staff to cater to your every need. If you wander down the beach there is a choice of little local eateries who serve up yummy, cheapo, nosh. You can also get a good massage here.

title: Exceptional
review: The only reason we booked this hotel because of a deal through Travelzoo. It is about 1 hour north of the airport and away from Phuket tourist. We are sooo glad that we did. The resort was above and beyond our expectations. We had a pool access room, the rooms were beautiful, and the pillows are the best i've ever slept on. We had problems with our ac and our video player, both times they were in our room within 10 minutes and fixed the problems. The breakfast was huge and lots of different selections. The pool was so large that it always seemed like very few people were in it.  The staff almost always smiled everytime you walked by one. The room service was great.The restaurants were good. it was fun to have food brought to you while on the beach or at the swim up bars. We also…

title: Great resort for a bout of relaxation
review: We stayed here for 4D3N with our baby girl and things couldn't get better. We had a pool access room and we swam with our girl every day in peace and quiet. The beach is secluded and quiet and very relaxing. There were some huts nearby selling affordable food. The spa was good.  However, if you like the hustle and bustle of town, then this place is not for you. The nearest town is very quiet (takes you probably no more than 10 mins to walk from one end to the other). If you want to be in a world of your own, then this is it.

title: beautiful, relaxing, romantic
review: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 7 nights in November 2011. We had never stayed in a 5 star hotel/resort before and we were blown away with the standard of service and facilities the JW Marriott Khao Lak gave us. The room we had was a Pool Access which was wonderful. Large bath and shower and the most comfortable bed and pillows. Free WIFI internet was great as I took my laptop and we were able to book day tours and upload photos to family and friends from our room.  The hotel is very much secluded (there are no other resorts either side of it - it is basically in the jungle). However there are beach restaurants run by locals either side of the resort which sell food, drink and massages. We ate at these places most nights as prices were much cheaper than the hotel restaurants…

title: Marvelous resort for relax and enjoy
review: I stayed in this property from 13-16th NOvember with big group for company seminar. This is one of the finest property of JW Marriott  group. It far from the hustle and bustle of Phuket town. One should  chose this reort if really want to relax and enjoy sea privately with less crowd. The property is  very big with swimming pool all around with center big pool with jacuzzi. The spa is very nice with big rooms and the massage staff are too good . The rooms are  spacious with nice comfortable bed and sitting area. The balcony is also  big  to relax. The bathroom is good but not  big enough in compare to other  resorts of this standard. The sea front is very very good with enough chairs with umbrellas and staff to serve you with drinks and meals. all the staffs were courteous and…

title: Great resort, average atmosphere
review: The widespread resort is a beautiful park area with lots of accommodation buildings surrounded by a large pool. The ground floor rooms have direct pool access. There are almost no rooms with sea view. Deckchairs are all around the resort and on the beach. Restaurants are also everywhere with high quality food, perfect service and different styles. Breakfast is served in huge halls, this has a train station atmosphere. Only a few tables are provided outside.  Staff in the resort is very helpful and friendly – beside the front desk reception. Staff is incompetent, unprofessional and unfriendly. Check-in and Check-out was full of mistakes and rudeness. Complaints and requests during our stay with the front-desk never received an answer or reply.  Rooms are coming with all amenities…

title: Amazing experience, luxury at it's best!
review: We booked the Marriott Khao Lak after seeing a deal on Travelzoo, offering ideal dates during our 3 week holiday in Thailand.  This was our first experience of 5 star standards and our expectations were met entirely as we arrived - and completely surpassed when we were shown to our room!  We were greeted at reception with a cold towel, fruit juice and biscuits then checked-in by the friendly and efficient staff and driven to our room on a little buggy.  The room was amazing, with private sun deck area and steps leading down into the infinity pool.  So many extra little touches could be found in the room, that just make a property 5 star!  The bed and pillows were the most comfortable thing I have ever lay on, and the bathroom was out of this world with the biggest bath and…

title: The best hotel we've stayed in!
review: My mother and I stayed at the JW Marriot between the 5th and 12th November and I can't describe our stay as anything other than excellent! We flew to Puhket's airport and the trip from there to the hotel went smoothly.  Our room: + We stayed in a pool access room, and it's worth the extra money! It was very peaceful sitting outside by the pool drinking a cup of tea. And if you wanted to take a swim you just had to jump in the water and not bother at all with packing your back and go to the pool/beach. My mother loved it! And it was a bit entertaining to watch the people who swam by. I encourage you to stay in a pool access room, it was AMAZING! + The rooms are big, spacious and very beautiful! + The room was always clean when you came back from the beach. And the housekeepers…

title: Only Three Nights, Not Long Enough!
review: Lovely private rooms overlooking a lagoon...swim-in-swm-out...Beds are sumptuous, with high quality mattress. Beachfront is very quiet and restful. Gorgeous waves (too strong for small children)...and the world's best breakfast buffet overlooking the ocean. The spa was fabulous...with experienced & well trained staff. Staff were very attentive in general, although welcome was calm but a little underwhelming. The restaurants were all excellent...and there was a seafood buffet out-of-doors one night. There are also good low-tech beach restaurants off to one side for inexpensive dining or a change of scene. Only negative for people seeking a lot of action is that it is not that close to any other hotels or main beaches..but this is a plus, if you are looking for some time-out.

title: An amazing experience
review: My husband and I stayed here after booking the hotel on a 'last minute' deal.  We were picked up from the airport from the hotel's taxi and the transfer was about 1 hr and no hassle.  We'd had 3 flights of around 17 hrs so were were very tired.  The hotel was just beautiful, so spacious and clean, reception staff were very efficient and we were in our room within 15 minutes.  Our room was on the 3rd floor but I was not disappointed at all, in fact the views were amazing.  The rooms were clean and spacious and had a feeling of luxury.    The swimming channels around the hotel are a brilliant way of keeping fit without realizing it!  There are 2 swim up bars serving 'happy hour' cocktails at around £3 from 5 - 6.30pm.  The hotel is right on the beach and it takes your breath away,…

title: ... relaxation, great personal service
review: We booked this resort and were initially a bit sceptical because it was far from Phuket area.  Turned out that we liked the Khao Lak area so much that we never went over to Phuket.  Enjoyed the elephant camp, waterfalls, beaches and of course the JW resort.  We were initially given a family room and were then upgraded to a bi-level room (highly recommend) - with two bathrooms.  Was great for my wife, two daughters (ages 12 and 10) and myself.  The hotel has a great pool, beach, spa and restaurants.  However, what really sets this resort apart from others: 1) Management attention.  Appreciate the service, entire hotel staff provided.  Many thanks to the General Manager (Ty C.) and Ms. Yuki for making our stay wonderful. 2) Breakfast area.  The best array and quality of items I…

title: Book pool access!
review: We stayed at the JW Marriott using a travel deal and didn't realize it was in Khao Lak and it Phuket - opps. So check you hotel name properly.  The pool access room is amazing - you need to book this, but try and ask for block 3 or 4 (we were in block 4) as access to the pool is much easier with steps and pool with is wider. I had a massage nearly every day - they are amazing and just like what you get at home - but you also pay the same rate as well ($90aus) for 60min aroma. But we got massages as part of our travel deal.  Food is cheap and tasty at the places next door on the beach.  Breakfast is massive with so much to choose from.  Don't bother going to Khao Lak - it's like a sleep town.  Great hotel to relax and do nothing. But expect to pay nearly 3000tb getting there from…

title: An Exceptional Experience
review: My wife and I just returned from a stay at the Marriott in Khao Lak and we have no hesitation in saying it is among the best hotels we have ever stayed in. We stayed in a deluxe pool access room which was just superb. Very well equipped with 37 inch flat screen TV, mood lighting and wifi, not to mention one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The pool, which is accessed directly from the room, has to be seen to be believed - winding all the way around the complex with a great swim-up bar in the centre (perfect for happy hour at 5pm!). We had a voucher which entitled us to a free meal at the Thai restaurant on-site, which was great (you can eat Thai-style on floor cushions which is fun) although every other night we ate at one of the beach restaurants as they were…

title: Very relaxing five star hotel far from phuket or anything
review: we stayed here for three nights and hotel is marvelous, a typical wonderful southeast asia five star resort. Great service, nice rooms, beautiful landscaping and creative design of the water canal covering all wings so most first floor rooms have access to the pool directly(make sure you ask for one that does). There are two pool bars and some whirlpool areas too, we spent a lot of time in the water due to its nice design and easy access. As previous reviews already said, food quality is not five star, we ordered room service once and had to change an item since it simply wasn't right. The Thai restaunt seems quite ok though we dined there twice. Location wise it is an hour and half from phuket airport, almost two hours from phuket and a good hour and 15 minutes to the boat dock…

title: Nice Hotel but unorganised Reception.
review: The hotel was great! Big swimming pool with pool acess, nice beach, good food, clean. We were here with 2 families for 10 days.  I was only a little dissapointed with the reception. I had sent an email, fax and telephoned befrore our arrival as i had my 86 year old mother in law with us and requested our rooms near each other(not done, possible the next days). The same with a late check out, we asked on arrival and were told to ask the day before. Were then told not possible but when our friends asked for them it was possible. Seems to be some sort of lack of communication and very unorganised. We were also called back as they had forgotten to charge something to our room after we had paid. etc etc... I had very good friends in Phuket who called the hotel several times and were…

title: Absolutely Beautiful
review: I absolutely love this resort - I would definitely rate it in the top places I have ever been.  It is around 1 hour and 20 minutes drive from Phuket airport but on a relatively smooth road passing through many small towns so doesn't feel that far.  The airport transfer service offered by the hotel (2,500 baht) was excellent with water and cold towels provided (plus a super plush mini van that was well air conditioned) however, the local taxis are very good and much cheaper (we were able to barter a deal for just 1,000 baht for the trip back).    Breakfasts are amazing, smoothie bar is out of this world and the Thai and 'Olive' Mediterranean restaurants are pretty good although as many others have recommended, the local restaurants just next to the hotel on the beach are…

title: very good
review: bsolutely brilliant resort. Rooms were spacious; bed was very comfortable; bathroom was large and clean; service was fantastic. Breakfast was more than plentiful with a wide-range of choices. We loved the 'smoothy bar' at breakfast and the chefs were just great in making you any type of egg combination you wanted. I joined friends staying at this resort for a couple of days. The pool access room was the perfect choice for me. Two steps down from my patio into the 3.1 km of swimming canals, which lead to the big pool in the middle of the property. Breakfast was delicious! Plenty of choices.

title: simply beautiful
review: very beautiful hotel with luxury interior.. had an awesome time there with delicious food served had a great time in pool with my love. it was like she falls for me again, food was good service was on time and the scenery view was as good as hotel interior

title: This is just the best place to stay!
review: Absolutely brilliant resort.  Rooms were spacious; bed was very comfortable; bathroom was large and clean; service was fantastic.  Breakfast was more than plentiful with a wide-range of choices.  We loved the 'smoothy bar' at breakfast and the chefs were just great in making you any type of egg combination you wanted. The restaurants are lovely, but you can eat and drink like a king at any of the restaurants located on the beach within 50 metres of the Resort for next to nothing.  The massages also located on the beach are fabulous (A$10 for 1 hour body/back/foot massage). There is heaps to do at the Resort.  Everything from tennis to sqaush to snooker to biking.  But, because the weather is generally excellent, you are able to lounge around the pool areas or the beach areas for…

title: Pool Access room is the best choice.
review: I joined friends staying at this resort for a couple of days.  The pool access room was the perfect choice for me.  Two steps down from my patio  into the 3.1 km of swimming canals, which lead to the big pool(s) in the middle of the property.  Breakfast was delicious!  Plenty of choices.  A light airy breakfast room overlooking the beach area.    Rooms and furnishings show some wear, but I like the Thai style.  The perfect place to veg out for a few days.

title: Superb service!
review: Stayed at JW Marriott Khao Lak during October 21-24. Impressed by the van transportation arranged by the hotel which picked us up from the airport. Polite driver who welcomed you with cold towels and cold water. The "at your service" department from the hotel called while we were still in the van to tell us they have everything prepared and if there was anything else we need. I told them a wheelchair would be nice since my mom has bad knees and a wheelchair was waiting at the exit from our van when we got to the hotel with 5-6 hotel staff rushing to the van to help us getting off. What a VIP arrival! The hotel ground was nice, huge canal-like pool, had fun walking around with my family. Don't forget to go to the infinity pool. We had fun floating on the jacuzzi bed. The kid pool…

title: Beautiful 5 star resort, in a beautiful location
review: If you want busy markets, and blaring night clubs, this is not the place to go. This awesome resort is a little quiet piece of heaven in a beautiful country. My wife and I stayed here with some friends, and absolutely loved it!  The resort is simply georgeous! The pool more then inviting, and the beach divine. The rooms were lavish, clean, and a pleasure to be in... not that we spent much time in there. There is just so much to do. The staff were pleasant and helpful, and we only had one power outtage, for about 20 sec the entire time we were there.  The food at the resort is quite nice, however, it is a little over priced. A dinner for two will set you back about 5000TBH, however, we dinned at the little restoraunts on either side of the resort on the beach with our friends,…

title: Beautiful hotel, food quality should be improved
review: Beautiful hotel with an amazing pool. Very pleasant and efficient staff.  Rooms are extremely clean and well furnished (the water supply is sometimes not totally efficient though, with a lot of drop of pressure. But it is not that big a deal. The same goes for the almost daily (short) electricity cut off.  The beach is vast and beautiful. The sport room is excellent.  The 4 or 5 outside restaurants on the beach are very cheap and cook good (Thai) food.  We would overall recommend such resort because it is peaceful as well as beautiful. You can relax far from stress in a luxury environment.  On the (few) "negative" aspects: it is really far from the so-called city (15 mn drive), and there is not much to do around (the hotel or tour operators propose guided tours, but mainly to…

title: Idyllic resort
review: Spent the weekend at this resort on a business meeting. Was unable to explore the whole resort but the parts of it I saw were beautiful. The pool access from the rooms is unique - just jump from your balcony into the canal and swim round the entire complex. The food was also very good, especially the seafood. The staff were attentive to a fault. Overall, this is a great place for rest and relaxation.

title: Total 5 star experience and then some
review: We were there Oct 11 for 7 nights. Everything was perfect. Stand out staff Sak and Irinia made it unforgettable. Facilities, food, rooms, setting, beach and staff all 5 star. Best holiday! Sue & Paul Barnes, we will be back.

title: Beautiful Hotel!
review: Nice hotel in Khao Lak, not too far from the main area. When i got there we realized that we had  come to the perfect hotel since we was tired, needed a foot massage, there was a spa right next door in Khao Lak Village. So not a long walk. The hotel is big, the staff are very kind and the rooms are gorgeous!

title: Best Location, Best Rooms, Best Service + Great Local Bars next door
review: Words cant describe how great this place was. It had the best service, great huge long amazing pool, friendly staff, and best breakfast i have ever had.   Depending on how much money you want to spend on dinner and lunch every day you can either eat at the Marriot or walk 30 meters next door to enjoy the cheapest cocktails and food around the resort.  Next door at the Andaman Restaurant we had the best food, after the second night the staff served cocktails at the happy hour price all night. Drink and food are usually about 1/2 the price of at the Marriot, and massages are 1/4 of the price.  Also they have a great tour guide called Mr. Cha, his company can arrange for pick up to and from the airport to the JW Marriot and he will tailor any tour to they way you want it.  I made 2…

title: Gorgeous just loved it
review: We had just spent a week in Phuket and decided to spend our last days at Khao Lak having bought a deal . Thank goodness, we were not impressed with Phuket but Khao Lak gave us a true taste of Thailand and the resort was amazing, so very very beautiful, their attention to detail was extraordinary. We loved all about this resort.

title: It's a great place to stay!
review: Highly recommended  to anybody looking for a relaxing slice of luxury.   If your know Queensland, this area is similar to a Sunshine Coast holiday as opposed to a Gold Coast - Patong!  The swimming pool surrounding the resort is fantastic and I took the reccomendation from TripAdvisor about the garden units in block 1 and 2.  It's well worth the privacy it affords.   The breakfast Buffett is fantastic and all the staff were so friendly.   We will be back...it's well with it!

title: Fabulous hotel!
review: If you are going to Khao Lak you must stay at this hotel. The service was fabulous and the rooms are amazing. The buffet breakfast is also wonderful. The pool is enormous and the beach is beautiful. The gym is great too.

title: Excellent staff made up for the torrential rain and poor dinner experiences
review: This trip was my first trip overseas, we arrived late on the 28th September and departed on the 5th of September (7 night stay), after a very long day of travelling we checked in to the JW Marriott Khao Lak with ease (“Finny” - Assistant At Your Service Manager - checked us in and would be our point of contact for our entire stay). She escorted us to our room and showed us the basics (where to find the remotes, mini bar, safe etc). After a delightful room service meal, we fell into the BEST BED we have ever stayed in - pillows are amazing and the comfort level of the actual bed was absolutely what you would expect for a 5 star resort. The rooms are lovely, shower is massive, bath was huge and the TV and DVD player worked so we couldn’t complain! Every day we asked for 4 bottles…

title: Great hotel want to return!
review: Stayed here on 2nd October for 1 night to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We travelled from Phuket where we were staying at the JW Marriott for 2 weeks. First Impressions  were good with beautiful lobby and easy check in. Staff seemed bemused that we were checking in for 1 night only but when reason was explained they understood. Hotel grounds were beautiful and well kept. Shown to our room a Duplex suite on the second floor which was exceptionally nice with huge bathroom and lovely balcony with cushioned seating area overhanging the pool canal below. Used the infinity pool and decked lounger area   towel and iced water provisions we goos and staff pleasant lunch there was good with a decent selection on the menu. Beach was nice and access was very simple. Resort seemed to be…

title: Thai Restaurant
review: My fiancee took me to the hotels thai restaurant for my 40th birthday and what a fabulous time had.The setting was wonderfull so romantic the staff were so attentive and the quality of the food excellent and the service impecible. They made a special night for me so memorable even bringing cake (which I hasten to add they gave complimentary) and singing happy birthday to me. We were not guests at hotel but were treated exactly the same and enjoyed the experience so much we shall be returning to sample their Japanese restaurant and would highly recommend if you want a special night out to dine there :)

title: Lovely hotel but customer service could be better during torrential rains
review: My husband and I have recently returned following a 12 day holiday at the JW Marriott in KL and in all fairness we were dreadfully affected by the appalling weather and suffered torrential rainfall the whole time we were there apart from a few hours on 2 days which is totally beyond the control of the hotel of course.  However, I would have liked to have seen them at least acknowledge the appalling weather and to have done SOMETHING to try and improve customers' holiday in some way!  Unfortunately, what we found is that the management just appeared to have buried their heads and decided to completely ignore the fact that clients had paid a considerable amount of money and travelled huge distances in many cases to stay in a beachside location in a quiet area which was proving…

title: This is a brilliant place
review: My husband and I stayed here for a week, and were very impressed with this beautiful resort. The grounds are stunning, and the beach itself is pristine and un-crowded. There is a very peaceful Thai feel to the place with lovely gardens and room decor. BEST BEDS EVER! Everyone talks about the pools and swimming canals- well, they are the best...miles of them, sparkling clean and you can swim or walk all around the resort. The sunsets looking out at the beach are really beautiful. Happy hour at the bar was fantastic value, and the restaurants were very good value. We enjoyed the Thai more than the Mediterranean ( no surprise when you're in Thailand that local food is better) Buffet breakfast was awesome with freshly prepared juices, eggs, waffles and lots and lots of choices. The…

title: Unbelievably beautiful - what a resort!
review: My husband and I stayed at the JW Marriott for 1 week from 15-23 September – what a delightful holiday! The resort is unbelievably beautiful and I am so happy we chose to stay here. It’s definitely worth every one of its five stars.  We stayed in a pool access room – after having read the recommendations from reviewers – and I highly agree. If you can, stay in a pool access room; you won’t regret it! We went in the rainy season, but it only rained heavily for 2 of days we were there. We even got a few days of blue skies and sunshine, which was pure bliss. The resort was very quiet at this time of year. But we didn’t mind that at all!  The resort itself is breathtaking from the lobby, to the architecture, to the pool design, to the room decor, which has an oriental flair, and to…

title: Best resort we have found...
review: Been a long time since we have been to a resort this nice. It was our highlight of ten days in Thailand. A TravelZoo Pkg which included a dinner and breakfasts, as well as an hour Thai massage. Most extraordinary swimming pool and lagoon canal, 6' from the back door. Swim up bar, awesome sunsets. Breakfast Bar was phenomenal. 150' of bliss, Eggs Benedict and Sushi included. Dinner at the Thai restaurant was disappointing. I do better at home. The beach restaurants on either side of the resort, had excellent food and drinks for reasonable prices. Lobster for two, $15US. Cold beer, $1. Rooms are elegant, beautiful conveniences and construction. Deck by the lagoon. Staff is exceptional, 1st class.  A totally awesome experience. Would I recommend it? Absolutely!

title: Excellent resort... a couple of minor items
review: I stay at this resort from Sept 14th through Sept 16th.  I got the package from Travelzoo which included 1 hour thai massage for 2 persons, daily breakfast, and 1 3-course dinner.    Resort - this hotel is situated 1.25 - 1.50 hours from Phuket airport.  I got a metered taxi which costed me 1400 baht but if you arrange taxi services ahead of time, it will cost you 200-300 baht less.  Arrived at the lobby and we were welcomed with refreshing drinks.  Checking in was a breeze.  Beach - It was stunning view especially during sunset, however, as noted by many members of the forum, the water is very wavy/tidy and it's not suitable for swimming.    Room - I booked the pool access room and it was very nice.  While it was very easy to get into the pool, getting out of the pool at the…

title: A true relaxation for mind and soul!
review: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in this hotel as a part of the vacation in Phuket, as we have been to Phuket area once, we would like this time to try something new. So we started off from Surin Beach and drove around 2 hours up North, the road was smoother and a lot of quieter to drive around if compared to the busy traffic in Phuket area; Even though our car was not equipped with GPS (I used mine on Nokia but it wasn’t able to tell our position for most of the time so in the end I didn’t even bother trying), there was no problem to find the hotel as there are clear signs all along the road when driving from Phuket, I think I saw the first sign by the road when I didn’t even cross the bridge to the North, so all you need to do is to follow road 402 & 4 all the way up…

title: Stunning in Every Way
review: Recently stayed at the resort as part of a Corporate conference. The room I had had direct pool access which is brilliant. The decor and furnishings in the rooms are beautiful and the bed was the most comfortable you can imagine. The resort is huge and the facilities are all of an incredibly high standard. The food in the various restaurants was faultless and the breakfast buffett was delicious especially the fruit smoothies made to order. What was truly outstanding however were the staff, gracious, helpful, friendly and professional....a real credit to the resort. Was a shame not to be able to enjoy the resort more but was there on work....will be back with the family soon.

title: Great resort
review: Stayed here for 5 nights in August, this was by far the best hotel we stayed in on our trip to Dubai & Thailand. We stayed in a pool access room which was large and had all the facilities you could need. Decor and maintenance of the room was great. The pools and the moats around the resort were fantastic and despite the amount of water were cleaned every day so were always clean. The resort was really quiet because of the time of year, though even in peak season I can't imagine it feeling crowded. Restaurants in the hotel were ok, though we found the Thai food to be poor for the price. This wasn't a problem though as there were 4 beach restaurants within a couple of minutes walk of the hotel which had good food for their much cheaper price. Breakfast at the hotel was good…

title: Stunning beach & fab waves !!!
review: If you go for: relax, quite, beach, good quality, just peace ..... go for this one. It’s out of the bustling tourism of Phuket, but worthwhile to drive an hour up north.  It’s absolutely 5 star ... (Kempinski standards), just great !!  You won’t regret it. The rooms, the food, the surroundings. Such a relaxed place.  The kids most favorite hotel ever. Just wonderful. We’ll be back .....

title: A very beautiful beach resort
review: My family of 4(2 adults, 2 kids) spent a week here to relax in July 2011. This resort is beautiful and exudes class in every respect.  First, the rooms are large, modern, spacious, elegant with a bit of Thai decor. The beds are big and comfortable, as expected of Marriott quality. I also loved the sofa on the balcony outside. The bathtube was the largest I've ever seen at a hotel.  The outstanding feature of the hotel are its 3 enormous pools all connected a canal that runs all around each of the wings of the resort. Those who have a ground floor room can just walk straight into the canals and swim. It is so relaxing to swim through the canals and pools as the surrounding gardens and buildings are so pleasing to look at.  The resort is right on Khuk Khak beach, a very long…

title: Best family vacation ever!
review: This was by far the best family vacation we have ever had.  My wife, 4 year son. and I had a fabulous time here.  The facilities were overwhelming.  The breakfast buffet was top notch and kept us full all day long while swimming in the enormous pool and playing on the beach.  They had a great club for kids to keep them occupied while we enjoyed our spa treatments.  I have been in Thailand for 20 years and this was by far the best massage I have ever had.  The staff was very professional and the spa was elegant and serine.  The only negatives of our trip was the rain and having to leave.  This is a great spot for families or couples wanting to relax and spend some quality time together.  We will definitely be returning in the future.

title: Beautiful
review: The JW Marriot Hotel is simply beautiful. The personnel is very kind and always smiling and professional. The room (pool access) is clean and big. The breakfast is good and there was a lot of food to choose. I used the fitness center and the bike rent and this was useful to go around the hotel. I suggest to spend a little bit for the room with pool access, it's very nice.

title: Wanna visit again!
review: It was a perfect stay! Nice weather even in the wet season, kind staff, grrrreat pools, fantastic beach...  Restaurants are not bad, but I'd rather order in room dining services and spend more time in the pool(you can ask the housekeeping to heat up the food you brought from home). In wet season like now, you can have lunch only at Waterfront(the breakfast restaurant), Infinity pool bar, Deli(mostly sandwiches) or in your room. For dinner, Waterfront is closed and 2 among 3 restaurants(Ta Krai, Olive and Sakura) are open. The pool bar closes at 8PM. Restaurants are few and the menu is simple. Oh, the staff are very kind and the dining atmosphere is superb. Having a Marriott Gold card(F&B card) would help.  Otherwise, Phen's restaurant on the right side of the hotel beach offers…

title: Escape the madding crowds
review: If you want to find a piece of paradise on earth, this is it. The resort has the largest pool in South East Asia at 3 kms long, and I definitely recommend the pool access rooms. However my suggestion to the Resort would be to install access, either a portable step or hand rails to allow easier access out of the pool. This would be a problem currently for elderly and not so mobile, or pregnant women to get out the pool in front of your room. Rooms are a lovely size and the bathroom is large. I would come back and stay here.

title: A Beautiful Resort and Going Back in October
review: The Khao Lak Marriott Resort is 80 km North of the Phuket airport.  We had a nice one hour flight down from Bangkok and took a taxi from the airport.  Taxi cost was 1500 Baht and took about 1 1/2 hours.  The resort is beautiful and located on the coast.  It was another resort which was destroyed by the Tsunami and was rebuilt by an investor and leased to Marriott.  When we arrived we were greeted by the hotel staff and the GM Mr.Jan-Hein Breitschaft.  All the check-in forms had been filled in and after a brief discussion in the lobby along with a welcome drink and cold wash cloth we were escorted to our room directly on one of their swimming pool canals.  In side the beautiful room the Guest Relations lady explained the layout of the resort and briefed us on all the activities…

title: Excellent and Poor at the same time
review: We just came back from a one week stay at JW Marriott Khao Lak. The reason for my overall rating is that the place scored an 'Excellent' for some aspects and a 'poor' for others, so overall I think and 'average' rating is fair.  The excellent part is the following: 1. A beautiful resort layout with a huge pool running across the entire resort. If you get a room with pool access you will be able to get out of the room's door at the back, jump in the water and reach swimming any parts of the resort.  I don't think there are many resorts out there which have this type of facility and design at the same price. 2. The beach is absolutely fantastic. A huge, desert beach, with hardly anybody on it. No peddlers, no rowdy parties, no stray dogs: absolutely nothing but beautiful sand and…

title: Can't wait to return!
review: The hotel is gorgeous and the service couldn't be faulted. We loved having a pool access room and used this a lot.  The spa is fabulous, the pool bar happy hour lots of fun and the food in the restaurants top-notch.  There is a lot of attention to detail which makes a stay here a five star experience.  This hotel made the holiday that much more special and I would definitely recommend it.

title: Fantastic resort!
review: My family and I just came for the day to check it out. We were in the main JW Marriott.  We booked a room for the day. It was fabulous. Very new with hints of Thai interiors. I loved the room! It was spacious and the bathrooms were nice. Best of all, you have your own balcony that leads to the lazy river.  Service was great, loved that there are sunbeds by the beach and it was very quiet and private. I will definitely return. What a great find!

title: Blew my relatives away
review: It is always interesting to get someone else's perspective. Let me start by saying that I love this hotel. We have been here seven time in the last two years. We brought our family from the US here last month. They were blown away by the amazing landscaping of the property and its magnificent pool. It's situation on a fairly secluded beach is a also a real plus. They were also impressed by the luxurious rooms, nice kids pool and a terrific kids club as well.  A  helpful hint: While I like the food at the hotel, the simple beachside "shack" restaurants north of the hotel have been uniformly good-just get thai dishes (seafood are the best) and drink local beer. They are great places to see the sunset.  A suggestion:  The breakfast has gone from amazing to very good. I would like…

title: Amazing, pure luxury.
review: We stayed here for 7 nights, what can I say, amazing. We'd arranged a private car prior to landing at Phukett, it took around eighty minutes to get to the hotel.When we arrived we were greeted with a cold cloth & a lovely cold drink which was really refreshing, we sat down in the huge reception area & the staff did all the running around. A member of staff took us to the room, it was lovely,very clean, huge king bed, loads of pillows & a huge marble bathroom, the decor in the room was very tasteful. We had a pool access room which was a bonus, the pool was so clean & was very well maintained.The hotel provides you with free bottled water in your room & if you run out you can aske for more. Breakfast was included in our package, there was so much choice & the food was great…

title: Fantastic
review: Just loved this place.  The staff, especially 'Twee Twee' were lovely.  Want to go back..!!

title: Wow what a great relaxing holiday
review: This is a great resort, 5* facilitities, 3km of pool so all ground floor rooms have pool access. The only down side is the resort is about 15 min away from town, there are a couple of beach restaurants and a few beach massage places, so for a week of pure relaxation it was the perfect place, kids had a fantastic time too. at night ever second night they had either a fire show or fireworks it was great.

title: 2nd fabulous visit and we loved it even more.
review: This hotel really has it all.  Excellent facilities, peace and quiet, beautiful surroundings and friendly, helpful staff.  We returned this year because we couldn't find a hotel to rival this for super 5 star service yet excellent value.  The pool access rooms are fabulous leading onto the lazy river and highly recommended. The gym also is well equipped and offering classes this year too.  My family especially love the smoothie bar and the egg station at the breakfast  buffet which offers a huge range of excellent quality food. All staff from gardeners to drivers and waiters greet you with a genuine friendly smile and greeting. Our room attendant Tuan was friendly and very thorough and actually recognised us from the year before.  it is a good idea to use the shuttle service…

title: Marvelous Marriott
review: Amazing resort. 45 minutes by car from Phuket airport. We arrived mid-afternoon. Lobby was light and airy. We sat on one of the many sofas while staff checked us in. This place is huge-- with the lobby on one end and the beach on the other. The rooms span across the length of the resort, in four sections. The standout feature of this Marriott is undoubtedly the pool. It is EVERYWHERE! Highly recommend the pool access room, although you can't go wrong with the standard rooms on the upper level too. In fact those rooms probably get much more natural light from the fantastic little balcony that projects out.  We were truly spoiled for choice at breakfast. Incredible buffet with everything you can think of and then some. Highlights for us: the superb smoothie bar, omelette station,…

title: Crazy beautiful
review: This was a very memorable vacation for me - my boyfriend proposed to me here!!  JW Marriott Khao Lak is around one hour away from Phuket airport. We arranged the hotel to send a limo and it was around 1500baht - pretty reasonable. The limo had bottled water and wet towels prepared for us once we got in after being picked up.   This resort is spectacular - when checking in, they asked us to sit in the lobby sofa's to relax while they checked in for us - much better than standing at a desk watching the receptionist type away looking for your reservation!   First thing that caught our eye while checking in was the fantastic view of the resort - all those swimming pools! I almost got lost on the first two days because they have 3+ swimming pools, one with a small water slide, one…

title: Great Pool, great beach, great rooms, great breakfast... will be back
review: We had a beautiful room, huge in size, very modern and in top shape, with a little terrace and a footpath to the pool. We never had any kind of bug or insect in the room. Flatscreen TV with a huge selection of channels and free internet. One of the most comfy beds I have ever slept in, huge bathtub and additional shower. Breakfast was great with a good selection of european, thai and other choices, lots of fruit and smoothies prepared on order. Every day we ate on the terrace towards the beach, very nice view and very attentive staff. We tried two of the restaurants, both were okay and not too pricey. Two little Thai beach restaurants (not part of the hotel) to the left and the right of the property get most of the dining business, though, and they are cheaper and a very good…

title: Wonderful place
review: Stayed at this hotel for two weeks and we were very satisfied. The room was right next to the pool and it was excellent. Very comfy bed and the cleaning personell did a great job. The only thing was that one of the lamps at the terrace was broken for a couple of days without being replaced and with glass scattered on the floor.  The beach with the sunchairs was truly a dream. No other hotels nearby so the beach was quite empty if you walked for a few minutes. During the whole day we received water at our sunchairs by the beach personnel.   Breakfast couldn´t be better. It was very good.Fresh directly made smoothies. Lots of different fruits. All you could ask for. But I think the restaurants at the hotel had too few options on the meny. Just a 100 m from the hotel, on the beach,…

title: Nearly heaven
review: What a perfect resort!  We had a wonderful time and even 6 days of rain could not spoiled this. We stayed in a pool access room and that was amazing. Very comfortably rooms with everything in it, you can possibly wish for. The housekeeping girls (Tang and Kik) were adorable. Every employe was nice and always greeting. The pool indeed amazing and the beach clean and quiet. The restaurants were a bid disappointing but..... who cares.... Left from the resort there is a beach restaurant Farmai where you can eat good and very cheap.   The best resort we have ever stayed so far (and we stayed in a lot......) and we will certainly come back again. Again...... if heaven is somewhere....... it must be at The Marriott in Khao Lak.

title: Excellent customer service
review: Which hotel you have stayed that made you feel like a princess?  I found it – JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort and Spa!  This luxury hotel is the best hotel I have ever stayed with. It is located 1.5 hour’s drive from Phuket International Airport and 15 minutes from Khao Lak Town. The only way you get to this hotel is by taxi or hotel shuttle – there is no public transport from Phuket Airport to this hotel.  There is a beautiful water fountain right in front of the hotel with at least 4 bell boys waiting to take your bags.  The lobby is gigantic – with a huge waiting area. There is a tour desk/concierge by the side that help the guest to make travel arrangement and to book free shuttle to Khao Lak town. The reception counter is located at the other side of the tour desk; with at…

title: Perfectly amazing in every way.
review: This hotel is absolutely stunning.  The rooms are large, clean, and comfortable.  Housekeeping is excellent.  The staff is polite, gracious, and beyond helpful.  The grounds and *amazing* pool are impeccably clean and cared for.    Rooms come with included breakfast, which i did feel was perhaps a notch below the level of the hotel, but still very very good, and i am really grasping for something to be critical about here.  Lunch and dinner were provided as part of a conference we were attending but that was all very good, too - a nice variety of thai, indian, and chinese dishes were available at these meals.    By far the most amazing feature of this hotel is the pool access from first floor rooms - you simply walk out of your patio door and have instant access to the 3K of…

title: most amazing pool
review: Just got back from JW Marriot Khao Lak. Let me point out the most outstanding and valuable asset of  JW Marriot Khao Lak. Firstly,this resort has the most amazing pools, it is 3.1 km long. There are 2 main pools which connected by a canal/river to all the pool access room. The water is clean and is being vacuumed daily when we were there. The next best thing is the resort ground. All kinds of trees and shrubs and flowers and palms are planted around the resort. Feels like a mini botanic. I had a great time looking at plants and lizards.......... As for the rest..... The room is decent size, consists a king bed,which I found to be very comfy,  a day bed and a chaise lounger, there are 2 more lounger on the good size balcony. Good size bathroom, our room's (4012) toilet has a…

title: paradise !!! will be back !!
review: great place,great people. i cant find any fault in anyway. wish to be back there soon

title: Marvellous Hotel
review: We have just returned from 8 nights at this hotel. The whole experience was wonderful, from the initial greeting when we arrived, with cold towels and drinks being offered, to our bags being collected and placed in the taxi when we left.
