We were upgraded to a 'pool access' room, which was a real bonus, if we were to return, we would certainly go for this type of room again. The facilities in the room were in keeping with a 5-star property.  A lot has been said about the breakfast, I can only agree with most comments that a huge choice was offered, the 'smoothie bar' was a particular highlight! Everything we ate was fresh and delicious, plus we had the wonderful view out over the Andaman Sea.  We tried 'Olive' restaurant a couple of times, our meals were again delicious. The…

title: Great hotel with great staff
review: We stayed at the marriott Khao Lak for 5 nights in May 2011, next year we are planning to stay longer.When we arrived we were met at reception and received a cold drink and cold cloth to cool us down then we were informed about the hotel and received a map of the resort which at first you need while the place is massive!we were then taken to our room which was amazing: big massive comfy bed with amazing pillows 2 big comfy sofas and bathroom with a great big bath although could"nt find a plug but the shower made up for that it was the best we have had in Thailand and this was our 8th time,also the balcony with 2 chairs and a great sofa to relax on was brilliant to sit there and enjoy a singha beer or two.The resort itself  was so clean and tidy it was very well looked after with…

title: Lovely Hotel
review: J W MARRIOT KHAO LAK  Firstly let me start by saying that we do not normally stay at large hotel chains – and if we do it would be Four Season or Ritz Carlton – so my review may be unfair in regard to this hotel in this category.  There is no doubt that this is a beautiful hotel. The pools as talked about are amazing and so are the gardens.  We choose this hotel for part of our week in Khao Lak as we hoped it would offer activities for our teenage sons and hopefully some company. Unfortunately the hotel was half empty so there was a lack of kids and activities.  The activities listed – like beach soccer, pool tournaments etc do not happen.  The rooms are excellent. Go for the pool access which are fantastic. Not having a seas view is more than compensated for by the view over…

title: Swim arround the block
review: My first stay at this great hotel was during thai Songkran holidays. Though as it is with 5 Star resorts, you expect great service, clean rooms and a good rest. And I must say, it's all that. My personal preference would have been a boutique hotel but as we stayed with the mom, dad and my girlfriend, the Marriott Khao Lak is a great choice.  I especially enjoyed the huge pool that loops around the rooms like a venetian waterway. Instead of going for a walk on the property, you can go for a swim and be gone for 2 hours exploring... or swim from room to room... it's just amazing.   Breakfast has everything you desire, from thai to european food. The selection is grand... and so is the breakfast room. Go and choose a table outside in the shade so you have an even more relaxing…

title: Relaxing Stay
review: Stayed in a pool view room. The service here was great. I could not fault it. Staff were very polite and helpful. From the people behind the front desk to the maintaince staff. Each person smiled and said "hello" or "good morning", which was so nice.  The room was very nice, although I did find some features in the bathroom a little worn or not best thought out. For example there seemed to be no way to use the plug hole in the bath tub. We looked and looked but couldn't find a lever to pull up or down. Also, the towel rail had sharp edges and I'd bumped into it a couple of times leaving a bruise. Also the wooden section on the sink seemed to be suffering from rot due, obviously, to water penetration.  Also, during our stay a balcony from a room down from us broke. So all the…

title: Great hotel, very relaxing in a quiet part of Thailand
review: This hotel is excellent if you're looking for a quiet, relax holiday in Thailand.  The room is big and with comfortable bed and huge bathroom. The hotel itself was very nice with pool surrounding the hotel and it's private beach. Food was ok not so great. There are a few restaurants in the hotel. Breakfast was excellent but dinner and lunch quite average. You can rent a moped and go to the town centre for food but even for me the food in town was not that nice, maybe because it's a small town. Service was great, staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Perfect treat for all ages!
review: If you’re seeking a full relaxation or a great getaway to recharge yourself, then JW Marriott Resort and Spa at Khao Lak, Pang Nga is the choice not to be missed.   The resort is situated in a secluded area with beautiful beach and sensational long winding pool, a total length of 3 km. with varying depth from 1.3 – 1.6 m. (a good walking exercise for those with knee osteoarthritis). The lagoon-shaped pool winds along the 5 wings of the resort, hence guest rooms on ground levels are all pool accessible.  Besides superb room amenities, JW Khao Lak offers almost all round services for guests to enjoy, from fun-filled kids club to well functional fitness centre to the soothing Quan Spa. One feature that is outstanding from other resorts is the free internet access in guest rooms and…

title: Fabulous total relaxation, super service, excellent hotel!
review: The service in this hotel last summer was fabulous so we have rebooked for this year and are bringing along another family through our recommendations.  We have never returned to the same place before - believing there is so much more to see but didn't find anywhere to beat our experience so are returning. The large resort makes you feel you are the only people there and our children believed the lazy river was their own!  Loved the pool access rooms and superb room service with all the little extra 5 star touches.  We have travelled all over and have not bettered the treatment, service and welcome we got here.   (we are travelling from Ireland so are prepared to take quite a few flights to get to this lovely place) Our children enjoyed the smoothie station at breakfast and…

title: Great stay
review: Had a great stay here during XMas 2010.   The food is good, the beach is great and the pool/s in the resort are amazing - free WiFi covers nearly the entire resort grounds.   Staff are friendly and always cheerful.  Went there for a relaxing time and found it...happy days.

title: Lovely Beach Resort
review: Travelled with my older kids here and had 2 interconecting rooms with pool access and had a great time. the pool is very nice and because we love swimming the extra for pool access was well worth it. Breakfast was the best we had in Thailand. There seemed to be a fair bit on for the tourist and I dont think many leave the resort but there was not the large groups of Northern Europeans we came across at some places. The beach is v nice with a few restaurants beach side to the north.

title: Truly Amazing - we'll be back
review: We stayed at this resort for 3 nights in April and were truly amazed. The resort exceeded all expectations. We stayed in a pool access room which was fabulous - very well appointed with a private balcony leading to the pool. And the bed was incredibly comfortable. The 3km pool is sensational - the best pool we have experienced by far. It was a lovely warm temperature too. The grounds are beautiful, with lots of little private pockets for sun baking and lounging. The buffet breakfast is more than plentiful. The staff are incredibly friendly and always went out of their way to assist. We were there for Thai NY which was a fabulous experience. The hotel did fill up during this time, however it still very rarely felt at capacity. The price for food and drinks was very reasonable for…

title: Wao! Excellent, Relaxing, Serenity, Refreshing, Retreat. Wao!
review: I visited this hotel and I think no words can properly describe the beauty, serenity, and magic of the place, a must see! In my day job I have organized many conferences around Asia Pacific, from Hawaii to Mongolia, from Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Philippines to Thailand, from Australia to New Zealand and then some… and I can say, unambiguously, that this is a magnificent retreat, a perfect fit for any organization looking for conference venue geared towards keeping the delegates focused yet relaxed. It is totally suited for team and relationship building with strong, lasting bonds among conference participant.  As I think about it, wow, wow, WOW! I can say that the place has it all, I think it is also well suited for family activities and would serve as a nice getaway for couples…

title: Absolutely fantastic
review: We had the most amazing time at the JW marriot, and it wasn't just us that thought this, family and friends have stayed there and thought exactly the same thing. We enjoyed it so much that we are getting hitched there!! It is unbelievable, wonderful service, beautiful rooms. STUNNING, would recomend it to anyone young or old.

title: If you're going to Khao Lak you must stay here
review: Lovely hotel, I don't know why its taken me two months to write a review.  We spent 5 nights here in early February and had a wonderful time.  Pluses: Free wifi throughout the hotel is a big plus, I wish more hotels did this.  I am also loving that newer hotels have HDMI hook ups so you can connect your laptop to the TV.    Pool Access room was delightful; however the extra space in this category of rooms is kind of vacant and not useful if there are only two of you.  Walking out of your room and straight into the pool is neat but not necessarily needed for the extra cost.    Breakfast was very good although they tend not to refill the hot dishes after 10 AM; however, there's still plenty to eat.  The smoothy bar is a nice touch.    Overall the staff are exemplary.  Friendly,…

title: Beautiful beach
review: This resort is very tastefully designed; the lobby is fantastic and the rooms, especially the balcony with cushioned chairs and sofa, are lovely. It has a good kids' club with arts & crafts, ball pool and toys in the younger area, and computers, pool table and table football in the older area. My son was disappointed that there were no computer games (Wii, x-box etc) but he still managed to enjoy himself. The beach is extremely clean and beautiful and the hotel sunloungers are directly on the sand. The beach was practically deserted and we went in Thai high season. The breakfast restaurant and Olive are both recommended. We hired a car from the airport in Phuket so were able to go to central Khao Lak as well as a day trip to Khao Sok national park, and I was glad we had the car…

title: Resort aims to be 5 star but lacks the details to truly be one
review: Pros:  1) Great children's pool and hotel is vry children friendly. 2) Beautiful beach side lounge area 3) Be sure to escape to the little eateries and beach side massage (400 B for 1 hour) just next to the beach lounge area.  Cons:  1) VERY loud air conditioner which did not even seem to work.  Room temperature was always above 25 celcius even when climate control is turned as low as 15 celcius (lowest). 2) Bed much too soft. 3) Ants in room but was fixed by house keeping. 4) Resort very pricey for what you get.  5) Got the impression that hotel staff were not too happy to be there.  6) Rooms are very small

title: A little piece of heaven!
review: This place was just magical.   A very large property based outside of Khao Lak town (about 5-10 mins), the JW is simply an oasis in its own right.  We loved the resort and it really catered for everything.  It has 3 kms of swimming!   Travelling with small kids (5 and 3), they absolutely loved it.   Because its quite large, most of the time you feel that you have the pool to yourself.   Staff are friendly and always smiling.   The rooms are outstanding and many have pool access (which I would recommend).  The breakfast spread was amazing and their juice bar was the best thing I experienced at breakfast time!  Great points about the resort - massive swimming pool - it never ever feels crowded - the food is great  - rooms are magnificent and the bathrooms are the best I've seen -…

title: Relax in luxury
review: Loved the hotel and it's peaceful & relaxing location.  Restaurants all good quality and reasonable prices, although room service was even better value for money.  Stayed in a pool access room which was lovely, we were glad that we werent battling for a sun lounger as a lot of guests claimed them very early in the day! The only negative is that I booked directly with the Marriott website and their offer included US$80 credit per stay towards f&b or spa - when mentioning this to staff they did not know of the offer and asked us to print off proof of the offer (from their own website) which I did but on check out they did not honour this.  I found this very disappointing for Marriott group and when they sent through the request for feedback I sent them detailed information and…

title: Has everything to be a great resort, but miss the essential: service
review: Very nice hotel located on a gorgeous beach, but service is weak in many areas especially bar, restaurant, pool and beach service. The staff is friendly but obviously lacks training and supervision. When this problem is solved JW Marriott Khao Lak can be recommended.

title: Loved it!
review: Absolutely loved this hotel.  Amazing pool.  Had a pool access room which was fantastic.  Location perfect, hotel grounds beautiful.  Blissful.  Would definitely return to this one!

title: A true great experience
review: A great experience. Wonderful place: swimming pool, restaurant, beach, rooms, service... all absolutely wonderful. Had to stay one extra night and without saying a word, they offered me to stay for the same special deal I got for the week.

title: Not for us.
review: Unfortunately we were put off my our encounter with the reception staff and their inability to do their job. We arrived at about 1-30pm lunch time , now i know that the recommended check in time is 3pm but we had a fairly long drive and i made good time and arrived early. Initally we were greeted well with a drink and cold towel, then a member of staff came over to us and talked us through the layout of the hotel, then we were asked to wait for a couple of minutes, when this member of staff returned she said our room was not yet ready and that if we went downstairs and had a cup of coffee it should not be longer than 15mins, we returned about 20 mins later and sat down in front of the reception, other people were coming and going and being given their rooms, i was not to worried…

title: Excellent choice for families with and without children
review: I usually prefer smaller boutique hotels especially in Thailand where luxury accomodation is very accessible. However I was extremely satisfied with my stay at the Marriott, to the point that we came back after cutting short a stay at another hotel in the same week!  The hotel is about 1 1/4 hour away from Phuket airport, an easy trip in taxi or with the hotel shuttle (a roomy mini van) for an extra fee. It lies on a very quiet beach : no one to ever bother you at any time. Few people in the water even though the hotel was busy. The sea was also nice for kids because it goes down slowly. It is not the nicest sand you ll find in the area but good enough and I could only spot one beer bottle abandonned over a mile long strech, the water was reasonnably transparent (not that…

title: Great resort with just a few little issues.
review: We just ended our 5 day stay and would really recommend the JW for someone looking for an alternative to Phuket. Our pool access room was great - large, well appointed with access to a narrow portion of the pool that was about three feet deep. Small issue - no ladder or stairs to get back onto your patio. Pool access rooms on the other side of the resort seemed to have stairs.   It's a very large resort with lots of kids/families, but there are plenty of quiet areas if you wish to get away from that. Most of the clientele was also European - we felt like the only Americans there. Not a bad thing, but just a bit unusual. There were tons of chairs on the really nice beach - seemed to be more than enough for everyone there.   We saw other comments here about the value of the food…

title: Great place surely will come back
review: We have seen many great places and always had critics for hotels, but this place was one of the best and negative points are almost not existing or minor. Surely we will come back here, it was worth it!  Pure relaxation and great service. We have tested the Mediterranean restaurant and it was great with perfect service! (German managed, clearly visible in the result)  Negative points actually minor ones but worth to mention: 1	Room cleaning was great, but always need to be called so they come….not sure if we had wrong expectations of timing tough 2	The pool is huge but not very deep 3	Near the pool is the pool bar, nevertheless I missed pro-active servicing when staying on the sun chairs, I am sure they would also enhance the turnover of the bar once they start this

title: What you see is what you get
review: We spent a week at the hotel and its a very good place for a beach holiday if you are looking for a traditional big chaing luxury resort.  There is nothing to really complain about but not much stands out either.  The rooms are good, the restaurants are pretty good, the serrvice is good and the location is good (directly on the beach).  We had a few issues but management was attentive and fixed things pretty quickly.  So if you are looking for a week on the beach at a big and pretty good 4/5 star hotel for a good price then this is a good option. If you however is looking for a real 5 Star experience at an exceptional place then i would look elsewhere.

title: Will be back
review: This newer hotel that has it all.  Even though it is a huge place it doesn't feel that way unless you try to swim the entire pool, which we did.  The Spa was awesome and the special dinner on the beach was very impressive...  A must if you're on a romantic getaway.  Plenty of great beach restaurants on either side plus a reasonable drive to the town.  This is great if you want to avoid eating at the hotel restaurants the are on the pricey side.

title: Great stay spoilt by the front desk
review: Great hotel - as long as you do not interact with the front desk.  Arrived with a 6 month old and a 4 year old at 930 PM local time and 1030 pm home time. No problems with pick up. Hotel van really good. Hour and a half to the resort/ good roads. In a hurry to get to the room and put the baby to sleep. Unfortunately the front desk which had no other work at that time took their own time checking us in. We were then taken to our room which was a level down. Lift seemed to be out of order for a long time and had to carry our child and stroller down the flight of stairs by ourselves.   Things were much better after that. The much talked about  swimming pools were really good. We had a family pool access room and it was really worth the extra. Good spread for breakfast. We tried the…

title: Excellent resort to relax and enjoy a quiet vacation
review: We booked this hotel in a rush for Chinese New Year, i had based my choice on the reviews on Tripadvisor: we were not disappointed at all. It's a very beautiful resort.  First, in terms of design and architecture, this resort is a must: it feels luxury, elegant and comfortable. The way it's designed is very clever, making everything quite close in distance, being the main pool, the spa or the beach. I enjoyed their system of pools which are all over the resort, making it possible to swim around, or just stay in front of your room and still enjoy a swim.  The room was clean, comfortable, with nice big shower as well as bathtub. We had a king bed, and even they had forgotten the extra bed we had requested for our daughter, they installed it within minutes.  The pool is beautiful…

title: Miss it now, a nice hotel, even something needs to be polished
review: Just come back after a 10 days trip to Thailand and stay in this hotel. See ingmany claims about the location of this hotel. It's necessary to be aware of the choice and what you want. It's not the place who wants to go out. For us, it's the choice to get far away from the crowds. We look for ocean breeze, nice beach, leisure life, nice sea food ...... then, it's the perfect place. It's perfect for couple, olds, and even great for young children. (Actually, there are many kids in this hotel, they spend the time play together and enjoyed.) Still miss this hotel for beautiful grounds, the generous layout and nice service.  e.g. they provide ice and water on the beach and serve it to the pool. The drinking water supply is almost endless. Hotel staffs always greeting guests on the…

title: Beautiful Beach & Mama's Greeting Restaurant
review: Great Hotel and beautiful beach.  My son had lots of fun at the pool as well as the beach.  Free use of the body board as well as the sea kayak.  We also enjoyed taking Muay Thai lessons which was free of charge from a very good instructer named Mai.  My son and I took 2 lessons from him and we enjoyed it very much.  We both practice Shinkyokushin Karate and experienced the similarities as well as the differences of both martial arts.  We ate at the restaurant just once for breakfast.  This is the only area where the hotel needs to improve since there were not enough chefs so service was slow.  This was our first day and for the remaining 6 days we ate at Mama's Greeting Restaurant which is about a 2 minute walk from the hotel (right side of the beach).  We ate breakfast, lunch…

title: Great Location!!
review: This hotel has everything to offer.  The staff are very friendly and accomodating to your needs.  The free breakfast buffett is a can't miss adventure.  You can create your own style of smoothies and omellettes.  The beach area is very quiet but go early in the morning to stake a claim to your beach chair by placing books or beach towels. Otherwise, you will be you "know what"  out of luck finding available beach chairs after 9am.   Olive restaurant is pretty good hang out for drinks since there is live band that belt out  pop music to rock music and even broadway.  There are nightly events that ranges from night BBQ to Thai culturarl show. A little downside is our room, it has a moldy smell and we were showered with ginger oil scent to cover the smell.  Our TV did not work for…

title: perfect romantic getaway but NOT a gr8 location for sightseeing
review: very nice hotel....romantic....AWESUM SPA !!!  BEAUTIFUL sunsets.....peaceful n serene  but the location is not gr8......around 2 hrs 4m phuket airport.....so if u wanna do lotsa travellin and sightseeing den its NOT the place 4 u.......but if u wanna relax and unwind its wonderful !!!

title: A superb experience
review: After a two- week stay it is difficult to find fault with this well-run and immaculately kept resort.  The rooms are well-designed, well-appointed and spotless.  The breakfast is as good as you will find and goes on for an amazing 5 hours, so those with jet-lag don't miss out (loads of fresh fruit, fresh-squeezed juices throughout, and a wide choice of menu).  Enough has been written about the stellar swimming pool arrangements; it is truly impressive and enhances the atmosphere. After a few years on beaches in Phuket, this one seems almost deserted by comparison and even the vendors are kept away from pestering you.  There are plenty of restaurants in the hotel and private ones on the beach within 200 metres of it.  If you want to savour the local night scene then you need a…

title: It doesn't get any better than this!!!!
review: We have just returned from our second trip staying at the JW Marriott Khao Lak. The first time was truly sensational, but it was even better the second time around.   Absolutley all of the staff were great. There is not a thing that is too much trouble. We even asked for a birthday cake with dinner for one of our fellow travellers and it arrived just after dinner with the waiters singing happy birthday. To outdo themselves, when we returned to our room, there was another cake waiting.  The rooms are extremely well appointed with king sized beds and the bathrooms are huge. Of the four restaurants they have on site at the resort, we found the Thai to be the best, although the others were only just behind in terms of food quality and price. Breakfast was one of the best buffets we…

title: like a paradise
review: we have been there for  our honeymoon. It was wonderfull experience with orchids. Hotel is very clean and peacefull.

title: Paradise
review: Awesome property, Sushi for Breakfast was great!! We have a 1 year old and the down side to this hotel is that the foot paths have too many stairs and the elevators were not functioning so that made for tough times with a stroller. Food was good at the restaurants and great service from all the staff. Everyone is always smiling and even the groundskeepers greet you when passing.  Definitely recommend this Hotel. They have babysitting and events for kids up to 18 years old. There are English speakers throughout the property as well as German, Swiss, and a couple of other European languages. "Lek" is the Concierge and will bend over backwards to help with any kind of request. Tailor shops are near, fresh fruit is second to none. Great vacation!!

title: Wow
review: We had 3 nights in 2 pool access family suites.  Husband & I in one with two kids (5 & 8) and grandparents in the other with 1 child (10).  Rooms were very large and comfortable .  Very nicely decoratated and equiped.  The only issue we had was my parents (60's) found it very difficult getting out of the pool back to their room  as there were no steps to get out of the pool up to your balcony.  Even I must admit struggled getting up without scraping the shins. The beach was beautiful for swimming.  Food (room servce & Olive restaurant) were great.  Breakfast - well, that deserves a write up of its own.......the biggest selection I have ever seen!  I am only sorry that I couldn't fit more in as wanted to try everything.  We have had some great buffet breakfasts but this was…

title: Resort and staff exceeded all expectations
review: My wife and I just returned from a fantastic eight day stay at the JW Marriott Khao Lak Resort and Spa.  In short the resort was nothing short of breathtaking and the entire stay was a very memorable one. In the past we have stayed at the JW Phuket resort.  I must admit after our stay the JW Khao Lak resort is my favorite in Thailand. Please don't misunderstand me as my intention is not to compare and contrast the two resorts. The JW Marriott in Phuket  is a world class resort.  I did, however, find the  overall resort, beach, pool, spa and price of the JW Khao Lak created a much greater perception of value.    To begin the history of the resort as I understand it is that the resort was once a Novotel that was upgraded to a Sofitel. Soon after the upgrade to the Sofitel the…

title: Not Quite Perfect
review: We chose this hotel because we wanted to be able to totally relax and unwind after a busy 2010.  The  hotel is about 90 minutes north of Phuket.  There are lots of option for transferring from the airport to the hotel, which are all bookable over the internet so you don't have to haglle with the taxi drivers at the airport.  Phuket Shuttle charges 1500 baht and Taxi@Boss 1200 baht.  You can pay for Phuket Shuttle in advance.  Check-in was efficient even though it was 11pm.  We had booked a pool access room and our first night was spent in one of the 20 rooms.  After having had a look round the next morning we asked to move to one of the 30 rooms.  The 30 rooms open directly on to the pool rather than down a little path and are south-facing.  If you have kids, you would probably…

title: Magical experience
review: JW Marriott Khao Lak was the perfect hotel to relax for a week. We opted for a swim-up room which was the best decision we made! Having the water on the footstep of your terrace was bliss. Here's what we loved: 1. The rooms - beautiful bed and pillows, scented room, the oversized bath (big enough for two adults) and the granite bathroom (and again, the pool at the doorstep!) 2. The pool - it really is huge and, meandering 3. Breakfast - made to eat omelettes and fruit smoothies, western and Thai buffet 4. Happy hour at the infinity pool bar - roughly 4 cocktails for $20! 5. The location - yes, the others have found the relative remoteness of the hotel to be a down side, but it was much appreciated. It really is only 10 mins by open taxi to town - we settled on about 200 baht…

title: A Grand hotel, nice beach, quiet - will go back
review: Very impressive Hotel ground area (main pool, awesome swimming canals, manicured lush settings, etc) Four rows of townhouse-like rooms and each has a water canal at the back for the first floor rooms (hence pool access).  All canals and the main pool are connected with bridges.  So you can swim non-stop for a few km.  For the first 2 rows, guests can walk thru their private wooden gated balconies and small shrub area into the canal, just like a private cottage with access to the river a few steps away.  For the second 2 rows, there is no shrub in front of their balconies.  Some have no gate (open) and some have glass gates.  The canals there are wider than the first 2 rows.  I like the private and exclusive feel of the first two rows.    The infinity pool is OK.  They do have…

title: Great for Families!
review: We really enjoyed our stay but wanted to write to inform other families with small children about the pros and cons of the hotel.  One of the biggest pros is the beach.  It is calm, wide, long and quiet....great for young children.  Another pro is the pool area.  There are several fun shallow areas for the kids to play.  The hotel has high chairs, a decent kids menu, etc.  One of the cons is that the designated "kids pool area" is so poorly designed that no kids are playing there.  Clearly the person who designed it does not have kids!  There are a couple of shallow areas but they are in the middle of the pool!  Also, there are exactly 2 lounge chairs by the kids pool (next to deep water).  So there is no way for the kids to play while you sit and watch.  There is a nice water…

title: The biggest pool in south east Asia
review: Well, that's their claim to fame.  The pool is pretty great - especially if you have a bottom floor room because many 1st floor rooms have direct access to the pool.  The hotel is very quiet - great for a leisurely stay.  The service was excellent.  The rooms were beautiful.  Not a lot of on-site restaurant options, though the hotel offered transporation to town for a small fee and the town was great!

title: Romantic yet Ideal for Family too
review: By far this is one of my favorite places to visit. Rooms are beautiful and when on the first floor, you can leave your patio for a swim all the way to the beach or just nearby. The pool is quite nice, perfect temperature with a swim up bar, lounge chairs in the shallows as well as on deck and jacuzzi jets you can lay on, in the shallows...   On Christmas Eve we enjoyed an amazing buffet with a variety of goodies that would tempt anybody; then, we attended Christmas Eve mass at a Our Lady of Grace Catholic Church near the resort. Didn't understand a word spoken except "the body of Christ" but enjoyed every second. Orphans from a nearby orphanage acted out the nativity and danced to Christmas carols. Beautiful church, beautiful people, beautiful mass.   Christmas day we…

title: Great time after a slow start
review: We started our holiday with 5 nights in the JW Marriott in Phuket and after being spoiled for 5 nights settling in the JW Marriott in Khao Lak took a bit of time as it is very different. Initially we felt the place lacked a bit of soul with many parts of the hotel not having a realy "warm atmosphere". The resort however really grew on us and we enourmously enjoyed the wonderful beach, the free kayaks, bodyboards and the genereal beach feel of the beach side of the hotel. The beach was also wonderful for an early evening walk. The breakfast was wonderful and we enjoyed the thai buffet in the Thai restaurant. The Olive restaurant struggled to get everyone served on time but serving staff were trying hard to manage the large volume of people. Food was fine.  Rooms were very…

title: Be sure this is the one you want - Location Location Location!
review: I say this, as after reading reviews I believed it was. Unfortunately it did not live up to my expectations.  Yes it looks lovely, no doubt about that  with a huge pool, which to be honest does not really get used and the bedrooms are spacious well decorated, cosy. But that's as much as I can say about it.  Location is terrible, absolutely nothing there. You can not go anywhere without being charged a ridiculous amount. The Marriott wont even give you a Free shuttle bus they charge you 200 baht one way which is steep, especially for a family of 5. I moved to Bangkok 5 years ago and  I can tell you that is expensive. Also be warned with the Marriott pick up as they charge 2800 baht for a car/bus -  WAY TOO MUCH . We managed to haggle down to 1400 with the taxis outside Phuket…

title: Almost Perfect, a Wonderful Resort
review: Most of the advice given about this resort we agree with and so not alot to add apart from the detail, particularly on pricing in and around the resort. Also, our son is 6 years old, and although the resort is probably more suited to couples still has a good kids club geared mainly for kids around his age.  Pricing: (AUD and US) - room service is very cheap, around $25 for our family at dinner, and $20 for lunch, we did not eat at the restaurants however they are about $40-$50 for dinner, and the local restaurants on the beach are at least half this. Spa is a bit pricey but you expect that from this type of resort, we had a 2 hour special for about $120 each (1 hour massage is about $80 - massage outside the resort are about $15 for 1 hour), drinks at the resort are Australian…

title: Not yet a 5 star hotel
review: This was our second stay at the JWM in Khao Lak, the first being not long after it opened. Some things have definitely improved e.g. on our first stay there was no one to welcome us or help with our bags and we had to carry them into the hotel ourselves. This time a friendly porter greeted our car the moment we arrived. Check in was smooth and we were offered a drink while we waited. There are definitely more staff round now, but training still leaves something to be desired in some areas.   According to the guest directory in each room a turndown service is provided each evening. It didn't happen for us on our first stay with any consistency, and the same happened on our 2nd stay. On the 3rd day we mentioned it to Reception and they seemed not to understand what we were talking…

title: As good as the reviews suggest
review: An excellent hotel, with superb rooms, pools and Breakfast - certainly the best choice in the area in my opinion if Khao Lak is your chosen base. It is pretty isolated though and a long way from Khao Lak and civilisation, so bare that in mind. It was ideal for us after a hectic week sightseeing in Northern Thailand! I would recommend they add a shop though for things like magazine's, papers, sun screen etc as we otherwise had to head 15 mins into Khao Lak to find a Seven Eleven. Whilst good, the food and drinks and Spa are stupidly overpriced on site, but the wonderful beach has it's own local options which are far more sensibly priced and a good option. Also - local taxi company's can be charted for 1100 Baht each way to Phuket Airport - I wouldn't pay the hotel 2500 Baht for…

title: The Resort With the Most Luxurious Exotic Swimming Pool!!!
review: With my wife and infant child, we've had our share of experiences from different hotel and resorts especially when it comes to staff service, condition of accomodations, ambience of the premise environment so on and so forth. From the JW Marriott Khao Lak website and other pics/reviews from the those who had stayed there, we account our experiences during our stay on the 20th and 21st Nov 2010 and was not in any way based on anyone's recommendations or feedbacks. Slightly lengthy but worthwhile. Unbiased. So rest assured.   Upon arrival at the Phuket International Airport, we met one of the JW Marriott staff (from JW Marriott Phuket Resort & Spa) at the entrance and he was very polite to direct us to the actual staff from JWM Khao Lak who was waiting for us a few metres away.…

title: Unique luxury resort in low key setting
review: We deliberately sought out stand-out luxury accommodation for our honeymoon in November and definately found it in this hotel.   The hotel is large, luxurious and sprawling, offering many dining and activity choices in a unique environment - surrounded by really gorgeous pools (that look like canals) that weave in a 3km length around the resort. It's quite remote (in comparison to Phuket) but if  you want something slower paced, it's a good place to go.  We stayed in their best room - an executive suite - and it really had wow factor. It featured an outside shower which was romantic and so invigorating, a separate lounge room, bedroom, powder room and walk-in robe that was massive. But above all, the view was pretty spectacular. We did have one minor problem. With all the heavy…

title: Another Marriott Coup
review: we are loyal marriott groupies, but this place has surpassed many of its other resorts...  We like the jw in phuket but the beach and the pool features here surpass it...  The staff has to be the best trained and most pleasant in all of SEA.   Nothing is too much to ask for, but rarely do you need to ask for anything....  the pools and lagoons are inviting, huge and the water is just the right temp...The beach is lovely and very long and wide, with no undertow.  our pool access room is in bldg 1.   the bed is fantastic, the chaise and sofa are attractive and comfortable.   the bathroom with huge stone tub and double sinks, and seperate glass enclosed shower room and toilet room  (only negetive--glass) is perfect....    our covered deck with 2 upholstered chairs and ottomans…

title: Best Hotel I've ever been! An oasis in Khao Lak
review: The hotel is AMAZING!!! We stayed there for 5 days and we enjoyed a lot! The rooms are incredible decorated, very very cozy! The hotel has 3 km swimming pool which surrounds the whole hotel. The service were super nice with us, and totally dedicated to the guests. It has 5 different restaurants. The beach in front of the hotel is fantastic, perfect for going with kids.   The only inconvenience is that the SPA of the Hotel is extremely expensive, and they charged you for one hour massage the same prices like in Europe. But one can get very good massages in Khao Lak city.  In general, a paradize! I will go there back for sure!!  pd: Perfect place to go with your boyfriend/girlfriend...very romantic!

title: Like paradise... missing it already
review: Just returned from six nights at the Marriott Khao Lak. An absolutely fantastic hotel with really great friendly staff. If you are looking for a relaxing, peaceful stay in a wonderful hotel, do consider this hotel. It basically consists of four parallel blocks of rooms, with the reception at one end, Japanese and  Thai restaurants half way along and an Italian/ main restaurant at the other end and beyond that the beach. There are swimming pools between the blocks with 3? Main pools. The rooms are furnished to a high standard, with a huge bath, shower room and very comfortable bed. Our only gripe during the while stay was that we have to phone housekeeping one day as our room had not been serviced by 4.30pm. During our stay the hotel was less than half full, so one accommodation…

title: Perfection doesn't exist - but the JWM comes pretty close!
review: Having been fortunate enough to stay in Khao Lak last October  we knew what to expect from the area in general but our stay at the JWM was the unknown factor. Upon arrival my wife, teenage daughter and myself were greeted like long lost friends and our luggage was whisked away to appear later in our room as if by magic. We were offered a refreshing drink and a cold towel whilst we were very efficiently checked in by Irena, a delightful  front desk staff member from Russia with perfect English language skill. Irena then escorted us to our duplex suite showing us the various facilities en-route to suite 3130. We were a little wary about booking the duplex suite since there are no pictures of the room available anywhere on their website (hope you’re paying attention JWM – you’re…

title: venice in khao lak
review: what can you say about this hotel that has not already been said.first class check in,room was large with everything that was needed and the overhanging bench on the balcony brilliant. breakfast was very good with everything to keep the most fussy of eaters happy.the way the pool winds itself around the resort with the many bridges over it makes it feel like you are wandering around venice and you just feel at any minute a gondola is going to appear.the only thing i think it lacks is some lovely gardens to wander around like most other large resorts of this kind tend to have but i guess thats me just being picky. would return at the drop of a hat as in its present state and superb friendly staff it is just about faultless.

title: Amazing !!
review: We stayed at the JW in August during the low season for our honeymoon and it was perfection. We arranged for the hotel to pick us up at the airport, which was reasonably priced. The poor driver waited for hours because our flight was delayed and still waited with a smile.   When we arrived to the hotel we were informed we were upgraded to the nicest suite available.  The suite was a bilevel with beautiful hardwood floors, lovely balcony big enough to entertain overlooking the pool and sea.  The master tub was big enough to swim laps in, made completely out of this lovely stone but it took quite a long time to fill and once it finally filled the water was cold. The air in the room worked awesome.   The hotel was only 20% filled during our stay meaning we had pools/beach…

title: most beautiful marriott i've stayed at
review: wow...what an amazing hotel! finding it at night was nearly impossible but definitely worth it. check-in was a pleasure. our room was spacious and had a backyard deck with direct access to the pool. the pool is actually a series of gorgeous canals that converge at one large pool overlooking the ocean. this was the highlight of the hotel for me; the pool rivals most water parks...it was so peaceful and relaxing. breakfast was endless and delicious. this is the perfect place way off-the-beaten-path to go for a truly relaxing experience.

title: Relaxing Stay
review: Recently I took the family away for weekend to Khao Lak. Having two young children (4 and 2yrs) the quality of the resort facilities was important. This property delivered per expectation and more.  Breakfast was excellent, quality buffet, very good presentation and most impressive was service; attentive, well supervised, cheerful, well groomed and moved quickly.  Kids menu was also very good, ordered the Kids two meals Fish and Chicken. Congratulations to the kitchen for making quality kids meals rather than the usual over-priced, deep fried, tasteless meals kids often get. Booked a nanny, she was lovely, on time and did the job! Kids happy too! The Italian restaurant was good, liked the live music, simple menu was nice. Three attempts to get the wine I selected in stock was a…

title: Phenomenal Hotel, Location Slightly Off
review: Went to this hotel for a wedding and definitely right up there from all the hotels/places I have visited in the past.  Location wise there is not much around and about an hour and a half away from the airport as Khao Lak is by itself so is someone is looking for a nice relaxing holiday to enjoy the beach/sun/hotel and in house entertainement, then this is definitely one to look out for.  The swimming pool is really nice as well and one of the longest pools in asia as it is spread out throughout the vicinity of the hotel.  Very reasonably priced. Rooms are modern and spacious. Service is great and staff on the whole was very very friendly.

title: I Can't Wait to Come Back!
review: Unfortunately, we were only able to stay one night at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak.  We spent most of our trip to Khao Lak at another resort; due to change of plans for our return, we had an extra night on our hands, so I decided to try out the JW....Boy, am I glad that we did!  While I am not usually a fan of mega-resorts, the JW impresses on all levels.  The rooms are wonderful and modern - warm, dark woods; beautiful Thai artwork and decor; nice furnishings that are functional as well as eye-pleasing....We had a "pool access" room on the ground floor, which was really neat - the "pool" is more like a snaking river, and it took almost 20 minutes of swimming (OK, I'm not the fastest swimmer in the world, nor in the best of shape!) to get to the beach - great exercise!  The staff…

title: Bliss
review: After a frantic few days in India this was the relaxation we needed.  What a terrific resort this is.  We stumbled from the comfortable leather seats of the airport transfer into the gracious welcome and fragrant atmosphere of the airy reception area where refreshing lemon grass drinks and an orchid garland were presented to us. We were efficiently shown to our beautiful pool access room with its a marvellous marble bathroom and the enormous bed with pillows that were like clouds. Basket of fruit and a lie down later - I didn't know it was legal to feel that relaxed.  Our teenage daughter loved being able to walk straight into the pool and swim off and our room had a small tropical garden in front which was much preferable to some others that had a tiled or concrete patio. We…

title: The "W" in JW Marriott must stand for WOW!!
review: Even before travelling we were able to get speedy replies to our emails from the reservations manager. We arranged for the hotel to collect us from the airport and this was a great service at a good price.   Check in at the fantastic reception area was handled very well by the staff team after a very long flight from the UK. My partner’s birthday was on the day of our arrival and there were some flowers and a birthday cake in our room.   We are Marriott Rewards gold members and have used the Marriott brand in many countries. We have however, never stayed at a JW Marriott. This place was beautiful a real 5* hotel experience in every way. The room we were allocated was a pool access room which was really luxurious with top notch everything: bed, TV / DVD, furnishings, décor, air…

title: Wonderful holiday but not quite 5 star rating!
review: This was our first trip to Thailand and a very special one as it was our 25th wedding anniversary this year. The reason we chose this hotel and location was for the excellent reviews we had read about it.  We arrived at the hotel being greeted by numerous front desk staff who couldnt have been more weloming, they were just so nice and helpful. After our welcome to the hotel we were given a beautiful garland and a delicious drink. We were then escorted to our deluxe pool access room which had a lovely ambience about it, oil burner in the bathroom, fresh fruit, just little things that at first made it look and feel extra special. The room itself was a fair size with a nice marble bathroom, large shower, minibar which was extra, large flat screened tv with limited english channels.…

title: Fantastic !!!!
review: Fantastic resort. We were in low season and loved the room with pool-exit !!! Very spacious and stunning views and a amazing pool. Services and staff were great !! Thai and Japanese restaurant excellent and really good value. The friendly kidsclub makes it a great destination for families with children. Our daughter was 10 months old and loved it as much as we did!!! We can really recommend it!!!!

title: Lovely hotel, great staff, big time relax
review: We just spent a week at the Marriott Khao Lak, and can’t say enough about the place.  This is our second ‘5’ rating in a row, and I don’t like to do that, but this place deserves no less.  The service, setting, and facilities are all top notch.  If you are looking for a luxury escape, the Marriott Khao Lak might be the place for you.  First, the service.  Everyone was extremely helpful and friendly.  You don’t always get both, but in Khao Lak we did.  The ladies at the kids club were like family to our boys.  The wait staff in the restaurants bent over backwards to ensure we were well served.  The people at the front desk seemed to be looking for any way to make us happy.  One example – it was our three year old’s birthday while we were there – and everyone seemed to be…

title: FIVE STAR LUXURY....BUT THREE STAR SERVICE
review: A great hotel, but as previous reviewers have mentioned a number of things still let it down…. We were met from the airport by the hotel limousine: a luxury mini bus (2500 BHT one way), offered cold scented towels, water and a menu of music to choose for the journey to the hotel. On arrival a welcome ginger drink and flower garland for me were presented while we checked in, before we made our way to the room; on the ground floor with direct access to the pool. Although we had booked stating clearly there would be two adults and a teenager in the room we were greeted with a cot…and not enough towels for three…small details which overlooked become big annoyances. The room was a good size, nice bathroom, good bath and shower but we felt that the general housekeeping let the hotel…

title: Has potential, but improvements needed, especially in food service
review: Beautiful location on a long stretch of beautiful private beach.  Had wonderful, quiet walks along the deserted beach.  Hotel was, at most, 25% occupied.  Hotel is fairly new, but already in need of many repairs.  While I was there, hallways were constantly blocked between my room and the lobby requiring many detours, often through uncovered passages (not useful during the rainy season).  Room was spectacular (I was in an executive suite -- living/dining room, bedroom, walk-in closet, massive bathroom with great outdoor shower), with very comfortable bed and great views from large balcony (with two sunbeds).  Biggest dissapointment was the food.  Have stayed at different Marriott-branded hotels in Thailand before (this was my 18th trip to Thailand).  This hotel had, with the…

title: Almost Perfect
review: We found out about this hotel on TA while searching for places to stay in Phuket. Despite its distance from Phuket, we decided to come to Khao Lak because of the hotel's pool and better value compared to similar hotels in Phuket.   Overall, other than our disappointment with our late check-out, we are very extremely happy with the resort. (Considering that we went with high expectations knowing the exceptional ratings on TA).   1.	Check-in Very good –we were offered drinks and cold towels and an early check-in around 10+am. Off to a good start!  2.	Room We chose a pool access room and were given one in Building 1(Note that Pool Access in Building 3 and 4 rooms are differently designed). I think our pool access looks nicer, and has more plants in front of the room for more…

title: Fantastic dream
review: Lovely JW Marriot; Many many thanks for all wonderfull time which we spent during our journey in Thailand. The hotel has been designed and organized as just like piece from heaven. The room concept was delightful which makes you relax in modern and exotic area as excellent. Also it is impossible to forget sleeping in  extra comfortable beds. All staff has been done their job very kindly and good-homouressly. In briefly everything was perfect in JW Marriot Khao Lak and espicially I recommended to stay in pool-access rooms for new visitors. I tried to write some constitutive commentary but I couldn't find something to write. Asolutely couldn't !..    Mr. Önder Gözükara

title: Great Beach fabulous pool stunning architecture
review: Stayed 5 nights pool access room great for our 14 and 15 year olds. you can swim for miles? and then there is the beach 4 miles of  clean sandy beach great for swiming and body boarding. The hotel was really quiet which we think just summed up Thailand very few families around. Rooms are stylish and are furnished to a very high standard .re eating breakfast as others have commented is really good .Along the beach there are 5/6 beach shacks all with similar menus and prices. We settled on Mamas and ate there for 4 out of the 5 nights all the food was pretty good  and prices okay ( 1/3 of hotel prices but twice Chiang mai prices 100 to 150bt per dish?) in summary a good place to relax for 4/5 days

title: great for getaway
review: Excellent pools and rooms, great services, very nice location

title: A Slice of Paradise
review: While trying to decide where to go for a short break in Thailand, the reviews here finally swung it for the JW Marriott resort in Khao Lak.  I have to say that all the positive comments made about the resort are thoroughly justified and my partner and I had a wonderful time there.  I do feel however that there are a few things which need to be iterated so that future visitors are aware of what is in store. Firstly the positives.  The welcome at reception was outstanding, very professional and attentive at all times.  Our room (one with a direct pool entry) was wonderful. Tastefully decorated, really comfortable bed and pillows, a great bathroom and fantastic balcony (though a fan and some mozzie coils would have been nice). The breakfast buffet was impressive (I have had better)…

title: not quite perfect....but still pretty good
review: Stayed 11 nights at this hotel in July 2010. I booked this hotel after reading the rave reviews here and though I was heading to "paradise". Although I considered the hotel to be very good ,some little things stop me from giving it the coveted "5 stars"  The hotel is in an ideal location right on the beach but a good 10 minutes drive from the main town, certainly not walkable. For rest and relaxation its perfect !    To get into town you need to book a seat on the free hotel bus (only 6 passengers) that runs a few times there and back every day. I can see that this would cause problems during a busy spell. Occasionally we couldn't book as all the spaces were taken. There were no problems getting back as you could just jump in a taxi for 300 Bht.   Three restaurants were open and…

title: Pure Paradise
review: We stayed at the marriott for four nights in june, the rooms are outstanding,from checking in to checking out we recieved first class service, the staff from the mnagement to the cleaners are wonderful nothing is too much trouble. a lifetime experience!! luxury on a grand scale.

title: Great Resort!
review: Stayed here for 11 days and everything was perfekt. The room, the pool, the breakfast, the staff. We will come back!

title: Go before everyone else finds out about it.
review: We stayed here for two nights after a long stay at the Sarojin desperate for some activity and ran right into an Indian wedding which was great. This place is pristine and beautiful and very reasonably priced, something I doubt will last.  The pool system is great and a room with direct access to the pool is a steal at current prices. It's really relaxing and fun to swim around virtually the entire resort and then back to your room. The breakfast buffet was very varied and something to look forward to though I think the perishables should be covered with glass containers to stop contamination from the flies. The coffee here is exceptional -  unusual for Thailand. We had a meal in the Italian restaurant and room service from the Thai restaurant. Pretty average sadly but we had…

title: beautiful  property
review: The  Marriott  has  been  rebuilt  on the  site  of  the  Sofitel  which  was  completely  destroyed  by  the  Tsunami.  It  has  a  beautiful  lagoon like  swimming  pool zigzagging  along the  rooms. It  is  located  right on the  beach  and  serves  a  fabulous  buffet breakfast. It also  has  a good  kids  club  and  an  Italian,  Japanese  and  Thai  restaurant.  The  town  however  has  nothing  much to  offer  and  is  very  disappointing  with  nothing to do. Khao  Lak  brings  back  the  terrible  tragedy  of the  Tsunami  as  half  of  those  who  perished  in Thailand  lost their  lives  here. There  were  70  residents  of  the  Sofitel  who were  completely  caught  unawares while  at  breakfast  with  no  means  of  escape.  But  the  hotel  has  buried the  past …

title: Fantastic
review: It was our first trip to khao Lak and our 6th to Thailand. J.W Marriott was everything you could wish for. The pool was hard to explain with it winding around the whole resort I had never experinced anything like it. The staff are friendly the food is fantastic, the rooms are clean, the beds are the best I have ever slept in. The resort was so quite and private, The facilities are great with gym, squash, tennis, great baby sitting club. I can't wait to go back. Khao lak was fantastic if you are looking for a quiter time ecspecially in the off season.

title: Wonderful Holiday in Khao Lak
review: With the plethora of positive comments and feedback in Tripadvisor, my husband and I were confident we had made the right choice in going to JW Marriott in Khao Lak.  Like many others in this forum, we were not disappointed.  From the pick up at the airport (loved those cute little bunny-shaped cold towels!) and the warm smiles at the reception, the great first impression set the tone for the rest of our holiday.  The resort itself is relatively new, with certain blocks still being refurbished, however, that didn’t get in the way of our enjoyment of the resort as all the facilities, restaurants and spa were ready for use.  The studio room they upgraded us to was fantastic!  The room was on the ground level and had direct access to the pool and the bathtub in the room was so big…

title: Best hotel in Khao Lak
review: We stayed 1 week in the executive suite and we loved every minute of it.  Property: Absolutely fantastic.  I've never seen any pool like this one. The hotel has about 300 rooms and is therefore quite big, but it certainly does not feel like it is too big-soulless. The beach is perfect. The only disappointment was that during our stay the sea was choppy and we could not swim in the sea.  It is a bit far off from the center of Khao Lak.  If you want to go to a different restaurant or do some shopping you have to take their shuttle or book a taxi (THB 300 one way). The shuttle is for free, but was always booked out.  Food: The breakfast is below average compared to other 5*-hotels in South-East Asia (sorry guys). The Asian selection is small (no dumplings and no Japanese…

title: Love, Love, Loved it!!!!
review: After reading all the fabulous reviews on tripadvisor I was looking forward to my stay at this hotel very much. The good news is that everything that I read was true!  The staff (like most Thai people) were so lovely and the way they looked after our little girl was out of this world.  By the second day, a lot of the staff were calling her by name. Special thanks to Non at the poolbar who always made sure that she was given a float for the pool and who made fabulous chocolate milkshakes!  I was a little concerned about the location but I actually loved that it was away from the main part of town. In fact, I would have been perfectly happy to not have left the hotel at all.  I found that there was plenty of variety across the restaurants and the room service was great as well. …

title: I wish I was there now
review: We stayed 5 nights at the JW Marriott Khao Lak 4/11/10-4/14/10. We had a water access room. The hotel itself is beautiful. But the beach.... all I can say is WOW, The grounds, the pool, the rooms... a very special place. It was pretty empty while we were there, which meant that the restaurants, pool and the beach were very uncrowded. This was a plus for us since we like to avoid crowds and would have gone off property to explore and eat anyway. We rented a car and the drive to town (for eating/shopping/diving) was a piece of cake. We did eat the breakfast buffet every morning and it was fantastic! Something for everyone, plenty of it, and it was good. I thought the service was impeccable. We were always greeted with a smile and never once had any issues. The only downside was…

title: A place we wish to return to!
review: My husband and I stayed 9 nights at this lovely hotel. Usually we feel like moving on after staying a week in one place, but not with this hotel - we enjoyed it so much.  We chose a pool view room, one floor up from the pool access rooms, and were happy with that choice. The room was beautiful, with hardwood floor and plenty of closet space. The king bed was a bit firm for us, but the hotel provided a nice thick top pad on request, that really helped a lot. We thought the DVD player was a nice touch for rainy evenings - the reception had a small movie selection too. The bathroom had a large rain shower separate from the bathtub. There was a roomy balcony with two chairs and a comfy daybed.  The breakfast buffet was among the best we have seen. All the "standard" western…

title: Relaxing, Spacious, Natural, Friendly Weekend Stay
review: Came up from Phuket for 2 night at JW to get away and relax. Perfect! Clean beaches, incredible pool, and friendly staff!

title: The perfect getaway and a true paradise!
review: We live in Bangkok and usually only go to places we can drive to like Hua Hin or Khao Yai, but this hotel was recommended by friends who had been there so we took the trip to Phuket. We were picked up by the hotel limousine and arrived an hour later at this spectacular place. It is the nicest hotel I have been to, the view from the lobby was so amazing that we didn't even want to go to the room! Impressive buildings and the best beach I have seen besides Similan! The staff are so nice and did everything for us. We stayed the whole week in the hotel without leaving because they have so many different restaurants and the prices are very reasonable. My favorite was the Italian and Japanese where the chef did a great show to impress us. And for Thai food we will definitely come back…

title: Fantastic Honeymoon...
review: I had not even seen pics of the hotel, but somehow there was a gut feel it would be good. To my surprise it turned out to FABULOUS!!! everything, from the room, the level of detail, of providing cookies every evening, to posting our agendas, was abs fantastic. It was our Honeymoon, and we couldn't have asked for anything more. The pool is huge, plenty of beach beds available. We stayed at the duplex suite, and it was worth every penny, the split makes you feel at home with a brilliant view of the pool and beach. The staff were very courteous and ever smiling. We definitely feel like visiting the place over and over, its absolutely brilliant and is definite. Some of the worlds best Mojitos and Long Island Iced Teas were served there!!!! Fantastic options to eat as well.. the…

title: Paradise Found..
review: My family has been traveling to Thailand almost every year and we have stayed all over Thailand.  The JW Marriott in Khao Lak is by far the best hotel we have stayed at.  The hotel is beautiful and the service is excellent: every one is very nice and helpful.  The  private beach is beautiful with soft white sand and clear blue warm waters.  It was off-season so very few people at the hotel and easy to get a beach chair.  Someone from the hotel regularly made the rounds to provide ice cold water, fresh fruit, or towels.   The pool is amazing and winds around the whole hotel.  My son loved playing in the sand pool w/the waterslide as well as the main pool area.  Pool bar provided great drinks and light meals.   The rooms were spacious, clean, with nice decor.  Beds were very…

title: great place
review: Its an awesome resort for a vacation. Very clean huge property, most courteous staff. Nice private beach with lots of activities like kayaking etc. A very huge swimming pool that surrounds the entire hotel. The best spa and restaurant. Rooms are superb and very clean with great view

title: Very nice - family oriented resort
review: For starters, the reservation process was extremely well done, especially compared to other hotels in Thailand.  The e-mail responses were quick and helpful and confirmation was smooth.    The rooms were typical for JW Marriott - first class.  The beds are really comfortable with very large and fluffy pillows.  Good closet space with a mini-bar and safe.  The bathroom was very spacious with a very large shower and deep bathtub.    Like many others, we stayed in the ground level room with direct pool access.  It's a novel concept and can be fun to swim around the resort and the kids loved to jump right in and swim around right beside our deck.  The large pools were very nice.    Our room was actually very far from the beach and breakfast area.  I guess that's part of the issue…

title: Fantastic Relaxed Family Holiday
review: I never thought I would write a review on a resort but this place deserves my comments!  We just got back from a great family holiday at the JW Marriott Khao Lak Reort and Spa (5 nights). My wife and I have travelled extensively and now with two sons (aged 8 and 5) we were aiming to have a relaxing beach holiday and didn't want to hassles of a Patong stay. We heard from a friend that the beaches are unspolit and clean at Khao Lak (approx 1.5 hours drive North of Phuket airport). The extra transfer time to get to Khao Lak is well worth it!  We arrived and were welcomed from the first moment. I'll try to list a short despription on each section for readers;  Resort - It has to be a new resort and it has all the facilites you would expect from the Marrott brand.  Rooms - Beautiful…

title: Impressive hotel
review: I'm a very frequent traveler and therefor have certain expectations from a hotel.  Our family recently spent 5 nights at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak and had a very good experience.  There is no denying that that hotel is an impressive facility.  It is massive in size and has endless amenities to offer for your stay.   The beach at the Marriott is a beautiful, white sand beach with calm waters, great for swimming.  It lacks some of the more awe inspiing views that you might see farther south in Phuket or Krabi but you also don't have the crowds that go with those places.  The pool is also quite amazing.  It meanders throughout the entire hotel.  We walked out onto our balcony and slipped into the pool and could then literally swim anywhere in the hotel.   I've rated this as a…

title: FABULOUS--JUST FABULOUS
review: This hotel was fabulous.  We usually stay at the JW Marriott Phuket because of the timeshares.  We decided to try this hotel because we wanted to avoid the crowds over the Easter holidays.  What a great deciscion.   The hotel is new to the JW chain.  I am not sure what the capacity was while we were there but it never felt crowded. The rooms we a decent size, the bathrooms roomy (and yes the bath tub is huge as stated in other reviews).   The lights in the room could be bigger, but minor.  TV, DVD, Wi-Fi  all there.  Definitely go for the pool access room.  The pool large and the towels by the pool are the best I have ever encountered.  The pool/beach chairs are all new.  The beach is huge and swimable.  No huge waves and no big undertow.   The food was fine,  the breakfast…

title: very well traved around the world
review: Well what a amazing hotel, our room stepted out on to the 3km pool which goes round the hole hotel like a Disney lazy river. staff cant do enough for you, two great little beach shack restaurants beside the hotel. never saw more then two people in the pool because it was so big. could have complete privacy in this hotel.

title: Tempted to Return Year after Year
review: My partner and I could not get enough of the water. And i'm just talking about the pools within the hotel.  And I myself am not even a swimmer.  The rooms were lovely in decoration and atmosphere, though a few honey bees kept stranding themselves at the curtains (easy to flick them out - even they seemed so relaxed). The restaurants offered decent food, the thai restaurant was above average and Olive gave great Med food. Breakfasts at the Waterfront were more than sufficient, with a great view to welcome the day. Spa service was also very good, made me relaxed and snoring away not long after! Getting into the village centre was also easy, to get some local food to stuff ourselves. The Bazaar or market was rather disappointing in the shopping department, though it did offer some…

title: This is a fantastic hotel for all ages to relax, chill and enjoy the quiet surroundings!
review: I do not even know where to begin to tell you how satisfied and happy I am staying at this hotel!   We booked our flight to Phuket for 21 - 24 March 2010 and was comtemplating in staying in JW Marriott Phuket or JW Marriott Khao Lak. Both are under the same luxury brand that has a good reputation. In the end we decided to choose Khao Lak as we have stayed in JW Marriott Phuket twice before. Furthermore, this hotel is brand new with lots of good reviews. I was travelling with my spouse, my mother and my 14 month old baby. Lastly, the thought of going to Asia's largest swimming pool just bowled me over.  We took a hotel limo (was supposed to be from hotel, but their limo were full, so they sent a 3rd party limo service instead). But its all good. What I didnt expect was, they…

title: Excellent hotel in a lovely location
review: Totally agree with all the great comments from other people about this hotel, we just loved it.   The staff were all great and the more you try to speak Thai the better! The swimming pool system is amazing, best we've ever seen. Best of all, as the hotel was only at 20% occupancy no rush for the beach sunbeds!  Here's a few extra tips!  1) Tours & Trips - Use Mr Cha whose base is located in the Fahmai beach restaurant to the left hand side of the hotel. He's a genuinely nice guy who looked after us very well. Good prices and he obviously loves his job. We did the elephant trekking with him and it was a great experience! (See the attached pictures)  2) Taxi's into the local village - Again use Mr Cha, he charges 500 Baht for a round trip. he'll drop you off and then pick you up…

title: Best for swimming lovers! Go now- untill so new and half empty!
review: Khao Lak in general is the best place if you just want to “reset”, have some lazy time in a beautiful, paradise like scenery -not too crowded, no speed boats all over, fabulous, wide and almost empty beaches  which fringe the  turquoise ocean and a glorious National Park which surrounds it- what can be better if you want a great leisure?  Khao Lak was the last part of our trip and we choose JW Marriott hotel as the resort was brand new and had promising reviews. The place is really beautiful.  So good that it’s new- everything is clean and fresh. Also the design of the rooms, lobby and the whole area is really nice. If you like to swim- there is no other place to choose. This hotel has probably the biggest swimming pool in whole Asia! It goes around the whole resort , the main…

title: A wonderful stay at a great resort with a promising future!
review: Yes, this is a new hotel and yes there were some simple issues to be worked out but I would rather start with the positive.  It was stunningly gorgeous, amazing pool, beautiful room, huge tv, nice bathroom, great gym/workout area.  For the price, you simply can't go wrong.  How many JW Marriotts are in this price range around the world?  We traveled with a 3 month old and spent 90% of our time at the resort as a result.  The location was a bit isolated as others will mention.  We were upgraded to a family suite.  Truthfully, there was not much difference in a family suite and a regular room, it was just a little longer and had two Thail day beds.  One I used for laying out clothes, the other I used to change diapers.  Unless you need the daybeds for kids, don't waste your money…

title: Fantastic hotel with private beach and great facilities
review: Located abt one hour drive from phuket airport, the hotel is a paradise away from the crowded beaches of Phuket. The hotel is tastefully designed in Thaistyle architecture but with Italian interior decor. We got a room with poolside access. Despite the poolside access each veranda facing access to the pool is secluded with lush greeneries to afford privacy. And the pool is huge with waterways.  Our room comes with large 42 inch screen, big king size bed, huge bath tub and separate shower and toilet area. The veranda is big with 2 comfortable loungers. Spent a lot of time there reading a book while listening to the sound from the water fountain.  Hotel has its own exclusive beach area with its own high class chairs and umbrellas. The towel boy will even serve you ice cold water…

title: Tranquillity away from the Phuket humdrum
review: Fantastic newly finished hotel. Rooms well appointed and comfortable. The fusion of newly planted gardens and the largest interconnected pool system I have seen is fantastic. Food great and reasonably priced. Drinks unfortunately as usual, over priced. Usual selfish stupidity of reserving sun loungers with towels before breakfast. If vacant I just assume possession now ! Much of the time however we used the little sunlounger corners dispersed around the pool areas. Beach is long and unspoiled. We ate quite often at the various little beach restaurants adjacent to the hotel. They serve excellent fresh local food pretty cheaply but adjusted of course for us farangs ! A nice selection of day trip actvities can be organised in Bang Niang, Khao Lak or through Mr Cha on in the Fha Mai…

title: Nice place but not ready. Staff not polished for a Marriott.
review: Stayed for a week at the JW Marriott Khao Lak. Having stayed in Khao Lak pre Tsunami a couple of times in the 90's it was nice to be back, but of course it's much more developed now then it was in the 90's.   The JW Marriott is lovely, but it's only really just opened, the staff have a lot to learn about handling such a premium resort, and the hotel has a lot of teething issues to be ironed out. The room had a terrible problem with a noisy air conditioner that took two days to sort out. Only after finding the hotel manager and threatening to leave did things get fixed immediately. It's always a sign that things aren't going smoothly when it's a constant battle with the staff to get things fixed for ages and then suddenly the manager intervenes and it's fixed straight away. …

title: wonderful resort away from the madding crowd
review: My wife and I stayed in the JW Marriott Khao Lak over the Chinese New year  just to get away from the Phuket crowds and we were not disappointed. The resort was new, well equipped and very very comfortable.  The bed is one of the most comfy ever and we have stayed in top hotels the world over. The breakfast was excellent too.  The most outstanding part of this resort were the service staff...they were unfailingly polite and helpful...esp Eje a Turkish lady who took great pride in the hotel!  I was stung by some jellyfish in the sea but the hotel staff were attentive and knowledgeable in dealing promptly with it. Eating in the seaside seafood shacks on the beachfront outside the hotel was wonderful...picture this...good food, a coconut, cold beer, and a sunset to die for....all…

title: Fabulous Oasis With All the Extras
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the J.W. Marriott in Khao Lak.  The service was exceptional, the amenities were first rate, and the rooms were comfortable and tastefully decorated.  I especially appreciated the ample storage space in our hotel room, which made for a clutter-free stay, despite the presence of 3 sets of full scuba gear, all of our luggage, and an extra rollaway bed.  This hotel is brand new.  Staff reported to me that it only opened last November (2009), and there is still light construction ongoing in many areas of the hotel. Note that we NEVER HEARD ANY CONSTRUCTION NOISE, and the only noteworthy difference it made was that a few paths and bridges were blocked off while they laid tile, painted trim, etc.  I kept commenting to my friends, "Man, this place is…

title: Drift away...
review: Stay here if you want an oasis of calm, a pristine beach, endless pool, luxury every step of the way, attentive service and a tranquil ambiance. Don't stay here if you like to be close to local action (unless you don't mind a 250-300THB taxi ride to town one way) The hotel is set back 1.5 km on a gravelly road from the main road and there is nowhere to walk to except the local shacks on the beachfront. Not that you miss anything, except maybe a little shop in the hotel selling basics you may have forgotten to pack. Although the hotel seems to have thought of everything for the comfort of their guests, like ice water being served as you unwind on the beach and mosquito repellant spray kept on restaurant tables. We will be back for sure, hopefully before the hordes of tourists…

title: Best family vacation ever!
review: Where do I begin? First, there is the hotel itself; a beautiful and brand new resort right on the beach. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. The beds are among the best hotel beds I've ever encountered. Most of the rooms overlook an enormous pool area with beautiful landscaping (most of the rooms on the first floor have easy access to the "lazy river" section of the pool-great for an afternoon beer and a swim). There are also many different places for eating and drinking at the resort- 4 large and beautiful restaurants with international, Japanese, Thai and Italian food (although the Italian restaurant was not yet open) as well as two pool bars. They even have a really nice deli! There are also simple, local Thai beach front restaurants next to the hotel, which can be fun…

title: Can I stay longer please!!!
review: Lovely hotel, huuuuuge pool, staff were all very helpful, but some could brush up their English skills a little (but that could be said for any resort in Thailand!). The restaurants were surprisingly reasonably priced, so we actually ate most meals in the hotel. The location can't be beat - you are right on the beautiful beachfront....we loved going for long walks down the beach at sunset. The only downside was returning to the snow in the UK :-( We got a very good rate through our regular agent www.asiareservations.net at about 5,500 Baht a night with breakfast.

title: Nice...but could and should do better
review: The staff lacked in 5star experience but very helpful and very nice. The management were keen to interact and ensure all was good. We needed to be patient as there are a lot of teething problems, which frankly should not be happening. The soft launch has been happening for a few months! This irritated other guests we met.
