Examples: restaurant lights kept switching off at 10 - happened twice. It was not rectified and we completed meal by candle light.  Cold food served in warm plate. Same dish requested by three people... Rogan Josh.  2 dishes arrive 15mins before 3rd. New LCD TV /entertainment system in room kept breaking (crashing), needed engineer out 3 times. Operating light system in room was a mystery even to hotel staff... and me. I design complex, high performance…

title: The most amazing hotel I have ever been to.
review: Our stay was 21st to 28th November and it was just incredible. We stayed there as part of our honeymoon and were so happy with our choice!  We knew it was in soft opening phase when we booked (and experienced the name change before we arrived), but we received very helpful pre-arrival information from Adam Laker and Mark Supphiah who helped us with our arrangements. They were extremely polite and courteous, which set the tone for the rest of our stay.  As it was our honeymoon we opted for the pick up service (at a cost) from Phuket Rassada Pier which is about 2 hours from the resort. We'd spent the morning coming from Koh Lanta on a very rough journey and were delighted when our beautifully dressed driver Piek came and picked us up in a luxury van. It had leather seats and we…

title: Not far to go now
review: W e stayed towards the end of November for 10 nights. At the time of our visit approximately 30% of the rooms were completed. I understand that some of the delays were due to fire sprinklers being added to fulfill the terms of the contract with Marriott. The spa opened during our stay, leaving just the Olive restaurant to be completed, along with the remaining bedrooms.  The location is approximately 10/15 minutes from Khao Lak by taxi, 250B as oppose to 450B using the hotel mini bus, access is in part down a fairly rough track though Marriott do have plans to upgrade this I'm told. A few beach restaurants and bars are walking distance along the beach, though I don't believe any are within walking by road.  The Thai, Japaneese and Waterfront restaurants are reasonably priced…

title: wow!!!
review: What a beautiful hotel, they have thought of everything on this one! Amazing sea front property with the biggest swimming pool I have ever seen..Seen all room types and all were amazing. Had lunch in the waterfront restaurant that overlooks the beach and the food was excellent and resonably priced for a 5 star hotel. Khao Lak itself is quiet low key and you would need to travel about 10 mins in a taxi into the centre but there is enough varity of bars and restaurants and lots of shops selling the normal thai wares. If you are looking to have a relaxing stay in a beautiful beachfront location then this is the one.

title: Fabulous resort . . . .
review: We (my husband and I along with another couple) stayed for eight nights this November and had a lovely time.  We have stayed in resorts throughout Thailand/Malaysia and this certainly rates at the top of the bill!  The resort is new and still in 'soft opening' and I therefore feel that the only couple of niggles we had will probably be sorted when the resort is fully open.  Staff -  excellent.  Courteous, attentive and genuinely cannot do enough to help.  English can be 'iffy' but the majority of front of house/restaurant/bar staff  are fairly fluent.  Indeed many of the bar staff seemed to like chatting to us in the afternoon at the infinity poolside bar  or in the evening in the restaurant or Czar bar.  Trips were arranged with little notice (Similian Islands and local markets…

title: Wonderful Hotel/Traumhaftes Hotel
review: We have been at the JW Marriott for three weeks and we had a perfect vacation. This luxurious hotel leaves nothing to be desired. The beautiful and spacious resort is the perfect place to relax.  The service is very friendly and helpful and they speak English and German. Our expectations have been exceeded by far.  The rooms are spacious and very comfortable, especially the bath room, and cleaned up twice a day. The beach is sensational.  During our stay a Thai and a Japanese restaurant were opened and both of them are recommendable. We ordered dishes not on the menu and everything was absolutely delicious.  Finally, we had a wonderful vacation at the JW Marriott Khao Lak and are planning to return.

title: Enjoyed
review: My wife and I stayed 4 days in October, weather was mixed with occasional showers which we enjoyed  Found accom good with pool access room top class. Dining area very pleasant with great location breakfast good selections except cooked food is cold seems to be a constant in Thailand were food is cooked put in bain marie with no heat. Had evening meal and was very happy albiet a little expensive for Thailand. Only gripe was trip to Khao Lak cost 400 baht one way by hotel arranged ride a courtesy bus at set times would be helpful. Staff very good.

title: Amazing resort.  No disappointments.
review: I've stayed in many Marriott Resorts, mostly in the US and Thailand and am familiar with the brand.  The JW Marriott Khao Lak is a special place.  If you are looking to stay in the Phuket / Khao Lak area, I would give my highest recommendation to stay here.   They have spared no expense in every area of the infrastructure and within the rooms.  The service and attitude of the employees is top notch.  The employees are happy and so the resort is a happy place to stay.   Concerning the property, the pool is a gem.  Long winding lagoons that lead into larger areas (beach, Jacuzzi, family areas, etc).  The greenery has been carefully selected and is maintained meticulously.  The overall design, size and materials used is right out of an art gallery.  Like nothing I've seen in a…

title: A great place to relax
review: We came to Cher Fah to relax and unwind. While the resort was not fully completed, it had everything we needed. The pool area was great, the children enjoyed the Kids Club and were made to feel part of the family. The staff were very attentive and were always smiling. We will be back.

title: Perfect Service + Splendid Room" = Excellent holiday
review: We spend one week at the Cher Fah in Khao Lak during our trip through Asia. Both of us were overwhelmed from the Resort and especialy the brand new rooms. We had one with "Pool Access" and it was equpped with everything of he best we could think of<. 3 x Cisco VoIP-Telephones, Samsung 37" LCD and DVD with connectors for Laptop, HDMI etc. Te bathroom is marvellous and there is a large window to the bedroom. We really loved this room and could access the 16000 square-meter pool directly from our4 veranda!   I would like to mention espeically the staff which is more then happy to "read every wish form your eyes" :-) Although still in the soft opening phase. Everything was nice, 100 % clean and the approx. 290 staffmembers showed their friendly behavious in every way they could. …

title: Excellent
review: Well, about Cher Fah there is only one thing to say, it is perfect. The Hotel at overall, the rooms, the pool, the bars, the food, location, and they have best, most welcoming  staff  I have ever met.

title: Tourist escape
review: My husband and I chose to stay here for a total of 6 nights after we were offered a great deal against other hotels in the area.   The staff at this hotel are wonderful. In fact, there are loads of them and they are extremely attentive and very friendly. We were there in low season, so it probably explains the number of staff per resident ratio.  We arrived to be told some major parts of the hotel (the pool in particular) were contaminated and would most likely be fixed after a couple of days. Part of the pool was fixed, but the main pool closest to the beach (the best part of the 3km pool) was not completed during our stay. We were offered a complimentary one hour massage each (one of the best massages I've ever had) to compensate. We were informed before we arrived that there…

title: Find paradise in Khao Lak
review: We choose the Cheh Fah Resort in Khao Lak after research on the internet, and were highly satisfied with our decision. We were looking for a quiet and relaxing place, and Cher Fah lived up to our expectations. Service and attention to detail as impeccable. Every little detail was cared for. Staff was very friendly and highly attentive to our requests and needs. A little thing like providing free drinking water throughout the day, both by the pool, seaside and at the restaurant made a very good impression with us (at present, during soft opening, only one restaurant is open, but three more will open by the time the resort is in full gear). It may not seem like much, but to provide drinking water all the time, even though we didn't always buy other drinks at poolside, showed that…

title: Splendid place to unwind
review: While most other Thai attractions might get a little empty and desperate for the average European traveller in these times of political and economical turmoil, the Cher Fah in Khao Lak is to be commended for all sorts of reasons.  Despite the fact the resort hasn´t been fully finished yet, it is welcoming guests with open arms and friendly traditional Thai `wais`. One can´t possible complain, as the rates are only a fraction of what they once were. Bargain hunters´ paradise. Just off the main road, North of the peacefull beach retreat Khao Lak, a secluded hideaway opens its gates to travellers.  Once standing in the main lobby, overlooking the gigantic dimensions of the pool, you´ll soon forget the 90 minutes drive from Phuket.  This resort is setting a new standard for Thai…

title: Magical place to be
review: This is an amazing resort, situated on a beautiful beach with waving.  Families are booked in a separate are with full children's facilities  so that people without children can enjoy a quiet relaixing time if they so wish. Waving palm trees.  comprises huge swimming pools with pooll bars, all lit up at night time.  Rooms have huge TV screens and the most comfortable beds.  Altogether a  most wonderful place to stay and I would recommend anyone to stay there.    nearby shopping markets and elephant rides are all nearby.

title: Excellent services and facilities
review: We stayed at the hotel for 3 days and be appreciated of good hospitality in serving during our vacation.  Hotel staffs keen to help us and recognise our favourite drinks.   Although, a short time but it was a really wonderful trip there. The room is very nice, clean and modern as well as pool is very fantastic to swim with bare eyes.  If I'm not wrong the total length of the pool is around 2~3 kilometres.  We are enjoy all the time at there

title: Fantastic beach, super facilities and service -- even though in soft-opening period
review: Our children (5 and 9) 'voted' Cher Fah the "best hotel in Thailand" so that is why we decided to stay again at end-June after our first visit early-May. Located right at one of the most beautiful beaches of Thailand, Cher Fah is a perfect holiday resort. The super-comfortable rooms (with connecting door to the children's room), complementary internet in your room, the huge swimming pool(s), the spacious kids club, the fitness and great food: all world-class. The hotel is still in soft-opening phase so additional facilities (eg squash court, late check-out lounge, additional restaurants) have not been opened yet. But we have promised ourselves to come back and check these out as well ! Hotel staff and management really went out of their way to make our stay(s) unforgettable.…

title: This place is great now and will be unbeatable when fully open
review: We stayed for a week with our 18 month old boy.  THe staff were very friendly and the food was great.  A couple of resteraunts aren't open yet but will be in a couple of months.  We really enjoyed the day trips they organised.  The guys and girls of Cher Fah went out of their way to make our stay special whether it was a reliable babysitter, a great (healthy) kids menu or romantic dinners on the beach (while boy was asleep/babysat).  All for some seriously good prices while still in the soft opening period.  The whole resort is new and the rooms a very good.  Bed is one of the comfiest I've ever been in.  We would recommend this place to anyone travelling with young kids

title: Luxury = Cher Fah. A true diamond on earth.
review: From the moment you arrive, there is a sense of something uniquely special. A friendly Thai greeting awaited us as the car pulled up on the driveway. Enter the lobby and you know that you are in for a luxurious stay. The view from the lobby is special - overlooking the large pool and ocean. The friendly staff escort you to the room and porters arrive with luggage shortly after. The room is amazing, elegantly furnished to a rating greater than 5-star. The pool access from the balcony was superb.   The dining was great for breakfast, lunch and dinner (perfect ocean views). The large pool was excellent. The private beachfront location has to be one of the best on earth.   From the moment we arrived, to the moment we left, there were only smiles. This resort will be hard to beat. It…

title: The perfect and ideal location to relax, unwind and to escape reality.
review: The resort was amazing and very memorable, and was the perfect location for me to propose to my girlfriend.  It was very romantic, proposing to her during a secluded candle lit dinner on the resort's own private beach, which was totally organised and taken care of by the very trustworthy and reliable employees of the resort. They also played the perfect role on the night to ensure it was a moment in time which could never be forgotten and or replaced.   To cap off the memorable evening, we made a special wish whilst letting go of a flaming lantern - to bring us good luck. Very special and a moment I will always remember and cherish. The other parts of our stay at the resort were fantastic. All resort facilities were A1, especially the room; which was very hard to leave, the huge…

title: High quality resort with beach & waterways
review: We stayed at Cher Fah during the 'soft opening' period.  Though not all facilities were available at that time, the quality of the rooms and all fittings are to a very high standard.  Staff were very friendly and happy to engage in comversation.  My family are keen swimmers so it was great to have the full length pool plus the network of 'waterways' running through the resort.  It is also easy to take day trips from the resort including to some of the country's best snorkelling locations.  The beach setting is wide and open. I'm sure that this will become a very attractive destination.

title: Luxury experience welcome to paradise
review: A truely beautiful resort with a great beach front location. Rooms very large and furnished in 6 star luxury. Restaurants  utra modern & overlooking ocean  Wonderful service & very friendly staff One of the largest pools in Asia
